njtYc6By1oeKnKur6W99GQ.text: Brunch was the meal of the day this Sunday morning. We had the whole upstairs to our monthly group, SMUNCH. Seating was nice arranged and quite comfortable. I had the scrambled eggs and the baguette. I also tasted the roasted potatoes and tried some of the skillet waffle.  The quality of food was great. Very tasty and I enjoyed the meal. The one common comment was that the two eggs looked like they could be gobbled up in two  1/2 bites. They were tasty but on the smaller side.  The roasted potatoes came with a tangy sauce, all good...and the bread was like wow!! I am glad I ordered my own little loaf as I also got to take it home and have great bread with my own little bit of grilling.  Would I come back again, yes! The staff as very friendly in fact I kept wondering how many people worked there as new face kept appearing with plates of tood for our party. Even the Chef delivered which is always awesome when the chef takes time to meet the customer  They also have live music, which was NOT obnoxious but rather created a great little ambiance. Then again a Big Bass and little keyboard will do that.

syA0cWCHP6GOmShIJ7hDGA.text: Great food and a great atmosphere. We love going there for Sunday brunch...kids eat fee

NFx42FLkjG-rN00P8VJFZA.text: Today my husband and I went to brunch at St Francis for the first time.  The food was fabulous, the service fantastic with Greg and Kaitlyn and of course the wonderful jazz music.  Can't wait to return!!!

1jpBpuiThdi2PunLm0em9g.text: We came for dinner and it was good. I definitely want to get back for brunch as I've heard that's great. I like the light rail accessibility.

ZLap4A-hvQazM7diS9mzSg.text: We came around 3pm on a Sunday and they were in between brunch and dinner menu so we could only order off the happy hour menu which has plenty of selections.The forbidden rice is Amazing! The pork green chile is really tasty, a little spicy and served with delicious cornbread.

LwRLTjvQelFjpci6Z8W8Pw.text: I have only been here once and cant wait to return. The decor is industrial/modern. The crowd here is eclectic. We started with the goat cheese appetizer. It was tangy, smidge sweet and acidic from the tomatos...absolutely delish. I ordered an almond margarita out of curiosity...you must try! It is hard to describe...but it totally works. We had the hanger steak and salmon. Hanger steak was sooo flavorful, tender...exactly what i wanted. The salmon is spectacular! I cant wait to return and try everything else! It all looked good.

tP21eI8eTX4xBOGg6Wfdcg.text: I want to live here. Wait, what?  You're probably thinking I want to live here because of the food, yes that's partially True, but I absolutely love the space.  It's exposed brick walls, lofted dining area, glass garage door and cozy patio...it's what I envision my future residence to be.  Similar to the decor, the menu boasts a variety of comfort food with a modern twist.  Pot roast with bok choy and polenta?  Heck yes, why didn't anyone think of that sooner?  The portions are generous and I've always gone home wtih a box of left overs.  Let's talk liquor.  They have a great beer selection but if you are a fan of sangria, you MUST try theirs.  It tastes as if the citris has been marinating in there for days, which is just the way I like it.   I took my foodie friend from the the big apple here for a celebratory dinner and he absolutely loved it (I know this because his plate was spotless by the end of our dinner).  If it's good enough for a new yorker, you KNOW it's good.   Brunch here was just as wonderful.  The blood marys were strong and the entrees were hearty enough to cure our hangovers.  Again, the portions were large portions yet packed with flavor.  I recommend the baked eggs and their cauliflower soup which was incredibly creamy and not gritty like you'd find at other places.

CjhZVp4xxRvEwwJbbaOqag.text: My favorite high-end burger in Phoenix so far.  she had the seasonal vegetable flat bread (read: pizza) I had the burger (read: simple and awesome)  we had the smashed fingerling potatoes. our only problem was that the ketchup was some sort of Heinz/Hunt's mixed with who-knows-what. The fingerling potatoes were absolutely delicious.  I only had a bit of her "flatbread"... i was too busy with my burger. the "french onion" burger is spectacular. the french-fried onions, gruyere cheese and arugula are a great complement to the brioche bun and the tender ground beef patty. This is what a fancy burger should taste like.

zc_jYr2Jtbv9rTKMZCI61g.text: The food was good however I thought the atmosohere would be better. Maybe it was because we were sitting upstairs?? Do like that they take reservations and the fingerling potatoes were excellent.

lZ1uFLzktAkDiJDL3ird0A.text: Went for Sunday brunch today. Seated within 10 minutes was nice. Gave us a table directly in front of the jazz band and I couldn't hear myself think, it was extremely loud. Moved us upstairs. I had the fried egg sandwich, which I ordered with a hard yolk and it came with a soft yolk (yuck). The server, Daniel, said he'd "do something for us." Hubby's crispy onion burger was greasy and underseasoned. Check came and Daniel did not do amything for us. So it's highly unlikely that we will return to this restaurant.

sJ-GFT5bYFLrd7fdKRNN3Q.text: We just tried this place and it was okay...not fantastic though.  I got a salad.....i probably should have gone with the chile verde.  It was a nice atmosphere and the service was decent....I did think it was a bit overpriced.

9KxdMdOnfj3vYBnc9ypzIw.text: My wife and I went here on a Thursday evening.  It was just OK all around.  The food was not bad, but overpriced for the quality.  Comparing it to something like Postinos, I think Postinos has better quality food.  I think the ambiance was pretty cool, we sat on the second floor overlooking the bar.  Although the waiter was friendly, he did not seem to be on top of his game.  Funny story:  My wife ordered a salad and asked to get it without bacon.  The waiter said "wow, you're really good at noticing details, aren't you?  Most people ask after the salad comes to the table".  We were both a little puzzled at this statement, as he seemed to be shocked that someone actually read the menu.  Well, after all that, when he brought the salad, what would ya know, the bacon was left on it.  :)  I was so tempted to be like "hey, you're not really good at noticing details, are you?"  Anyway, we let it go and my wife was like 90% done with the salad when he finally came back around and said "sorry" and gave us another salad.  A nice gesture, but it was too late at that point... two salads is one too much.  I ended up getting the meatballs.  It was unique but way too much sauce and just not the most appetizing flavor.   All and all, we have no solid plans to go back.  Nothing except the style impressed us, and there are too many good places out there.

Ejcs87KzWgO-Vw9n0n0Dgg.text: Had a wonderful time at St. Francis last week.  The service was very attentive.  The architectural detail of this place makes it worth the visit for that alone.  Ask for a tour of the details, they love sharing it with you.  Can't wait to get back there again as the menu expands and it is open more hours.   Warning though:  it isn't inexpensive.

wSKzhkwFH410DbIICtXvhw.text: Without a doubt, the best dining experience I've had since moving to Phoenix. From the courteous staff (everyone said a genuine "hi!") to the bartender, the food runners and the waitstaff, tremendous customer service. Onto the food... the creamy polenta app and the kale/cabbage salad are winners (especially the salad).  For an entree, try the seafood ciopino (ask for it spicy if you can handle...absolutely worth it). Great for dates, family special occasions, etc. etc.  A gem in Phoenix!!

u8V1NPuzlJ2h2TNS3de0bQ.text: Like many others who visited the restaurant because of D.D.D. , i tried the pig dip sandwich. I was expecting to get this huge mouth watering, savory, full of meat and cheese delight.   W R O N G.   Luke warm, small amount of meat, very little cheese on a small stale role.  Oh so disappointing.  I should have read the reviews, and not expected to get the same sandwich that is served to another chef.

joz3pAutQdR_BEicLFn3_w.text: Every time we've been there, we've been blown away in all the best ways. Service, quality, consistency, friendliness, design, flavor...it is just incredible from top to bottom. HUGE recommendation!

9s_ws0rOPxmWbMGpW3VzQA.text: went to St. Francis twice in past month and I must admit that i will be going there in the future. I am giving this place this high of a rating not because i had a meal that blew my socks off. It is because these people have managed to put together a neighborhood place that has fantastic atmosphere and good food.  The first visit was about 4 weeks ago for lunch. We sat inside for patio was completely booked. This was not a bad decision for we loved the ambiance. For my meal i had the short rib sandwich. It just stood out and i had to have it. The dish was very tasty. the only down side of it was that it got a little soggy so the bread lost that crunch, but the flavor was there and this was to be expected from that juicy beef.  Went for dinner last Tuesday and the seating situation was exactly the same. Outside was packed, the bar was full so we had to sit inside or wait for about 30 minutes for outdoor seat. No problem... we set at the table inside and again had a great time.  The ambiance was great. servers were fun and helpful and the place was filled with cool people.  For appetizer i had the goat cheese that was good. it was recommended to us by our server and we were grateful for that. tomato sauce added just enough acidity to the dish to keep the cheese from being too potent. nice crunch with the crostinis.  One of us ordered the pot roast that was very good. Cool thing about it was that the dish did not come out as heavy as we have expected. The meat was juicy and tender and polenta was just great. The cioppino had very good amount of seafood in it but we thought that the sauce was a bit of a let down. We expected that zing that cioppino should deliver along with an abundance of fresh aromas, but in this case it was missing. Do not get me wrong, the dish was good but not great.  Finlay , the prime hanger steak was good but little over done. It was ordered MR but delivered MW. The mashed potatoes were great and roasted cipolini were fantastic. the mushroom ( i think it was a form of demi ) was delicious. not overpowering and allowing other ingredients to speak for themselves. Had it not been overcooked, this dish would have been a winner.  All in all a great experience at ST. Francis and i will be bringing friends there for time to come.

shYGK8ri233Kp4tpabUtQA.text: I love that they are kid friendly and that chef Aaron came by to ask how everything was. Delicious food.

sV8-YkXhh7zpx_MDd8OsjQ.text: This is one of my favorite places.  Great food, great service, great bar, and great atmosphere.  There is a nice outdoor area.  This one of my favorites.  . The only negative is the restaurant manager.  He is a younger guy and everytime I go he is very critical of the waitstaff.  I kind of cringe when I hear him speak to them.  Otherwise, this is a must go to place.  Great.

15J66FyJOj5ljTrnD0viCg.text: I had brunch here on Sunday and it was fantastic.  We shared the bakers bread board which perfect.  The Scone is amazing!  I ordered the fried egg sandwich which was great!  I wasn't very happy that I couldn't sub fruit for french fries, I mean, the sandwich is bad enough as it is.  I did order the side of fruit, a huge portion, my friends ate my fries.  I would recommend St. Francis any day for brunch.

ZxbT09z50qQJkuafLAUgVQ.text: Took my wife out to lunch today and we decided to try this place and I am glad we did. I had the Pig Dip Sandwich and my wife got the Chicken Salad Sandwich. The food was brought out on large wooden platters instead of your traditional glass plate which was kinda cool. The music was loud enough to mask the conversations around me but to loud that I couldn't talk with my wife, we liked the whole ambience of this place. Now  I love to eat food and when I go out I want enough on my plate to be able to enjoy what I am eating. The portions were large and I left full but both my wife and I were very happy with how the food tasted. Everything was delicious. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. We went the week after Christmas so I think they were probably less busy than normal. I felt the food was fairly priced for what I got and we also noticed on their website it shows that kids eat free!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TNvZ2wBoAd2yRudxE27gCg.text: Update: I went back for happy hour, which is $5 heaven, wine, cocktails, you name it! Bartender was friendly and the service was on point as always. I did just have drinks, but it was the St Francis I was used to. They won me back, let's be honest, I wouldn't be able to stay away. I eagerly await the return of their pumpkin soup this fall. It's pure heaven in a bowl!

2BEfNNWWpiXpq46INRFOTA.text: Tried coming here once a year or two ago and was greeted by a rude hostess so we opted to leave and go elsewhere... Finally I decided to let go of the grudge and try them out...  We ordered based on Yelp highlights: Fingerling potatoes, French Onion burger & Moroccan Spiced meatballs.  Potatoes - delicious. Love the fried herbs and the lemon aioli! Huge portion, share these. Burger - delicious. Hearty burger with all the fixings. Meatballs - Large portion. 6 huge meatballs to an order. I thought these were okay...  Service? Great! Friendly and attentive. Glad I decided to give them a try. Would I come back? Yes, I probably would.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy Fingerling Potatoes! (Yum!) 01.17.15
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Onion Burger w side salad (delicious! Get this!) 01.17.15
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moroccan Spiced Meatballs - huge!! 01.17.15

cCpk8Yf10wrsI5q3RiHgOw.text: Incredible food! Three stars though for the seating arrangements. Super tightly placed tables to the point that you can hear the couple (who is on a first date)'s conversation next to you. I was looking forward to a romantic dinner. We were having a deep conversation, and really had to stop because the table 10 inches away would hear our dinner conversations. Even at the booths, one portion of them don't have back rests! You butt up to the person behind you. So weird and uncomfortable. *If you go, I'd go with a party of four and request a table against the wall (not a booth). In addition, upon entering, I felt like we were placed at one of the "lesser desired" tables in front of the kitchen walkway because we didn't have a reservation. They asked us at the door. A "better" seat was empty, but it went to someone who came in after us. Again though, great food.

U8OsqZr0oWI3HS38-_4mKg.text: Came in here with the hubby for a nice dinner. Was so glad we came in here! Food was phenomenal. Service was great. Only reason I have 4/5 stars was because I didn't like how close our table was to the one next to the others. We wanted to get a jump start on celebrating our anniversary but felt like we were having dinner with the 2 people next to us because we were so close. Also, just a heads up that parking is valet. I didn't know and felt bad because we didn't have any cash to tip the guy working the valet. Overall, I'll be back to try the rest of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

_92GQWh5CYK5rvq7km44kQ.text: This is my second time here.  I came here the first time with a local and can say I wasn't disappointed either time.  The staff is friendly, prompt, and they really know the menu and are able to provide great recommendations.  The food here is farm to table and seasonal, but each time I've come I've been able to order the duck and have not been disappointed.  The duck was seasoned and prepared well (although I wish the skin had been crispier). I was also able to try the meatballs and the big rib, both were delicious!  Tonight we had a party of 8 from all over the US and we ordered the bread plate appetizer, meatballs, the big rib, duck, roasted chicken, and the onion dip burger.  All were fantastic!  Everyone at the table enjoyed their meal.

VZD2DYG2TlKe2im6KBWvlw.text: I really enjoyed my time here, The atmosphere was super cozy. I didn't even mind waiting 30 minutes for our table. The bartender was super chill, and joked with us as we waited. When our table was ready, we were seated. I ordered the Salmon, and the Sweet Potato (which I split with my friend). It was soo good, Great Gluten free dinner. Lots of flavor in the quinoa. The waiter, was very attentive and good spirits. I will definitely venture out here again! Maybe when its a little cooler to enjoy the patio!

rXTIJn5y9rsGoWSJbtssZA.text: St. Francis is a truly great gathering spot.  I've come here a few times with friends and family and I always enjoy the atmosphere, the outside seating is nice even when it might seem to hot to go out.  They have a wonderful happy hour and who doesn't appreciate locally sourced ingredients.  They are always happy to accommodate and one night they let my girlfriends and I stay even after they had closed up shop and were about to finish cleaning the place.  That's what I call great customer service!  The desserts at St. Francis are my favorite.  I've devoured the sticky toffee pudding and the Apple Crumb Tart,  you should enjoy them at some point too.  I feel that this picture of the Apple Crumb Tart speaks for itself, you would be a fool to skip dessert here.  My favorite dish at St. Francis, other than dessert, is the Pig Dip.  The pork loin is cooked perfectly, I'm a sucker for prosciutto and bacon and the fennel marmalade, Dijon and Gruyere make my taste buds scream for joy.  I have to state for the record that I have not had brunch here yet and it always looks fantastic when I see people posting pictures.

Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. And this is the kid&#39;s meal!

bBy1ry6Dm2eClJ6PHMX_7A.text: Had the forbidden rice bowl today.  Simply amazing. Just a perfect balance to it. We paired that with the romaine heart salad which was also delicious. Last time  I had the delicious pig dip which also great. Got to come back for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pig dip up close
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pig dip

KAM-pPyE2aSfLeMH3ACWsw.text: We decided to go to St Francis because I read Yahoo's review that stated this place had the best burger in the state of AZ.  I live in CA and visit my fiance in AZ often so we like to try new places when I'm there. Went at lunchtime today after checking the ALL DAY menu online ahead of time. I wanted the baked goat cheese.  Nope, not available. The stuffed peppers and parm risotto weren't available either.  The ALL DAY menu is NOT all day apparently. Hmpf! So I went with the Chile Burger....supposedly the best burger in AZ.  It was pretty tasty. Heat, good meat, well cooked. We also split the pumpkin soup which was delicious, but could use like 3-4 more pieces of the croutons. Our server took a long time to get our drinks. He never asked how the meal was.  And he filled my fiance's water, but not mine.  Overall, the food was good, but I don't think we'll revisit.

o6zZWuMs9UrW-LYiBxY_uQ.text: Been coming here for years! Awesome food and great atmosphere. A little bitter about them taking away the chocolate cake but I'll live. Get the forbidden rice bowl or the pig dip!

s9YY8qFpGoh9Q7R3qBGvmw.text: Food was amazing as well as the wait staff! Pork Chile Verde with an egg...a-maz-ing! I'm trying the Pig Dip next time. :)

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I love this place! Pork Chile Verde was my favorite. However everything was AMAZING! Including the wait staff!

wvGYYuPZTOE6YXRbwnEc8g.text: this place is so good love the atmosphere and the food and they have a good happy hour. They buy all their food local and make healthy option

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hQpbN1tSHEQAKxQBYXs2hQ.text: This was our second time here, and, when we travel to the Phoenix area, we have to come here, for it's lovely atmosphere and top-notch plates. Sit outside and enjoy lunch and cocktails (happy hour is 11a-6p). Portions are large, so two people could easily share dishes, such as the spicy Moroccan meatballs with pearl pasta or the Pig Dip sandwich with fries. They also offer smaller fare, if your appetite isn't quite so hearty! We made this our last dining stop en route to the airport-easy access off Route 51 at Camelback East

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pig Dip Sandwich with Fries and Moroccan Meatballs

iJYGkf7RREINi9och44LnQ.text: Love everything about the place from the vibe to the food. If a "foodie" were to be visiting the valley and wanted a recommendation I'd certainly point towards St. Francis. Love what they did to an old building and made it into their own concept.

t5ku8XlsVCUWp5fq04AzuA.text: Some excellent selections, waits here are a bit harder with traffic off Camel Back.  But breakfast through dinner selections are worth trip

qWEcdSuHfzVlXz592ubzcQ.text: This is a nice upscale restaurant I went to for lunch for a work meeting. I tried the pig dip sandwich since I saw it on the Food Network and it did not disappoint. The sandwich was huge comma and large enough that I had lunch and dinner in one meal. The flavor on the pork was amazing although the bread was a bit too large for the sandwich. I definitely would come back and order that meal again

RhqG-_WhuZjDk3YfvTpgtA.text: First off let me just tell you Kendell was absolutely amazing. She suggested all the perfect things from drinks to food!   Cucumber Cooler refreshing and light was perfect but the Santa Rosa was just perfection!! Was the best drink i ever had in my life. I had it with Gin and the new bartender made the perfect mistake by putting mint in it too. A phenomenal drink   I had the Forbidden Rice bowl with chicken it was great!  I had a bit of my friends Pig Dip, that sandwich was top notch very tasting drink!  Potatoes Finger we addictive as well!!   St Francis is a must when in AZ   *Side Bar* the pancake is only done on Sat n Sun i was bummed at first but that quickly change once Kendell took over *

HCfMTqGKHu225icerR3n0Q.text: Love the food here! I dont think I've tried something I didn't really like. Yes, this place can be pricey and being charged for valley on top of that may be a "thumbs down" for you. However if this isnt an issue and you are craving for good food in central Phx this is the place.  I also happened to like modern things. This place def can fit into that description.   Service can be blah sometimes which is why I didn't give full 5 star (Server can be non-attentive or sometimes even unfriendly. Food can take long to serve. )  Also one time my friend had problem with the vallet. Apparently the vallet guy that took my friend car leave (his shift ended) but didnt communicate well with his coworker so my friend had to deal with "misplaced" key. Meaning he got stuck and had to deal with bs before he got his car back.

fQPRshmO8QdIZctn5LaLug.text: We had seen St Francis on DDD awhile ago and then recently I saw a chef from the restaurant "Beat Bobby Flay" and it just so happened to be the day before we were heading to Phoenix.  We stopped for dinner and my dh had the Pig Dip and, which was featured on the show and it was so good!  The baguette that it was served on was made in house and so crispy and delicious looking.  I liked this place because they allowed me to order the side dish of wood oven cooked summer squash with romensco sauce  and add a piece of salmon to go with it.  The salmon was cooked perfectly and the squash to die for!

nbac2q1n2JHBDxXJiciOLA.text: St. Francis should repent? Five "Hail Mary's" please. Or at least two consistent bloody mary's...  Heck, best leave it to the old school men of the cloth to dole out "punishment" but - - - fifty-eight dollars lighter after a "not so heavenly" brunch for two (not including tip)(we were in a group of six) - the wallet is feeling a little punished. Having now been to this resto on three occasions - each time leaving less satisfied than the time before, well - - - it's time for a last write.    SInce we enjoy spending money on good food/drink, service and ambiance, St. Francis' prices didn't dissuade...until the experience didn't live up to the bill:  Ambiance : modern Phoenix standard interior, nice open air feel, live music at brunch lends itself to a lovely atmosphere, but volume on the music to the point of someone asking to turn it down (someone NOT being me, Hallelujah! because it's usually me) and tables with "back to back benches"...husband elbowed chronically by guy behind him and I know I took out the lady's spine unintentionally behind me...makes for the misery like flying coach.  Food and drink - Unacceptably inconsistent...even at the same table during the same meal. I'd love to recommend the Bloody Mary & I do - that is, the FIRST one we had. It was so hopped up on tabasco and flavorful that, it was a huge hit of heat. It was kind of surprisingly intense at first...but then....determined...loved it! Bring us another. The second round came about forty minutes later for two of us girls and Nada. Nothing. No oomph. Not even the same garnish. Mine went from the green olive, lemon and lime to no olive, a pearl onion and what looked like a half-eaten pepprocini. Thinking about it now . . . on the first order, I'd requested "fresh horseradish" on the side.  Instead of the server obliging, she replied, "It already has that in it." I still noted, "that's great, please bring additional." Maybe the bartender / server decided, "we'll show her?!" (It was hotter than the devil's den!) Who knows. Maybe just different bartenders. But the outcome of inconsistency is unappealing anyway you garnish it...especially when priced at nine bucks. On the up-side...my egg sandwich was reasonable - "good", a nice portion and with a side salad - a value at $10. I think I've always had a "one really good item" at St. F and it kept me coming back, but one item does not an overall good experience make - especially three visits over.  Further inconsistency: the scrambled chorizo dish. One guest's plate - piled amply, the other - roughly two-thirds as much if even that.  The iron skillet pancake was good - a good size, but not really a steal at eight bucks.     Service - She was friendly, but insisted on reciting the six orders instead of writing them down and subsequently, a wrong dish was delivered. Then, one friend waited while the rest of us ate - you know that scenario. Then, not even an offer by our server or a manager to comp a drink of theirs. In addition, hot sauce was requested by our other friend...never delivered. The check came and...you guessed it - incorrect.   The group we were with - all fairly new friends - no one wanted to sour the spirit at the table and to speak up too much. Later though, we did note the shortcomings of this brunch.    Time for confession - never should have given it the third try.

RKVhObrN06jqzj6oiIubIg.text: Good food, good service, good ambiance.  Menu could be a little more expansive, but a focused menu is often a good thing. They had lots of app/small plates/salad items that I'd like to try.  The entree selection was a little less interesting unfortunately.  However, we both liked what we had quite a lot, and two friends who ate there same week also like their dishes (all 4 different things).      Wine list is short, but both reasonable and comprehensive enough that most anyone can find something they like.   A lot of Arizona wine selections, which I am unfamiliar with.  I was hoping waitress would be able to shed more light on them, but unfortunately she was either unable or unwilling to answer my query.    The restaurant is a little loud inside and would benefit from a few soft surfaces to soften the sound.  I'm not sure why but the trend the last 10 years or so seems to be very sleek designs that look great but don't function well  - as they ignore the sound quality and acoustics of a space.   Anyway - we were still able to carry on pleasant conversation.  Parking is complementary valet only.  I walked, but that's a nice touch - and common if a place has tight or limited parking.    Anyway - we had  a great time.

t-bIsyEjrqDyDrf6R6Jv2A.text: Great atmosphere - the specialty cocktails are top rate - I thought the Moroccan meatball were overpowered with cumin - the service a little slow but we were a group of 14

gB3PMM_p9LEby49vU123jQ.text: Pros: 1. good atmosphere 2. great patio 3. Cheap happy hour drinks 4. food is good. **bread is amazing and so is the goat cheese**  Cons: 1.only valet parking on Saturday (maybe all the time, I've only been on Saturday) 2. the hipster staff is just nice enough to get the 15% tip they deserve ( no I didn't leave that bad of a tip but they really don't deserve more)

Eau89G86SE7gHoxIGByFfg.text: This is a weird review, because St. Francis is one of our favorite restaurants. We're "regulars" there -- but, after last night's experience (one-star) we are going to be taking a break for quite some time. We've been there regularly over the last three years, and recommend the restaurant to friends and out-of-owners. The atmosphere is nice and the people have always been very caring and thoughtful. I have a terrible allergy, and they (with one exception) have always kept my meals free of my problem foods.  Last night was a disaster, however. We went for the Happy Hour, which I see gets good reviews here on Yelp. The problem is that their Happy Hour menu is integrated into the standard menu, in a way that perhaps the person who designed it understands, but not necessarily the casual reader. We came in, saw a giant blurb on the menu that said "Happy Hour -- Cocktails $5" and selected a couple of cocktails when the initially attentive waitress came up to the table.   Later, however, that waitress proved completely inattentive, concerned solely with another large table nearby. We must have called out to this woman a half-dozen times, trying to get her attention, without success. Over and over again, we'd call to her when she was just three feet away taking care of the large table, and she would keep her back to us. (We're normally very easy-care customers -- we just wanted to check on ingredients for one dish, due to allergies.)  When the bill came, the $5 cocktails proved to be $12 each! It was a shocker, to say the least. I asked the waitress, who we did see again at time for our bill, to please correct the charge and she said that the menu is "quite clear" about cocktails, and these were not included in the Happy Hour. I looked over the menu, and saw her point -- but it was sure confusing. There's a tiny mark next to certain drinks. There's no explanation of what that mark means (we assumed it was just a "Bartender's Favorite" kind of notation), but evidently only certain drinks are included in the discount, and not the ones we ordered.  Personally, I'd say that when customers come in and order a Happy Hour food special, and the cocktails they order are NOT on the HH menu, the wait staff needs to clarify the pricing in advance. If you're going to print a menu with this kind of confusing detail on it, you'll need to ensure that waiters are not going to be confrontational when someone expresses a miscommunication has occurred. This gal wasn't nasty, but she made us feel like we were real dummies because we didn't read their wacky menu correctly.  In this case, two regulars (who have always loved this place) will now avoid St. Francis and hopefully find when we next visit that we don't sit in her section, and that the Happy Hour menu is clear, or that management will at least "get" that not everyone understands their hieroglyphics and what it means about the price of your food.

9Avfg5PNEX1D5lUvEqp03g.text: I've only been for breakfast and they try to get fancy with it. Nothing wrong with that but it just didn't taste right.  I'll review them again once I try their dinner.  Also, it's super hard to get a seat of you don't have a dinner reservation and it's valet parking only.

5NY_djzFhqbWXgsynmPXBw.text: Great service and delicious food! Had the Santa Rosa to drink..waiter Daniel's suggestion.. Really tasty and for happy hour only $5? Can't beat that.  The pork chile verde was so so good! --get it with the egg on top. It's delish. Not too spicy (I'm such a baby when it comes to spicy..I can take it a little spicy but not too much). The homemade cornbread was really tasty and the crispy fingerling potatoes with the lemon aioli.. And fried herbs! So yum.  34.66 inc tax? No brainer for this caliber of food. ..and Great great service!

zqRNObSMWWhoVRW2TVyl2w.text: Breakfast was just average. Ordered the Eggs Benedict with Pork Loin. The Pork Loin looked like deli meat.  It was very dry with 2 little egg yolks on top. For $14. Rip off city. This place has good food but not for breakfast. The cinnamon roll did look off the chain though! Might try that next time

RYVpQN0ofrhbbauFNxDVgQ.text: Great food.  Every time.  Only complaint would be that the menu is limited to only a few choices.  Oh!  and for some reason every time I order "to Go" the order gets completely mixed up or something is missing when I get home.  But that is my own fault for not checking before walking out the door, right?  Yes, I know.  Lol.

y75Cc1plNXf_NtO8SC2u6w.text: Every about this place was perfect! As a visitor from Tucson to this establishment I can say the bar was set and I am extremely impressed. The moment we pulled in you're vehicle is complimentarily parked by a valet team and you we walked in and were sat quite promptly. The service was great everything was brought out quickly and hot. I ordered the eggs Benedict with salmon and OMG it was amazing. Came with their hollandaise sauce and potatoes that were to DIE for. Great atmosphere very modern and comfortable seating arrangement. Also tried this orange juice mint drink that was super tasty. I'll make it a pony to come back on future outings.

So9RmV8ilccRnSmCtcRppw.text: St. Francis would have earned 5 stars but parking stinks when there is no valet. This has  great rustic decor , swanky indoor/ outdoor bar . The food is always amazing . Never ever a disappointment . Grab your friends / or your honey and give it a try !!!

Y8mTZskfyGx7uaUhxPmdYw.text: Had brunch with my daughter here (finally - it'd been on my list to check out for soooo long!) It lived up to the hype! Love the casual urban chic interior design. The patio seating looked very inviting, too, so I think I'll request that next time. They had the wall open behind the bar which just created the perfect brunch ambiance for enjoying our gorgeous Phoenix winter weather. Was pleasantly surprised by the diversity of the crowd -- nice to see older people, trendy hipsters and families with young children all contentedly co-mingling. :)  Brunch portions were VERY generous -- we had to get to-go boxes! Daughter & I shared their cinnamon roll and I'm pretty sure it was bigger than my head (and I have some pretty big curly hair, so that's saying something!) It was so big we were unsure we'd finish it -- and then we tasted it and that sucker was devoured in short order, with daughter scraping every last bit of cinnamon and frosting drizzle off the plate! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!  Don't remember the name of the dishes we had but it was pretty traditional breakfast fare -- just done excellently. The bacon was divine! Again, generous portions. Might've finished if we'd not started with that ginormous roll, lol, but it was all so very good and we have zero regrets about the excess calories, bwahaha!  My kiddo's a tween so she didn't get to enjoy the free meals they offer kids but if you have young ones, this place should suit everyone -- delicious eats for parents / grandparents and free yummies for the kids. We'll be back. :)

mzrNYJWzdJGShZGVygdsQg.text: It was girls night out for us and been wanting to try this place.  I ordered a chicken dish and  took a bite and noticed something didn't taste right.  I pulled it out of my mouth and found a string of metal!  I returned the dish and complained to the waitress.  She looked at it and said, 'oh it's probably just the piece from the sponge they use to clean the pots!'   By then I was completely sickened by the fact she said it was from a sponge!  They didn't charge for the dish, but won't go back because I'm a complete germaphobe!    Ugh...feel like throwing up just writing this review!

nOmD39I8fbMFoG7L7Yh4fg.text: This is one of my favorite brunch spots to go to. I like that their mimosas are not mostly orange juice for brunch as well. They have plenty of vegetarian options for lunch and dinner as well that I have also tried. Free valet parking is a good perk too.

fAbjInTr3gGwfjwkjlmT_g.text: The staff is amazing!!!! Very attentive always there for what is best for you!! However be aware the amount of cumin in the Moroccan meatballs is so intense that before you finish the first one your mouth will be on fire not to mention the pearlized cous cous pasta is non existent might as well not be there because it's not!!! If it was it might cleanse your palet to continue but because it bare exists it can't  but again staff is amazing so that makes it worth it!

QFgkfOkx2R3mINka2GUCYA.text: After wanting to try this restaurant for years and hearing such great things, I was beyond disappointed. They sat us at a cramped table right up against the table behind us. We sat on a bench with no back, directly up against the people behind us! I was literally back to back touching the person sitting behind me. Then the meal I chose the Prime Hanger Steak which came with whipped potatoes. Did I mention it was $30? As the most expensive dish on the menu I expected it to be a decent sized portion. It came out with 5 small pieces of meat, so red it was still mooing, and a tiny bit of whipped potatoes. Since I was still hungry after my meal I ordered the chocolate cake desert, which was the only redeeming part of the night.  At least I never have to go back.

CYn_94D1gkEAyXWg8VzDEQ.text: OK, to be fair, my fellow Yelpers must know that the Manager of St. Francis has attempted to remedy my last review by offering me dinner on him.  Yes, I was sent a gift certificate so that I might try dinner again.  I LOVE that gesture, and it was very much appreciated!  I am only sorry that it took me so long to 1) return, and 2) to update my review.  I returned for a visit at the first part of September.  However, my position remains the same.  I really do love the ambiance!  But my service experience has been just poor...defined as not attentive, and not even very friendly.  I would have loved to have been able to write an improved review but...when there are so many restaurants that serve me well, I will have to pass on this one.  :-(

Kho3UdnIu0Wp9JHlPcK7mA.text: I visited St Francis for lunch with a couple girlfriends. Kinda pricey for lunch, but we knew what to expect and wanting to try it out. Luckily, a couple of us with smaller appetites were able to split our Pig Dip sandwich without any fuss from the staff or 'split' charge you sometimes see at more upscale places. They even served it on separate plates and gave us each our own basket of fries.   The sandwich was quite yummy and we enjoyed a couple brews, as well. We sat outside on a beautiful day and their patio is quite cozy and nice. I'll probably be back. :)

k4Z1TDyMb-TFQiUJK_Nvuw.text: Not impressed. I don't see what the hype is all about. Its a cool place to meet for drinks tho..but the food is just ok.

mHilLKffqkcf3UtBjxG6zw.text: It took me a couple tries, but now I can officially say that I am a fan of St. Francis. I met here recently for lunch with a girlfriend and this is a great restaurant for a ladies lunch. The atmosphere is trendy, fresh, unpretentiously sophisticated and although it's right off of busy Camelback Road, you'd never know it once you step through the doors.   First and foremost, I like that they allow you to make reservations, even during the lunch hour. This is smart to do because it does get crowded. The food here is simple with a culinary twist. The menu offers flatbreads, salads, sandwiches and other options. On a previous visit, I tried the burger which was juicy and delicious (as well as a little pricey). The burger is definitely a good option to order if you are in a hungry mood. The fries are thick steak fries with plenty of salty goodness to them. On my most recent visit, I had the Del Real which is a sandwich with goat cheese, cucumber, peppers, onion marmalade and avocado, plus I added turkey. It comes with your choice of a side salad or fries, but this time around I fought through my cravings and opted for the side salad. The sandwich was on ciabatta bread and absolutely delicious! The side salad had a great dressing to it as well.   All in all, the meal was delicious and the atmosphere was good too!

3JAFcZET1O24ieEXZFRbQg.text: Fantastic atmosphere. Very Very friendly staff. Food presentation was spot on.  We had drinks and a Brick Oven Flatbread (cheese) and it was delicious. I can't wait to go back and try a full entree. They had a Salmon dish on the menu I am going to try when I return. I was staring at other dishes and they looked mouth watering.

_E3fA-OqwMLqpceO9rAiaw.text: I made a reservation at this up scale, trendy, and sheik restaurant to have a post holiday dinner with my mother and friend. The architecture was outstanding. We had the best experience at this place! Our waiter, Andrew, was extremely accommodating and was most polite with just the right amount of humor. Followed by introducing himself, he suggested the featured dinner for the night, Pan Brazed Scallops. That was an amazingly tasteful dish with a perfect portion of carrots and lentils sided by 5 of the largest scallops I've ever devoured. My mother had the Chorizo and Shrimp Flat bread and my friend had the Cheese Flat bread. To sum it up, the flat breads were an upscale pizza. Deliciously cheesy. I had a hot Vanilla Rooibos Tea that was Savory. Over all, an enjoyable experience! Thank you!!

wN3gnJ8p5Gr0uWIo2K-LyQ.text: St Francis is everything that I Like in a restaurant,  Unique, modern decor,  great artwork, good food and big portions.  We had the corn flatbread which sounds strange but was great, fresh bread with olive oil, salmon, pork chili, a cheeseburger.  Good deserts too...  I would have given St Francis four or five stars, but the service was sub-par.  When they brought our entrees out there were no forks on the table.   We asked for forks and none came.  As our meal was getting cold, I got up and went to the service stand and grabbed the only fork that was left.  Finally, our server came with forks and said that they were busy and ran out of forks.    You tell me, what kind of restaurant runs out of clean forks at 7p on a Saturday night?

3LBfoXWHxqiSQqeRGyxlUQ.text: This is probably my new favorite spot, as I just moved into the neighborhood.   I've been here twice. Once for drinks on a date, and once for brunch. Each time the service was stellar. They have an accommodating, kind, and thoughtful staff!  The drinks... Oh, the drinks. I'm not usually a cocktail person, but I ordered the Strawberry Basil Caiparinha and the Cucumber Cooler. They're made with actual fruit and were a delight. Not terribly sweet, so perfect for my taste buds. But the crowning glory was the cucumber cooler. Hendrick's Gin, Lemonade... To. Die. For. I HIGHLY recommend this cocktail!  For a date night, it was perfect, and relatively dead late at night. The ambiance of the patio was wonderful for the feel of the evening, and was a perfect treat to round out my night.  And for brunch? My tongue was titillated with the delight of an appetizer of a baguette with pear-ginger jam & butter, the "Smoked Salmon" and a mimosa.   The smoked salmon was served like a Benedict, hollandaise and all, along with fried fingerling potatoes that still make me drool, even still! I dipped the 'taters into remaining hollandaise and ate until I couldn't anymore! It was simply too good, and I would love to enjoy it again - I can't wait to!  I was also impressed with them locally-sourcing goods, such as their tea from Maya in Tucson. It was high-quality, and tasty. I'm a total beverage snob, so I appreciate quality coffee and tea!  If you like fine tasting food and beverage, this place is great. Brunch also features a jazz group playing, that fits perfectly with the atmosphere provided. I highly recommend this for a date, or a special treat!

Djoz0xrUEyyk9kGRE0HvbQ.text: I have been here a few times and feel it is time to write a review. This place gets 5 stars no question. From the decor to the food to the service this place is great. I have yet to order anything that is even just ok. Everything has been wonderful.  To start, be sure to get the bread. Yes, they charge you $2 for it but they serve a warm loaf of bread with high quality extra virgin olive oil. Also, be sure to get the quinoa salad, which is one of my favorites.  For an entree, everything we have ordered has been great. I have tried the green chile pork and the pot roast. Both of these dishes were amazing. As for my wonderful girlfriend, she always sticks to the salmon which has been good perfectly evertime and is always fresh. When her parents were here with us the got the special which was a fettucini carbonara, and one of the best around. If they have this on the menu, order it. The burgers and flat breads looked really good too, so I will have to order one next time.  The drink menu is extensive and they have a good beer list. Also, be sure to save room for dessert as the bananas foster is great.

nzssX3kAQC0oNkcwice7tQ.text: We don't know if we are somehow jinxed, but while we have had a favorable opinion of the food, the restaurant cannot seem to connect the dots with service.  Tonight was a prime example - a relatively quiet Sunday evening around 7:30.  We sat at the bar and placed our order for dinner.  The soup and bread came out uneventfully, but it went downhill after that.  The waitress / bartender brought out my entree, the Risotto, and instead of what my partner had ordered - their pork chop - she brought out the pot roast for him  Then she proceeded to tell us that she had punched in the order wrong, and added that they were out of the port chops - this after I had my meal in front of me.  We were ready to walk out of the restaurant at that point, and then a chef came out and suddenly advised us that they were not out of pork chops.  Knowing that the chop is cooked on the entire rack from prior visits (hence "the limited availability") we then knew that either the waitress and/or the kitchen had initially lied to us to foist an unwanted entree item on us.  15 minutes later, after I had stalled in eating my meal so I would not be finished before the other entree arrived we finally had the second meal.  All in all, the night was a very stressful and unpleasant ordeal.  Several visits earlier, our entire dinner order was "lost" - this after we waited for 40 minutes after finishing the soup.  While the food has generally been pretty good, the service level will take this restaurant off of our list, which is a shame since we live only a half mile away, and like to support all of the neighborhood establishments.

CR1tj2aUpi14JlrhNG-G_A.text: Did not like anything in this place at all. The onion burger was very salty . I also think that the valet parking is ridiculous and totally designed to rip you off more. Yes, it is free, but you still have to tip the guy. Silliness .  Great service though.

rSATEkcPGkMRumwZUGX-jg.text: Finally had a chance to try this.  Loved it:  order the iron skillet pancake.  also had the farmer's market frittata.  Fabulous bloddy mary and live jazz music sunday afternoons.

g6bOPlm9MBvqZI79msDVTQ.text: Absolutely loved this place...  The menu is reasonably priced and the food was excellent.  The ambiance was very cool and I can't wait to go back.

-M4vYafQw8zv3Qwa5_Ms6w.text: We decided to check out St Francis after seeing it reviewed on PBS's "Check Please Arizona". And we were definitely impressed. Really cool architecture, design and ambiance!   To the bar for a drink before dinner! I ordered the organic bottled "Sum'r" Ale (by Four+ / Uinta Brewing out of Utah) which I loved! If you've got tasty organic beer, you've automatically got extra points in my book!  :)  My friends initially ordered cocktails at the bar and then wine at dinner. We were impressed with the wine suggestions made by our server at dinner. He was very knowledgeable in the vino department!  All of us enjoyed the dinners we ordered. I had the mozzarella salad. It was delicious although when something is called a "salad", I would anticipate greens of some sort to accompany it. Very good, but not really a salad. The others ordered the french onion burger w/ fingerling potatoes, the roasted salmon and the pot roast. Everything was beautifully presented using fresh, high quality, seasonal ingredients.

pPGwoSOLKJ8cKZhaQdR4Og.text: This place has exceeded my expectations every time I've visited.  I've experienced brunch and dinner at St. Francis and have been impressed with everything I've ordered (and everything my friends have let me sneak bites of!).  For brunch, the Homemade Biscuit (with vegetable gravy) was perfection. I'm no stranger to fatty breakfasts, and was really impressed by the richness of this dish. On a separate occasion, I enjoyed a mimosa with my Iron Skillet Pancake (perfect amount of sweetness with the chocolate and berries) and an order of scrambled eggs. No need to add salt -- Chef Aaron Chamberlain gets it right. I'm known to judge a breakfast by its eggs and this one was fluffy and the perfect break from my sweet pancake adventure. I topped it off by splitting their GIANT cinnamon roll with my friend. Even the two of us couldn't finish it!  The live Jazz is a classy touch, and the perfect backdrop for a Sunday rendezvous.  I've had dinner on a few occasions and ordered their Roasted Salmon, Steak, and Pot Roast. All cooked to order (and cooked to perfection). Paul prefers his steak "moo"-ing. I prefer mine a little more... umm... cooked. Both were great. The pot roast has been my favorite. My advice is to pair any of these dishes with their signature Cucumber Cooler (which includes some legit Hendricks Gin and is garnished with a cucumber).  The service has been wonderful and prompt every time I've visited. On my most recent dinner there, our server noticed I was wearing a black dress and asked if I would prefer a black napkin over a white one. I asked why, and he replied that the white ones shed and he would hate for me to get lint all over my dress. That's the kind of consideration that really makes the service at St. Francis shine.  Combine the amazing food and great service with gorgeous, modern decor... and I'd say you have a winning restaurant.  I'm so excited for their new weekday breakfast schedule and the espresso bar/cafe that's going to be added. I'll be headed back to St. Francis for sure.

5RYJzXP5t1lrz6RXw6OZMw.text: The service was excellent. Food was decent. The flat-bread that was recommended to me. It was not much of a flat bread. It had A LOT of flour on the bottom and was soft and fluffy, not the typical crisp flat bread I am used to. I wasn't blown away but I was also not disappointed. The atmosphere is wonderful. However, we went here for our child's birthday and no desert was offered to him. That was a little saddening, seeing how it was ranked best restaurant for kids. At any rate, I won't be rushing back but I also won't be running away. Cornbread was probably the star of the night.

hFVA7Zvuf55IG8EdEHZ15Q.text: Great food, nice atmosphere. There are a lot of nice original libations (try the Ruby Red, if you like vodka) and the burgers are really tasty. The Chile Verde is really nice, too. Because the bar opens to the outside, it's a treat sitting there -- whether you're on the inside looking out, or on the outside catching a breeze. If you have out-of-towners and want to take them somewhere fun, I'd recommend this place.

bqW-aEnspz8r0zIQGkYQdQ.text: Amazing food, amazing atmosphere and a great wait staff. Their burger will blow your socks off. Prices are medium, fresh baked bread is awesome. This is very close to a 5 star restaurant and I recommend giving it a shot if you are in the area.

oNqbGgT8OICwFQGc4fYF3Q.text: Great place!  The atmosphere is great and the service is friendly and attentive.  The food is fresh and unique with a healthy flair.  The almond margarita is to die for and you must get a dessert.  Toffee Cake is a great one.  We loved the toffee cake so much they gave us the recipe.

CXvdm1uxeTsWqcLsozglqQ.text: I went here based on the reviews and menu and my experience confirmed the high praise - and then some!  They are a very conscience restaurant - for example, the server knew where the salmon was caught, which farms the chicken comes from, and where the produce is from.  Everything was prepared with care and it is evident with every flavorful bite.  It was great eating a meal that was as healthful as it was flavorful.  You won't regret eating here!

zQVJG0If0UaVszLYX1BuZQ.text: Moroccan meatballs excellent. Son said French Onion Burger was best burger he's ever had. Ice was even good!

jLJG6DLSczKVouK4nih4nQ.text: I had a really great lunch today at St. Francis.  The food was excellent, the ambiance was beautiful, and the service was very good.  I had the lunch soup/salad/half sandwich for $12.  My girlfriends each had a spinach salad and a pizzeta (sp?).  I think our total tab was around $50 for 3 of us and my son.  I'm pretty sure I inhaled my lunch in 5 minutes, maybe less.  SO GOOD. Can't wait to go back for dinner.  The space is beautiful.  So much light and so well-designed.  Kudos to Aaron for transforming an office building so beautifully.  Not a detail was missed.  I was really pleased to have a great experience at St. Francis.  After reading the mixed reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect.  Will definitely be back--I just wish it wasn't an hour away from me....

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. lunch special--soup, salad, and half sandwich

sNAsn1Jtsuy22cPgqz5htA.text: This place by far is mine and my family's favorite restaurant.  The food is delicious which is unique and has a comfort "feel" to it.  I love the atmosphere which is warm and inviting.

tMAl6pQiar9pNB3Z28qy4Q.text: Restaurant is very nice. But sadly had a bad first experience. When my food came out wasn't how the waiter explained it would be. I was so hungry I dint return my food back. Which was a mistake because my food was not worth what I paid for. Let the server know. Waiter seemed to not care. My luck.

RtTOiphEzDmy2xk4KUCjBQ.text: Love the unique ever-changing menu and selection of interesting drinks, such as a mezcal mule. The indoor/outdoor combo make for a refreshing place whether it's hot or cold outside.

rLG7Sx21c11Y74rBJbk7TQ.text: We went for Sunday brunch and the food was good but the menu changed since when I was there last and it was much more limited.   The big reason for the point deduction is our service was painfully bad.

7UrqwVGpsFNo3mdYSJCugA.text: Menu items change seasonally, but everything is always fantastic. Great atmosphere for dates or small gatherings. From time to time they have a live jazz band as well. This is my go-to spot for birthday dinners (keep in mind it's a little small so you should make a reservation if you have a large party) or date nights. Their family recipe dessert is a must-have too.

NEWtbXGMu3Ysj9HvMp247w.text: Classic Southwest Brunch done without the usual kitch.  Relaxed atmosphere that says take Sundays easy.  Knowledgeable and friendly staff who clearly like food beyond merely serving it.  There may be a wait on Sunday, so plan accordingly.  Trust your bartender to make you something special by simply telling them your tastes.  Walk it off with a stroll around the strip across the street.

5kszs5IMRPBeujHbtJVzLg.text: I often have driven by thinking...I have to try this place!! While working I helped a gentleman who later gave me his email which was stfrancis.something...! I commented that I wanted to try that establishment and asked if he was linked to the restaurant!! He owned it!! Ha Ha!! I figured it was fate and came in with friends to check out the menu! I always refer to Yelp for the favorites and we sampled all the recommended goodies! Baked goat cheese!! Superb! The meatballs....exotic flavors abound! The pig dip that had us trying to refrain from drinking the bacon aus juice! I sneaked a couple sips...I think I would eat my shoe dipped in this!! Then the shrimp risotto!! All the items were delicious! We also had the Santa Rosa cocktail that complimented the goodies nicely!! Thank you Aaron!! We enjoyed it very much!! Well Done!! We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The refreshing cocktail!!
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The meatballs were perfect!! One for each of us was very satisfying!
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baked goat cheese was a tasty start!

qbgS5iRrtvGpr1u0s-j7Bw.text: I love this place! Just the right amount of swank appeal without being pretentious. Food is awesome too!  On my 1st visit, I tried the summer corn soup (excellent!) and a fingerling potato appetizer (really good too!) Add well-priced and well-made happy hour drinks & it was a good time. Next visit was the Moroccan meatballs (OMG yummy!). Portions are generous.   I tried the blueberry corn trifle for dessert. Quirky, creative and it totally worked. The popcorn on top added just the right amount of texture.  Parking is sticky, and the building is mid-block (next to a bank) so be careful not to drive right by it. Valet available.   Service good. Shaded patio (duh, it's Phoenix!).  Bottom line,great place for happy hour eats & drinks, or a swanky date night! Lots of food options to enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qRYQqI1tbP-i16wEYEPyZg.text: Love the decor and love the service but hands down the worst food ever. Ordered medium rare streak at 12:00 on Sunday for brunch. The place  was  slow waitress was amazing friendly got drink order and brought right to us. Now food took 35 minutes steak was over cooked and eggs under cooked. Potatoes looked good but were still raw. So sent back steak . Steak comes back fresh and it will as cold in center. Only thing good was the service and the pancake we ordered . Thanks but no thanks .

-btT6g7XAD8Px95X1iFOiQ.text: Great spot for brunch!  Everything was great, including the fact that you can make a brunch reservation! More restaurants need to pick up on that! We walked in and were sat right away. We ordered the chorizo eggs with spinach and the tomato baked eggs. Both were awesome! The waitress was very attentive and made sure our drinks were always topped off. They also had a live jazz band on Sunday morning which made for a really nice, lively atmosphere.  The only reason why it's not a 5-star is because they have mandatory valet and the temperature was a little off. Even though it was well over 100 degrees outside, they still had the doors/windows open. I am all about the indoor/outdoor space, but maybe it's not the best idea during the summer. Even with AC blasting, those of us who were sitting next to the open doors were really hot.  Overall great brunch spot that I highly recommend!

ffYmRfBq-dQniTDGm4n3Aw.text: Nope, would not recommend, some days it is okay but other days it just sucks, and you come back hoping maybe it'll be better but it's not, food is never good but it isn't bad, just like something your mom could make without as much salt, lol.

R7TymchwF8wW76uHZtMqpA.text: I decided to try this for hubby's birthday. Only way to get in is with valet parking so bring something for your valet. We were seated upstairs and I have to admit it was so dark I had to use my iPhone to see the menu. Music was loud so conversations had to be yelled across the table. Cramped place and the food was good but nothing to rave about. Service was uneven at times rushed and other times non-existent. We shared the goat cheese appetizer which was tasty. Hubby chose the pumpkin soup which he stated was "ok". The shrimp risotto for hubby again received a "just Ok" rating. I chose a simple romaine salad which was "ok". Dessert consisted of sticky toffee pudding which he enjoyed and I had the chocolate truffle. The desserts were better than the meal. Overall 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Parsnip cake with buttercream
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Onion burger
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rice bowl with 7 veggies

oz4JsMlxJiNtWUjPQiMfHg.text: I made a reservation here for Father's Day brunch and I'm glad I did! My experience didn't start off great as I pulled in and saw complimentary valet and was told I had to use it. I'm not a fan of strangers driving my car but chose not to argue. Turns out this place is bigger than it looks as we were taken upstairs and seated in a cozy booth. Our waiter was very friendly and gave his recommendations on drinks and food and even offered us complimentary orange juice later on as we chatted with him more. I decided to go with the Salmon Eggs Benedict, which I really enjoyed. The potatoes that came with it were perfectly flavored. My dad ordered the Mushroom omelette, which he enjoyed as well, but I wouldn't recommend it if you're really hungry. Aside from the valet, I really loved my food and experience at St Francis and definitely recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict

1gCSD9e8BC4vZMXW7ufOpQ.text: Always like a good local spot and I love what they are doing with their menu, makes you appreciate the food and drinks a little more!

fYdl9WXqfV7EWrXFWg-OdQ.text: Arrived 25 minutes early for our 11am reservation for a baby 'sprinkle' for a girlfriend. Our intent was to ask if we could set up a few decorations prior to the other girls arriving. We were not greeted or acknowledged for 5-6 minutes and stood waiting at the host stand. At that point, the hostess came around the corner, trailed by the manager. We were ignored for an additional 2-3 minutes before the manager finally acknowledged us and asked if we had a reservation. We replied that we did. He then asked if our entire party had arrived and we replied that no, we were hoping to set up a few decorations prior to the rest of the group arriving. Had we been told in a professional manner something along the lines of 'oh, you know, we have you down for 11, so we're not quite ready' or 'unfortunately, the table's not ready yet', we would have been 100% okay with that. Instead, we were told, very rudely, 'welp. We can't seat you until the majority of your party is here.' My response was, 'okay. So we can't set the table up?' and he asked 'what are you setting up for?' (as we are standing with our arms full of baby gifts, diapers, etc). We told him a baby shower. He then went on the full defensive, stating that our reservation only says it's for six people. We confirmed that was correct. He then asked incredulously, 'for a baby shower??' Yeah, dude. Six people. Like the reservation says. He then replied 'are you even sure they're coming?? Because we're gonna give you the best seat in the house if it ends up just being the two of you, we can't give it to you.' 'Yes. We're sure they're coming.' 'Do you promise they're coming? Because we can't give you that table if they're not.' Are we in elementary school? Because my five year old wants to pinky promise everything, and I'm pretty sure that's what he was looking for.  At that point the hostess, who was clearly uncomfortable with the conversation, walked us to the [best] table and tried to recover as much as she could, offering her help to set up and making sure we had everything we needed. She was great. The server was also great. Very helpful and friendly. The 'best table in the house' however, was housed directly next to the live band (who were all EXTREMELY friendly and really were a good band) so we couldn't hear each other speak most of the time. Food was sub-par at best.  Worst part was that throughout the meal, he kept peeking around the corner and standing on his tiptoes to 'check the status' of our table from afar. We've all been in the industry and know what you're doing. We know you want to turn the table. However, we have all traveled from out of town, and from across town, to celebrate our friend and her pregnancy. And we're paying guests. With a reservation. So chill out.  Towards the end of our meal, the manager approached the table, leaned over and asked for the extra roll ups (that they failed to pull off the table upon seating us) that had been sitting there the entire time, WHILE we were eating, so he could take them to another table. Tell me you're not going to use those for other guests.  The final straw was when one of our party entered the restroom after he walked out, to an empty toilet paper roll on the dispenser, a half use roll propped up on the side, an un-flushed toilet and an empty soap dispenser.  Nothing would convince me to return.

DJcVcZWGspdWmn-_8hEoTQ.text: All I can say is YUM, yummy food, great drinks and such fun service!

fmYzgMO3rgwy5uqA9kpAEg.text: Great restaurant went there a couple times the most recent time was for a brunch we ordered the pig in a blanket I believe it's called sandwich it's like a roast beef sandwich in the crusty bun along with a salmon on top of of quinoa salad that was really good! We always get gift cards for our friends birthdays and special occasions great place for date night!

V2Uj6g8vfWKGT58tng6oTA.text: This has been hands down one of our favorite date night spots. I hate to say in the past year it has gone downhill. First they changed my favorite salmon dish. They still have salmon but it is not the same! Tonight we went and the service was awkward. Our server was awesome but different staff kept coming out and telling us that the food would be "delayed by ten minutes" due to a rush. Honestly the place was not that crowded and anyway we were on a date and not expecting fast food! The music was awful. Kool and the gang?? Seriously? We asked to change it which they did but who wants to listen to Kool and the Gang? I know this place sold so not sure if things will improve..we may be looking elsewhere for a fav date night spot. Disheartening.

EifOXy8tTypoRlZ6iV1pZw.text: Delicious! I got the forbidden rice bowel with salmon and my friend got the shrimp risotto. I loved my dish. They cooked the salmon perfectly. inally a place that doesn't overcook salmon. The flavors were very unique and complimented each other well. I definitely recommend this place. They also have complimentary valet parking on site which I'm a huge fan of because I cringe at the idea of dealing with park garages in the city. Thanks St. Francis for a wonderful experience. It was a great time celebrating my best friends birthday here.

yHYiMHa1T2qb3e1VSAy7fg.text: Fried egg sandwich with a spicy Bloody Mary is my jam.

Wscb9z9DOrMXkT0lYHf1Vg.text: I've actually only eaten here for brunch. Yumm! The restaurant has an open and cute atmosphere. The brunch is delicious. I don't think you can go wrong with your meal choice. Enjoy!

Si71CaDV2YjtSaA44NrRXA.text: Just had Sunday Brunch and ordered the Biscuit and Gravy with Eggs over medium and a Mimosa. I was dining alone so opted to sit at the outside patio bar, looking in to the main dining area. A pretty good spot for people watching.   My order showed up promptly but was only warm... Not hot? Was confusing, as again the order was out pretty quick.I'm therefore guessing the gravy is made in bulk and just ladled over the also pre-made, but kept warm biscuit. The eggs were cooked pefectly... But rather than taken from the skillet with a spatula, the eggs were poured onto the dish with all the butter they were basted in, creating a puddle on top of the gravy. While I like butter, and the dish is not on anyone's health-conscious menu, it was visually off putting... (See photos) but only just a little. Unfortunately they must have sat in the window or been under a fan or something because they, too, were not hot but only warm.   They next issue was the first bite I took... Which apparently was a bundle of sage or green onions? They were stringy and took some effort to chew up... Seriously chewy... I would have spit them into a paper napkin had I had one.   Ok, all of that pickiness aside, the dish was otherwise well done. Good flavor and consistency to the gravy with large chunks of sausage and the portion was big enough without leaving me in the need for a nap.  The only other issue was with the staff... While its early on a Sunday and the youngish hipster staff made polite acknowledgement of my presence at first, I felt quickly forgotten as I wasn't offered a refill on my beverage or given salt and pepper until I was halfway through the meal. Being a single diner (and former bartender) I easily got the impression I wasn't going to register on their radar unless I spent more or was part of a larger group. Not saying they were not friendly, just that most employees were busier with their own conversations than with the attention paid to the customers. I finished my meal and drink and sat waiting for the check a good five minutes with an empty plate and glass in front of me the whole time as well. While I may understand this at a table in the busy dining room, my server/bartender was no father than six feet from me the entire time.   I'll go back, as again the food is good... But I'll have to lower my expectations I guess.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuit and gravy with over medium eggs... And apparently all the butter/oil they were fried in. Disappointingly, only warm...

A5k5ctPfF1Sp3TNsgJziiQ.text: The food, space, and staff are superlative. Very friendly and efficient staff.  This is a great place to go regularly or for a special occasion.

Mii7JV0NvHn6EmDg2zSsDQ.text: First and foremost, let me just proclaim that the food here is top-notch delicious! We ordered the Moroccan meatballs, baked goat cheese and the famous pig dip. The meatballs were lip-smackingly good. The pig dip was like mana from heaven. So, two thumbs up (plus two toes up) for the excellent food.  Now, the reason I'm giving St. Francis just two stars is the service...it was ABOMINABLE. Our waitress was difficult to flag down or to even find. Since we couldn't find her, we asked another waitress to call her for us. The other waitress asked us what we wanted and we told her that we wanted a beer. She even gave her recommendation and said that she would take care of our order. From that time until we were done with our meal, we didn't see a trace of the said beer.  To seal our verdict on the disappointing service, when we asked for a paper bag to put our take-out boxes in (we had 2 big boxes of leftover pig dip), our waitress, who finally decided to show herself to collect the payment, said that they don't keep the paper bags up on the second floor (where we were seated) and that we could get a bag from the hostess from downstairs on our way out. All that time that she was giving us this lame excuse, we were thinking, "Why couldn't she just go down and get the paper bags for us now?" She was very inefficient, inattentive and unhelpful. For this reason, we don't think we'll be back to St. Francis.

BYPBJTD57JVg1FY_iHgtKQ.text: Me and the lady, me and the inlaw kids, me alone, been here many times and its always great. Not sure the complaints about staff or wait times or valet people post on here... If it looks busy, you gonna wait. If there is an open parking spot and 5 cars sitting in the line, you can't just park yourself, If you haven't got what you ordered, tell the server.   For me the brunch is the best, better than the dinner menu, if I had to judge the two. One of the most consistently best spots in town.

p4Ed9juVByDnC8uqLcy9Ng.text: Right across the street from a private school so lots of young girls in plaid skirts on bikes come through. We went at a busy time and received excellent service despite the rush. I noticed Ryan (food runner) working extra hard and made sure to tip specifically him but noticed he put it in the tip jar instead of his pocket :/ great food but little pricey. Good for coffee and dog spotting

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ryan put down everything he was doing just to fill the coffee for me. Mad respect
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Doggo spotting me spot him

HRQbVCzYhlxPOI6O0nGDtQ.text: So it's actually been  couple weeks since I was here but still wanted to do this review.  Went with coworkers for lunch. I am so in love with the venue and its ambiance. Service was amazing and the food was very good. Unfortunately don't remember the burger I ordered only that I enjoyed it though I did not care for the accompanying fries. Fries weren't terrible just ok but then I like crisp to my fries and these had more flop than pop. Now the pumpkin soup was amazing...creamy, hot and tasty. My fries are the only reason they are getting 4 from me but really the overall experience was great and I am definitely going back and recommend others go!

Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmmm mmmmm good, pumpkin soup!

2QzzgLUPF--m2YyWJDpBSQ.text: Just amazing appetizers and service. Mussels & Chorizo a delectable placed flavor. My drink of choice is The Dark and stormy.. It doesn't disappoint. Date or happy hour on Saturdays from 3-6 or Friday nights. Atmosphere and flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xIb5kFjohDJvgc1ygDd9Rg.text: Joined a friend for happy hour last night & sat at a table (no bar seats avail) it was fairly busy with screaming kids (ugh!) never witnessed so many kids at HH before. Anyway, the service was absolutely horrendous (food 4 stars) the server seemed irritated that she had to serve me & it took way too long for a happy hour menu & my first round of drinks to arrive.  Note to St Francis: your HH menu is very confusing and misleading. I thought all food items on the lunch menu/HH menu were $3 off and you only showcase a few wines, even though every wine by the glass is half-off.  I was surprised to see my fingerlings weren't discounted even though they were on HH menu. Anyway, they need to work on hiring more staff and I would appreciate my server letting me know HH is ending so I can order another glass of wine for $5 she did give me my second glass at the HH price because it was just 6pm when I finally flagged her down.  The food is solid so I will return in the future but I must sit at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy fingerlings very tasty! ($8)

s4E9Z0XXkdhLt1Goo5dQZg.text: Thanks to DDD this spot was right on! I was trying to make it for brunch and the apple pancake but ended up meeting for lunch with a friend. Had the pig dip sandwich which was epic. The bread was amazing but the bacon jam was awesome! I will def. try to recreate this one at home!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pig dip

nxyUwhSlWsnCqaWorxq2Sw.text: My family and I went to St.francis tonight to celebrate my birthday, we had told them upon making he reservation that we were celebrating it. St.francis staff did not even acknowledge my birthday. We ordered the cucumber cocktail which was nice and the happy hour Pinot noir which was good. I've been dreaming about the Moroccan meatballs that I had awhile back, so I ordered those. My husband got the Chile pork verde and we also got the fingerling potatoes. The pork and potatoes were good, but the meatballs dish didn't have the same flavor it use to have, the sauce lacked the seasoning that it normally has in it. Overall, I probably won't be back, which is unfortunate as it use to be a family favorite.

ABbxvWh7Fq14-LHcxWvszQ.text: I visited this place in the first week of October. I am sharing my experience a bit late but surely don't want to miss. I have been here before and I have waited for at least an hour to get a table for two but this time I reserved before coming. So yes, this place gets slammed during dinner time and if you mind waiting that long then reservation is highly recommended. Also, this place was on Guy Fieri's must visit list, so it needs no further description.   In the menu, few things were exceptional and some were just fine. Nothing was bad though, so overall four stars. We tried crispy fingerling potatoes which could have been crispier. Creamy corn soup and corn bread were good. In entree, Italian meat balls and veggie wild rice bowl were flavorful! For the  dessert, we had toffee pudding which was little sweeter than my liking but my husband loved it.   I hate to mention but this place was very noisy that day. One big group in particular was VERY loud that it was hard to hear across the table. That definitely made it less enjoyable.
