DKP0w5hfF7wwAj6K_sX5Kg.text: I haven't been in a while but the last I went it was very good; food and customer service

H55ICexmub1fthwqrvGltA.text: Where to begin, how do you summarize the worst night of your life? I can only say that I will never be going back unless I want to punish whoever I am with. I don't understand how any organization could be run so incompetently and still have an unnecessarily long wait time to be served garbage. The wait staff seemed completely uninterested in our order or our needs. We got some truffle fries and unfortunately they were oversalted to the point of being inedible. Trying to get them re-done so that we could actually have fries we could eat was a hassle and they acted like we were an inconvenience to them. Our first order was a shrimp and avocado salad which can only be described as devoid of flavor. When the tastiest item present is red onion, you know you're in dire straits. We also got the forbidden rice bowl which came out as a pile of mush with a few pieces of vegetable noticeable. The only saving grace was the cucumber cooler cocktail that we ordered was drinkable. I have had meals five times as good for half the price. I would not go here unless I was literally trying to waste money. I would recommend the chipotle across the street or literally licking the street instead of going to this restaurant. The whole place needs to be redone, from the management to the waitstaff to the cooks to the people who own the building and those who clean up the floor.  We need a complete overhaul to make this place slightly bearable. Honestly just knock it down and start over from scratch  Tl,dr: I wish I would've hit my head on the way out so I wouldn't have any memories of this place.

Us-FUCOMyNvInsgeOSi7mg.text: Pretty bummed about my experience here today. I have had this place bookmarked forever so I was excited to finally get a chance to dine-in for brunch. Unfortunately, my experience here wasn't so great.   My husband and I parked in the back lot so we walked through the restaurant to the host check-in and noticed on our walk in a bunch of empty tables. I thought to myself, "Great! There won't be a wait..." So, I was a little surprised when the hostess told us there would be a 30-minute wait. Thinking to myself it was probably an overestimation (as I have discovered many restaurants do these days) we agreed to wait.  It's important to note I am currently 7 1/2 months pregnant and quite uncomfortable standing for long periods. So, when told we'd have a 30-min wait, I looked around and asked if there was a place I could sit while waiting for our table. Again, a bunch of the tables in the main dining area were free and there was actually a two-top with a nice booth backing right near the host station that was also vacant (that I specifically asked if we could sit at). Instead, the hostess directed my husband and I to sit at a counter with tall bar stools (not so comfy) that overlooked the kitchen. Mind you, these seats were less than 2-yards from the other, more comfortable 2-top I asked about AND they were serviced by the same waiter! He asked if we wanted to order drinks and eventually took our food order.   Now these stool counter seats were a bit awkward since we were basically directly overlooking the chef that works the fire oven. Which would have been fine if he was friendly, fun, cool, gave samples, or customer-oriented. Except, he was clearly not at all interested in us asking him any questions or watching him do his thing - and these seats sort of forced us to literally watch his every move, observe his work space, and view the entire kitchen. Honestly, it was kind of torturous watching all the delicious food being prepared and delivered to tables while we sat and waited for a real table for nearly 40-minutes.   The server we were assigned at this counter top also wasn't super welcoming or forthcoming about the expected wait time for a real table or food. He also forgot to bring me a coffee refill and didn't check in on us much.   Finally, after 40-minutes of waiting in uncomfortable seats, starving, feeling tortured by all the food we had to just look at - I was getting HANGRY! I made a bit more of a fuss. I asked the hostess if we could get an actual table. She apologized and told us the kitchen was backed up and she didn't want us to have to wait longer once seated at a table for food - (which makes no sense to me) - and we explained we had already ordered food from our "server" and just wanted an actual table in the dining area. She promptly seated us at one of the several open tables and our food was delivered about 10 minutes later.   The food itself was actually very good. I can see why this place does well overall because the flavors and quality are definitely great. I am also guessing from all the other reviews that our service is not the typical experience most guests have while dining here.   Still, I probably won't return. The fact that I am visibly very pregnant and they were ok with us:  -waiting for so long in uncomfortable, awkward seats with many other open table options -didn't update us on expected wait-times -didn't explain up front that the kitchen was what was super backed up -didn't offer a comped drink or app or extra apologies to make up for the crappy service   ...definitely didn't leave us feeing like we were very welcomed, valued customers. Bummer.

QZR5puNs52Lee15q1y3tzg.text: I work in the industry and am picky on where I choose to eat at. So when I go out I expect my money's worth I had brunch there today and it was highly disappointing idk what the kitchen was selling but it wasn't  food. I chose to have a cinnamon roll which was obviously store bought, the Eggs Benedict was discussing hollandaise was really thin and plain it also came out cold. So my wife order the French onion burger it was mediocre to say the least. The best part of her was the servers which is the only reason there getting two stars.

qo9wzVgET2d2x1F6mRj9xw.text: This place seems to have management issues.  In fact, where was the manager during dinner service on 8/17/18?  The place was a complete shit-show.  We weren't greeted after being seated for an extended period of time.  Other tables hadn't been pre-bussed and looked understandably upset.  It was difficult to get service.  When we were finally able to get someone's attention, it was awkward, nervous and standoffish.  Not exactly the warm welcome one would expect.  Drinks then took forever as the bar seemed to be backed up.  They then ran out of wine glasses and served a Cabernet in a champagne flute!  It also happened to be ice cold.  When we finally paid and left, all the dirty plates from our dinner remained on the table.    The food was good, but unfortunately the kitchen's good work was overshadowed by the FOH's complete failure.  Not once was a manager visible helping to clear tables, make drinks, check on guest, etc.  If there was an effort to get things back on track, all would have been forgiven, but it seemed like they just didn't care.  The bathroom was also filthy and there was no paper towel.  I think this place's glory days have come and gone.  We won't be back.  EDIT:  I just read that this place had been recently sold.  Of course!  That explains the 180 degree change from previous experiences.  Don't go in expecting the St. Francis of the past.

7iY3DSUrO-ZSvbxq714Mow.text: I love this place! One of my favorites in Arizona! Awesome food and craft cocktails although fairly pricey! Not my regular place but fun to go once or twice a year! Beautiful decor and occasional love music

HqvB1lTWi38FqFMhB9AEKw.text: Sat at the bar after a Dr appointment this am... was having a bad morning. Wonderful sweet bartender named Malcom was so kind to listen to me... I hope to see him again, great service! :)

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baked Goat Cheese... yummy!
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cucumber Cooler... Hindricks Gin, muddled cucumber &amp; fresh lemonade. Very refreshing

zPy_CKC7ILfGps0gkS-cVw.text: A fall from greatness.  This place must be under new management/ownership. So sad to see the food quality drop the way it has.  This formerly was one of my favorite restaurants. I went in about 2 weeks ago and my girlfriend ordered the meatballs which come with a delicious pearl pasta underneath. After receiving the dish we noticed it did not have the pasta. We asked our waiter, she went to the kitchen, then came back and informed us they no longer include that.... It was one of the main reasons we ordered it and clearly printed still on the menu as the description. I expressed my displeasure with the discrepancy got an apology from the waitress, who actually had perfectly good service, but nothing was done about it except we were offered free sherbert after dinner if we wanted.  Fast forward two weeks and I really wanted to give it a try again so I went and got some stracciatela as that was delicious when I had it before. It was very obvious they were almost our and just scraped/ dumped the last of that container into the bowl. It did not have the freshest taste and it was not the usual consistency and full of water. Bartender was phenomenal however!   I would have formerly given 5+ stars to this place for the ambiance, food, and service, but it seems those in charge no longer share the passion for food the former management did.

OWM-aYUEZweI2X3bx1r9TA.text: Nice Resturant. Good food. More expensive than Taco Bell. I'd take a date there for a special occasion.

3esPpjQbcqNoWeZzS8laIA.text: I took my wife here last night for an early birthday dinner and we were really disappointed. I've been here once before and it was good but not the case this time. The service was good but the food was not. My wife for the meatballs that weren't too bad but the pig dip sandwich I got was not good at all. The bread was stale and the meat was cold. I was excited to go because I remember how good it was but I don't know when I'll be back.

v3cPLqtBdi0hMdRpdRpmOA.text: Ok so it's been awhile since I've had a steak that made me just smile. I had the hanger steak and it was so flavorful, tender and just downright good. If you save room for desert the bread pudding was the best I've had... Ever.   Other then that the service was fast and everyone in my party had a really good time.  If you want dessert order the sticky toffee pudding. Delish!

SNQtGn60sukrMtvfDha1pQ.text: Last time I ate at St. Francis I ordered a salad that had colorless lettuce, croutons, and a little parmesan cheese...would that be a Cesar salad maybe? It was $11.00. If I had wanted chicken, that would have been 4-5 dollars more. Dressing was boring. I make great green salads at home for very little money. Why would I want to eat a mediocre one for $16? Why is it that if you want to try and eat healthier, it costs so much more and usually ends up thrown together as a boring after thought on the menu? Value alarm went off!

ZpYiOLntCNWOncAKcxcUSw.text: Fun and modern 2 story restaurant. We were there for lunch but not very impressed. Ordered forbidden rice salad with chicken, meatballs, sweet potatoes, and meat flatbread. Salad was over priced ($19) for what we got, nothing really impressive in the ingredients either. Meatballs were excellent however, I wouldn't recommend it if you are not a meat lover though (there's LOT of meat). The sweet potato...you get one potato! I think it was $7. They just baked it and added some seasoning. The flatbread wasn't very flat. It was very doughy and not impressive. I think Trader Joe's frozen pizza is way better. Overall, very expensive lunch for mediocre food.
