N4WuesknqDMj0oMg4zAKkw.text: i had been wanting to come to the St. Francis for a while. When i walked in, i wasn't even acknowledged. I waited with friends for like five minute before, "have you been helped?" was asked from afar. The host said to give him 3 minutes and they would have a table set up. We were sat, and given menus.   As we were sitting the table next to us was sending their food back as everything was cold. Ten minutes later the waiter came back and dropped off some glasses of water, and then didn't even look at us before walking away. Another 10 minutes passed and he came back and said Hi and then offered us drinks. My almond margarita tasted like a plain margarita. The blue corn tortilla quesadilla was really good, and i recommend that. ONLY that.   Our waiter forgot about us. He came back and took our food order and then left, and we didn't see him for a while. He surfaced at our table to give us water, and then left again. Other tables that arrived after we did, were served a lot faster.   When we got our food. I ordered the Chile Burger, and boy I was disappointed. it was cooked correctly, but there was no flavor. I ended up adding salt, pepper, and some of the sauce from the quesadilla to at least make it edible. Our waiter didn't come back to ask how everything was tasting.   The waiter showed up, and asked if we wanted dessert, but honestly after waiting for so long I ended up opting out of dessert and calling it a night.   I have heard so many good things about the food here but honestly, i would go somewhere else for dinner. The food was bad, and the service was terrible.

SPW8grWWJBezJ24ajWqTQw.text: The place is very nice but needs some work on service and quality. The steaks are not as good as they look for some reason. They lack flavor. Everything else was very good. I had the home grown beets as appetizer. Bathrooms were very filthy, no cleanliness at all. People were drying their hands with toilet paper before I told one of the servers the restrooms needed attention.

AohdmFvyXc_GIh8XE1ojtw.text: I'm just going to say this place was all around fantastic. Loved the jazz on Sunday and the food was stellar. Also the architecture was super cool. I got the eggs Benedict. Seems to be a place that has a wait on the weekend! Also decor is very hipster / South American modern cool. Has the very popular role up window and beautiful landscaping in front. Will come back!

CPkz-AB8uVqrwCQuphn8Iw.text: Great food, service, and atmosphere. The chicken salad sandwich was delicious and enough for two to split. The place has a great vibe about it and the service was excellent. I would definitely come back again and highly recommend!

NhLJXQSTZLX2DCWb2Z4Fkw.text: It was ok. Nothing bad about it but nothing that wowed me either. I saw it featured on Food Network and the Travel Channel so I think there was just a lot of hype. Food was ok and the restaurant had a cool vibe to it.

22zEO_K9ilxOe3WwF2it0A.text: This place has an amazing atmosphere and an even better happy hour. Love coming here on occasion. Would definitely come more if the hospitality at the bar improved.

S1-toSvfxHz_ctx0yhNQPA.text: The service was awful!!! We sat..and sat...and sat with no service. The restaurant was fairly empty so busyness factor was not the issue, just lazy waiters and waitresses! Never coming back!

w79WINplFc-OxuBYMTh5uQ.text: In the land of urban sprawl and desert colored shipping malls filled with chain stores and restaurants,  St Francis,  is an oasis in the desert,  no pun intended.   Looking like a Dwell Magazine sustainable design structure on the outside,  St Francis has an open flow,  outdoor terrace dining,  outdoor bar,  large open windows connecting the interior and exterior spaces.   Serving farm to table comfort food,  the kitchen is open. Our table had a view of bandanbed, bearded, tattooed chefs doing their thing,  and they did it well.    Shaved Brussel sprouts and cauliflower salad with pomegranates almonds fried capers etc was excellent. The Moroccan meatballs in Moroccan spiced tomato sauce with pearl couscous,  slow cooked pot roast, fire roasted  peppers, all were delicious.    Their infused vodka drinks were strong and excellent.   Our servers could not have been more enthusiastic and charming.  We got the whole " what farm the meat and vegetables came from" schtick, kind of like that Portlandia Chicken episode, which was cool, but we didn't get a bio or go to the farm to check out our meals parents :-D  Good place,  good folks,  nice change of pace.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gXRSHQNkukyRbm9F6pu78w.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat! From the intimate and warm setting to the well crafted dishes, the restaurant stands out! Fresh and local ingredients! Good drinks and  great desserts! My experience at St Francis is at dinner and lunch. On weekends, they tend to get too busy and service is not the best but overall, i would highly recommend if you want local and creative cuisine but a traditional twist.... everything that is roasted is delicious!

ouWTfA26YZVzMk-ZRXKLiw.text: Great atmosphere, food and service! Unique little spot with checking out. The Pig Dip was delish!

IpDk9id-Fi3eIh03lcq2rQ.text: I had dinner here with a good friend.  We had the pork belly and the rainbow trout.  The pork belly was good and tasty.  The rainbow trout was probably the best in the Phoenix area, or in the top 3.   Place is nice and cozy, and dark with candle light at night and has complimentary valet service.  Nice romantic atmosphere on a Thursday night.

cRStDzrfXY3H14YYilzXRw.text: The food and service were excellent. I had the skillet pancake which was far from generic. My partner had the quinoa bowl which she enjoyed. Nice relaxing atmosphere for breakfast. Also nicr background music.   With all the healthy options it surprises me that there is no Almond or Soy milk available. Seems to be an issue with many Phoenix restaurants.  Over all very good and will return.

N1XWR42IZgibeB31OAcqVw.text: Where to begin....  First, the parking. If you don't want to be forced to valet, then you better park across the street and walk. Oh well, I decided to go with convenience... Upon entering there was an inviting feel and I was quickly greeted by the smiling hostess. She promptly sat me at one of the very few open tables - and I thought, this is a great sign being that it was 1pm on a Tuesday, but that's where the service started going awry.   Immediately after sitting down a waiter popped up behind me and yelled "hi". He asked what I wanted to order, but I had literally just been seated and hadn't even picked up the menu - so I asked for a minute.... though, 15 minutes later he still hadn't returned. I finally had to flag him down (which I haaaaaaaaate doing) and asked to place some orders while waiting for my sister.   I started with a dark and stormy, I love my cocktails and it was refreshing. For an appetizer I ordered the baked goat cheese. When the appetizer was brought over, it was a different waitress and she rushed by, slammed the plate down, and ran off. It was almost like she was upset at the table - I couldn't imagine what it had done to offend her, but I figured, maybe she's in a hurry and after tasting the food, I was happy. It was very good. The bread was nice and crunchy and the prominent flavor of the goat cheese was balanced out by the tomato sauce at the bottom of the dish.   Next, the entree's - My sister's plate was SLAMMED down first... she just looked at me in a confused way... then another waitress brought my dish and just plopped it down on top of the small appetizer plate and silverware in front of me... I tried to move the stuff out of the way, but before I could she quickly ran off again. Okay, what in the world is happening? We were both a little confused by the abruptness of the servers. Its like they just grabbed these people off the street and gave them an apron. At least the taste of our food was better than the service.   My sister tried the garden, the chicken and the egg (why such a long name for what is basically a salad, I don't know). She said it was very good, nice and refreshing. I tried the french onion burger, it was good and had french onion dip dripping off it, can't complain about that.   Overall, I give it 3 stars because the place had pretty good food and a great vibe (4 stars), but the service left something to be desired (2 stars). I would go back, but I am not in a hurry.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dark and stormy with baked goat cheese appetizer

jsKhy_2JDE3erLyS1Va66Q.text: This is one of my favorite spots. A great atmosphere with excellent service and a fantastic menu. I often come for happy hour and a few appetizers but am never disappointed when having a full meal. Staff is always professional and friendly and well versed in the menu. They will customize you meal per request and offer suggestions.  A regular place for me and one I highly recommend!

_KM0g8lHkrmzC5OFTbklUg.text: Haven't been here in a couple years. Went to celebrate a friend's birthday. Staff was very attentive. Food was okay, small portions. Bummed that new management makes you pay for kids meals. Old owners allowed kids to eat free all the time.

Wo9vcNgGp4qxfxtpsHeskA.text: This restaurant came as a breath of fresh air after my last few disappointing outings as I explore my new town.  The menu offered creative, well-prepared, and beautifully presented fare.  The ambience was excellent.  Our waitress was friendly and our food was served promptly.    Highly recommend for a lunch or dinner with a friend, date, or on business.  One of the most pleasant experiences I've had in Phoenix since I moved here last month.

U0ahBGlKxzXS0MJPPr8Xew.text: I finally made it to St. Francis.  This is the place that we have often talked about going, but never actually made it.   If you are the same way, drop what you are doing and head on over there immediately!     My boyfriend brought me here for dinner on my birthday.  I loved it!  Great ambiance, definitely good for a date night on a special night!   The food was delicious.  I had the chile pork verde and he had the salmon and quinoa, both were excellent choices.  We each had to refrain from licking the plates!  =)   The food was excellent, so flavorful.   Hats off to the chef!!    Can't wait to go back and try more here.

6FdZOARjcFINSOsj_mZ3oA.text: Brunch was really yummy.  The omelet was cooked perfectly.  Great atmoshphere with a loft feel. Service was excellent!

_ywR_Zchr1DNF0yZvBN1MA.text: Four of us enjoyed dinner, & drinks. The place is cozy, casual, & comfortable. Service was excellent! Food...yum! Started with baked goat cheese, & we were ALL happy we did! Specialty drinks were great, martinis were just OK. Dinners were trout, risotto, meatballs, & the pork chile verde. We all tasted every dish, & were extremely pleased with every one! We had the caramel corn chocolate trifle dessert...worth it!  Portions are generous enough for a doggy bag. My only disappointment was no espresso. We will be back as soon as we can!

zNusSRrZdEE0WxjsM3BGmQ.text: Very nice. Stopped in for dinner on a busy Friday night and we had a great time. The almond margarita is really excellent, with an unusual flavor and delicious taste. The vegetable flatbread is relatively healthy and light - good option if you're avoiding meat. The French onion burger is really tender and delicious, and I liked the thick cut fries that came with it. The pork chile verde is spicy and yummy, with a great cornbread on the side. The chicken salad sandwich is good, but I'm not sure if it's worth getting again. The other menu items are so good and promising that i think the chicken salad sandwich is a little too boring in comparison.  The service was a little slow, and I thought the seating was a bit crowded. Overall, very nice. I'd go back (especially for happy hour).

9PFm2dLP7P9ro7H7QS2gsA.text: This place never seems to fail.  I always get the special if they have one, I've never been disappointed.  Want a refreshing brunch, lunch, or dinner?  This is the place!

9iF2A5O3FdwOsjku1kiIgg.text: My wife absolutely loved it, and I thought it was good. I really enjoyed the look of the place, and the staff were very friendly. I wasn't as wowed by the food as my wife, though I'll definitely give it another go, and recommend it to people looking for a romantic place to dine out.

o1vsBLgtkmamPq9-FmTlEA.text: Looks like it's been about a year and a half since I did my St. Francis review. Good timing - as I was asked to suggest dinner ideas for my cousins visiting from New York. And ideas for Sunday brunch with a dear friend and her daughter. So happy we decided to come here! (Yes - two visits in one weekend - score for me!)  For dinner - we arrived close to 6:30, a party of 4 with no reservations. No problem - we were seated in under 20 minutes (we got lucky!) We ordered way too much food - the four of us shared 2 apps, 3 salads and 2 entrees - as well as a few cocktails. It was all SO GOOD! Our server Barry was perfectly on point through the night - my NYC cousins were sufficiently impressed - and St. Francis retains its placement as one of my favorite Valley restaurants.   Fingerling potatoes, baked goat cheese, romaine hearts, kale ceasar, beets, roasted salmon superfood and the special that night of half a roasted chicken. All prepared and plated beautifully. None of us had room for dessert - so that will be a goal for next time!  For brunch Sunday - we arrived at 10:15 - I had made reservations and we were seated immediately. Cocktails and coffee for the grownups, mocktail for the daughter. We shared a baker's board and ordered the kid's pancake, smoked salmon flatbread and tomato baked eggs. There was no room for dessert - but with the lemon and pear muffin, carrot cake and cinnamon roll from the baker's board - we didn't really need it.  Once again - and proving the consistency in service and food from my first review - St. Francis does it right! So happy to have it nearby - and need to keep it on my heavy rotation list!

ky2E6aNeO92m0pZDkjFj4A.text: Beyond the valets, who were quite efficient, we had a truly underwhelming experience at the St. Francis and would never return.     Hosting - 0 stars Incompetent and argumentative... They told us on the phone there was no wait and we should hurry over.  Arrived in less than 10 minutes and told it was now a 35-minute wait (even though 1/3 of the place was empty) and we better plan on getting drinks in the bar, .  We protested and they argued back that we took too long to arrive.  We showed them our cell phone and yes, it was 7 minutes since we had spoken.  They rolled their eyes and grudgingly gave us the huge bar table that was far too large for just the four of us.  Should have just walked out right then.  Seating - 0 stars Very dark with no lighting, no menu, and no server.  Waited for a while in site of the host.  Finally, went over to ask her for a couple of menus.  It was so dark, had to use our cell phones to read the menu.  After a squinting at them for a while, still no water & no server.  We're about to flee this "Bermuda Triangle" experience, but the server finally shows up and apologizes profusely that this is not normally his section.  OK - let's start again...  Unfortunately, it did not improve much.  Service - 2 stars Pleasant & helpful, but we were repeatedly forgotten.  Our shared appetizer didn't show until the main courses arrived.  Refills of water were slow and offers to refresh hour drinks didn't occur until we were nearly finished eating.  Took ages to get the bill paid now that the place (about 90 minutes later) had finally filled up.  Food - varied * Roasted Salmon "superfood" - 4 stars ($23) quinoa, avocado, soy beans, radish, sweet chile vinaigrette were a good combination of flavors.  We enjoyed that dish.  * Flatbread (which was like fluffy Boboli bread) - 2 stars ($13+ each) - Roasted vegetable version was severely lacking the vegetable toppings - Sausage version was heavy & greasy, and flatbread fell apart  * Meatballs - 1 star ($15) Three dry, overcooked & overly spicy meatballs (and I normally like spice) Had heartburn all night  ;-( Plus the garlic bread served with it was so hard, it was uneatable.    We will not return.

hgciQQRjFCFtlExHvo3lXQ.text: Popped in here looking for a place to eat after checking it out on Yelp.  I had the cheese flatbread, which I found to be so-so.  I also had to try the fingerling potatoes. YUM YUM.  The outside was nice and crispy.  Two of us split the small order, which was plenty for us.  She had the eggplant parmesan.  Definitely a different take than the standard Italian where it is soggy and swimming in sauce.  This eggplant was very tasty and had some body to it.  Small dinner salad was also a nice addition.  The service was EXCEPTIONAL.  We came at an off time, so could see that this place could get packed quickly.  Quirky table set-ups inside and out...

pMlm2wZxDdN6LbSwjMa13w.text: Went here for one of my best friend's birthdays. We had a large group so you know things are usually altered when you're traveling in a pack of 12. We were seated in a cool area that had part of the booth extend out into a bay type window area. It was a really cool effect and would be really nice if it was rainy but as it was, it was a nice touch. We order our drinks, that didn't take too long. My boyfriend attempted to order a Heineken, then a Fosters, then a Corona, but they didn't have any of those options... He finally settled on a Stella which he was happy with, but I thought it odd that they didn't have any of those other options.   We moved on to the menu, which if you're a vegetarian, go else where. I was a vegetarian for a time and I really didn't see a lot of options outside of the salads. Not only that but it seemed like meat was infused into everything. I swear, not joking, pork was in every other item on the menu. If you like pork, that's great, but if you don't eat it, or can't eat it you were kinda $hit outta luck. Even dishes like fish had some kinda of pork in it... kinda weird. Oh yeah, and PIG DIP, is not an attractive name... I finally settled on the pot roast and got an appetizer of the goat cheese.   Meanwhile our drinks took literally around 20 minutes to get. This might be ok, except they weren't that busy... I got a standard margarita which was average at best.   We eventually got our goat cheese app but my friend had to re-request the bread that he had ordered for everyone. The goat cheese was really great, I'm not sure I've had melted goat cheese before but it was definitely a good choice and probably the best part of the meal and evening.   Eventually our food did come, it definitely took a while. The waitress left plenty of empy water and drink classes sit for a long time. I'm not sure if it was because we were tucked away in the corner or what... oh that and no matter what she's gonna get 18% gratuity. It took a while, and we actually had to try and flag her down so we could order another round of drinks and get some more water... But anyways back to the food. My pot roast was good, but definitely not amazing. i think I'll probably stick to eating my mothers for how much it cost. But to be fair I feel like most other people were happy with their food, and its not that I wasn't, but this place is pretty expensive and the service had been crap at that point.   We got our checks and attempted to pay, but they gave us our bills without gratuity, so after we gave our money, she they returned to give it back so we could pay gratuity that she had forgot to add on (they were very good about splitting up the check though, which is always appreciated). After gratuity it was a hefty bill for two people. We then re put our money in and 15 minutes were ready to leave. She never came back with our change (and I wasn't leaving her a 30 dollar tip for that service) so I went back in to find out what happened and she had actually never even taken our bill again. So when she finally came back to get it, what should have been 11 dollars and change, she just handed me two 5 dollar bills..... I don't even know what to say about that.   All in all, the food was fine, it wasn't great it wasn't horrible. The ambiance was nice, visually I enjoyed the venue, but service wise I was super freaking disappointed. I'm not crazy about having amazing service, but that was just horrible and if you're not busy, there's no excuse. ESPECIALLY when a group of 12 people is then paying gratuity. LAME and I don't know that I'll go back.

JnV8l4ckiMKiYSykm-i_bg.text: So far, everything I have had here has been great!  The buns on the burgers are so yummy.  AND, the best part of all is that kids eat free here, every day, all day.  The kids meals (burgers, pizzas) are the same size as the adults too.  My daughter really enjoyed her burger.

EL2W1TEwHjCyRTvZnAPN8w.text: I have never had such a good lunch with my children! Their food was FREE! I can't believe how big the burger and fries were for them. They loved it!! Every time I am here the service is awesome. They make us feel at home, and they have a great attitude about us having the children with us:) once my chicken was too dry:( but not always!  The salads are amazing and happy hour is perfect!!! We will be back a lot!!!

SLARCMn76LZC5hU4nPokZg.text: Actually had a great time here this Sunday morning. Food was amazing and service on par. I highly recommend the mushroom omelette.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omelette

wHaxbLW0qaNR4iJKMyRabQ.text: Came for happy hour. Delicious cocktails. The French 111 was my favorite. Kids eat free which was a great surprise and the food for them was really well prepared. Cheese pizzas and chicken breast with spinach.   We ordered the French onion burger, medium with French fries. So delicious. Also the pork chili verde with two yolky eggs on top. Wow!   Service was amazing. So kind and thoughtful.

9u3fjZ0NEQAhzLdi8ShJNQ.text: Definitely not my favorite! I went here after seeing it on TV the night before. So excited to get the pig sandwich. I got there around brunch time so I had alittle wait. 45 minutes...cool...no problem. I sat at the bar and had three drinks while I waited (don't judge me. I was thirsty.) The bartenders were cool ,very trendy and friendly. My bill came to $30. Paid & went to my table, all excited about the pig. To my dismay, I couldn't order the pig because it wasn't lunch time, they didn't have all the ingredients AND if I wanted it, I would have to wait another 45 minutes until the shipment of supplies came in. Not a good first impression. Still excited to give this place a try, I order the American Breakfast. Definitely something I can cook at home (see pic). I was not a fan. During my brunch, the bartender thought I hadn't paid my bar tab. Luckily I kept my receipt (let this be a lesson to you kids. Keep your receipt). He resolved the issue, I paid for my brunch & left. A few days later, I was checking my account and noticed two charges. Sounds good...right? One for the bar & one for brunch. Fooled you didn't I? Must have fooled them too. A different card was used for lunch. The bar charged me twice. Yup...you read that right. TWICE! They get three stars because Shelby (manager) took care of the issue within minutes with a giftcard for the second charge. IDK if that's good or not considering I wasn't planning to go back AND they get to keep my money. I went for the quickest option because Shelby said it would take two weeks to get my money back. Why? It didn't take two weeks to come out the account. My gift card is in the safe with name on it but I'm not in a rush to pick it up. I'll give you three guess why...

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

j-VAU6dvizKvGNBcTv1vPg.text: If I was solely rating the food, this place would be a three star restaurant, but the ambiance and the structure of the restaurant really deserves my extra star.  The design of this restaurant is really very beautiful, and the outside area is absolutely lovely.    Our waitresses seems to have a little argument about who our table belonged to which gave me an uncomfortable feeling.   We got the pumpkin soup and the goat cheese appetizer.  The pumpkin soup was good, too sweet for my taste, which we fixed by adding lots of black pepper.  The herbed goat cheese though, wasn't quite what I expected.  I love baked herbbed goat cheeses, and this one was cooked so long until it was almost completely liquid, and served with lots of tomatoes.  So it's more of a baked tomato goat cheese than herbs.  It was still pretty good, I was just craving one of my favorite preparations of goat cheese which this one failed to satisfy.

1bVFQo0pCcznavb3Ez66qw.text: We have been going to St. Francis since it opened.  Have always enjoyed the atmosphere and the food.  A few weeks ago we stopped in there for lunch.  We both had a cup of the pumpkin soup which was delicious, then my husband had a burger and a beer, I had the forbidden rice bowl.  I've always enjoyed the rice bowl but this time it was terrible.  The vegetables were barely cooked, the chicken was old and tasteless, there was no ginger, It was a bland dish.  The good news was the wine.  Next time we want to drop 80.00 for lunch it won't be at St. Francis.   Such a disappointment!

ogFgbSlRi-yNM8W4_jpbiQ.text: Saint Francis of Assisi may be the patron saint of animals and the environment but after a recent visit, I wonder if St Francis neighborhood restaurant in Central Phoenix can live up to it's namesake.  I'd heard several things about this little restaurant near Camelback road and Central in Phoenix via both Facebook and Twitter, mostly from people who seem to know a thing or two about a good meal. After having stopped in on several occasions I'm ready to share my thoughts.  The restaurant is larger than it appears from the outside, in fact, you can (and I have on many occasions) drive right past with nary a glance. The parking is terrible but once inside things begin to come together. The decor is modern, funky and comfortable, the staff accommodating, and the menu enticing.  As I'm a True fan of a good burger (something so simple yet often executed so poorly), I was drawn to the French onion burger with it's promise of applewood smoked bacon, gruyere cheese and crispy onions ($13).  I've had quite a few "gourmet" burgers in my time and have sadly discovered the only thing gourmet about many of them is the price tag. Having said this, I was a little dubious about what would arrive.  My (notably) pleasant server arrived with my meal in short order and I was quite pleased with both it's presentation and size, not obnoxiously large but certainly enough to justify the price if that were the only criteria.  On first bite I knew something was different about this burger, it was perfectly cooked mid-rare, juicy, and the thick, crunchy bacon played well with sweet, slightly salty gruyere cheese. Crispy onions seemed a great addition and added texture and flavor while the bun, and this is important, didn't go all soggy and fall apart.  Flanked by some of the tastiest French fries I've had in a while, I'd have to give this burger high marks for concept (simple but well executed), texture (not the typical dry OR mushy patty passed off as gourmet), and taste (in this case, exactly what I'm looking for in a burger).  If you find yourself in need of sustenance on the long road to wherever it is you happen to be heading, make a point of stopping in and partaking in the food and hospitality of St. Francis.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Simple, Delicious fries
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The French onion burger

VQv4Tikitt2zj0rkxGKObw.text: My favorite restaurant in Phoenix. Service is great and the food is even better if possible.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VNObEGdjBERjB0VeX1XEXg.text: Food was great.  Had the goat cheese app, pork chop entree, and some dessert.  The wine the server recommended pairing with the pork chop worked wonderfully.  Very reasonably priced.  The only issue I have with this place is the hostess.  She might have been new, and if that was the case - then it's OK.  However, she was pretty absent minded and in general - underqualified to be a hostess (wow I cannot believe I just wrote that).  Whenever I am in Phoenix again, I will make sure to come back.  Cool place.

nQaCVbRKMFLJR_iEOqhLSg.text: 6 of us went to dinner last Saturday and sat on the patio. While the ambiance & service was good, the food was very disappointing. My friend ordered a burger and another ordered the Flatbread pizza. . They were "Okay", and I  ordered the pasta which was very bland and plain. I was not impressed with the food, based on the ambiance/prices, overall I was very disappointed in the food :(

cqpFnmJJ_B8Uv9TcZHAy9g.text: The food was good. The service was good. We would definitely come back to try other items on the menu. We weren't super impressed with the selection of food. Cool vibe, though.

Ow_O7QHGKrBWYaN7ujKL7w.text: This is my second time here. I love the atmosphere and friendly, speedy service. The food is pretty good but not phenomenal to me. Many disagree. Give a try and see what you think.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pumpkin and cheesecake in a jar
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wood roasted pork chops
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Parmesan risotto

485881AnCTQaJIWbgXPg4A.text: The atmosphere was pretty trendy and nothing out of the ordinary  for Phoenix. Nothing to write home about. We were seated within two feet of another couple even though there were many other tables open. It was uncomfortable and we got up and moved to another spot and the waiter seemed a bit put out because I guess we didn't ask first? The food took around 20-25 to come and the waiter didn't come to check with us or to tell us the food is on it way. However the French Onion Burger I ordered was wonderful. It was very flavorful and the bread wasn't thick and heavy. The Chicken Salad Sandwich was also very good but left me a bit wanting. Overall the food was good.  The service not so much and it was very cold too, and I hate to be cold when I eat. Weird I know but there it is.

A55gt7w_5ZPGg6rwTaji3Q.text: The food here is amazing! Everything I had was delicious. I saw this place on the food network and after I looked at the menu, I had to go here. Very cozy atmosphere and friendly staff.

R2c3uSb5_FXPAp0xKHqhmg.text: I have really tried to love St. Francis, but the restaurant just isn't working for me. I've been back a few times, and I have the same mediocre experience each time. Nothing is ever BAD; it's just average.  The food is the one redeeming quality of St. Francis, because for the most part, everything is really good. I say this based on my friends' opinions because I'm never completely satisfied with what I order. The most recent time that I went to St. Francis, I had the french onion burger, and it was lacking a defining flavor. Something sharp to offset everything else. It was, dare I say it . . . plain. Broadly speaking, the bread is good, the seasonal soup is good, the flatbreads are also (you guessed it) good. I just haven't been given a blown-away food experience.  I get a little agitated with the seating. I know that St. Francis takes reservations, but it is upsetting when, as a walk-in, you wait for 30+ minutes while many empty tables go unseated during that time. Not just one or two; we're talking five, six, even eight empty tables at one point. I haven't been a hostess for a long time, so I hate mentioning it because I probably wouldn't understand the workings of seating arrangements at a fine dining restaurant, but it's one of the things that always happens when I go to St. Francis. My friends and I wait while many tables remain empty.   I know that I am outside of the statistical norm with my rating, but I can't bring myself to give any additional stars. And to be honest, I'm not sure if I'm willing to spend any more money to try to give St. Francis the opportunity to earn any additional credit.

riL5nJcILN6fbRToMOmshQ.text: I really liked this place. They have fresh baguette and I had the Forbidden Rice which was great! The menus tell you what's gluten free or dairy free. The servers seem a bit rushed but it's good other than that.

_GLTqKatO_1Lo8CfpsuFkw.text: Nailed it!  The atmosphere is great!  The service is great!  The Italian Sandwich is the BEST Italian Sandwich I have ever eaten.  This will be a regular stop!

Krf3wLTsxZHREPScniZBkA.text: Love the Moroccan meatballs. Order a loaf of bread to sop up the delicious sauce.

RpoXhgZZIf_NZF9WfToYCw.text: Excellent service, drinks, and atmosphere. Would recommend the santa rosa cocktail and french onion burger. The pork chile verde was good.  Not a huge fan of the goat cheese appetizer. Overall, not a bad place. I would go here again.

DF9XDb5l1ygRD2SW6BcG_g.text: Service:  Took a bit for the waitress to make her initial visit for a drink order, but then after that, it was great.  Water was never empty and beer for me and drinks for Mrs were definitely attended to.  Food:  Seriously so so.  Wife had pig dip, which I had a bite of and it was good, but not worth a 30 minute drive.  I had the chile verde with sunny eggs.  This was the definition of "meh".  I can't say it was bad, because to say it was bad would mean it had flavor that didn't appeal to me.  To me, it just didn't have any flavor at all.  Sunny eggs and a roasted jalapeno should make a catcher's mitt taste good, but to me nothing worked.  Other people might think differently, that's just my opinion.  Happy Hour:  Really good.  Mrs. had a $5 cocktail and I had (2) $3 draft beers, one from Four Peaks, the other from Sleepy Dog.  We got the fingerling potatoes for an appetizer, those were great.  All in all, if you're here for happy hour, it's a great place.  I, however am rating on a dinner experience, and the entrees just didn't deliver near enough.    It can pass for decent if you live close, but if not, I wouldn't make the drive.

yZ-cIA_MQf9PC6BO_CC9Pg.text: Three of us had excellent meals at St. Francis. The goat cheese appetizer was a tasty starter. My pot roast was quite flavorful though a bit fatty. The salmon was a big hit and the Moroccan meatballs were good as well though you have to be prepared for Moroccan seasonings like cinnamon. The sticky toffee dessert was a good choice to share for the table.

-_kTingUnq33YLRol4zV_g.text: Tried this place for the first time after seeing on Diners, Drive ins,and Dives . Love the breakfast and the service was superb. Highly recommend! Only wish they had all the breakfasts during the weekdays. First time I went they were not serving the breakfast I had come to try.

Y7dm1fnzCQ4QB5UXvDREBg.text: A great restaurant for any special food need.  Had a great time and enjoyed my dinner immensely.

CR9F09rY2Jt6yc3Fy_keBQ.text: I was telling a friend about this place, and realized I never reviewed it. I couldn't get rwifi eception on my phone when I was dining there. The food was fabulous and the portions great! I had the burger which was so incredibly delicious and mouth watering. I also tried the flatbread with the smoked salmon and that was amazing :-) I went there during happy hours, because I hate to pay retail and love a good deal. lol!  must be the Jew gene!

2U3TRazz6Q7W0H0TzBmObA.text: Pretty good food. Good ambience. Tried the salad and pumpkin soup. Great baguette. It was pre salted and buttered so if you don't want butter make sure to ask in advance.

X2eKApZ9BASdC1QWI4deJQ.text: A hidden gem! Everything great! Food, service, atmosphere, MARTINI'S..... WOW.  The fingerling potato appetizer is huge,, enough for 5-6 I think.  The toffee dessert was the best, even if you think you are full,, GET IT!

sOSdL8kTKGcDyUse0LguOQ.text: The food was good. Had the pot roast which was not special . The food took 1 hour to arrive at our table... Drinks were watered down.

ueHrD5R57s1ihHwno3rJKA.text: Pig dip and pancake were life changing. Fig and bacon scone was a close third. This place rocks!

3FZw7-ITkoHq2tO5TVQpLQ.text: I don't write many reviews, but St. Francis is one of the best foodie joints I've been too. Knowledgeable staff and great use of ingredients. Had the Pig Dip and am thinking about coming back for dinner. Definitely will come back next trip to Phoenix.

Bksxiek_dhXc1Ojr32NhTw.text: As featured on Diners, Driveins and Dives. foodnetwork.com/videos/t...

xiiypvwPBOzFXUUerovhFg.text: This was my second time here. The first was excellent, but this time not so much. I was on the second floor this time and the service was very slow. There was constant foot traffic right behind my chair and you can feel the floor shake with every step anyone takes. Not only that, but it took 4 trips to get a glass of wine because the waitress kept coming back saying they were out. When I finally did find something that was actually in stock it cost 40% more and was only half as good as my first choices. All in all, the food was good but I will definitely avoid being seated on the second floor if I go back.

Cfuc1Kh6XGSU5dXqalDFXw.text: I hat the pepper and pork stew, it was fantastic, and very filling. Along with the stew I also had the creamy corm Polenta it was absolutely great. It had a nice atmosphere and some unusual architectural design.  Give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fd4g0pE7q1_T3sfk6uAQJQ.text: Yummy Fries. Yummy flatbread. Yummy Romain of Hearts salad. Can't wait to come back and experience it again.

vujaWwRXFKVAV5Xtk7_SZg.text: Dinner menu last night appeared to be the same as the lunch menu. Started with the romaine heart salad, the buttermilk cheddar dressing is really good and a beet salad with nuts. Then we had 2 ftatbreads, they are known for their flatbread. Both were equally good, the cheese has just the right amount of garlic and the mama meatza was covered in a variety of meats. Overall a pretty good meal.

nDmnYeCwYBYh0n8pmGWhTw.text: This is a wonderful place to go and have a nice meal. Been there twice, once for breakfast and once for lunch and both times it was a wonderful experience. The staff is wonderful and the food is delicious. It provides a relaxing atmosphere that makes the whole experience very enjoyable.

58SQNlupNHjmnC7VmxAkPg.text: One of my favorite downtown restaurants.  It seems many people feel this way ...consequentially the weekend nights can be pretty slammed... expect to wait a good half hour.  But its well worth it and besides you can get the evening started out right with a glass of wine from the bar.    I love the intimate yet sleek atmosphere.  There is exposed brick walls and beams on the ceiling, vintage yet modern interior... great lighting and little candles everywhere.  The exterior is just as inviting!   We opted for the chicken flatbread and pork chile verde...both of which were really excellent and fairly inexpensive for the quality and vibe of the restaurant.  I think this is one of my favorite things about St. Francis... you feel like you should be paying more than $10-15 for a meal... but then the bill comes and you are pleasantly surprised!    So guys.... remember St. Francis when you are choosing a date locale... its super cute, looks to be on the fancier side, but won't break the bank!

_e9Q7WWR7EMgIslaC5YZPw.text: The St. Francis is a great experience.  Great food and a really nice environment - tasteful architecture, live music playing softly in the background. This is a place to go when in PHX.

3OaEUQTshJPct2cYspLu8w.text: St. Francis is one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix for the following reasons:  - It is trendy and chic with a cool indoor/outdoor bar and an upper mezzanine seating level - It is neither in a strip mall nor is it part of a fancy, sprawling resort - very rare for Phoenix - There are both moderately priced ($11-12) and more expensive ($20-25) entrees, so you can please everyone in your party - Cocktails are inventive and tasty (try the almond margarita) - I've tasted at least half of the menu, and all of the items have been good to great (personal favorites include the salmon and the meatballs)  Word to the wise: if you don't want to wait, avoid prime dinner hour on Fridays and Saturdays and brunch on Sunday - it can get pretty crowded!

1OgxVYsUIPlPraNbJjFVLA.text: The fingerling Potatoes are the best! I really like them. One time we went and had a snack and a drink. They did not have happy hour that day so we wanted to get a cheap beer. But low they were locked out ofF the liquor cellar. We got wine for 12 a glass but I wishes they would have been more sorry. Not being able to give your customers what they want is stupid

OKPALVmOA8oXdGcvkCGxpw.text: One of the best restaurants I've been to in Phoenix. The food was spectacular. The service was world class. Although I only had a few items on the menu, I would be willing to bet every single item is off the charts tasty. Great ambiance and don't forget to watch DDD before going!

7BH7wguGkHVrCin51IOv1w.text: Not a bad spot, however, stay away from their version of the Cioppino if you have ever eaten it in the bay area, specifically San Francisco. The one here has nothing but a few clams, a monstrously soggy piece of bread and something like Hunt's tomato sauce as the broth. I guess the old adage remains True, nothing beats the original.   Other than that, the risotto was OK and the Cheescake in a jar was amazing.   Another tip for those that go, park at the bank next door instead of valet usage.

7q93KjDfSoyOba80rWlWpQ.text: The salmon flatbread is super yummy! Try the baked goods, specially the bacon sconce with creme fraise. Definitely a great brunch spot! I don't like the sort of forced valet situation,  I prefer to park my own car. But otherwise a great experience.

W7m39vqKQXP9fE60FoVVdQ.text: You should be eating here more often.   One of my favorite spots to dine. Happy hour absolutely rocks! Here are just a few things that you should be eating when you go there: meatballs, flatbreads, fingerling potatoes, and baked goat cheese.   Quick tip: the upstairs always seems a bit hot to me. Might want to opt for sitting downstairs.

gcwpeqfTFite3U--t_a16w.text: After 3 experiences, I think I can admit that I am not crazy about St. Francis.  This last meal confirms it and is by far the most telling.  First of all, our server ranted and raved about the cioppino.  When she said she got to enjoy one after "winning a contest" at which point I should have know she was more of a saleswoman than a True guide of the menu.  She ranted and raved about the cheesy bread included in the dish, not exactly a traditional staple of cioppino but I thought I'd give it a try.  It tasted like delicious cheese bread in the middle of Ragu and old seafood.  Good cioppino is rare, but it's not rocket science.  This was easily the worst dish St. Francis has done in my experience and for the price and reputation they try to uphold, this is inexcusable.    Happy hour at St. Francis?  Good.  Pizza?  They use the crust from LGO so it better be decent.  It's a good thing St. Francis has a good location, beautiful building, hipster popularity and great happy hour...  General Phoenix diners will be able to look past the low quality food for those reasons.  True quality food-seekers will look elsewhere.  I'll give you a try again in a few months St. Francis, I hope you can hold on to a few decent cooks and a chef long enough to make some changes.

40HJK8N7fmxL7LGFeyOyPg.text: Love! Love! Love! This place! My boyfriend and I go here very often! It's again a great first date and for many dates to come!   I'm gonna keep this short:  For drinks get a Melboc or Cucumber Cooler  For breakfast get the baked eggs or eggs Benedict   Lunch/dinner the salmon,meatballs or chicken  It's great! Have fun!

y4Q_UHhWcrMy_wo_4YfaYQ.text: Pretty restaurant, slow nonexistent service, $31.00 total for one glass of sangria & minimal salad? Ridiculous! Won't be returning. Sad.

Tj9VM9CuahGpVj6vXxXYqw.text: St. Francis is stellar in my book and I think I'll be tempted to give it five stars next time. Looking for a cool, urban, unpretentious place to eat? Then you've found it!   My friend and I went on a Saturday night. Without a reservation, they were able to seat us immediately. This may even have been too fast, as I didn't have an opportunity to have my pre-dinner drink and I'm not one to drink during dinner. While I've read the patio is the place to be, there were no tables (not just "not available" but literally no tables!) which may have been a good thing. With temps hovering around 100 degrees at 8:00pm, the comfort of A/C has it's advantages!   The staff, everyone from the valet to the seating hostess to the server, were on their toes. All were attentive and friendly ... the type of service where you know the tip you gave was well earned.   My friend had the Pot Roast; probably a dish better suited for cooler temps, but delicious and satisfying, nonetheless.  He tells me his wine was also good.  (I'm not much of a wine person, so I can't comment confidently on that.)   I opted for the more season-friendly cool Chicken Salad Sandwich. It was a wonderful combination of flavors. My only concern was that the sandwich began to fall apart, making it difficult to eat neatly in public. It came with a choice of sides and I elected the sweet corn polenta. Oh Em Gee!!! If I didn't know it was polenta, I would've sworn it was Mom's whipped potatoes. Soooo creamy and yummy! And a steal as a standalone for just $3!   St. Francis's ambiance is great for both day or night and seems like the kind of place I'd like to revisit time and time again for anything from brunch to dinner. As the Governator once said, "I'll be back!" :D

hw-LrMTJ3D3VU3l4N3oIJA.text: Went to St Francis on 7/15 (with a reservation). There was no hostess for 2-3 minutes, so we just waited around the hostess stand. Table was ready and we were seated within a few minutes.  When we were seated server introduced another server. She was fairly absent for much of the dinner.  A few key items: Parking: "complimentary" valet? Really? One knows it is not complimentary. I can park my own car, thanks (and I did - in another lot) Delays and wait times: Took 10 minutes before drink orders were taken, even longer to replenish (I waited 15 min for a 2nd beverage - A simple draft beer). Other members in the party waited for drinks on other occasions as well. Food: Loooong delay (45+ min) with getting food delivered, no bread etc was offered until we asked, and then food magically appeared 2 min later. A simple excuse of "a private event was taking up the kitchen" was the only reason given. Really? Private event (presumably per-arranged/scheduled) and you don't schedule enough staff for it? Food was OK, not as amazing as I had expected. My burger wasn't cooked as requested, but I did not want to wait another hour for food. People in our party asked for various additional items, and there was a delay with most of them, or server had forgotten that we had asked, so we had to ask a 2nd time.  I almost went back to ask to speak to a manager, but by the time we were leaving - it was so late that I was ready to head out, and not spend any longer (waiting) at the restaurant. But I'd suggest someone takes a look at scheduling and kitchen.  Would I go back? Maybe, once they fix wait times and kitchen issues. Atmosphere was neat - only reason why I give it 2 stars. I hope others have a better experience.

ZeXPZDKJ0auLw5kJ53HUvQ.text: My favorite thing about this place is how it looks on the inside.  Very cool with the red brick.  The only thing I didn't care for was the halogen lights  on the wires.  They remind me of the mall.  I know, picky. I think they were trying to be too cool with the bathrooms.   The "sink" looked like a copper plated shelf that was corroding.  The safe was pretty neat though.   We first got to the restaurant for Sunday brunch they had a band playing. They were playing very loud it was very distracting. I couldn't even hear my wife talking to me sitting across from me. She agreed that the band was playing too loud it was annoying to her as well. Luckily they stop playing soon after we arrived and it was a much it was a much more relaxing experience.  Had they kept singing I would have given the place a 3 overall and would probably not be planning on going back.   I am not a fan of brunch.  we got there after 1pm.  I had already had breakfast earlier.  I would of liked to have seen more dinner type entrees.  I will likely be back, but not for brunch!  Now on to the food. If you are addicted to carbs you will love this place.  The bread and other backed goodies looks great.  The bake them in a wood oven.  I did not try any of the bread, but was tempted.   I had a chili verde and my wife had the salmon salad. They must have left it sitting under the broiler a little too long. Some of the top layer pieces of pork were little dried out stringy. Underneath the pieces were very tender and was tender as well. I have to say though I like the chili verde at Z'Tejas better and it's cheaper there as well. My wife said that they changed the salmon salad from he last time she ate there. They got rid of the lettuce!  The salmon was perfectly cooked but it was sitting on a bed of  cold quinoa.   Only the first few bites of salmon were warm, then it got cold.  I think it would be better if the quinoa would have been hot.  My wife liked the version with the salad much better.

c3AfLwDPmLeQOnmMXFQKig.text: Thrice I have dined at this establishment and thrice I have enjoyed my meal.  The french onion burger is wonderful and the forbidden rice is sinfully flavorful.    Great decor and good vibes all around.  Cheers.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BuuAa1ncvjjeA8WHkvUTOw.text: I went with a large group (12) for a birthday. I ordered the french onion burger and it was not as good as I remember. I feel like it had less meat. Also, our service was pretty bad. My friend Xurri R. was there with me and her review goes into much more detail. We waited very long for drinks and refills, never got any check ins. Had to ask for things and they weren't that busy.   It's pretty pricey. For 2 burgers, 1 cocktail, and 1 beer it was just shy of $50 before tip.   Also, they served our cake that we brought, but I had number candles which had been taped to the cake and they freaking lost one. My friend was turning 20-something and they lost the 2! WTH?

9hL1e92XjEB9mLA-6JvVEA.text: Two words. Pig Dip. Two more words. Order it  My wife andI went on a date night and on the lightrail, I did a search and found out how close St . Francis is.  Greeted by a hostess, we were painfully early for our reservation and they were slammed. We weren't in any hurry so we took a couple of chairs at the bar. They have Flagstaff Brewing Co. Red!    We previewed the menu and asked some questions. Then, we got to sit down upstairs (after a second Red). We ordered starters, a s roasted squash with honey, jalepeno, almonds and goat cheese. We ordered the corn soup.  Both...delicious.  We waited a bit long for our appetizers to come, but it gave us a chance to catch up after a long week. The only issue, almost predictably, our entrees came and we had to rush through finishing our starters. The corn soup has a nice hint of spice withe roasty corn sweetness. It was a little under seasoned in the salt department, but a small pinch took care of it. The roasted squash was the star here.  My wife chose the pork chile verde and I did the dip with fries and what tasted like a homemade chipotle ketchup.  The pig dip is perfect. On pickle would have been a nice add, but...that's nitpicking. It's the best pulled pork and cheese with pork broth on great crusty bread goodness a man with a waisteline should have.  Oh so, piggly wiggly good!  The fries were homemade and the ketchup was excellent. My second red ale washed my palate. The pork chile verde was delicious as well (we swapped bites). My spouse and I cleaned plates and then shared the date bread pudding with the vanilla gelato and caramel sauce. Make sure they have fresh coffee brewed before you order dessert because we couldn't stop eating it and it was gone before the coffee got back to the table.  Thanks St. Francis for a lightrail treat on Camelback Rd.

dl462kXuLowBz9JdPB76kw.text: I'm only giving it 4 stars because the meatballs were salty. I returned it for the white fish dinner. The white fish dinner was amazing. I will definitely go back again to try the other dishes.   Thanks to my friend I am no longer a brandy virgin. For the life of me I cannot remember the name of the drink but it was a mixed drink that included brandy. I'm anxious to try the remaining speciality drinks on their menu.

Yq_DGvZx61uyrTioYosUdw.text: Had to run my father-in-law to Phoenix today, and so I told him I would take him out to lunch.  Having recently seen this place on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives, I though we would give it a try.  We were pleasantly surprised . . . the staff was great . . . the food was wonderful . . . the only draw back was the noise level due to all of the hard surfaces.  I had the French Onion Burger and my father-in-law had the Chicken Salad  Sandwich.  Mine was cooked perfectly . . . nice and juicy and the arugala add just enough to take it to the next level.  The iced tea was fresh brewed and my glass never got less than half full before it was topped off.  Will definitely be back . . . Hope to try the weekend brunch items (the pan fried pan cake) and also dinner.  Why only four stars . . . the noise level . . . hopefully dinner will be a little quieter.

Zlw023nATMXsKTE-rriU4g.text: This place was delicious. The ingredients are sourced locally and were very fresh. Cozy interior with great patio and outdoor seating. Portions were smaller than expected for pricing though, but well worth it. Would definitely recommend :)

-58SkA6qUpnku0CvytwP8Q.text: Words cannot express how awesome this place is.  The happy hour prices are phenomenal!!!! Food is fresh and the servers are extremely knowledgeable about the menu!!!! Always good food and good service!!!!

hlMM7llwLmS5VeXDnlSu6g.text: Experience varies day-to-day depending on staff.  Some staff are the best in town and provide the highest level of customer service.  Other staff members, well... They leave a lot to be desired with inattentiveness being a key factor.

IL-U2wyog4af-YR4otrB0A.text: Great experience at St. Francis! Great service and kind staff. The fingerling potatoes are a must!

EdrjSqFpeA-Oto4jnNSMpQ.text: We stopped in for brunch with friends earlier this month and had a great experience!  The restaurant is beautifully and comfortably decorated, the service was fantastic and the food was amazing - fresh, flavorful and just tasty!

5ny8cqnmPAmIVK61A5UyMQ.text: As we toured the Mesa and Phoenix areas this week, my second stop was St. Francis restaurant in Phoenix. After watching it profiled on Diners, Drive-in and Dives, we just had to make a stop here. I ordered the wood roasted broccoli. It arrived a little blackened and it was adorned with lemon aioli, Parmesan cheese and croutons. Wow! Good stuff. The skillet pancake came next. It was charred from the skillet and the wood oven in which it was baked. Add to that the chocolate chip filling, the carmelized apples on top and the whipped cream and you've got a hit! Yes, we are two-for-two. The third item was the pig dip sandwich, a combination of pork butt, bacon, and onion fennel marmalade on a French roll. Every dip into the au jus was a piece of heaven. Three-for-three! Good work, St. Francis. Good work!

tnrkfCRZstPyXKLIzdtbKw.text: I enjoy all the food here. Good wine and beer selection. Cocktail's are on point. Titus knows his stuff. Forbidden rice dish reminds me of a red Thai dish. Flatbreads are tasty, wood fired broccoli was amazing. This place is always on my list. Nice contemporary design and decor. Great concept. Service is always good, can be a little quirky but I always enjoy myself.

oAE2u9sKi0NwP9USmN0U7Q.text: I want to apologize because I wanted to love it.   Its a lovely place to eat on a gorgeous Arizona spring day. Friendy friend Diane and I had a wonderful gabfest and were treated graciously by the server, not rushed out.   Di had the chicken salad sandwich and she was totally pleased. I had the French Onion Burger and was disappointed. Meat was undercooked for medium rare [and were I not a fan of 'rare' in its Truest sense [rather than the current 'omg it causes food borne illness - lets get rid of all color in the burger' rare...] I would have sent it back. The meat is juicy but not seasoned enough [hardly] for my taste. The onions were not 'crispy onions' just barely cooked, bare-naked onion, the bacon/gruyere combo was deevine [I ate it sans the other half of my burger] as was the light brioche bun. I was starving and the side salad was a delicious combination of greens and veggies perfectly dressed but overall I wasn't impressed, especially when the bill came. $17 for a burger and an iced tea.   Seems hit or miss and I think we had a bit of both.

H_BnFVkVwcGwEEJkIrcaFA.text: This is fast becoming my go-to lunch spot. Helpful staff, forbidden rice bowl, salmon super foods. I brought a team here for a celebration and it worked great; everyone raved about the green chile and the meat balls. Stopped in on a sunday and they had live music. A Great experience.

JTF9tU6jdQyqmvJeOIOBKw.text: This is a superb restaurant. I had the main entree, lamb chops with a smooth polenta. It melted in my my mouth.  My husband had the Pig Dip.  Incredibly good. Don't forget their deserts.  This is a restaurant worth going to if you are in the Phoenix area.

nBPZ1SzZGjpLJl4KzgEVIQ.text: 1. They have an awesome happy hour, with their best menu items. 3-6pm, I believe. 2. Service has always been good, every time I have been there.  3. You get free dessert on your birthday. 4. Most importantly, the food is delicious. I have yet to get something I am disappointed in there. Flatbreads, amazing. Forbidden rice, delicious. French onion burger, omg. It goes on and on. They also change up the menu depending on the seasons, which can be a bit of a bummer if your favorite flatbread goes missing, but they always are adding new amazing dishes.  One of my favorite places to eat in the Valley.

b98GPPljBX3WfmmeZ4bpJA.text: I never update reviews but in my visits to St Francis since the new year, I have to say that this place is slipping. Busy or quiet, the service is slow and inattentive. Food is still good but drinks stay low to the point of irritation. On our last visit, yesterday, my coffee came out with lipstick on the cup. I requested a new cup when our server took our orders but didn't see the new cup until 15 minutes later -- and I had it finished before our meals came. Also, Jenny ordered an english muffin that did not come out with her plate but were assured it was coming. Since no one came to check on us until we were almost done (which is when I requested my coffee refill), she just waved it off. Our server did seem apologetic about the issue and, since someone else was delivering the food, it's understandable that he was disappointed. Still though, St Francis, get everyone on the same page. YOU USED TO BE SUCH A GREAT PLACE!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

t_Wvh12IvAtHbqU4zIG4nw.text: I've probably been to St Francis over 15 times.. Saying that I'm obsessed with the Roasted Salmon Super Food would be an understatement. And the sauce they put on it- I could drink it! I've tried other items on the menu, which were all good but I always go back to the salmon. The rice bowl is a close second though. We've been there when it was a little slower but most of the time it's a very busy place. We've never waited more then 30 minutes for our table which is really good for such a high volume, happening restaurant. If you want to avoid a wait, I'd suggest making a reservation or going during lunch. We normally get sat right away when we follow those two simple rules. If we're really hungry we'll get the melted goat cheese app. Its served with really crispy bread. My mom has sensitive gums/teeth so we just asked for a side of softer bread and they were more then happy to bring that over for us. Just expect for the bread that comes with it to be pretty crunchy.   I love St. Francis, can't think of a bad thing to say about it!

tg51SPSH-ND7F1ozvsdfrQ.text: Called Fri am to request a reservation for a party of 6 on Sat nite.   Got their VM and left my request for them and all the contact info for St F to call me back.   No such call.   Called again on Sat am to ask if they received my VM from day prior.   Was told "apparently not" and further told no availability for the time I requested.   Please don't have a VM option if you don't bother to listen to it or to return calls.   Had friends in town from out of state and had hoped to show off your restaurant.   Won't happen again.

uUZVKAO8RaNGU5F3fkHQ8Q.text: Cramped restaurant but pretty good food.   I have been to SF for brunch, lunch, happy hour, and dinner.    The brunch hours on the weekend seem to draw a big crowd.  My friends and I had just so-so service when eating brunch here.    The lunch/happy hour are pretty good.  I love the white loaves of bread, and they are only $3 to purchase for a to-go item.   The Happy Hour pricing is OK, but not fantastic.   I enjoyed the bread/ goat cheese with pesto. It was delicious, and it was very filling.  The side of vegetables was just meh. It included green beans, carrots, old broccoli, and some others. The veggies were bland and boring.    Parking can be a pain. There is only valet parking during certain hours, and the lot is teeny tiny.  We parked at Auto Zone one time (not sure if that's allowed, but whatever). The valet parker told us to park behind a bank. I don't know what he meant.   The ambiance is loud/crowded. I felt cramped at my recent dinner, and the people next to me were maybe six inches away from our table. I could hear every word of the conversation. I was bumped at least three times, and my date had butts in his face multiple times from wait staff turning around right near us.   If there was more space / less claustrophobia, I'd be back!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side of veggies.

siFVgNDSR7IZKVOGTc7wOA.text: Obsessed with the Pumpkin soup! The fingerlings were so delicious and a huge serving, could only take a couple bites but left me wanting more! Love tonight's dinner and service, would have ordered another glass of wine if they actually had a good pour...maybe next time!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5dC9t0l1NMPicGH8ZgBDsQ.text: This is a great place culinarily but you can tell it is time to remodel the facility overall.  It is showing signs of wear and tear which could lead to less clientele in the future . Food is on par with with similar restaurants in this echelon, and is probably above the median in terms of taste, selection and dining experience..

FSPD62Fi259lbanEMqJtww.text: We would drive from Tucson to Phoenix to come eat here at the time. But this time they switched the bread in the pig dip and didn't even fill it with onions. My husband order a Manhattan and they didn't  make it properly and the waiter blamed on new bartender  also the portion was smalller and didn't taste as good it was in the French bread they had at one point. Very unhappy with food and drink.

uZL8--jAIIkMYHoUQjMQPA.text: I love st Francis. Everything I've had here has been amazing. The French onion burger is always perfectly cooked, juicy, and flavorful. The pig dip is delicious and huge! Easily shared between two people. Ask for the lemon aioli to dip your fries in! So good!!! Their crispy fingerling potatoes and also crave worthy. They are nice and crispy and salty with fried sage on top and lemon aioli to dip in. The eggs Benedict we had today was also really yummy. They were a little pricey though at 15 dollars. Their coffee is cartel coffee, which is delicious. Parking can be tricky, but not usually a problem.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pig dip! Yummy

TA69eEXv-79gWNmo9oUv_A.text: Met a date for brunch.  Ordered eggs Benedict with avocado. Food was good. Server was awesome!  Funny and engaged.  Awesome vibe in this small space. Can't wait to see what the patio's like when the weather cools off.

5ZP8ejQmJYm6bQ5io9MYeA.text: We saw this place on Diners, Drive-Ins, & Dives and decided to check it out.  The food was fantastic and the service was great!  People were just hanging out having a good time inside and out.   We started with the baked cheese appetizer that's mixed with a red sauce, very good!  I got the pig sandwich that's was featured on the show and I was basically in heaven!  The sandwich is HUGE and I brought half of it home and split it with the bf for lunch the next day. It heated up perfectly in the toaster oven the next day. He got the French onion burger and it was cooked spot on and tasted delicious, he had no leftovers. We both got fries with our meals and I don't eat ketchup so got a side of the red sauce and I literally wanted to eat it like a soup!    We were both stuffed but I wanted dessert so we got the chocolate trifle with caramel corn to go and we're not disappointed a few hours later when we ate it.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Onion Burger  cooked to perfection
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gigantic Pig Sandwich is heavenly

7f_smB-_fi-SoPnrjP6Cjg.text: I wanted this place to be better.  The food was good, but nothing special.  If I had closed my eyes and gone purely off taste, it's no different than something I might have cooked at home.  Purely perfunctory and there really wasn't much variety on the menu either, so no real incentive to go back.

dxzJLqLVgvSZ0chetLjEQw.text: NOT what it used to be!! When we first came to those spot it was hip, happening and had good food. Never amazing food, but good food and a good ambience. ... While our server was still great, that was the only positive of our evening. The food was TERRIBLE. I asked for light butter on my spaghetti squash and instead got a butter-drenched soup of almost inedible goop. Disgusting! And for $20?! WOW!! The rest of our party was equally unhappy with their WAY OVERPRICED meals and the overall experience was disappointing at best. For a place that used to be good we are so sad to see it go downhill to the point that we will never be back.

QighppqZHxynBnhRaOrCYw.text: Came here with my mom the other night for a nice dinner. I've been wanting to try St. Francis for years now, and finally did! We had to make sure we were going to the main entrance even though we were on a dirt path. But its the right way!!  Starting with the crispy fingerling potatoes, they were extremely tasty but just wish there was a little more crisp for me personally. The season was perfect. We also started with the wood roasted broccoli, which was amazing. The sauce that the chef pairs with this simple vegetable is delicious. It is a lighter sauce, with I think a tint of lemon... I highly recommend this one. Lastly, we shared a Pig Dip. That's right, a Pig Dip. One, this sandwich was heavy! I picked a half up and couldn't believe it! Second, the taste and caramelized onions were a hit on the sandwich. Our server was also very helpful and knowledgeable, which was nice for us.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pig Dip
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wood Roasted Broccoli with a little lemon!

KfviM-h3XqI_4fNcmt5TMg.text: Went at noon on a Saturday, place was busy and we had reservations so got seated quickly! Awesome service, even when we was served cold potatoes and Au jus for the pork sandwich the waitress quickly fixed the problem! The food was ok, not outstanding and not bad, a little on the pricey side, $20.00 for pork verde with a egg on top, seemed more like a 10.00 type dish! I won't rush back and take friends with me, but if someone suggested to meet up for a meal there, I would still go!

5mhy9OYQ7JdDd6PvQIRtuA.text: We were very excited to try this restaurant to celebrate a birthday. We arrived a few minutes before our reservation and were seated promptly. However it was just downhill after that. Flat champagne, out of pork tenderloin, roasted chicken was WAY over cooked and so DRY, then the swordfish was served with about a tablespoon of spinach and 2 cups of rice, not well balanced. We couldn't wait to leave which worked as they rushed our meal by bringing dinner before they had cleared the appetizer. We were in and out in about 35 minutes. Not exactly the nice birthday dinner we were wanting.

bmynpSaZbc0DINgTumCpIA.text: Food: So the food took quite a long time to come out and wasn't that good to be honest. I had ordered the French Onion Burger and my meat was almost burnt, the fries were drenched in salt, and I had ordered a side salad that was forgotten upon arrival. Folks, if you want to pay 15$ for a Burger King quality burger then this is the burger for you. Service: The service was about average. Our waiter was nice and smiley but neglected the table quite often to the point that I thought we had ceased to exist. The sodium special fries had my mouth frothing at the mouth for water to quench the dry oasis of a desert that had formed.  Atmosphere: It's hip and the music is some kinda house music that's kinda jazzy. I don't even know. Must be some millennial music idk.  Overall: A nice-looking area to eat but in all honest my surroundings felt cell-like and my fellow table mates had to be hunched over like rabid dogs feasting on bones because of the IKEA quality seating arrangement.

qIVpg33TsdHwLRgx_sBz9g.text: There's a basket of toys for kids to play with which is amazing, but their food and cocktails are delicious as well! We love their French onion burger so much we haven't tried anything else yet!

o5LKnuDZVMRKjz0i6Cso1w.text: I've only done brunch here and it's great. Food is fresh and place is cute. They have complimentary valet

GIvGKfo98hYwI3Wu1zHGaQ.text: Yum!!!  Bread - is a total must.  Mussels and chorizo - a second must.   Make sure you dip the super soft bread into the extra sauce for total heaven in a bite.   Our server bless her heart was clearly working her tail off. After a mix up she ended up leaving us with a bowl of the pumpkin soup which would never be a first pick for me but it was delicious!  We also had the seasonal salad which didn't totally get my boyfriend on board with beets but did at least give him reason to try them!  Mixed with fresh citrus it was so refreshing.   Last we shared the Mongolian meatballs which had such a unique taste we had to ask what they seasoned it with. Sure enough all the usual meatball culprits were there for seasoning with a special appearance by cinnamon!  They were awesome.   If you are going on a busy night just a heads up you will want to make a reservation. They fill up quick!

aH_WgsUyK4fceehBh8V4NQ.text: Pros -Decent flatbreads with quality toppings -Food comes out quickly  Cons -Have to valet park -Worst chairs on the planet. Constant squeaking against the floor like nails on a chalkboard. -Super Noisy -Cocktails are not generous pours -Salad was wet with water and underdressed -Chicken added to salads is cold on purpose -The Pork Chile Verde is made somewhere else and reheated.

cdQ9T2ajU6jHf_XvLVnHnA.text: Great place for brunch with a group. The atmosphere is cool, but I think some of the menu is a little overpriced for what they are.  It's creative fare, but not really worthy of the $$.  Staff are always friendly, and the service is relatively quick even when the place appears to be full.

rpopV3iirrA410-KXtuESg.text: Everything they do, they do it right. the interior is very creative and provides a chic/hipster vibe. I ordered a Santa rosa cocktail. It was by far, my favorite drink. It's not too sweet, but you don't really taste the alcohol, which is what I prefer. If you like grapefruit, this drink also has a hint of it, but isn't so overpowering, since it is mellowed out by the basil. I highly recommend trying this drink. They also have good deals during happy hour. I have only eaten lunch here and got the french onion dip burger. It was probably the best burger I have ever had. It was cooked medium well and was pretty juicy and well-cooked.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

z5I8Yd6sWDhTnY9WpXZ1nA.text: This place is just so great....and old converted fire station is now a restaurant! The happy hour is top notch with a nice variety of eats and cocktails. I love the meatballs! The service is always attentive and friendly. I'm a regular and highly recommend!

JsQVLNtloJZHkhiHQL2-yg.text: While visiting Phoenix, we found St. Francis online and decide to check it out; mostly because of the live jazz music on Sundays. We got there around 10 am before the music started, which was a good idea cause it crowded around 11. The menu was certainly "hip", but not too many options.  We ordered the Tomato-baked eggs and the chocolate pancake. Both were very good, however... DO NOT CALL IT "MAPLE SYRUP" ON THE MENU WHEN IT CLEARLY WAS NOT! I'm from New England and when you say maple syrup, it better be REAL maple syrup... not "Log Cabin" crap (I asked the waitress and she told me it was that). I know this is Arizona and maybe people don't notice the difference (or frankly care), but as someone who grew up around legit, authentic maple syrup, I'm very passionate about this subject (clearly). That's like serving American cheese and calling it "artisan cheese."  NOT THE SAME! Just put "syrup" on the menu - not "'maple syrup." The pancake was delicious however, even with the crap, store-brand syrup.  At the end of our meal, we got a mimosa and a Bellini to enjoy the music a little longer. While they were slightly overpriced, they were a good way to end our meal.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tomato-baked eggs and the chocolate pancake. Both were very good, however DO NOT CALL IT &#34;MAPLE SYRUP&#34; ON THE MENU WHEN IT CLEARLY WAS NOT!

FU0aqE17e1_D82BgODdxSw.text: This is one of my favorite places to go when the weather is nice, but I only really love it when the jazz group is there. The atmosphere is amazing! However... the service is just bad and the food is hit and miss. The past two times we've eaten there we've had to go get our waiter/waitress to request something because they only showed up every 10 minutes or so. On top of that I felt we were being rushed out. The last time we were there, as we were paying, our waiter actually asked us if we could get up from our table and move somewhere else so a large party could sit at our table. I brought my parents for the first time and they were turned off. We were very disappointed.

e8YG4xlby7ugwDpigziE3g.text: I was hoping to love it more, but was disappointed by their signature pancake dish.  Decor is cool, will try it again.

ClBiQTkwFKPFZK7bbNCFZw.text: Super cool place in central Phoenix.  Great food, great wait staff and awecome atmosphere.  Parking stinks, but again, your in Phoenix.  Don't let that stop you from going!

kadD3eDr-q8LdddOAAkgKQ.text: Great food. The service was excellent. Four of us were there for dinner and we were all happy with our dinner plates. I had the halibut and it was excellent!

3h2ge0girlwGQ-iwLt6_ug.text: We had a lovely brunch at St. Francis on Saturday. When we arrived, there were one or two tables available (around 10:30am), so we were seated immediately, much to our surprise. Our server came by and got our drink order and offered to get us a Iron Skillet Pancake to start while we looked over the menu. I ended up ordering the Chicken Salad Sandwich with French fries for my meal and my husband got the Tomato Baked Eggs.  The Iron Skillet Pancake came out first and was actually quite filling. It was tasty with the apples & maple syrup. I'm not sure if this is one of the options I'd order on my own (since a few other baked items also looked really good) but as mentioned, it did taste good! The Chicken Salad Sandwich they offer was much different than I've had at other restaurants while I liked. It didn't have the traditional mayonnaise-base but rather was tossed in a lemon vinaigrette. It was a nice lighter option. My husband really enjoyed the Tomato Baked Eggs, he said this dish was one of the best brunch dishes he has had at a restaurant. The presentation itself was very nice, in a small skillet with the tomato sauce, potatoes, eggs, and spices along with a piece of toast.  Overall, we were intrigued by their menu items as they seemed a bit more unique. We are planning on returning to try their dinner as well. Only thing to note is the service is good but a bit slow so I'd give myself some extra time to dine here but would absolutely recommend this restaurant!
