We waited a slight while for the flatbread to come out, and because he noticed me filling out the card, for the first time came by and filled our water glasses without us asking. (I think we had to call him over at least 5 different times, which is a little excessive). The manager was next to the table that had the burnt chicken and asked how everything was. She never turned around to check on us or anything, but when she was clearing off their salad plates, i asked her if i could please give her the comment card. She said, yes and walked off and we proceeded to leave. The manager to her credit, did come out and stop us to ask us what she could do to make things better, adjust the bill, gift card, etc, we politely declined as my bf had to go to work. I do give her credit for trying, it was just too little too late. The whole experience just left us with a bad taste. - Oh and as previously mentioned, they never brought my cornbread.

4wzHhUFKvYtJ-Rzv64DpQQ.text: Second time we came here for brunch, first time was awesome but today the egg tomato bake was only partially cooked and the server brought us a second soda (without asking if we wanted another one), and then charged us!   I don't mind paying if asked up front but dislike these types of sneaky practices- too many restaurants in the Camelback area to choose from, doubt we will be making the trip to St. Francis again.

FBNQpJYN6w2JSO9uO4LZCQ.text: A little trendy and full of itself, but the food is good and the atmosphere is beautiful. I hate that you have to valet especially when I can see open spots 5 feet away, but the lot is limited in space so I get it.  I've been here twice for brunch and left satisfied both times. We tried the eggs Benedict with smoked salmon which was unusual but good, the mushroom omelette with yummy goat cheese, and a cinnamon role which was superb.

wAw_shySHRlKmfmCZ60qmQ.text: Over priced apps... Hot inside location with ice in water melting immediately. Happy hour cocktail I had was pretty refreshing tho.

Kfnuna1_S3NAV7eu1ITElQ.text: Late dinner for my sisters birthday. Dim lighting and a good place for conversations. The staff was amazing. She was so kind and took care of us. The food was delicious, very flavorful! my favorite had to be the shrimp ceviche! Very spicy! Loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp ceviche
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flat bread
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nFQgbC_FgpbDRZRbvW2IWQ.text: I love the food! This is our Sunday brunch spot! Complete with fresh squeezed oj mimosas, amazing breakfast(we've tried everything on the menu!) and you get to listen to live music! The atmosphere is amazing & we love it!!

Ko0gzTSmV3YREoPtginoWQ.text: I've been a baseball fan my whole life, and I have to say that this place hit one out of the park!  We had lunch at St Francis today and were thrilled.  There were only two of us so we had a limited sample of the menu, but everything was topnotch.  We tried the baked goat cheese appetizer and were wowed by the creaminess of the melted cheese, the piquant flavor of the tomato salsa, and the crunchy toasted baguette to spread all the goodness on. This is a winner... just go ahead and order it and you'll thank me later!  Dining partner got the Red Wine Braised Beef sandwich, with the Red Quinoa side salad. Now I must tell you, I was all over quinoa ten or fifteen years ago, before it got real trendy, and cooked it often... but always had it hot, sort of as a substitute for rice in dishes where you'd use rice.  Never ran across a recipe for it to be used cold, in a salad... REVELATION!  the dressing and other ingredients in this dish are very cleverly combined, look very nice on the plate, and provide the double whammy of (light and flavorful) with (savory and satisfying)... you could make a lunch out of it and go home happy!  The sandwich was good... grilled bread tasty... horseradish sauce brings zing and flavor... but all in all nothing to write home about.    I ordered the Pork Chile Verde... gosh I seem to order that all over town don't I?  this one is not a home run, it's more like a Grand Slam In The Bottom Of The Ninth!  OMG so smoky good, with a healthy heat index (comes with a roasted jalapeno in the stew, eat at your own risk)  A side of homemade corn bread is delicious, crumbly and just goes perfectly with the stew.  Don't be shy, just dip it in there and get it all over your upper lip... no one will blame you.  I definitely will return to this restaurant, perhaps at dinnertime... but whatever time you go, I am sure you'll enjoy it!

2PdKL-h3ZTpGlytowPLoqA.text: We made a reservation, and the restaurant had us seated immediately.  Even on a busy Saturday evening, the service was great.  Happy Hour priced wine was good and the food (both the roasted chicken and the whitefish) were fantastic. Highly recommended.

2qGUhAhu-mx6OIOPcppSXQ.text: I loved it here!  Great atmosphere, comfortable setting and tasty food!  The menu is small but quality and the taste was amazing!  It seems to wrap an urban, uptown, outdoor patio with fireplace vibe all in one!  I had the Hanger steak with green mashed potatoes and asparagus.  AWESOME.  Friends had the chicken and salmon and both delicious!  The warm goat cheese appetizer is a MUST!  Service was excellent and I'll be back soon and refer!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hanger steak
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon

66xrSgyb_DvUosR9B6m8oA.text: I initially wanted to check out this joint because Guy Fieri admired it (and I have thoroughly enjoyed 95% of the places he recommended on DDD). While I like to scope out places on my own, I also like to check the Food Network from time to time as well. Sadly, this is one that wasn't as great as others he visited in metro Phoenix. I ordered the olive oil, chocolate, apple pancake that Guy had and it was just alright at best. Perhaps my expectations were too high to begin with, but I anticipated a lore more out of that combination presented. It was just one medium sized pancake for $9 (ouch). So, being a bit unsatisfied with that I opted to try the mushroom, leek, goat cheese omelette and that was actually more pleasing to the palate. It was savory and rich, plus the bread with strawberry jam was a nice touch. I left with a food baby after that. I met my uncle for lunch and he wasn't impressed either with a salad he ordered (it was basic and rather small). It was a neat quaint spot, but consequently it didn't pan out the way I had hoped.

xXPLsEv3Y8DaRYfmKt0hEw.text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!!! This place is sooooo over-rated its not even funny! But if you like a horible wait staff and badly prepared, under-seasoned and over priced food, then by all means this is the place for you!   Our lunch started off with us being seated at a table that was about two inches away from the table next to us. Ok cool, I get it your trying to be the over packed swanky LA restraunt you cant get a table at, but come on. So we sat at our table(timed it) for 12 minutes with out anyone of the 15 waiters and waitresses walking back and forth by our table. Now I could see if we were sat in the corner in the back someone forgeting about us, but we were in the center of the dinning room! So after our waiter finally came up to us, after 12 minutes, he said something to the effect of... Oh no one told me they sat you, but yet he had walked by us and made eye contact with me several times what a joke. So he took our order with his nose in the air and im sure someting lodged in his bottom and procceded to leave. I ordered the $13 "KOBE" Beef burger medium rare. I have never had a more lousy excuse for a premium kobe beef burger in my life and trust me I know a good burger. There is no way that burger was even wagu just no flavor what so ever! My burger came out medium instead of medium rare and was underseasoned and over-cooked. I have had better burgers for $5 at a dive bar(stray cat, tempe) for real!   So after a $55 lunch that took over an hour and didn't even really leave me full or satisfied I will NEVER step foot back in this horible excuse for a restraunt and I erge you to do the same!!!

touMVxZDFOPlsC8AefDR4w.text: Went to St. Francis on our way to the children's museum. My friend was raving about the pig dip so we decided to stop and get one. We did know that kids eat free as well. Upon entering, we were greeted by an unenthusiastic man who began to lead us to the main dining room and then stopped and seated us near the door. I assumed it was because there was no room in the main dining room. We were seated and waited a couple minutes for someone to come over and get drinks. We asked if we could order the kids meals first because they were starving. The server, who was apparently not our server "put the order in". About 10 minutes later we ordered two entrees. I walked to the bathroom, through the main dining area to see that the dining room was not if fact full. Seems like we were placed in the entryway because we had (well behaved) children with us. A few minutes later our entrees arrived. But not the kids meals we ordered 10 minutes before. We say something to whoever dropped the food and they said "oh ya, it's coming". A couple minutes later they bring one of the 3 kids meals we ordered. We tell them we had two others we ordered and they said the same thing. We put the kids meals in first for a reason. All of our food finally came and we all enjoyed it. Our server never came over to see how things were or if we needed anything else. When he did we were ready for the check. He dropped the check, and we waited almost 10 minutes for someone to take it, when they didn't I tracked someone down to take it. Here is the thing that makes me madder than anything. Being treated poorly in a restaurant because we have children with us. We are not jerks, we clean up the floor and the table behind us. We tip over 20%. We factor in the cost of the free kids meals and tip on what the bill should have been. We are good customers, good to those who serve us, and we treated crappy based on preconceived notions. While we were getting our crappy service I was staring at the New Times award for the 2014 best restaurant for kids.  Good food and free kids meals aside, I doubt I will return due to the lack of respect and poor service.

NBtU5llrgtWwGR0L5MveDw.text: Yummy food yet a bit too pricy. The "trendy" atmosphere doesn't really do anything for me either. If you sit upstairs, don't be surprised if you have to sweat it out because it gets toasty up there. I'd choose the Vig, Postino, or the Garage over this place.

PYAZPsUiifDffQFzTqW8cQ.text: 3.5. Surprise complimentary valet for parking. Good, solid, food in a cute atmosphere. I enjoyed the live music and my baguette to take home. The boyfriend thought the turkey scramble could be bigger and I would have more liked more evenly crispy fries but overall it was an enjoyable time and I would go back.

nDhIRxFaogUdjjNEEy1UXw.text: I discovered St. Francis from Yelp and decided to celebrate my birthday there.  Excellent follow-up with reservations both by e-mail and phone call.  Service was very good (we were there for happy hour and got two glasses of wine half off - Try Simple Life - Pinot Noir - excellent!).  Both our meals were excellent - my husband had the French Onion Burger and I had the Seafood Cioppone.  Unfortunately, did not have time for dessert - next time.    The only negative was the loud atmosphere - it is a smaller space - keep that in mind and tables are close together.    Interesting aspect of Julia Childs cooking show being shown on a white wall outside.

-x-23pW12fxx6zFpoPT06A.text: Saw the great reviews on yelp, and I had to give it a try! I was not disappointed.  I got the cheese flatbread. Super fresh.  Drinks were delicious. Swanky, trendy atmosphere.  Great for a date night and close to where I live! Win win win!

qT08vOBV96mehulAtB8yTQ.text: I came to St. Francis last week for a birthday celebration. The ambiance of this place is very cozy. Our table had the very delicious Fingerling potatoes for an appetizer, Salmon flatbread, Pig Dip, Roasted Salmon Superfood, and the Roasted Chicken. The standouts were the potatoes, the salmon flatbread, and the Pig Dip. The Chicken was very disappointing, not really flavorful, and a little bit undercooked in places. The service was excellent. Never once did our table need to ask for refills and were very attentive without being annoying. I would have given them four stars, but I think they are a bit pricey for the type of food they serve.

uw8A6AGXW3KNBAwBwXdK_A.text: First visit, and there will certainly be more! My mom and I went for brunch and it was so delish! First, they had complimentary valet! Thank you for thinking about your tight parking on a Saturday morning. It was nice to not have to fight for a parking spot!  Then, the restaurant design is great. Although there were a lot of tables in a cozy sized restaurant, it still felt open and modern. Since it was such a beautiful day in Phoenix, we decided to sit under the grape vines! (A tropical moment in the desert.) Now onto the food: We started with the unique Cherry Vanilla Coke, it had chunks of cherries at the bottom with an almond syrup or extract and was so sweet! A fun and refreshing treat!  We also shared a small bowl of their fruit salad that was tossed in an agave nectar or honey of some sort! Fresh and local, a perfect start to a bunch!  My mom ordered the Iron Skillet Pancake. OMG! Perfect. Enough said.  I ordered the wood oven baked eggs with braised beef. It was so exciting! The seasonal veggies for me was broccoli, cauliflower, tomatoes and peas. My FAVORITE, how did they know?! The beef was so tender and the whole thing was covered with cheese! The eggs... I asked for them well done, a hard job when it's oven baked without drying out the beef, but it was also perfect?! That took True talent! Amazing!  Hats off to the chefs!  As we were leaving, we noticed the bakery area. That will take a whole other review some day... I'll just say that it looked so beautiful, it looked fake. I'm still not convinced that I was dreaming it all up...

av_YBN2_2DD-V0q6H16XUg.text: What a great place for Sunday Brunch!  The live jazz music and overall atmosphere is so welcoming.  The servers are attentive and friendly.  You can even sit at a bench, enjoy your drink and watch the kitchen staff at work.  So many incredible things coming out of the oven......  The egg sandwich was delicious; the ingredients so fresh!  The house dressing on the salad is amazing. Skip the island punch and order a cinnamon bum; so yummy!  This is definitely a place that's worth going back to again and again.

TSexfrVuJSbjxzpdNM4qcQ.text: Been here a couple times. Delicious flavors and the happy hour has a nice little menu and drink selection (both wines and draft beers). Love the fingerling potatoes!!! I really enjoy it when I come, but it just doesn't completely stand out to me which is why I didn't give it 5 stars. Still a great place though and I suggest you try it!

xd8zuw4mf6rewzis8d-CrA.text: I've been there twice for lunch.  The food is good - I don't think I can rave about it like others, but a good, nice, trendy place to take business clients.  The second time we were there my boss had flown in from out of town and the service was terrible - so inattentive.  Drinks weren't brought out, he didn't write down our orders and had to come back and ask what I wanted to eat, etc.  I thought maybe it was because they were busy, but we had a long lunch and the waiter was still MIA even after the rush was over.  My boss had to physically GET UP and find the waiter to give him his credit card so we could leave.  I see I'm not the first to complain about slow service so hopefully it's something they can fix.

NMm9vF7VWnBm3OXluDBNow.text: Pretty cool cozy place on Camelback.  Try the salmon, very tasty!

8i9hOxne_c2D9la4cYZblw.text: We had a great time at happy hour! The market veggie flatbread was delicious! We also loved the Goat cheese app with baguette. The service and atmosphere were lovely, I would recommend sitting outside when weather permits!  Do not miss dessert...you will be mad later.  Um cheesecake in a jar? YES!

C_FO_EayrBTMFD0rFYLwGw.text: I have thought long and hard about this. I have tried the French Onion Burger (FOB) 3 times now.  I say this:  It is the best burger I have ever had.  That is a very difficult ruling to reach, but I am ready for it.  I have a few other issues with the place;   *  service seems preoccupied with life's other details and not totally "in the brand". *  a few mis-steps from the kitchen (FOB #1 overcooked), (fries undercooked) - But in each case they made it right instantly.  The FOB is the best burger I have ever had.

nnIn8T0ZZkJb2MOPitA5_w.text: Came in on Saturday for dinner, spectacular green chili pork with a side of the sweet corn polenta! On my way back to try the lunch menu today.

7EEf8F8eudH-qyWyhoE_fg.text: Had an absolutely wonderful dinner with the roommates here. It was a bit of a rough start, as we had reservations (which are a must on a Saturday night) but due to weather people from the patio were moved inside and we had to wait anyway. However, we sat at the bar and enjoyed some delicious cocktails and found the bartenders to be highly entertaining. When we did finally get seated we ordered right away and the food took a while to come, but again between the ambience and the cocktails we didn't mind one bit. The food was 100% worth the wait. I had the forbidden rice bowl (which is vegan) and it was delicious! The other entrees that we had were the filet mignon and the salmon. We all left very happy.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

o9daH1AtRryrgp79U4xhjw.text: Recently celebrated a friend's birthday with a group of ladies at St. Francis, and I was disappointed. Having enjoyed the place previously with a group and loving it, I was really looking forward to a return visit. Sadly, it's the service that all too often kills the experience despite the best efforts from the kitchen. The service was painfully slow. It was a good 30 minutes for our cocktail order to be delivered. Now, that's understandable when the place is packed, but it wasn't. The pacing of the entire meal expanded the work day evening out by at least an hour. The birthday girl even got up to grab a pitcher of water, after we asked for some and waited 20 minutes with our server not returning. Oddly here were several things on the menu that were not available "for the summer" we were told (roast chicken isn't available for the summer?) as well as several items on the wine list. Trouble at the St. Francis? That would be a shame.

v4jzRb3uphNS8clKRkic9g.text: Stopped by in town and pretty glad I did! Girlfriend got the meatballs and I ordered the french onion burger, pretty good and on par with most places I've been. Delicious

f_rtbQK3wi_p_4h8Jz8wKQ.text: Wow!!!!   VERY disappointing!!!   Didn't know it had changed owners (in May '18) and our party of 7, ALL noticed a difference!!!   The Famous Pig Dip didn't taste as good, the baked goat cheese appetizer was the smallest portion ever with little cheese, their fountain drink machine must have been broken because drinks were flat and/or didn't taste correct, coffee was served cold (when it finally came), and the Caesar salad was completely soggy due to too much dressing.   And desserts!!   You'll have to simply pass!!!!   They said they got a new pastry chef but my 11yr old son could have prepared better.   Firstly, they were out of truffles (and we dined early), we ordered butterscotch pudding and there was on odd hardlike substance in it that none of us could discern...waiter told us bananas... well they must have been VERY ripe because they were hard and tasteless and do NOT order the lemon poppyseed cake!!!   We ALL said the driest cake we've ever tasted.   All took a bite and that was it - even with the fresh whipped cream!      Then there's the service - or lack thereof.   We sat in the very front, nice private table which was lovely but we couldn't hail a server to save our lives!   While our waitress was adorable, the service was slow, every time she did come by we would have to ask for multiple things, we had to ask for bread three times before it came (and we wanted it to eat WITH our entree).    The SADDEST PART is #1.    We had a party of 7 and they automatically added a 20% gratuity!   Because I surely wouldn't have been giving them that!   #2.  We went there because USE to be my husbands favorite restaurant and it was his Birthday.      We won't be returning.  What a shame.   We predict will be closing soon.

ZfU5lG50UUMXbV3i3digWg.text: Very good food and service but ordered bread pudding for desert and it took over 25 mins, had to leave for a concert with no desert. It never came

m4b4yXhTjhOH5DbMF7fRFA.text: Lovely atmosphere with delicious food and great service. I took my daughter for dinner once and returned for Happy Hour with my husband a few weeks later. Wish it was closer to my house, but we'll be back!

PX_S493fr4MtbwnwBBYozA.text: The food was okay. We went as a large group of 14 and realized they do NOT do well at accommodating large groups like that. Our food took forever, they forgot one of our appetizers, and in the end we didn't love the food as much as we had hoped. However they were SO gracious and offered us multiple free appetizers while we were waiting, and ended up giving us a few entrees for free because someone dropped one on the way out of the kitchen before it got to us. Everyone's favorites were the fingerling potatoes and the wing appetizers! I loved the winter salad over the Arugula flat bread I ordered. The flat bread was mostly that - bread. With only a few dots of cheese here and there and some balsamic. Everyone loved their swordfish, and my husband loved the French onion burger but said the bun was dry. Also everyone was obsessed with the black rice!

kQImG2ijfSh6LUuVRg-Xsg.text: Burnt pancakes and small tables. Servers are ok.

RnKX4tVl6r13Vds_e01wgg.text: I had a bad experience here, 3 different menu choices were unavailable because they ran out of bread. It seems someone could have run to the store to get bread? Terrible service, water and ice tea never refilled. They said they had been busy before and used that as an excuse for bad everything was. We used to love this place from the beginning. I guess now they have new owners? Staff?

Z5UGRClRv_TK0867O9m_eQ.text: Absolutely love this place food drinks atmosphere ... the ambiance is incredible an old bank!!!

vJO_GfbA8LdUNUpgooYBjQ.text: This place is absolutely delicious!! My sister and I love to come here on occasion for brunch. It can be a bit pricey, but that comes with the location and type of restaurant. Their brunch is amazing, I especially love their egg sandwich. I haven't had alcoholic drinks here so I can't vouch for those, but the breakfast is amazing.   It's also fantastic that they offer free food to kids!

JH4zlJ2u6snnOSoC0zqYdg.text: Atrocious. Food had been sitting under a heat lamp. Our drinks sat empty. When I got a coffee refill I was given half a cold cup. Was also charged for a second cup of coffee for the half a refill I received. Would give it 0 if I was able to.

lSXO-UizatwCoTNPeNotVA.text: Unfortunately had to go back here for a work function. Terrible. All our entrees tasted like TV dinner. Waiter was nice but in a bad posistion to have to serve substandard food. Who ever the new owners or management are have no clue about the business. Gone by the end of summer

6a1C2RnX1oJ1ZJF-jfXdBg.text: Worst experience ever. Called to make a reservation and upon arrival they forgot to make our reservation and all they did was kick us out that there was nothing they could do even tho we had prove that we made the reservation. They wanted to seat us outside with 2 baby's.. Really disappointed..

4Ac5LKdMYt-yWdqixU1Uyg.text: We went on a Thursday evening, about five other parties were there. The building is cute, chill ambience. We started with two appetizers, the Strachatelle and scallops, both fresh tasting and delicious. We shared the Caesar salad, the croutons were amazing! Entrees we ordered the french onion burger,  chicken statler, herb crusted swordfish and salmon. Portions were great, everything tasted fresh. Dessert we had the house-made cheesecake, best cheesecake in town, hands up

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Statler
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stracciatella
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon

5efrbTxsXUxdXI-dlD4WBQ.text: We had this restaurant on our brunch bookmarks and decided that it was time to try it instead of going to our usual haunts. The building is very interesting in design and the patio should be lovely during the cooler months, also the small outside bar area would be nice then too. The interior of the restaurant is nice and we were greeted quickly and sat under our Yelp reservation. The main dining area was pretty full of tables but the tables are big enough and far enough apart for it not to be an issue. My fiancee had the salmon eggs Benedict and an almond cherry coke and I got the Housemade biscuit and a couple Deshcutes fresh squeezed ipa's. We both enjoyed our meals a lot, although I am jealous of the eggs Benedict she got. I definitely want to try some of their other menu items and we were talking about going back for dinner. The food is good, service is good and the ambiance is nice. I would definitely recommend and will be back.

KLr4HIjq6ZuUTvmMOPegPQ.text: The best neighborhood restaurant in the central and Camelback Corredor. Their ingredients are robust and fresh. People that go in there and eat our hip and lively so you're bound to meet new people every time you go in there. It is also very neighborhood oriented and they love to give back to their community. If you live in this area or not, Saint Francis will give you a wonderful experience

chIj4Swd-MY9SquMJ_ufdA.text: Love this place - the food is creative and full of flavor.  Never have had anything here that wasn't great.  The patio seating area is awesome on a cooler evening they have a fire place that creates the nicest setting for a relaxed dinner with friends or your honey.  the wait staff are friendly, the service is fast and the drinks delicious.  when the weather is good they open the bar area windows and you can watch the Camelback hustle and bustle go by while you enjoy your food and drinks.  I nice change to the usual restaurant offering in the area.  Was sad to see it go to dinners only but understand.    If you haven't been and you are looking for something different give it a try I doubt you will be disappointed.

mrVhiY6xAzyh5k0P_GPbsg.text: Had dinner here two weeks ago.  Service atrocious food cold.

Vgc1_8cpqO9WrEN8sV9W3Q.text: A little hipster   Went for my mother's birthday. Started off bad by having mandatory valet. It's ok but then you feel obligated ( and you should) to tip.   Ordered some apps on happy hour and they were ok.   I ordered the steak special for a main course and it was awful. Both the preparation and the presentation. Taste was ruined due to the cooking of the meat and how it was cut before it was brought to the table ( a big no no)   The bathrooms do not have a changing table-not kid friendly.   The wait staff was very attentive and friendly. Maybe just go for drinks and apps.

puO1Dk237-z2XwaWYrGDsg.text: Food- Above average Service- atrocious Beer Selection- sub par Atmosphere & Decor- sexy  Would I go back- No.   Will I recommend to a close friend- No.   Why?  Called half hour before I arrived "no wait" for three (Saturday night for 3)...arrive with a whomping 45 min wait.   I overhear the hostess totally give another customer crap about arriving for a reservation for two- with three people.  Saying that they mainly accommodate parties of two bc of the way their tables are set up...man up and put two tables together!! It's worth it not pissing people off or turning them away.   Next- we sit down at a long booth for six and don't get attended to for at least ten to fifteen mins.  Finally have to order the hostess to retrieve our bumbling waitress. She takes our orders. Annoying- they're supposed to be known for their bread--they didn't even have their well known baguette to order as an appetizer- pathetic.  Drinks don't arrive for another ten mins at least- after our appetizers.   It doesn't end there-  Our supposed orders arrive--they were wrong.  They forget to make my burger and arrived with some other sandwich.   The waitress didn't even acknowledge that it was her fault or anyone's.  The burger finally arrived, we ate.  The food was good and dessert was too.   In the end we should have been comp'd a dessert or something for the extended, sub par dinner.   I don't recommend this place to anyone.   There's a Sweet Tomato across the street- at least they have parking...

-aEq4tTYvJ8dzZKsHdAOyQ.text: Had a friend recommend this place to me & it didn't disappoint! Amazing food with so many & so much flavor! The cooks put a lot of heart into it! You can tell the food is so fresh & the hand crafted cocktails & wine are also amazing! It's a must if in the Phoenix area! One of the best meals of my life hands down!

wuiCsJ5X2rrCyIx3Sdi08g.text: They have a great healthy rice bowl, excellent sandwiches and also tomato soup & salad. The chocolate cake is rich and tasty as well. I've been here several times and always had great food and service. They also have live music on Sundays starting around 10am/10:30am.  I was flying to Arizona from California regularly on business and pleasure and had heard about this place from locals.   The only tip I have for the restaurant that I hope they can improve upon is that this past Sunday I came at lunch time and it was busy. I sat down at the empty extra large table by the window to wait for my smaller table to open up (it didn't take very long) but the hostess came over and told me she needed that table and asked me to wait outside in the 110 degree weather instead. Didn't really make me feel that welcomed and while I realize that locals probably think 110 degree weather is normal, in San Francisco we rarely get a day above 70 degrees. Luckily, the wait wasn't too long so I didn't die of heat stroke in front of the restaurant but I think one idea is to offer someone a glass of water (no ice, in that kind heat) if you need them to wait outside or figure out some extra chairs or small area indoors where people can wait.

eo1ECbI27EBWcldAxtGlYQ.text: Popular, but for a reason. The St. Francis experience includes great atmosphere, an extensive drink menu, and wonderful food options. The web site offers online reservations, which is highly recommended for a Friday or Saturday night out. If possible, ask to be seated in the upstairs mezzanine for a quieter dinner.   While small, St. Francis utilizes its space quite well. The bar area seems a little cramped but everyone was enjoying themselves when my wife and I were last there. Complimentary valet parking makes the downtown Phoenix experience that much more enjoyable.   I've heard the chili verde and meatballs are the popular dishes- but I can say first hand the roasted chicken and halibut dishes were divine. We also ordered the cheesecake in a jar- which was awesome.   Happy hour is a must - everyday from 3-6p - and allows you to partake 1/2 off all wine & beer with $5 specialty drinks. Be prepared to spend a little money but you are paying partially for an experience of downtown dining. Meet up with some friends, hang out, have a few drinks and unwind. St. Francis is the epitome of hip downtown eating.

LkkedyhgU6isRAFb5uCGMw.text: We dined here with friends last night and we had such a wonderful experience.   Everything starts with our amazing server Kayla - she was funny, knowledgeable, and timed her visits perfectly.  The food was awesome - meatballs, salmon, chicken, squash soup, baked goat cheese, all divine. We highly recommend St. Francis!

UM0I_L9c1hzUeCCNhxUEfg.text: Excellent food! Everything on the menu that I have tried is well above standard. Their bread is great but they charge for bread and butter. It's a fairly small restaurant so I try to go a bit off peak hours. Parking is a problem but don't give up.

H8Au05736J7gXpMeP8xdSg.text: An amazing evening was had last night at st. Francis. I had the cucumber cooler to start. ...delicious cocktail which hit the spot on terms of beating the heat.  My mother had the fresh squeezed orange juice and was in love.  For starters we had salad and naked goat cheese which was to die for.    For entrees,  I had the chili verde (a little spicy,  and fantastic! ) my boyfriend had the steak which he gobbled up quite quickly with no offer to share  (so it must have been good) my father had the Moroccan meatballs,  also spicy but he normally doesn't like spicy food he ate all of it and loved it. My mother had the scallops, which she said were amazing.    We had desert- the apple tarte and chocolate cake The apple tarte is perfect of that's you're thing. I'm a chocolate fan myself and ate the whole thing eventhough i was full because it was so good.    Long story short been here several times,  love the place, and last night (with the patents in town visiting) we got to show them that phoenix has top notch Restaurants and cuisine.   Thanks again!

H8lYbKwhqfJzmFhpX9RxVg.text: There is only one thing I keep not likening about one of my favorite local bar/restaurant. The fact that tables are so close to one another, especially outside.   I understand that restaurant wants to make money, but they are pushing a line with putting people seat so close to each other.   Every time I go there, I can feel guests next to me breathing on me. Little privacy would not hurt so much...Especially when business is always booming and that extra table will not make a huge difference if it is not there.  For everything else, I give this place 5 stars...Service, food, drinks, etc....

9CpzC8kgG24-osCOtaU8Pg.text: Romaine hearts w a delicious buttermilk dressing goes perfect with the Bacon and corn.  Moroccan spiced meatballs are a True treat.  Even a local (yes, Arizona) red wine that's not only surprisingly good but better than a lot of California's.  Do I look forward to a return? In the words of Bart scott, "can't wait!"

rL0AVtNnBThyGRysgZdxYw.text: Tried this place since I saw it was featured on Food Network's Diners drive in's and dives. It has a very clean/modern ambiance inside.  We went during happy hour to avoid the crowds I heard a lot about. Parking is valet only pretty much. They have offsite but it's a walk.   At happy hour I got the morrocan meatball entree for $11 at happy hour instead of the regular price of $16. Same portion size too. It is tasty but very very filling. The cous cous on the bottom of the plate is nice but I kind of wished for more starch since the tomato sauce can get pretty tart without some starch to even it out. My wife got their infamous pork sandwich which was nice. Overall nice place and I would go back if I was in the area.

7tsJqAMCfEV1L0ygm_qvCg.text: Food was really good but there was a long wait and noise level is pretty high.  This is a great place to hang out for happy hour or with a group of friends on the weekends.

Wa4Fg-VzF7I6NAkgLWziXg.text: I finally made my way to St Francis last night... better late than never, right?  I'd been wanting to try it for awhile, so upon deciding where to go with fellow yelpers Tammar and Brad, I suggested it.  Tammar had been before but the rest of us were St Francis virgins.  Not anymore!  We made a plan to meet at 8pm but of course we were running on Jared time so while Tammar and Brad put our names on the list we were still on our way.  We arrived around 8:15 and Tammar and Brad were sitting outside by a fire lamp with drinks in hand.  According to Tammar, the total wait time was 36 minutes.  (They initially said it would be 30 - 40 so they were right on.)  We admired the restaurant as we followed the hostess upstairs to where we were seated.  While the tables are fairly close together, the accoustics were perfect.  I sat next to Tammar and had "girl talk" with the guys did their thing on the other side of the table.    For drinks, I went with a glass of Argentinian Malbec, which I loved.   Tammar's Ketel One cocktails seemed to go down easy, Brad had a couple of different glasses of wine, and Jared went with some indie beer, one of which was Moose Drool.  Nice name!  For food, the guys split the Green Chile Stew appetizer, T had the one and only salad on the menu (hopefully they will add another option for that in the future), and I chose to start with a side of their roasted vegetables.  Unfortunately, our waiter (Rob), must've misunderstood and I was brought a soup instead.  So by the time the mistake was corrected, the rest of the table was done with their starters.  Although I had to wait a long while, the roasted veggies were very good.  We were also served some fresh from the oven French bread and olive oil.  And I was the odd man out when it came to entrees.  The three of them went for the Flatiron Steak while I was delighted with my Seafood Stew.  We were all way too stuffed for dessert, although the warm sticky toffee pudding sounds pretty amazing.  I guess we'll just have to return to try it sometime!  All in all, a delightful dinner date... especially the pleasant ambiance, fantastic company, quality organic and fresh veggies, etc... I'm sure we'll come visit again soon, St. Francis.  Perhaps you'll consider taking reservations in the future and/or adding an additional salad option to the menu?!

2toduTzcxvQ9wnBWEV3_nA.text: Woww So Great this Food is at St Francis Restaurant. Yum...just writing this is making me want to go back right now. Hertz Car Sales Phoenixs' friend Brian O'Malley let us know how awesome the food is and he was absolutely right. Thanks so much Brian. Your restaurant is crazy comfy with such good food....I'm heading over now. Happy Camper, John Fliss and the guys over at Hertz Car Sales Phoenix.

k5A1sOu_Y-lazK-F1WD_TA.text: St. Francis prides itself on its house baked baguette, and for good reason. These lovely little loaves are crunchy on the outside and perfect inside. They pair perfectly with the tomato, basil and mozzarella combo that was on the menu on our first trip. We really enjoyed our cocktails, the neat lighting and the intimate feel of the dinning room on the busy Saturday we visited.  The service has always been more than accommodating and even went as far as to offer us deserts on the house because our entrees took "longer than expected". Crazy thing, it was only about 20 minutes! And when the drinks are flowing and the weather permits outdoor seating, who could complain?

OvIQZ0Kjz8yak7QBe3Lt8g.text: Came here for a date night with my boyfriend and had the pork chops. Definitely some of the best food I've ever had!  Our server wasn't very friendly, but it didn't bother us all that much.  I would highly recommend this place!

__mJx8ol18Lmi1ew3gLo_A.text: Slow service. Over done burger. We actually got forgotten about. They didn't put my burger order in but put in the rest of the food which took just a minute (literally) longer than it took to get our iced teas.    When my burger finally arrived it was well done (I had asked for medium) so it wasn't even close to right. When we were done and paid the server brought a receipt without a line for a signature. (Not a problem for me since I wouldn't have tipped her anyway but my wife was buying.)   Trying to leave and the complimentary valet can't get the older couple in front of us Prius started. He makes them go get their own car. Are you kidding me???  We won't be back.

_0cYOwJ3_F1-8utRH1mbJw.text: The last few times we've been here the food has been hit or miss. Our previous visit we had to send back our eggs Benedict twice because they were cold the first time, and barely warm the second time. This visit I ordered the biscuit, gravy and eggs. Requested my eggs over medium but they were way over cooked. The server offered to take them back but I declined since the eggs were still acceptable. My wife ordered the special which was a quiche, although she liked it the food was served at room temperature. I know restaurants have good and bad days but so far we've had more bad than good.

k7qj8P-3MgLUUGpgZQravQ.text: Picture a Monday afternoon, the sun shining but it's still perfectly comfortable weather outside, and you have nothing you need to do. No, that's not a scene from a movie, I just got lucky while on vacation in Phoenix and had a taste of life after retiring. If I were to retire tomorrow, you bet I'd keep coming back to St. Francis for happy hour!  Anyway, we sat in the covered patio area and had some drinks and snacks. The Dark&Stormy (cool name) and Santa Rosa were great drinks; I had more than a few of the Santa Rosa. For eats, the Baked Goat Cheese and House Baguette were a perfect combination.  It was nice, refreshing and relaxing.

zKdomtW2gMEDv_LBGCRwRQ.text: Food was okay. Service was bad. Waitress didn't check on us or refill our water, after saying she would. Waitress and waiter were rude when asked about the movie screen outside.

XEAqOMLRaCIRVz_C0_dz5Q.text: The atmosphere at St. Francis is wonderfully eclectic. The food is more like fine cuisine with the menu offering frequent variations including fresh herbs and vegetables from their own garden. Happy Hour begins at 3:00 and they have tasty drinks unique to them.   St. Francis is frequently busy which can affect the service and the noise level during the busiest parts of the day. If you go prepared for that you will enjoy your experience.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful beams support the upper level.

vVOQhPSX9q6dJz3NFRb84A.text: Visited St. Francis for dinner on 4.23.16. This is a popular place, last time I tried to dine here I wound up leaving due to a long wait. Luckily, the outside bar was wide open when I arrived so I took a seat. I ordered, the scallops. unfortunately, they were a bit under-cooked for my preference. Ken the manager made contact within 2 minutes, explained they prepare this dish 'medium', and would re-prepare the dish to my taste. I had sampled the other elements on the plate prior to sending it back, and all were excellent. The roasted heirloom carrots were cooked perfectly, the dill accented both the creamed/mashed potatoes and the roasted carrots very well. I have no problem stating that all flavors on this plate were De-lish!  About 4 minutes after sending the scallops back for more heat, I realized that I was going to be late for the show at Phoenix Theater. I felt really bad about requesting the dish be re-cooked, as I now had to leave.....Ken intercepted 1/2 way to the exit, with the dish in a to-go bag assuring me he did not want me to go home hungry.... Sorry Ken.... and thank you for assuring a positive experience. You are absolutely an asset to this business!!!

ZQbyOQFysrY1HmKwewmcbw.text: Nice atmosphere, there was good variety of entrees, friendly staff, good food but not too high-brow. Music can be a bit loud which is one of my pet peeves but still.

7Pauv9QtGD86C-hSOd5akw.text: Chicken salad sandwich and omlette were delicious and fresh. Nice environment, and if I were just rating our server, Shelly would be a 5/5. Genuinely friendly and helpful. Thanks for the hospitality!

Oj9WHF5bpuuXvtsm8er85g.text: I've been to this location twice now normally later in the night around 8:30  The visual of this place is very romantic, the lighting is mood and the outside is so peaceful. my favorite aspect is they have grape vines on the patio that hang above you while you eat. its nice to see that in Arizona.  the food has always been great. Each time I've  been here the friends I'm with and I will just order items and share everything. The appearance of the dishes are almost as amazing as the taste, but  the flavor takes the cake for sure.  I really enjoy this spot its small but very nice for date night   only negative... the people that work there can be more attentive. the host took us to a dirty table and the old dishes remained on the table for too long after we were done with an them. Also they can offer more knowledge of the dishes and wine pairing.

rRsu6KzXypgP28YwFOUVFg.text: Without a doubt, my favorite burger spot in Phoenix.  The Chile Burger and the French Onion Burger are both masterpieces.  The beef is amazingly fresh and flavorful with the right ratio of meet to fat.  I always get mine medium/rare.  The buns are always fresh and soft.  And they aren't skimpy either.  Some high end spots in town...who shall be left nameless...give you these tiny little burgers (almost sliders) and think charging you $15 (a-la-carte, mind you) is fair.  Not St. Francis!!  No sir!!  Big, beefy, juicy, loaded burgers with a generous side of perfectly fried, hand cut French fries for about thirteen bucks!  Great deal for a filling, high quality, gourmet burger experience.  My friend Tanner swears by the pork chops.  I've never tried them, but next time I go, I might have to get a side of pork chops with my burger!!  (To my wife: That was a joke).  Guy Fieri has featured St. Francis on Triple D, and the first time I went I had the sandwich that was featured on the show (the Pig Dip).  Wasn't a huge fan.  But the burgers are another story.  Again, THE BEST IN PHOENIX.  Very convenient parking, indoor/outdoor seating, full bar, relaxed and comfy atmosphere, friendly wait staff.  Highly recommend for a casual afternoon lunch or early evening bite before hitting the town.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chile Burger
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The French Onion Burger
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Onion Burger

rkOV-SfPKif3L5WAebtzBg.text: We had a very nice brunch on the patio. Still a little warm out but it was the first available.  I had the fennel sausage and biscuit which was very tasty. Big chunks of sausage over a really fluffy biscuit. We also tried the chorizo and shrimp flatbread. You wouldn't think those would work together, but they really do.  They had a live jazz band playing which was unexpected and nice.  The only negative was the service was on the slow side. The food more than made up for the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo &amp; shrimp flatbread
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fennel sausage &amp; biscuit

zcDsVv7dKMjPhKlPdYp1PQ.text: This is a nice restaurant. I took my mom for mothers day and we enjoyed a great meal together. The restaurant was not too busy when we went, but we still ended up waiting about a half an hour for our food after ordering. That was pretty much the only negative aspect I saw during our visit.

uZaGLNvP-N1ewxgqeT0wHw.text: Another DDD restaurant we just had to stop at and just wish we lived closer; we'd be regulars. Parking is tight so they actually offer complimentary valet and the place fills up fast. We got there right at 11am when they open and by noon it was packed.  We felt little under dressed given most of the lunch crowd was business professionals but the staff treated us no different.  We actually came in for the Pig Dip, which the hubs got, but to our surprise it was the White Flatbread that stole the show.  I almost didn't order it because I wasn't sure if I would like the dates but it was amazing.  It was sweet but savory and the creamy goat cheese just melted like butter. The Pig Dip was good as well but it was a lot of pig and heavy.  Like food coma heavy, would be the perfect sandwich after a night of heavy drinking.  Oh and I forgot to mention that despite it's posh feel, it was actually really cheap!  Our bill was under $35 and that was for two entree's, a glass of wine, and a glass of beer. Seriously I was the second cheapest meal (behind In-N-Out) we had on vacation and the most memorable.  I will replicate that flatbread at home until we vacation in Phoenix again just so we can go back to St. Francis.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The beautiful metal work mixed with wooden rafters.
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The White Flatbread that stole the show.

-GA6z_Nc_Fm5j3L5ifXEHQ.text: St. Francis is always a good time.  If you can make it here early enough on the weekend you can enjoy the jazz band and amazing breakfast food.... and mimosas, duh! I have been here maybe 4 times and have yet to have a bad experience.  The specialty drinks are always delicious, I forget the name of this apple cocktail but it taste just like apple pie and I really need to know the ingredients to concoct it at home..  Perfect for families or for groups, very laid back environment and the staff seems to always be friendly.  We brought our kids once when they were playing jazz, and were totally cool with letting them dance.  This will always be one of my favorite spots to hang out with great company

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mediterranean meze

C9-dLtxGOdzJdtz9diKHZQ.text: Simply put this place has a nice atmosphere and pleasant staff, but breakfast, dinner, and desserts are overpriced for the taste and quality received. It's nice the first time, however save that second date or meetup for a different place with a similar priced menu.

9_9zxNJfdk2LxkYKhgKVeA.text: BEST green chili pork and always a very friendly waitstaff! Love to dine there! We have been often for drinks, lunch and dinner. The pig dip is fantastic and their daily specials are always great. I once had a lemon pizza that was truly to die for. Light and flavorful. Wish it was on the menu all the time.  Really have never had a bad meal. Delicious fish also.  Love the atmosphere too.

4L5sbU_H09e1n_EKRJK7cQ.text: I've been here 3 times. I absolutely love it. The staff is super nice, and the food is great. I know how to make baguettes, but you can get a great baguette here without any work. I originally came to this little gem after seeing it on Diners Drive Ins & Dives. I seriously can't believe I never came here sooner. The ambiance is lovely. The only thing that would make this place better would be access to a changing table in the restroom.   I had the pig dip. It's the perfect sandwich. I get that every time. Everyone should try it. I'm seriously obsessed.

KveRCKNEvC4tEAjubyVCuw.text: I love the atmosphere and food at St. Francis. The fresh baguette and seasonal offerings make for an incredible meal.   We enjoyed the risotto and the pork chile verde. The food was enjoyable and the wait staff attentive.   My only issue was that we were seated right in front of the pizza oven and on a 115 degree day, it was rather stifling and uncomfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chile verde.
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Risotto with Brussels sprouts.

Xj4xobx2g_eFnFhg8aIfgA.text: First time here for lunch. Went with a friend. Not the best location but ok. Negatives first: We were ignored by hostess for a few minutes as we came in and then seated. Server was mediocre as she was definitely not attentive.  We had to flag her down to ask for drink refill which we never got. First-time ever leaving a less than 20% tip. The water was horrible tasting.   Positives: food was FANTASTIC. Menu is short and to the point. Had the flat bread and the Pork sandwich with fresh cut French fries. Portions are LARGE and filling. Really outstanding.  The food is why I gave it 4 stars. If I based it on service alone I would give it 2 stars.  I recommend this place and will be back even with the sub par service.

0DVRDWV9VJ1A-rdqvGj3Eg.text: The space is rustic, modern, and chic. It was also open and inviting. Great bustling spot for brunch. I made a reservation via OpenTable and after a few minutes of watching the hostess fumble around, she said she located our reservation and we were taken to our table. (Side note: later that day, I received an e-mail from OpenTable informing me that I was a "no show")  Our experience started out nice enough with prompt service, however, while we were eating, we could not find our server. Our waters and coffees were empty and we were desperate for refills. When we finally spotted her, we could not get her attention. She tended a couple other tables, then stood at the server station while flirting with another server. It was infuriating. Especially with other wait staff walking around the restaurant and no assistance. Do colleagues not help each other? We finally got her to refill our beverages. My mom also requested additional sugar packets for her coffee, however, our server just went about her business, so we finally had to flag down another server and he kindly brought us more. A couple minutes later, she drops off a whole container without a word.  Thank goodness the food was tasty!  Cheddar Herb Scone ($5): The scone is a daily selection and I'm very pleased with the one we had. It was delicious! Great texture and flavors. I'm a huge fan of savory scones and this is definitely one of the best ones I've had. I was tempted to order another one if it wasn't for the price tag.  Cinnamon Roll with caramel sauce ($6): This is HUGE! And importantly, delicious. I really liked the caramel sauce that was fortunately not too sweet. We couldn't even finish half of it, so we took it home and it made a nice snack.  Crispy Fingerling Potatoes ($11): Tossed with rosemary, sage, and Parmesan; served with lemon aioli. The potatoes were delightfully crispy with tender interiors. I loved the flavors of the fresh, fragrant herbs and salty, nuttiness from the Parmesan. The aioli was also a great compliment. My mom and I love potatoes and we were really digging this dish!  Farmer's Market Frittata ($10): A thin "pancake" of eggs is topped with market fresh vegetables (broccoli, cauliflower, tomato, mushroom, baby spinach), sun-dried tomato, pickled red onion, and cheddar. I was really disappointed with this dish. Pan-fried eggs with vegetables tossed on top is NOT a frittata. Even if I ignored the name, it was flavorless and boring! The vegetables were barely heated through. Silver lining: It's a great low-carb option. Just pretend it's called Vegetable Medley & Eggs.  Chorizo Scramble ($10): Eggs with chorizo, spinach, salsa, and jack cheese. Served with a slice of Brick Oven Baguette. This was tasty. Solid brunch choice for those that like it a little spicy. Ruben really enjoyed it.  Chicken Chopped Salad ($14): Mixed greens, avocado, dates, almonds, and medium-boiled egg. My mom and I both loved this salad! The dressing was light and flavorful, but not overpowering. Everything was fresh and I loved the crunch from the almonds. A very generous serving of chicken as well.  We also took home two Brick Oven Baguettes ($3/each) - bonus: they're Vegan! They seem to have a sourdough aspect? They have a great crust like that on my favorite pizzas.  The food was (mostly) really great, however, our experience left much to be desired. It's truly a shame. I'm not sure any of us would be excited to return.  FYI: Complimentary valet only. Really odd considering the lot is very small and when we retrieved our car, he handed us the key since it was so close to the restaurant and exit. So very odd. Anyway, I felt so bad for the valet because it was SO hot outside!

W3SxBbJcmpehS2S5U9blZA.text: I got the farmer's fritatta and I was super happy! It looked fresh and tasted delicious. I feel like their menu is a little on the limited side for breakfast, but what they do....they do well. My friend got the Eggs Benedict which had smoked salmon, and it was fabulous. It seems like they have some great fresh baked goods that looked yummy when they were being served. My only complaint really was that I ordered a fruit salad...and what I got were chopped up apples with a few blueberries and tart strawberries thrown on top. That was a little bit of a letdown- but now I know!

VMtvG7dGsLdZngdDnMAGHA.text: St. Francis is trendy, hip, and popular. It's on Camelback Rd. in Central Phoenix, a road filled with other unique and trendy restaurants. There is usually a pretty long wait on weekends. They do take reservations (for larger parties I think). St. Francis usually uses local, in season produce, so the menu sometimes changes.   They have different seating options: - Inside and outside (depending on weather) bar - Upstairs dining - Outside patio with neat lighting - Downstairs dining room with open brick walls - I like the table right by the entrance that has glass walls. Although it's too warm in the summer.  Menu recommendation: The flatbreads are basically a personal pizza. And they're amazing. I really like the prosciutto (and fig?) flatbread. Nice blend of sweet and salty. The crust is pretty crisp; love it.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flatbread: prosciutto, fig, and goat cheese. It&#39;s basically a pizza.

gxoqTA_nJskSCxfOJi67hw.text: Amazing food and service- we had the child verde and Moroccan meatballs after a roasted fingerling potatoes and garlic- will go back as many times as needed to eat everything on the menu

OGur84fnnMktb3WnZEpW5Q.text: Make all their own bread from scratch. Cook everything they can in a wood fired oven. Four menus:  one for each season of the year.  They do not serve things that are not in season.  Unique ambiance and you can still see the vault that was used when the building was a bank.  I love the soup and salad, but my favorite is a tie between the green chili pork and the salmon.

a3g63C4ypbCu562bIyHewA.text: Nice, little trendy restaurant with complimentary valet service.  I almost couldn't believe that it was complimentary and my mother kept trying to give the guy some money for parking our car.  Upon entering, we were immediately attacked by some wood or bark that fell off a top shelf and almost nailed my mom in the head.  I helped pick up the mess before we were shown to our table.  We were seated in the middle of the restaurant, but they let us move to a better table near the back.  Water came out a few minutes later, which is a good sign.  We ordered a few drinks from the HH menu: an almond margarita and some type of lemonade, cucumber concoction.    I didn't care for the cucumber drink, so I stole the margarita from my mom.  I specifically wanted to try their Pig Dip sandwich, because I had seen it on Triple D and Guy raved about it.  The Pig Dip is not on the HH menu, but their kitchen approved my request.  We also decided to try their Moroccan meatballs.  Okay, the plates are huge and make it difficult to navigate due to the small size of their tables.  I'm not referring to the portions. I'm talking about the strange wood plates they use when serving hot dishes straight out of their wood-fired oven.  Now, the food really leaves a lot to be desired.  At this point, I had been enjoying myself, but the food detracted from the overall experience.  The meatballs have a decent flavor, but they are INCREDIBLY salty.  I probably wouldn't order them again.  The Pig Dip sandwich is served with an au jus-like sauce and French fries.  The fries were absolutely delicious, but the au jus had too much vinegar or something.  It made the sandwich taste terrible and I couldn't figure out what it was until I stopped dipping my sandwich in that awful stuff.  The Pig Dip by itself isn't too bad, but it certainly isn't one of the best sandwiches I have ever had.  It isn't even in my top 5.  This was slightly depressing, because Guy made it seem like something special.  It clearly wasn't.  It also cost $16, which makes it one of the most overpriced sandwiches I have ever had.  Listen, St. Francis, I have eaten far better sandwiches than your Pig Dip for almost half the price.  I realize that you make most of the ingredients in-house, but that is just a ridiculous price for an average sandwich.  In sum, St. Francis offers an interesting combination of products, a great HH menu, and utilizes attractive decorations to make their customers feel comfortable.  I would probably go back.

a7pJ_pJgja3SxT5yZJG8cQ.text: Fresh produce and baked breads! I enjoy the happy hour menu here. Drinks are refreshing. The vegetable forbidden rice bowl was delicious!

X-mR8bpRL08aXRJdrFaDGA.text: I have driven by here countless times and never noticed it. Why I have no idea. Its a beautiful place. Very modern and upscale. Its a good looking crowd and trendy. The food was good, but not amazing. I had a hanger steak and my guest had the pot roast. The steak was cooking to my request. Not as tender as I would have hoped, not for a prime cut at least. The pot roast was moist and tender. The high point of the evening was the potato appetizer. Quite tasty and a bargain at 6 bucks. I could be happy going for happy hour with a drink and the potatoes. Service was excellent. I will be back.

9aWWca5X4iFkYk0onF35ww.text: this time we shared a craft of house wine, like it a lot,  and the goat cheese appetizer, liked that a lot too. The boy had the pork chop and it was melt in you mouth tender, about and inch and a half thick, and absolutely wonderful. I had the seafood cioppino, loved it. Ive seen some complaints about the soggy bread, but I loved it. I left it for the very last so it could soak up all the amazing broth, it was still slightly crispy on the edges, but gooey from the cheese and broth in the middle, it was the perfect end to a really great meal.  Service was good too.

O2DxhiACZZ-Kxpq88QUfPw.text: Such a great spot! The atmosphere is fantastic, staff is super nice, and the food -OMG! Everything, I mean everything, on the menu is delicious. Weekend Brunch has live music and the patio is delightful.

uvGDzFb-U6Fvnswb7Vo6Ag.text: Just had sunday brunch here for the first time. Awesome. Wood-oven baked eggs over braised beef...fantastico.

UjKb_2L-ani8bC0Cq6pNWA.text: The ambiance is great, industrial urban chic, unusual for Phoenix. But exposed brick, aluminum table tops, and concrete floor make it quite noisy.       We were there for late lunch, so we were seated right away. Service was pleasant but not terribly efficient. Entrees were not brought out all at one time, and drink refills were spotty. A requested side of bread and butter never arrived.       The lunch menu is tiny, but the items sounded interesting. The soup, celery root with apple puree was a winner. The romaine salad was nice and fresh and well dressed. Portions are large. However, our hamburger was disappointing. It was way too salty, but the french fries were even saltier. And it was expensive for what it was, $12 for a burger no better than Indulge or Blue Burger.       I'd be willing to go back and give dinner a try, but I understand that the wait is long, and the noise level excruciating. We'll see.

mY_iD0gRbSdAAJdd-HR2uA.text: The atmosphere and food was incredible. The staff however was sub par to what I was expecting. Our waitress Christie was awkward and slightly rude. It felt like she was being nice only to get a tip. Other than her, it was a good experience.

UDvifA_7XI1p62tc8u3JMA.text: The cool setting does not make up for multiple service mistakes (wrong dishes being sent to multiple tables, the wrong dessert being left at the table, etc.). For the price, the entrees are meh. This would be a two star review but the cocktails are good enough to ratchet it up one more star. I want to like this place more but other restaurants in this town are much better.

PH02Y9K_BsEaIu9Lb7whvQ.text: Visited this restaurant for brunch. We sat on the patio and had a mimosa & Bloody Mary before ordering. The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars was due to the amount given for the mimosa. I felt shorted. Other then that service was great, and very attentive. The waitress had wonderful recommendations since I was undecided on what to order. I ended up ordering the fried egg sandwich with fries. It was amazing! The roasted red peppers made the sandwich. Others with me ordered the pancake (A must order!) and egg Benedict  with procietto which was also yum! We sat and talked at our table for a while and were not rushed away. The complimentary valet was also a nice touch. Will be visiting this place again but next time for happy hour.

FRCMHMx7yKhOO3JwK7ylZw.text: I've been here twice for dates and had a great meal, with great service each time, along with great company. The first time here i had the green chile pork, it was a bit spicy, very flavorful and the pork was tender. The cornbrread along side was great too. it was also he perfect portion size. The second time i had a burger and it was SO delicious. I usually would order something that i can't make myself but im glad i ordered it! The ketchup which is made in house (i think) alongside was also really good and had a slight kick to it.

ibb0eCPOe9EBSqjm3h-gZw.text: We went for dinner on a Thursday night. I called for reservations at the time I wanted, and they were full, but was told 1/2 the restaurant was open. We walked right in when we arrived. The baked goat cheese was amazing! We ordered our dinner, and were waiting and I had a problem with my drink. It was removed immediately and was given a new one. It was taken off our bill, and they got me a $25.00 gift certificate. I tell you customer service goes a long way with me, and I really enjoy this restaurant. They use locally sourced produce, and make their own breads. We will be back!

OkPHR1nKhFmJ43hLcXoP3A.text: We had a great dinner here!  The food was delicious from start to finish-and what a finish!  The bananas Foster were out of this world-one of the best desserts ever!  The salmon was to die for and my husband ate his chili verde so fast I didn't get a taste! We'll go back for sure next time we're in Phoenix. (For people from the Bay Area, it was not swanky or hip and groovy, as other reviewers have written)

ft1TqFlRv2I2X4YyEr0lTA.text: I heard so many good things about this place that I felt disappointed ... the only good things about it was my company what made it so worth it... the drinks so "whatever" the food nothing special and the ambient just another urban style restaurant... I don't see myself going back to it.... @ least he requested again...

ApqjRjvYV9RU31EVOqB4ug.text: ummm....YUMM!!!! Great food, great service, great atmosphere..did I say great food? Great for groups, great for a date, cocktails were amazing. Bar is so freakin' cool! Wish it was a little closer to Scottsdale but I will definitely travel for this place!

VAo6k6l2ebeHC5ezLu5FhQ.text: Went to celebrate with my honey and a friend suggested this place. First of all, great atmosphere. Second of all we were seated right away in the restaurant and decided we wanted to sit outside. The hostess was super nice and accommodated for us right away. I always feel like an annoying person doing that and the hostess definitely did not make me feel that way! Ordered some wine and the roasted chicken flat bread to start. That was yummy. Then I ordered the white fish (which was a halibut) and he ordered the pork chile verde AMAZING! our waitress Elena was awesome and extremely attentive/informative. My only thing was that they brought out the entrees while we were still eating our appetizer. Not that big of a deal to be honest.

gWXH61bWjPIOJC9rzAxKoA.text: I have only been here for brunch.  I had one of the greatest gourmet burgers.  The design and ambience is one-of-a-kind.  I can't wait to go there for dinner.

wD83rXPEP7AmyYZ-fdVAwQ.text: This is a great place for Happy Hour and special times like birthdays, etc. I went here for a birthday and really enjoyed it. We happened to arrive during Happy Hour so our dinner choices were a lot cheaper. We ordered the cheese flat bread and the rice bowl. Both were outstanding. Portions were so big that we had to request containers to take leftovers home and the delicious chocolate cake we chose for dessert came with a candle and was free! Wonderful service, great atmosphere and terrific food...highly recommend St. Francis.

hUhMKCjazNcvrm0f7aPLRQ.text: the chili verde is great hear.  i also got to meet the manager at the local first az festival this past weekend.  their butternut squash soup and sourdough bread are amazing.

lXBtIoujcoNlkoqcRt3PEw.text: Last night I went there with a friend and had a perfect evening.  It's not often when I'll drive from Cave Creek to central Phoenix but this was really worth it.  I wanted to try something different from our usual places so I searched on Yelp for some good ideas.  St. Francis jumped out at me because that's the name of my patron saint so how could I go wrong there?  I made a reservation for 2 at 6:45 on a Saturday evening, Wow.  We arrived 5 minutes early so we had an actual wait of about 10 or 12 minutes before we were taken to the best table in the place overlooking the bar area.  The place was really busy and I had thought we would have a longer wait but thanks for the surprise.  Our waitress, Monique, showed up quickly and took our drink orders which also arrived quickly.  After discussing various items on the menu my date ordered the market vegetable flatbread and I ordered the green chili verde with pork chunks and with a egg on top.  We each also ordered a bowl of scrumptious pumpkin soup for a starter.  The pumpkin soup was as good as I used to get in the British Virgin Islands where it's served everywhere.  My date and I shared a bit of our meals back and forth a little.  The flatbread was fresh and loaded with great vegetables, and in spite of being something I would never order I actually liked it a lot.  The chili verde with pork chunks was incredible, it had a really good flavor with a very gradual heat buildup.  The egg on top turned out to be two of them and they made a nice contrast with the chili.  Our waitress was one of the best I have had anywhere.  Monique came by regularly to see how we were doing but she was never intrusive.  She made great recommendations, showed us great service, and there was no rush or pushiness.  We'll be back to St. Francis and I'll insist on having Monique take care of us again.  Boy, it's a long drive back up to north Cave Creek but the evening was well worth it.

IBXCF3LM262dsDSQWLEAwQ.text: I have been wanting to go to St. Francis ever since I heard about it, on the radio of all places, a few months back. I decided it was the perfect day to check it out, my hubby offered to take me out to lunch today for my birthday (he's a keeper!), so this was my choice.   I LOVE the architecture of the building, so much eye candy! We asked our server what used to be in this building & she told us it was an old Dentist office. The bathrooms were so cool! I love that the toilet paper roll was on a rod coming out of a safe on the wall & the flat sink was so interesting.   We arrived right at noon & the place was almost full, with about 2-3 tables available. The hostess promptly sat us & we gazed over the menu. Hubs ordered his usual Dr. Pepper, since it was my bday I ordered a cocktail. My 1st ever mojito! It was made with mint of course, lime & pineapple rum. Not a drink I would order often but I liked it, very refreshing! For an app we ordered the baguette with olive oil. It came out sliced, about 7 pieces, with a tiny cup of olive oil. Tasty! For our entrees hubby ordered the turkey & avocado sandwich & I ordered the pork chile verde. He said his sandwich was just ok but I loved my stew! It had so much yummy flavor & the cornbread that came on the side was fabulous!! Using the bday card again, I decided to order some dessert. I ordered the chocolate cake; which came with peanut butter gelato, caramel & caramel corn. It was delicious! The only reason i couldn't finish it was because I was already full from lunch & I ran out of gelato, I always mess up the cake to ice cream ratio!   The hostess came by to ask how our meal was & I told her it was excellent & that I was glad to have finally tried it out on my bday. She then told our server it was my bday so she took the dessert off of our tab. That was so sweet of them! So total with tip & minus dessert was about $45. A little pricey for lunch but totally & completely worth it in my opinion! We will definitely be back for dinner sometime :)

Ce1AHuqYOo8x3XLYtjKLFQ.text: This place is pretty good. The baked goat cheese was the bomb and so was my cocktail.

szobKMnET6cbUUaFd6tRcQ.text: Came here with family for brunch, around 1030-11. was hoping to get the pig dip sandwich but they said it was too early.  I settled on the pancake griddle.  the presentation of it was just a pancake on a plate and small. not impressive. but it was very heavy and soaked in syrup and was very good. I like sweet and it was.   I will comeback for lunch or dinner to get the pig dip sandwich.

u8WkXU8tg-ij-I3PK2oieg.text: Very hip place, nice open air restaurant. We made a reservation just in case but for a Saturday afternoon brunch probably wasn't needed. We had two awesome sandwiches! The Pig Dip was amazing, great flavor and size, au jus was good. Wife had the chicken salad sandwich which she said was great and refreshing. Both sandwiches had flavorful homemade rolls! Good beer and mixed drink list. Hope we can make it back soon and try breakfast or dinner.

gkxGLzKXdSijreiyw6N8-Q.text: We came to St Francis early for brunch and had a very nice time.  St Francis is about the food and the ambiance.  It's one of those restaurants that you wish you lived closer to, so you could become a regular.  The service is friendly and the wait staff has a effusive manner.  We ordered the Eggs Benedict with the standard english muffins and hollandaise sauce, skipped the potatoes for $13.00, along with the Farmer's Frittata for $10.00.  Both were very good.  The Frittata's taste lingered well after our meal, but in a good way.  It was light and had a nice mixture of flavors.  All the food came promptly and we had time to sit back and enjoy our meal.  It also gave us an opportunity to  browse the efforts of the interior designer and architect on the space.  I think I would call it light and breezy, as was our meal.  Enjoy!  .

4MEkL4cz801c57uc9vTNQg.text: Dinner at St. Francis was really just okay.   Things I really liked:  Valet parking, always a plus for me. Great romantic ambiance, dim lighting in what seems to be a converted loft with high ceilings. Sat on the second floor and was able to watch the talented bartenders craft drinks. Chicken salad sandwich was good and so were the fries. Not too greasy or creamy. Santa Rosa cocktail was made with fresh grapefruit juice and basil. It was very refreshing, one of those drinks that can really get me into trouble.    Kind of a miss:  Smoked salmon flat bread was okay. Not enough salmon or creme fraiche. Romaine salad was tasty but tiny.  St. Francis  for dinner... I wanted to like it, but it fell short for me. Maybe brunch next time.

FnLzPsRZjrUW1Pktnetzow.text: St Francis Restaurant.... well love it or hate it! I also have mixed feelings about this place and it is not so much about their food and drinks but more about their services. Twice now we were forced to wait an additional 45 minutes before being seated even thought we had reservations. Several couples which came way after we arrived were seated first. Food is alright but service lacks IMHO. Won't be back!

apKISl80Em_ARcqKBRBOnw.text: Arrived here for Sunday brunch on a hot Phoenix day.  There is a wait around 20-30 mins, pretty accurate with their timing which was nice.  We were offered a drink as we waited, spotted a kids area for those of you who have kids.  As we were seated there was a live jazz performance.  Began to look at the menu and was pretty skeptical with the menu as it seemed like pretty regular brunch. Boy were we in for a great surprise! We ordered:  Sparkling pineapple lemonade-  good to the last drop just absolutely refreshing and tasty for a hot Phoenix Day  Fried Egg Sandwich- my husband got this amazing sandwich, doesn't seem like it would be anything special right?  Wrong! It is pretty much one of the best breakfast sandwiches I have ever had, that bacon and chipotle aioli sauce is just amazing.    Eggs Benedict with Pork Loin-  our friend opted for this and it turned out to be quite tasty as well! The eggs were cooked perfectly (something we always look for in a benedict) and the pork loin was perfectly flavored with it.    Pork Chili Verde-  My choice, the pork chili came with corn bread and most importantly HOT! This dish was more spicy than I thought it would be which is a plus because I like spicy.  Those flavors packed into this tiny skillet.  You have to try and dip french fries into this, it was like pork chili fries.    Even with the wait, can't go wrong.  Absolutely love it here, they will be seeing me more often!

IP9m_Tw7AvOlU-6jc8FR5Q.text: I am currently sitting at this restaurant disappointed. There was a 30 minute wait.. Which I understand. However when we sat down it took 20 minutes for a server to even come over to our table as we sit here drink less. When the server finally came we placed our order as we ordered drinks and now we see people seated after us getting food it's been another 30 minutes since we ordered and still no food. I had such high hopes for this place going in, but I am currently so discouraged on coming back.  UPDATE: I went inside and asked for the manager, he came out and somewhat rectified the situation. Because of how kind and helpful he was I will update my star review from 1 to 3 stars.

Qv-RpOtKwplLIHrZxl4fRA.text: Seen this place on dinners drive in and dives this is a dive took 12 of us there after seeing it on tv. Two people in our party had the veg flat bread and got FOOD POISONING  - Vomiting and Diarrhea all night and the next day - Thanks great way to screw up our vacation. Oh also service was awful but that I could have lived with. Do yourself a favor skip this place its a vacation killer. To add insult to injury I called the Resturant the next morning at 9am and spoke to a individual and they said a manger would call me back. At 2:30 the following day since I never received a call I contact St Frances Resturant and spoke to Greatchin she asked me to hold and she would get me a manager - she came back and said manager Cory was not available. Gretchen then said she will give the message to Ken and he will call me back. He never did. I waited 5 days before I posted this. I would assume since there was no concern in what happened they may be used to receiving these calls. This ones a dive

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert at ST Frances in Phoenix

GvreYFaj5ahoXgwEJ4sVUg.text: I don't think I've ever had a bad experience here.   The only thing I will say is one night the wait was way too long and there was no service on the patio while we waited -- had to get our own drinks from the bar and then after we did that THEN someone came around to see if we wanted anything.
