They need to be more on their game on the patio for people that are waiting for a table. It sets the tone for the rest of the meal.

-uYP4UD9Sfz72dCeCLR2ng.text: St. Francis's comin' down across Central Avenue Upon Happy Hour I'll drink and wish I'm in a parade Light of a fire grill Chef cooks with a thrill Coming at you on the count of 1,2,1,2,3,4! (number of drinks - wink!)  This is St. Francis Restaurant and you better try it out Succulent Pork Chops that your momma talked about King of the flatbreads And I'm here to have a meal The Chile Verde in my belly in this fine establishment  It's the patron saint of the appetite With an angel face and a taste for great serviced foods! (Lyrics - Green Day - St. Jimmy)  As I said this over and over; I don't know St. Francis, but I love this place.  Maybe that's why he's a saint.  This place rocks!    The place itself is a rustic homey feel that has an open kitchen.  Reminds me of spring time in a farm.  It's really relaxed and chill.  There's a nice patio to the East with a fire place and upstairs is another level of dining.  Complimentary valet which is recommended.  I ordered the Pork Chile Verde which came with a side of corn bread.  This pork was perfectly braised and fell apart perfectly into the chile sauce.  It is pretty spicy so if you can't handle the heat -- well like they said go get yourself a beer! Right!?  My partner ordered the Pork Chops --- she didn't go wrong there.  It was perfectly done; moist in the middle and succulent!  We both shared the Goat Cheese Bites and man it hit the spot.  Nice, warm, and creamy; along with the crunchy crostini -- mmm!  Service overall was a delight!  Very knowledgeable and their recommendations was spot on making our night one to remember.  St. Francis is a gem and was voting best new restaurant when they first opened back in 2010.  Ever since then their awards and accolades resonate well once you try this place out. - Enjoy!

XUIsVxzZqdBO_KdADHWk6A.text: My husband and I are fans of St. Francis.  We start with the Goat Cheese appetizer... with little crostini's... very good!  Then, we settle in to the Pork Chile Verde.  There is nothing that tastes this good... we crave this dish!  If you come during happy hour, you can get the Goat Cheese appetizer for $5, then Pork Chile Verde dish for $8 and share a house white wine carafe for $12...  fantastic bargain and you'll leave happy.    The staff are friendly and attentive, it's a favorite early dinner spot for us.  Thanks St. Francis!  PS:  If you have the kids with you, they eat free.  Our 9 year old is a huge fan of the kids pork roast.

9KzrwlhzHVnelVUIjEPUgQ.text: I've been to St Francis on quite a few occasions. The food and drink never disappoint.  They have great happy hour specials too... Recently dairy free and vegetarian, the menu is a wee bit more limited, but they're willing to leave out the dairy when asked.  I am a sucker for fingerling potatoes and good drinks at happy hour prices.  This is a solid choice if you are looking for a date spot, meal with friends or happy hour with work peeps.  I've not been for brunch, but it's on my to-do list!! (p.s. 1000th review?! wow!)

bhxuqK5QLEwJIgFh4JplQQ.text: My wife and I have been here several times over the past few years. We return because of these reasons: great cocktails, great service, and cuisine not seen other places in Phoenix.   Tonight we had a cucumber cooler, a Santa Rosa, Moroccan meatballs, and vegetarian stuffed peppers. Everything was executed perfectly including the service. We'll be back!

Zf9_KbY5ysGb_p701R5kDw.text: Great food and service. Awesome trendy atmosphere. Set in the heart of central Phoenix, and is easy to find for after-work dining.

6wQ5qTBNocjQVRP0p3zk5A.text: Why four stars? Could have been better, like the Moroccan Meatballs, which needed more spice and were just a bit dry.  Still enjoyable, as was the Pig Dip, but not wow, how am I going to get this food every week when I live 1500 miles away. Why not two or three stars?  Because the staff was great, the decor and atmosphere was relaxing and unique.  And the flat bread! Yes! With thick pepperoni and sauce and cheese.  This was the best pizza I have had that isn't called pizza on the menu!  And the crispy whole fried fingerling potatoes with generous crispy herbs was a big favorite.  These annoying potatoes volunteer in my garden every year and now I know what to do with them.  We will be back to St. Francis!

AyQrCgogRClplmBnRRBUTw.text: I recently took my daughter here for dinner and we had a really nice meal. As expected, it was packed on a Friday night, but we didn't wait long for a table. The kids meals are free and my daughter had the cheese pizza with a side salad.   I ordered the pork chile verde, goat cheese app, and a side of polenta. I also had 2 cocktails and since it was happy hour, everything was relatively inexpensive. Before we left, I ordered the pork belly risotto for my husband and everything came out to $45. Very reasonable. Service was attentive, too, and humored my daughter with all of her 6 yr old ramblings and questions. We really enjoyed ourselves!

2Md_MT8xyLqkU7pmLEQjyw.text: Oh where to begin? The service was honestly the worst I have ever had the displeasure of experiencing in Phoenix. Took forever to get our first drinks. Not once was I offered to have my empty water cup refilled and finally it was filled up after asking 3 times. My burger was good, but the fries came out feeling like half frozen Oreda's. However, the waiter took so long to come back after dumping off our food that I had finished my burger by the time I could even tell him about the fries. When I finally told him he very awkwardly said, "ugh, I could get you some new ones, I guess?" Another server brought out the side of fries later and tried auctioning off to the table next to us (don't tickets have table numbers labeled?) which was kind of awkward, too. Essentially my friend and I ended up splitting some new (piping hot) fries after we were done with our entrees. When the runner dropped the fries I also said we were done with our entrees and she said she would send a busser to clear our plates. Well, about 30 minutes after staring at our empty, dirty dishes they were finally cleared.   My friend made the mistake of attempting to order a second beer which took over 15 minutes to receive. Once again, we heard someone try to deliver it to the table next to us and then the runner just left with the beer. Our original waiter came rushing out with the beer a few minutes later. We were there over two hours because everything moved so slowly. It's a shame because the ambiance is so nice and the area is convenient, but there's no way I would go back.

9b9c9Y4Zvqwdeu8hxDkhew.text: Stylish and hip yet humbly manages to stay comfortable and understated; St. Francis is almost one of the best restaurants I've visited in a long time.   There are enough interior design details to satisfy our inner Martha and a menu that's well presented and executed, so why the "almost"? The service was off. Our servers couldn't decide who we belonged too, another table's food was served to us, then our salads and soups came out with the entrees, huge no-no. For a restaurant that's been open well over a year, these kinds of rookie mistakes, while forgivable, are just out of place and confusing. It's a fact we all have off days, they clearly were having theirs.  In the semi-open kitchen you'll see their custom built wood burning oven which is the cooking method for many of the dishes on the menu. Now maybe I'm nitpicking, but normally at this caliber of restaurant, bread is simply part of the service. At St. Francis to get a few slices of their fantastic house made baguette, served with extra virgin olive oil and sea salt ($2) you'll have to ante up. I know it's only a few bucks and really is a sign of the times, but really? So the bread was chewy and had an excellent developed flavor, okay it was worth it.   When our Meatballs ($12) with Moroccan spice, tomato sauce, egg and olive oil toast arrived I swear there was cheese on top. After one bite of these meaty spheres there was no cheese at all, ends up the egg was so light and airy that it had a cheese like texture. This is that one dish that will keep me coming back over and over, such a taste departure from the typical Italian style.   I'd highly suggest ordering the fork tender Pot Roast ($17). Better than moms, it was served with sweet corn polenta, bok choy, carrots and tomatoes, rustic and deliciously fulfilling. The white fish of the night ended up being a thick fillet of Mexican Grouper ($23). Like everything else, perfectly cooked, the plump flavorful fish was served with carrots atop a pillowy mound of mashed potatoes. If you're craving a burger, try the French Onion Burger ($13) with its smoked bacon, Gruyere cheese and crispy onions, its a beautiful thing.      Sticky Toffee Pudding ($7) with sweet cream gelato, was an excellent way to end such a great meal.   The food at St. Francis was on point with every dish being excellent. I look forward to an on day when the service matches the food.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

F_J00mo0dhCilqvjtOJ07g.text: My party was thoroughly unimpressed with our food. We got 2 of the famous French onion burgers with high hopes and the pig dip sandwich. I was the lucky person to select the pig dip sandwich that was coincidentally crowned with a blonde hair. Never mind the fact that apologies are NOT offered at such a prestigious establishment, it's just swept under the rug and keep it moving with a fresh sandwich. On try 2 with the pig dip, my jaws were fatigued from chewing the thick sourdough bread with the heavily crisped and somewhat charred crust. Onto this burger that has World renowned known accolades. This was an eye opener for me to humble myself! Evidently seasoning is no longer in style on burgers, nor sauces. The fries were excellent, but unfortunately the best part of the meal. The mixed drinks were creative and tasty and the ambience was super trendy and fun. Overall, I would not go back because one typically goes to a restaurant to eat and in this case based off of the food I would've given one star but the service and the ambience boosted this spot to three stars.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Pig Dip
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The French dip sandwich

kyiRD38qQNfwGD1LOmJDMA.text: The food is usually good... Service is a hit and miss, and most of the time a miss.  Most of the servers are racist, and have a hard time swallowing a brown person with money...  I still go because the food is good, and I might get lucky with the waiter that is a plus... If they had better service I would be there once or twice a week for sure.. The food is really good.. Too bad ..

v1W4kxbhpiDE7sS6vcBMJQ.text: St. Francis definitely has the ambiance down. Driving by, I always thought the front glass booth seating would be a perfect place for a small party of friends to celebrate a special occasion. It was the first place I sat when I finally got to--the second day they started serving lunch, in fact, for a friends birthday. One word of caution and slight disappointment is the path leading to the main entrance... it's not exactly paved, so it could get messy on a rare rainy AZ day. And it's not just the physical space, but the musical space that St. F delivers... It is Indie Music Paradise and I LOVE IT. I even have a playlist in iTunes gathering up all the songs I hear. Overall, their track list is fairly small in terms of rotation... I heard several of the same songs repeated every time I visited (A total of 4, but the first 2 times I was there to get a GC, then to make reservations). I heard The Shins, Fleet Foxes and Nouvelle Vague. But it's growing because last time I heard Radiohead, Portishead, Supreme Beings Of Leisure and Feist to name a few more.  For my first dining experience, I had an open faced sandwich... I think it was pulled pork... with butternut squash and sauteed spinach... It was tasty and pretty filling--I brought 1/2 of it home for another meal. I wished it came with fries like the French Onion Burger a few of my co-workers had to round it out, but in the end, I didn't need  to as one of them was "being good" and gave me her fries... SCORE! They were definitely generous in serving size and pretty tasty. Other co-workers delighted in an Ahi Tuna Salad (Or was it a sandwich...?)... and I believe everyone loved their Ice Tea.  The second time I went was for dinner... again, for a friend's birthday and this time I got to sit upstairs. I was secretly hoping we would be seated up there after discovering they had a second floor... 2-story restaurants are few and far between here in AZ, land of low and horizontal sprawl. We were seated at the furthest end of the 1/2 boot seating... so had a great view down to the bar... the large garage door was raised all the way up, so we got some fresh winter air.   A couple of my friends got the Baked Goat Cheese, Tomato, Walnut Herb Pesto and Toasted Bread for Appetizers, so I got to try a taste. Yup, Goat cheese is too strong a flavor for me.  I decided on the Wild Mushroom Risotto with Oven Dried Tomatoes and Parmesan Froth. Yes, froth, see picture for effect. My favorite part of the flavors in the dish were from the oven dried tomatoes... makes me want to experiment at home because they were heavenly... I wished I had more than 2 on my plate. The mushrooms surprised me as they packed a lot of flavor, too... usually I think of them as pretty mild, but they definitely offset and added to the creamy cheesy risotto taste. When I order this dish again, I will make sure and ask for extra Tomatoes... YUM. Again, a friend declined her potato side... this time the extra thin Crispy Potato chips and we all got to try them. They were VERY thin, quite possibly the thinnest chips I've ever had and had varying texture and taste... some were pretty plain, others salty and others still with a hint of vinegar... it was like a box of chocolates! Ba dum DUM! It was funny, we looked like potato connoisseurs chip tasting. I also got a bite of my friends Peppered Crusted Steak and it was really good! I am not often a steak orderer--pepper crusted at that (usually find the flavor to be too strong), but I would order this one.  For dessert, we had the most interesting one on the menu: Warm Sticky Toffee Pudding, Sweet Cream Gelato. Be forewarned it's not pudding as in a pudding cup. It's bread pudding, but as a yelper said, it was more like a cake. I liked the flavor... it reminded me of (Buttter) Rum Cake... which I like when the Rum doesn't over power the entire dish. Sweet Cream Gelato? I assumed it was Vanilla and the melted toffee made it hard for me to think anything otherwise. If I have it again. I will have to take note of it's subtle flavors alone.  I have to go back at least 3 more times... to try out a new area of restaurant. I still have yet to eat in the main portion of the first floor dining space, the patio and the bar. I'm REALLY curious about their cocktails. I've heard good things about the Meyer Lemonade... love mojitos... and there's is pineapple infused one so I want to try that it (It's the island girl in me)... Heck I think I want to try every specialty drink off the menu! Good thing St. F's in my 'hood.  The only thing I can say is a detriment is the price--it's quite pricey and a lot of the dishes are small, but if you're creative and share it's doable without too much of a hit to your pocketbook. Or, if not, go here as a "treat" place. Definitely a place to bring a special someone or celebrate a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Warm Sticky Rice, Sweet Cream Gelato (Don&#39;t ask me why the photo is on its side...it wasn&#39;t when I uploaded it!)
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom Risotto with Oven Dried Tomatoes and Parmesan Froth

50H5xGGDciFLj7zVjEMXrQ.text: I have been to St. Francis about 5 times now and every time I am completely satisfied with everything from the ambiance, to the service, to the amazing food.  I want to touch on just one menu item, the Eggs Benedict.  I haven't been able to eat said food for about 5 years now after a horrible food poisoning experience in Mexico brought on by bad hollandaise.  It is my fiance's favorite breakfast food and every time he orders it I try it and every time I can barely choke it down.  Not the case here!  I tried it, I loved it, I wish I ordered it myself!  I ate not only a bite or two of his, but our dining companion as well.  Just thinking about it right now makes my mouth water.  In a good way.

et7bAk9yUf26mqVR3L1cxw.text: You'd expect this place to be inundated with hipsters, but not too many in sight. The food is spectacular and their HAPPY hour is crazy good. 3-6 daily including weekends. The service was par, the drinks potent, and the atmosphere phenomenal. If you go BEWARE you may love it.

kZgIu7WquD5JD7umerl67w.text: Second time in several years visiting this PHX spot. Great lively atmosphere. Excellent cocktails although drinks took too long to arrive. Food was solid but everyone's main course came out at different times which was awkward. This seems odd for an established restaurant. Overall good experience but they need to work on getting drinks and food out in a more coordinated fashion.

3a7b25BZqLlC0QtOtNaTjg.text: Excellent food and service.  I had cioppino and husband had chicken.  We had fresh mozzarella as appetizer and cucumber cooler drinks.  If you like cioppino as a stew dish and not pasta sauce - this is perfect!  The app is incredible and I'm craving it now.    Atmosphere is nice.  Open and light and comfy for hanging out and pretty people watching.  This will be nice dinner out place in the future.

3IPQ9vqpkxK9VLiqkKsVaQ.text: Went here for lunch.  Ordered the lemon chicken with the cous cous.  Really liked it.  Sat upstairs which was nice and warm.  The salad was very good.  The gentlemen next to me ordered the meatballs and they smelled delicious!  Would try those next time.  I would come back here again.

HA5svx2sV0uibWxNCKMtng.text: What a lucky break to be driving down Camelback road on a Sunday morning looking for a breakfast place and stumble upon the St Francis.  Very grateful the Good Egg was standing room only. We walked across the street and we were glad we did.  The eggs benedict and biscuit and fennel sausage were both excellent.  Service was quick and friendly and the atmosphere exceptional with a live jazz group.   Sipped a perfect Bloody Mary while we were waiting.  Felt like we were on vacation.

efPh5FesFl3vAciiuaprYw.text: Went here with a friend when I was in Phoenix on business.  I had the Roasted chicken with green garlic whipped potatoes, confit tomatoes and mushroom sauce.  It was very tasty!  I would definitely go here again.  The decor was modern, and a little noisy with the high ceilings, but it was fine.  They had a full bar, a good wine list, wonderful food and complimentary valet parking.  The music was very good as well..  They get 5 stars for playing DeVotchka while I was in there :D and serving wonderful food.

kYPDRaKAC4TpCKP0_P_-Lg.text: Where to begin.  I REALLY want to like this place and I'll start with the GOOD.  I love the bread and the Pork Chili Verde is good.  Oh and that St Francis lemonaid with the honey vodka is GREAT.  I've been there at least 4 times, but I'm not enough of a fan to go back because I crave it.  It's usually because someone I'm going with hasn't tried it yet and I'm going along to see if it's gotten better.   Maybe I'm wrong or maybe this isn't my kind of place, but for all intents and purposes THIS SHOULD BE.... The decor is great, the area is where all my favorite places are, the owner/chef is really nice all the time, but I just don't get it... I don't LOVE IT.  Couple of things that are a little CONS... I don't get why the part where you walk in is all gravel, it makes the entrance confusing since the sidewalk leads to the BACK.  I've had 2 instances were I've been treated in a CHILLY manner by the 2 different hostesses.  Alright, I'll just say it, they were kinda rude. That being said I go to a lot of places where I don't love the service, but I go back because at the end of the day, I can't get the food that I like anywhere else.  In regards to St, Francis I can get this food many other places.  It's honestly just blah.   I'd take my grandparents here and honestly they'd love it, but I don't think that's a selling point. The food needs some UMPH! I need some flavor that makes my mouth water. I'll keep my fingers crossed that it gets better, I really want a new local hangout place since a lot of places that are non chain have been closing up these days.

4iEIeIFIezGXp4n8wwXulg.text: Great happy hour! A nice place to hang out and grab some drinks. The baked goat cheese is amazing as are their baguettes. Service was good considering how large our party was. Happy to add this place to my HH list and will be back!

DuP86IZtbKddgtUpHT3tlg.text: I dig it. It reminds me of restaurants I would frequent back home in San Francisco. I found it to be a very cool spot with friendly, efficient bartenders and servers, diverse (yet relevant) menu and handsome architecture. I love the open airy-ness about the restaurant and the combination indoor-outdoor bar area.  The brick oven is impressive, the wines are exciting and the food is phenomenal.  Everything is very reasonably priced, including drinks.  Parking is valet-only, but it's complimentary. St. Francis is the perfect place for drinking wine with friends, and has definitely been added to my happy hour rotation.  It also strikes me as a great "date" spot. Not that I'm in any danger of needing to be concerned about that.   For as cool as this spot is, nobody there seems to be up their own a$$ about it. The ever-increasing cloud of smug I've noticed in Phoenix has definitely passed over St. Francis.

Ec2REo8ZFi3c1j5-ZAmXJw.text: Came here on 1st Friday with some friends; we had a reservation but still had to wait nearly 40 minutes to be seated. For the most part, I thought the prices were high considering the quality and complexity of the dishes, and the service. I got the seafood stew, which was highly recommended by the server. It was extremely fishy smelling, but that didn't put me off as much as the shrimps in my stew tasting like it had been brined in some kind of chemical. It tasted almost like they bleached the shrimp or something -- a very chemical, kitchen-cleaner-esque taste. The rest of the seafood in the soup was fine, but the shrimps were inedible because of the chemical taste.   We got the sticky toffee bread pudding to share and it was great -- certainly the best part of my meal.

5eX_gGEI6K6x_Pq5gnJsPQ.text: My man and I were really pumped with basically everything about St Francis, from our really super sweet server to the ultra classy but not top-heavy, spill all over myself wine glasses (my clumsiness is legendary, to the point of serving myself wine in tumblers when I'm home). All of the glassware and other service items were pretty and perfect, actually. Notably so.  We had the carrot soup and romaine salad with buttermilk cheddar dressing for our apps. The carrot soup, amazing. The salad would be amazing anywhere else, but given how good the rest of our meal was, we found the salad relatively lacking. RELATIVELY.   For dinner, I went with the seafood cioppino and he had the strip steak with fingerlings and onion... both were definitely top shelf all the way. Full flavors, the broth in the cioppino was so, so good, and all the veggies on his steak were just perfection.  Their cocktails looked very, very tempting, but I went with my standby date night beverage and was impressed that they had all three ingredients waiting for me: St Germain, Hendricks Gin, and a cucumber slice.

qZebteBM11V_MOtn_339aA.text: Service was great! (thank you, Patty!) Mimosa with my choice of oven-baked eggs. (Nice chunks of braised beef, so tender). Today is Sunday and there is live jazz. Great music but a bit too loud for my liking. Over all a nice brunch. No problem parking.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade biscuit breakfast
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oven baked eggs

bTCnqIkSTvG6madppDrm1g.text: I had heard just a little bit about St. Francis before planning my visit, but everything I had heard had been so good I knew it was on the top of my list of new places to try.  St. Francis may have even exceeded my high expectations.  We got there just after 5:30pm--able to park and walk from a friend's house in the neighborhood across the street.  The other member of our party had warned us she was going to be a little late.  Initially the hostess wouldn't seat us until our whole party arrived, so we got a drink at the bar--fun indoor/outdoor set up.  Bar food = amazing...can anyone say on-the-house dishes of olives, house-made chips, toasted nuts, and thin-crust cheese pizza.  The drinks were also good.  A nicely made, strong gin and tonic.  When I ordered it with extra lime, they gave me three pieces--good sign.    Toward 6pm, just as things started to fill up (they only take reservations for 6 or more, and its very popular), the hostess approached me, confirmed that the other members of my party were close on their way, and seated us--so nice.  The food was incredibly savory--AMAZING.  Since we had already sampled the pizza at the bar, we ordered the baked goat cheese with tomatoes and pesto, and the ahi-tuna sandwich to share.  Our friend ordered a burger which looked delicious.  Chips (which were yummy) and pickled veggies (which were admittedly not the tastiest to me) came with the dishes.  I am still craving the ahi-tuna sandwich.  It was a thick ahi-steak cooked perfectly to melt in your mouth perfection.  It was on a perfect, buttery roll...it had a drizzle of aioli.  I can't get it out of my mind and a part of me wishes I wouldn't have shared (even though it was certainly large enough).  I'm dragging everyone I know here asap.  So delicious, friendly staff, relaxed environment, and great building.    Extra information: The building is two stories, it opens at 4pm (no lunch, damn), and there is a little kids meal for all you hip parents with free meals for little ones.

-oeP0Qz9sVYjdjnaLdG_0A.text: The melon salad was pricey disappointment. Over half of the melon wasn't ripe, there were only 4 leaves of arugula which to me should have been the salad... whole almonds are tough to stab with a fork...not sure where the pickled rind was and a couple sprinkles of cheese. :(

eS-iIDotMJccGRWiP3jd9g.text: First off, as my inaugural YELP review, I would be remiss if i did not throw a shout out to all that blazed the trail before and left me a path.  Thanks to all who have submitted great critiques.   As a recent transplant to Phoenix I have relied heavily on using the recommendations I have found on yelp to try local venues.  I must say I have discovered plenty to appease my wife and my east coast and west coast sensibilities (respectively).    Today I took my family to St. Francis for the first time and it rocked our world.  Despite what other posters have noted, we had really good service from the valet right through lunch.    The food was really, really great.  Perfectly prepared, ample portions. Although a tad noisy the atmosphere was very cool too. The value was off the chart. One of the few times I got my tab after a meal and had to double check because I thought they under-charged me.   One thing that really blew my mind was an amazing kids entree that was free.  Are you kidding me?  My daughter is like the pickiest eater alive and she inhaled her food.  You can't make this stuff up, when we were seated she asked "what's that delicious smell?" and after devouring her food she said it was the best food ever (hurting my feelings a bit as the one who cooks at home).    For my family I think we all agree that this place "speaks to us".   Its nice to know that someone realized just because you have a kid doesn't mean you want to crawl under a rock and that maybe you you still want to enjoy some of the finer things in life with your family.    We will probably Make this our official stomping ground (sorry LGO) and whenever some visits us from out f town it's good to know we have a go to spot to "represent" what we think Phoenix lifestyle is all about.

sysX5XYIcOsyQlyiL0cf2Q.text: Went to St Francis last week for the first time with three of my friends.  The menu is limited.  The cheapest thing is a burger or pizza for twelve dollars.  The burger was terrible, over cooked and lacked flavor.  The pizza was better.  One of my dinner companians had the pork tenderloin. It was very good , a bit spicy but very tender.   The wines are pricey , nothing under eight dollars.   Parking is pretty bad unless you go late at night.  Probably won't be going back anythime soon.

qdAjy-T1Ez3ev0_h2seddg.text: I wonder if I will be banned from heaven if I don't give this place at least 4 stars? Oh well, I'm taking the risk.... Three stars - there you go.   I have been looking forward to trying St. Francis for many months and my experience was anticlimactic. The interior architecture is as uninteresting as the exterior. I'm not sure what saintly images I had conjured up, but I was imagining some sort of religious overtone. Nope.   I was disappointed by lunch. The menu isn't interesting nor diverse. I ordered a onion burger and my friend orders a blah salad.   I hope to try it again for dinner - given all those 4 star reviews. But honestly, after the lunch experience, I'm not in a rush to go back.

2IeLVkGnMhNFT-3NUqaWjQ.text: I ordered the French onion burger cooked medium, and I was first brought out the wrong burger. After sending it back, they brought out the correct burger about 5-10 minutes later. I attempted to cut the burger in half, but found the stale crispy onions and stiff bacon blocking me. Finally took a bite into it and was surprised at how overcooked and dry it was. Like Sahara desert in the middle of summer during a drought dry. We ordered three burgers at the table: 2 medium and 1 medium rare. All 3 were cooked the same - overly well done.  Can't say much about the rest of the menu, but I would not recommend a burger from this spot.

G7w__Uelj8xLmFDgbAYOCg.text: Wow!! I remember this place st Francis when they first opened and it was one of a kind and packed day and night! Here Years later .... barely lit up on the outside , half the lights out with different shades of light. Phone ringing off the hook, bartender ( lovely w/ great eyebrows) clueless and did not know the specials or menu....  patron next to us for warned " be ready this bartender is nice but has never been trained and has no idea...."  They have lost what made them amazing!!! Not sure if it changed hands with owner or management... but they do not have the same level of service or ambiance....  Sucks!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7W82iHTcjiArbP0X6tYBcA.text: If you like the facade of fancy/upscale, this might be your thing. I care more about how great the food is rather than the atmosphere, this place seems to focus more on atmosphere than food.

PpPheYUD2a2pxM9sh9qHfw.text: Great food! Bacon is legit, ! Gabby is a kick ass waitress.. Service is great, get the pancakes and French toast!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pancakes have a crispy outer layer!! Fresh OJ also!!

NO5v022SlmcleOhjidLHWg.text: Worst experience ever food is very plain my husband order the steak which was very dry and over cook it also came  with some kind of burnt potatoes I myself order the the pork loin wich was the same boiled verges soggy asparagus no salt at all I live in the neighbor hood for a long time and remember when st Francis was a nice neighbor hood spot. With good food and atmosphere...To the new owners shut your doors or get people that know what they are doing.

3jmciAtVxhYs5A2t9X7h4Q.text: I'm late to finally eating here but I can't say I would return.  Staff is super friendly and patient and gave us a nice up front seat towards the window.  I had the almond margarita which was a delicious twist on a favorite classic of mine.  We also had the goat cheese which was wonderful and full of flavor.   Unfortunately this is where the food goes south.  I ordered the New York strip medium rare.  It was tough and just a bad cut of steak and the flavor was charcoal like.  Yuck.  The two sides mushroom ragu and kale were just sour.  It was a horrible pairing.  My date had the swordfish which wasn't bad but I could smell it.  If something smells too fishy it makes my nose crinkle.   Maybe there was a hidden reason why it's taken this long for me to get there as it was not that good.  Not sure if I'll be back.

5DO_4eFwScI00R6-7tRUfQ.text: I was excited to visit St. Francis after seeing the great reviews and scores, but I was unfortunately disappointed with both my meal and the service. We were seated at a table that honestly should not exist. It was right in the flow of traffic, so servers were squeezing by each other next to our table the entire visit. I would have rather waited for another table to clear.    We waited way too long for our food...I would guess it was close to an hour. Our server apologized a couple times. At one point, he told us our food was being plated, but it was still another 20 minutes later before we were served. I ordered the Parmesan Shrimp Risotto. The risotto was prepared well, but it had no flavor. I think they may have forgotten the parmesan. There were only four shrimp on the plate, but they were tasty.  Thankfully, my dinner partner enjoyed his flatbread pizza.   After being there so long, I decided against dessert and also against arguing how I was charged two dollars more for my meal than the price on the menu. I see that I was charged correctly according to the price on the website, but I must have been given an old version of the menu when I was at the restaurant.  Sadly, I will likely not return to St. Francis.

jDljZe5zlpZ1fa-N7r63sQ.text: This place is VERY pricey and I'm really not sure why.  Food quality is exactly on par with other local restaurants, so I'm not sure why they feel the need to charge $10 more a plate than say, Windsor or Federal Pizza.  If you're in to eating super clean or vegan, this is the place for you. Although, id rather go to Tru Foods if I'm trying to eat clean and vegan.  I just felt like their menu was very basic and lacked variety. There's nothing on their menu that is substantial while also costing less than $13. You can get like, 3 asparagus spears for like $9 though, if that's your thing.

fqO15dIVVptIVH3TmcbwPA.text: Poor service, overworked staff.... nobody came to our table for refills etc   Please don't come here ever

N0CyImfB5NdJSRbq1BELhQ.text: Very happy with our meals tonight. I was very hesitant since seeing many negative reviews but was very pleased. I can tell management has changed because the lights are brighter and there wasn't music playing. Not very many people eating there tonight. Overall, pretty satisfied, just wasn't the best environment.

dwQMkLNxZiDLlabG6IdG_w.text: I came here with a friend for the first time after passing by this restaurant so many times on camelback and seeing how nice it looked. It has a beautiful outdoor patio and bar with a great relaxed but classy ambience. We came around 4:30 for happy hour and there was open seating at the outdoor bar. I was very impressed by the design of st. Francis! We tried 3/4 cocktails on happy hour: Santa Rosa, almond margarita, cucumber cooler which were $5 each. The Santa Rosa was delicious and was a fruity summer drink. The almond margarita did not taste as "almond-y" as expected, but had a hint of almond aftertaste. The cucumber cooler was a super refreshing outdoor drink! We had other plans for dinner, but I definitely want to come back for a dinner date here!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Almond margarita (L) and Santa Rosa (R)

S_Y6meMf8RLUTIMj-8pf_g.text: I was so disappointed!  I heard great things about this place so I tried it out with new clients. Ugh! And they paid. Shared a "pig dip" - clever take on a pork au jus.  Minimal meat, almost no onions as described, almost no cheese as described.  The top bun was two inches thick and the bottom bun almost the same. Had to dip it in the lack luster au jus to get it down. Fries were lukewarm. The other person's salad must not have been too great because most of it went uneaten. Bartender was average if not disinterested. I felt so embarrassed for choosing this spot.   Great atmosphere. I feel mean for writing this review but I'm so embarrassed that you need to know.

aPA6Nyb2FO8n9OeUWvW-QA.text: For the last several weeks, my girlfriend and I kept continuously debating on whether or not our first trip to St. Francis should be for dinner or brunch. The restaurant itself has been on our go-to list for quite some time now. As eager as I was to try their acclaimed skillet pancake, we reluctantly agreed to try them for dinner.  The setup of this restaurant is kind of what I expected. Small, hip, and lively to the point where some might find it to be frustratingly too loud to have an actual conversation. The food they specialize in is what's common in most modern-American restaurants, with the usual influences of Mexican, Italian, and Southern all being very apparent.  We made a reservation on a busy Saturday night and requested a booth, but were stuck with a table. Oh well. Servers were all very friendly and polite throughout the evening. Understandably slow, but that's not really the issue. The problem I have is that the food, although all looking and sounding great on paper, just doesn't really execute as well as we had hoped.  We started with the baked goat cheese, which comes with a variety of bread. The cheese itself was fine, but when combined with the tomato sauce, it comes off more like a soupy pasta sauce that is too runny to comfortably spread onto the bread. In the end, it's easier to eat by the spoonful, which I'm pretty sure was not their original intention. Additionally, we ordered their crispy fingerling potatoes. The flavor was decent, but strangely enough, only some of them were actually what I would classify as "crispy." They might have been undercooked for all I know.   For entrees, I opted for the pork chili verde. I added the egg(s) for a three dollar up-charge and was asked if I wanted the avocado addition as well. I agreed, only to see that it was an additional two dollar up-charge. This would be fine, except for the fact that you're provided with two tiny slices that probably don't even make up a quarter's worth of an actual avocado. It was okay for a few bites but got dull very quickly. It was also more on the soupy side.  My girlfriend had the Moroccan meatballs. Honestly, we've had some pretty decent meatballs recently, but these definitely weren't in their realm. These were very dry, almost as if they were over-baked. This would be forgivable and still edible if it weren't for their strange sauce that uses some kind of nutmeg-ish spice. Sadly, this overpowers any balance and makes for a very distracting taste that hits you almost immediately.  Our bill was handed to us without inquiring about dessert, but thankfully, the server realized the mistake before it was too late. We ordered the buttercake. We're both huge fans of well-made buttercake, but this wasn't quite what we had hoped for. We appreciated the additions of the gelato and prickly pear caramel, but the cake itself was very dry and hard. The locally-made honeycomb on top was excellent to the point that we would have been better off just ordering a bunch of it and calling it a night.  We loaded our leftovers into plastic containers, which probably isn't the most ideal way to transport runny meatballs and chili verde. But at this point, I didn't really care, despite the leakage that inevitably occurred.  Honestly, St. Francis is a place that I really wanted to like. They're using all of the right ingredients from all of the right sources. But if you can't execute the food you're preparing on par with the prices you're asking, then I can't bring myself to give it anymore than a solid two stars.  In the end, we probably would have been better off visiting them during brunch hours.

81uJJrNavwnd7NCv1zzfnQ.text: We walked in and were immediately stood up by the host/hostess because they never showed, so we decided to take up a spot at the bar. A grumpy hello from the bartender and we were set with our menus. Then that was it...about 10 minutes later we realized he was never coming back, even though he was mere feet away, bartender man was never going to care whether or not we wanted Anything. Even after 15 minutes of not even a glass of water, and having to sit in front of the previous customers' leftover plates and glasses(yes, they sat there the entire time.) AND THEN we finally gave up and got up to leave, all the while, in the tiny bar space he had bartender still didn't even try to salvage ANYTHING. He really was Never going to help us.   The one thing I've always told people about St. Francis? The food is fantastic, but the service leaves very little to be desired. At this rate? F*ck the food, you deserve good service for what you pay. As someone who has worked years in the industry I know what I want as a customer and it is painfully obvious the management SUCKS, otherwise their employees would be happy to give excellent service equal to their food.   If you choose to take the risk even after this review, I bid you good luck and at any rate, don't sit at the bar.

NczXi8PdzwMemV4CvaX-GA.text: The food dishes that were famed and that I loved are gone. So is my business. Sad to see the "changes" to this staple of uptown Phoenix. So long St Francis. The new ownership's poor grammar and lengthy defensive responses to honest reviews just go to show what a mess this place now is. When people tell you what is really going on and you defend the disaster this place has become under your watch you need to open your eyes. The so called "new chef based menu" from a former chef of a low cost low performing restaurant down the street is junk, it's not what people have known to love and enjoy from the past 9 years of St Francis. Quality and local ingredients are an extinct breed of the former glory this gem once held to Phoenicians. The new general manager is absolutely a disgrace to the establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fbpcdHLw-abfj0-bDsStvg.text: Have been wanting to check this place out for a LONG time, especially since it was on DDD!! We had excellent service and the food was REALLY good! We had the baked goat cheese, pork Chile verde, and the pig dip. They were all DELICIOUS! And the pepper in the Chile verde was HOT, which I like! They have a great happy hour menu and a super diverse dinner menu so there's something for everyone. Based on the service alone, we will definitely be back! Add the quality of the food and I think we'll be regulars from now on!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Chile verde. Delicious and that pepper was HOT!!!
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour drinks and a pig dip
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baked goat cheese and the pig dip with fries...YUM!!

rqlnTA9V2Lm7aoVwe199KQ.text: Went here because a coworker recommended it.  Man, was he right about this place!  It was a great experience overall, especially if you're not looking for a typical/average restaurant.  Two words...cauliflower steak.  You need this in your life.  It's flash fried and covered in yummy goodness.  In case you don't know what yummy goodness includes, it has golden raisins, capers, sun dried tomatoes, etc.  I could have made a meal out of this (shared it as an appetizer this visit) and then might have been able to have room for dessert.  For my entree I had the shrimp risotto.  Lots of great flavors, but I wish there were more than 4 shrimp.  Lots of risotto, too little toppings...in addition to a couple more shrimp, it could have used more spinach and olive tapenade.  Good flavors though.  Our server was great.  Very friendly and efficient.  She was able to describe how the cauliflower steak was prepared perfectly.  Not sure why they have valet only parking.  My car was parked right next to the valet stand, so I found it a bit ridiculous that they needed to park my car and pull it out.  It's free valet, but then there's the tip.  I will definitely be back here!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp risotto
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cauliflower steak - a must do!

ccjBJxjwbRiTQqanbn7dCg.text: They have very good food. The hanger steak is fantastic; I'm honestly not sure I've had a better cooked steak. They also made it a True "medium" rather than overcooking the heck out of it. However, note that this is not a good restaurant for vegetarians. They have a few dishes, like salads and forbidden rice, but they are not nearly as good. The forbidden rice was honestly pretty flavorless.  My big complaint is the seating. They don't have a lot of space, so they pack different pairs of people right next to each other. Given how expensive it is, my wife and I won't go there for a nice dinner, because it won't be nice when we're sitting two-and-a-half feet away from another couple. But if you have a big group, and no vegetarians, it's definitely 5 stars.

5QSvUhlBixEGX_3GTp82Rw.text: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING! I took my boyfriend here for his birthday dinner, we had been talking about going because it LOOKS really nice from the outside. Unfortunately the building is the only positive thing about this restaurant.  The service was unorganized, scatter-brained and aloof. We ordered burrata as an appetizer and they gave us cottage cheese. Our main courses were bland despite the high price tag. They definitely prepped our shrimp the same even though we had very different dishes.  Please don't make the same mistake I did.

P-NWB2aWnsoDpaa5Aoinww.text: I couldn't wait to eat here. I had saved the info on this restaurant for a year or two in my phone as a place to try as i had read somewhere how good it was. I had the burger that was supposed to be onion soup mix or whatever. It was so disappointing! it needed spices so badly! It was literally flavorless, and the bread simply fell apart. I asked for mustard to try to salvage it, but that didnt help. The fries were just ok, most being soggy. My husband liked his pork dip sandwich. I wont be back. It was one of the worst burgers in my life. The service was extremely slow for so few people being in the restaurant. The patio seemed like it need a good washing.

VcHWRJrRk2y1XUbSKHjfcA.text: I adore this place. Quiet, even when slammed, cozy even in summer and the food is simple but perfect! The wine list is nice, not great but so many good value wines. The service has even stepped up since last I was there to make it even more a must go to place. A simple pleasure I return to again and again! Have eaten the entire menu, pick what you like and it will be perfect!

2uMLfo2QshlRSnCtc0AxTw.text: It just doesn't get any better than this. We were privileged to be here when it was filmed for Diners, Drive-ins and Dives several years ago. It has become our celebration dinner place in Phoenix. The perfect filet, fabulous drinks, impeccable service from Barry. Always a magical evening! Can't wait to be back there in October to celebrate my birthday!

BRfNFZH0BtLJoRzRn-ehOw.text: A perfect example of a well executed local restaurant. I have been here nearly half a dozen times in various party sizes and the food or service has never disappointed me. Moroccan Meatballs, mushroom omelette, baked tomato eggs, etc...you can't go wrong with any of the choices here. The crusty bread is phenomenal and available for purchase at the bargain price of $4 a loaf.  If you come on a weekend, park at the bank next door to avoid the valet.  Wonderful atmosphere, welcoming for kids and groups. There is no bad seat in this wonderfully unique restaurant, however, try to score a table on the patio if the weather is nice.

HQGEmnl4poKIlJLx8nJsKQ.text: Been here a few times and have always had a consistent experience - friendly staff and good food. There was always an issue with space..I wish there was more room and was more accommodating for larger groups.  I'd definitely enjoy coming back if something were planned around it, but wouldn't go out of my way go back.

mBG5Nx1LZNjsAZm5mgmL5Q.text: I was really disappointed. We were very excited to try this place out,but we're disappointed in the end. Our waiter was nice...but very slow. We ordered the baked goat cheese,which was delicious, as a starter.  We then ordered the cauliflower baked flatbread and the roasted chicken dish...both were recommended by the waiter. The flatbread was delicious, but the chicken was way undercooked...it looked beautiful...but as soon as we cut into it...red juices everywhere. It was nearly 10min before the waiter came to check on us...he took the chicken back....it was at least another 20min before i simply told the waiter to forget about the chicken.  He was nice enough to take it off our bill, but no offer for another dish or anything.  It will be some time before we try this place again.

E6qiNHnoaK1cx9kdlqYGsQ.text: I came to this restaurant last night with my girlfriend. We were seated right away, and the service was great. To top off my great experience, the filet was absolutely amazing and we can't wait to come back just for that! I would definitely recommend to anyone!

gw3rKzfamoZn11G9U69WJw.text: From beginning to end, this place was a disaster. I can't believe a place with such a good reputation let me down so badly.   I had this place bookmarked for years so I suggested it as a meetup for my friends who live in north Phoenix. We ordered off the restaurant week menu which is actually not a good deal when you price out each individual component. About 20 minutes later, the hostess came up to tell us they were out of the okra app. If we had known how long our wait was going to be, I think we would have left at this point.  Thankfully, our company was wonderful because we didn't notice our appetizers hadn't come out after an hour had gone by. We finally had to flag down our waiter (who never checked up on us during that first hour) to ask about food for the 7 year old in our party. Most places know it's important to bring out the kids' food ASAP. Twenty minutes after that, our waiter came by to say he messed up on putting in our ticket so everything would come out at once.  A few of our appetizers came out, but mine never made it to the table. My husband said his ceviche was oddly sweet so he didn't eat much of it despite being very hungry at this point. He didn't like the pork belly posole either because the meat was pretty blah. I got the forbidden rice bowl which was ok, but it could have used a lot more veggies. My friend barely touched hers.  Dessert still took a long time to come out, and I was at my breaking point. I told the waiter to not bother and just get us the check. He brought out the desserts anyways. We call got the toffee pudding which was very dry. The gelato was the only redeeming factor.  When we got the bill, a bottle of wine that I first asked for but switched to another was still on the bill. My restaurant week meal was taken off, but I was still charged for my entree. Considering how bad our service was, I think they could have done better for us.  Between all of that plus only one functioning restroom and the valet bringing up our car to another couple, I will never come back to this place.

-tGhtOBM-dxzAtzQdFWC0g.text: We walked out before ordering anything and waited well over 15 minutes for even our server to come by.  Too many loud children (I guess they eat free).  Not our thing.  I've heard the food is fantastic, though I'll never know for certain.

twFPDgIDM1LeSiVPhc9CHQ.text: We were lured into trying this place and, from start to finish, it was awful. Slow service, a gin and tonic that took 30 minutes to prepare. The beet salad was drowning in blue cheese. The gnocchi was served cold with hot vegetables and a strand of someone's hair (not mine). Our simple meal of a couple apps, some salads and entrees took three hours to complete. I left disappointed ... only to be faced with a valet who opted to peel out as he delivered my vehicle back to me. Not impressed, from start to finish. Hopefully they can get organized and improve service sooner than later.

Ty-Wg2cEboDgwEqvUb_hAA.text: I've been here a few times now for both brunch and dinner. All three times were completely different experiences.   Brunch is delicious. The music is in point. Only place I'll actually order a Bloody Mary.   Dinner was slow. Super slow. I've never spent so much time at a restaurant, unwillingly. From getting said our first hello to bringing the check.   Tried to arrange a birthday brunch here as well and it was a huge hassle.   Long story short- stick with brunch surrounded by a few amount of people. Don't forget the Bloody Mary.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tomato Baked Eggs. Tasty!

iMnR9BGdMj-MUR9TRuhpdQ.text: Everytime I come here I forget how expensive it is and the fact that is is a little overpriced for what you are getting.... I came here for a late brunch on a Saturday. I was seated right away, other than food coming out slow I have never had an issue with the service here. I just forgot that they have a salad that contains romaine lettuce, endive (isn't that just bitter lettuce?), apples, bacon and dressing for $12. Sorry but bacon bits with 2 other ingredients, does not a $12 salad make. If you want to add chicken, shrimp or salmon? $6, $7, $12.   I really wanted salmon but I just settled for an egg sandwich for $13, the principle of spending $24 on salmon for lunch was too heavy.  The egg sandwich had red peppers, avacado, bacon and a special yum sauce. It was tasty and cooked how I ordered it. One gripe was they did not peel the red peppers so the skin made it very chewy and kinda ruined the bite of the sandwich. If I roast and peel my own red peppers at home, I expect it to be done for a $13 sandwich. More to my point the sandwich was good, but nothing spectacular or original. I've had a better one at First Watch for $9. The food here is ok but definitely not upscale and nothing to wow about. As I was eating, an older gentleman eating nearby complained about his food, said he didn't like it. The waitress handled it well, but from what I gather on thier conversation, (tables are really close) he was especially unhappy about his expectation from what he was paying for vs what he got. I get it's expensive to do the fresh local thing  but food needs to be better, maybe they just need a menu update or put more creativity into it. Bottom line they need to step up the food or lower the price. Prices are upscale food is not.

Qyx7C9om70Nao_HaXwtiZA.text: A group of us came over to St. Francis after a graduation for brunch and have to say it was pretty awesome. You can defiantly see that they take pride in their food and also use high quality foods. Everything seemed fresh, beer selection was small but solid, mixed drinks were very  good especially the cucumber cooler. Burgers here were perfectly cooked to you liking and fries were homemade and excellent. I had the full pig which was enough for 2 but very good. Overall a great brunch spot.

i3e8nVu705w8dCl-pUgh-g.text: Very poor service. Out of 4 items in the menu, only the burger and potatoes were worth overlooking the bad experience. The staff spent more time talking and folding napkins than attending to the customers. SKIP the pork verde chili unless you want soup stock covered in mozzarella cheese.

mP3oCpF3Vapyv_r_N6HS7A.text: It's hard to believe that I haven't written a review of St. Francis, given how often I come here. I love everything about St. Francis as well as its hipster sister: Phoenix Public Market Cafe.   Breakfast: I love choosing one of the special's, or the Chorizo Scramble. Bloody Mary's are always a must, as is the Biscuit's and gravy with Schreiner's sweet Italian sausage.   Lunch/Dinner: Seasonally, I love the pumpkin soup, and the "pig dip". Like a French dip, but all pork, and delicious. Typically it comes with prosciutto, Pork, Bacon - on a fresh made baguette.   Decor- When the weather is nice, the bar opens up- and its quite pleasant during the non-summer months.

SbpmekUlSPTmoY2TsLSRlQ.text: This was a great place to go and worth the 50 minute drive to eat there! We didn't have to wait to get sat which is always a plus. We got the skillet pancake which was to die for and you can really taste the quality ingredients in it! We also got the mushroom omelet (without cheese due to we are watching our fats) and it was good, even without the cheese. The wait for the pancake was a little long, but they explained that there was a little hiccup in the kitchen but gave us a freebie plate of some bread snacks which was great since we were hungry! If you are in the area for breakfast we recommend! We didn't get a chance to look at the dinner/lunch menu.

q_LMjed35UIRpMWTIwF8-w.text: Oh, St Francis how I love you. I love early happy hours sitting on the patio sipping on a house-made sangria. They have a nice selection of local beers and specialty drinks are only $5 during happy hour. If you are an architecture enthusiast, the interior of St Francis is amazing. They did a beautiful job of refurbishing this old brick walled building to its modern look today. Anywhere from the crisscross suspension cables to the paintings hanging on the wall that give it an art museum feel. St Francis is an urban neighborhood staple that sits right across from the foodie destination Uptown Plaza and the nearby Upward Projects restaurants down the street. They serve up fresh American wood-fired cuisine with an emphasis on simple flavors. I have yet to try their popular pig dip sandwich but the pork green chile with egg is to die for. I hear the bread is amazing too and has won some awards. The Sticky Toffee Pudding is a must try. St Francis has a great brunch menu on the weekends and I just recently had their iron skillet pancake. It's a nice throwback to my youth of cooking pancakes in a skillet during camping trips. The apples they use for the topping is caramelized in their wood fired oven and really adds to the flavors of this wonderful dish. St Francis is one of my favorite food destinations in the Valley and has been a wonderful addition to the Arizona food scene. Kids under 12 eat free during brunch. The Cafe at downtown Phoenix Public Market is a sister restaurant to St Francis.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Chile Verde with Egg
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baked Goat Cheese
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spiced Bourbon Milk Punch

u-LLM_jqruZI7GB94-11Uw.text: Had happy hour here which is highly recommended, glasses of wine were poured in a good portion and the food selection has a new American/ southwest cuisine. I had the veggie bowl and the veggies were cooked in a light tomato broth with a small bed of purple rice. Portion was not as big as I had hoped so would recommended adding a bit more to this item.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xNFeRSjqHgpAj7JamOW_UA.text: We have been eating at St. Francis for years, its was one of our fave restaurants. We came in sometime months back and noticed some of the menu had changed, I thought it was a seasonal change, the salad was terrible, I couldn't even eat it all, but we figured it was just a summer menu change. So we went in last week after many months of not visiting. The parking lot was always full on wknd eves, this time it wasn't. My order wasn't right, then sent back, then came back undercooked, the salad I got this time wasn't very good either and by that point I didn't want to order anything else. We were wondering what has happened, until I came on yelp and read reviews, had no idea they changed management, the food isn't the same at all. We had some fave dishes we always came here for, but they don't exsist anymore or are prepared differently. We wont be coming back as we were very disappointed and the price for the meal was way to expensive compared to what we were served, the quality and taste that was once the St. Francis we loved is gone. :(

CuSvlNQcIEqsmjGs4UA6MQ.text: We arrived between 10 and 11 on a Sunday morning. I'm not sure if this is a regular occurrence, but there was complimentary valet. We were seated fairly quickly and ordered drinks. The Bloody Mary was delicious, and you can't go wrong with a mimosa. We both ordered the eggs Benedict with salmon and shared a pancake. The food was served hot and tasted delicious and we left extremely satisfied. The pancake is thiiiick, you will definitely need to share! The tab was a bit high and I can't totally justify paying it, there are a handful of places you can go for the same food and pay less, however I'll be back to explore different options on the menu!

fYDkBsPEAWffn9_XYXJ_og.text: So yummy!  We went for dinner and had the roasted beets, stracciatella, calamari, arugula & strawberries salad, the swordfish, and peach pudding for dessert.  Everything was delicious, fresh, and beautifully presented.  I left feeling so full and satisfied, which rarely happens.  We were there early on a Monday night, so it was slow, but the service was great.  I love the ambiance in the restaurant and I can't wait to go back to try their brunch!

rIVjBYXemwi4jvLv3_Bk3Q.text: The ambiance is nice but I found the dishes unbalanced. My friends and I shared the Moroccan Meatballs, Shrimp Risotto, and the Salmon main course. There were flaws with each dish. I was left wanting more.

Vxu_qqMhxlUZWwClEqNQTA.text: I love this new restaurant in Phoenix, which is a land that has been overrun by the chains! Therefore, go go go and keep this place open!  All of the food is good, though I do think their bar is lacking.  They need better vodka!  Get some higher end stuff like Boyd & Blair please!    I've been here a few times and have always had a good experience.  MAKE SURE YOU CHECK OUT THE RESTROOM WITH THE SAFE!! Too cool!!

w07_7MRFFnDEsjogxoHQiw.text: I really would love to give this restaurant more stars but the service is terribly slow. The Big Hamburgers are DELICIOUS, the hangar steak, pig dip, and morrocan meatballs were yummy. The fingerling potatoes and baked goat cheese were amazing!! However, 3 of our 8 meals came out about 15 minutes before everything else - and being polite, they sat and waited until all of our meals arrived, so their's were nice and luke warm but the time they ate. We literally waited 45 minutes before we had a chance to ask for the bill and it took having another staff member's help to do it. In the end, I finally had to bring our credit card up to the register so we could pay and leave. The 20% gratuity was added into the bill because we were a party of 8. **edited the day after: We were so eager to get out of there that we were literally willing to pay anything just to be able to leave and didn't realize that the sangria, the 2 baguettes, the baked goat cheese, the fingerling potatoes, which we ordered as soon as we could - we got there at 5:40 - weren't put into the system until after 6pm and therefore didn't receive happy hour pricing. Bummer.

3Gbf3BvgOAY3G8NWm6jo7Q.text: First off, we visited three times during 2015.  Each visit got progressively worse and we haven't returned since...  THE VISIT We live within walking distance and had never given this place a try.  Swing by one Sunday morning and its nice enough to sit outside. Our waiter is fantastic and welcomes us warmly.  He gives us a tour through the menu and his drink recommendations are on point.  We order brunch and my Eggs Benedict are truly remarkable.  I actually eat slowly just to savor each bite.  We also had a bread board that was phenomenal.  We leave with smiles on our faces, vowing to return very soon.  Score: 5/5  THE VISIT (The Sequel) It's Mother's Day!  We had such a wonderful first experience at St Francis that we want to share it with others.  We invite our Mom (and all my siblings and their kids) to brunch.  We are seated at the window booth near the entrance and have bread boards to go around.  Everyone loves their orders, including my picky mother.  However, my husband and I notice items that are over-cooked, under-cooked and dried out (breaks, ham, etc).  In addition, we really had to work to keep the attention of our server when she was needed.  Score 3/5    THE VISIT (The Finale) We bring our young daughters with us to grab a late lunch\early dinner.  It takes quite awhile to be acknowledged after we enter, even though the place is NOT busy.  Once greeted, we are still made to wait nearly 10 minutes before being seated.  Again...the VAST majority of tables are empty.  Our waitress spends a great deal of time chatting with different co-workers before taking our order.  She did not check back on us until flagged, even though our food was taking quite awhile AND we had asked that the children's food be sent out first.  They never got this message and it all came out at the same time.  Unfortunately, the girls got the wrong order (how do you mess up pancakes...?) and my pork chili was COOL....like, not hot...or warm...but ewww...borderline cold.  When I ask for a manager I am given the excuse that they are switching things out in the kitchen to ready for dinner service.  Not sure why that is an proper excuse for cold-ish food, incorrect orders, inattentive servers, etc.  We end up leaving with unhappy children and finished with our patronage at this restaurant.  Score  2/5  There are SO many fantastic restaurants in Uptown...no need to waste time and money at places that are so-so at best.  Unfortunately, for us, this place is not worth the effort.

cIeoO4aU91XSlC0WuSR-1g.text: Been to St. Francis a few times and will definitely return. This last time was okay. They sat us upstairs and the vibe was blah. They could have sat us downstairs where all the action was. I forget if they asked us where we wanted to be. They could have given us the option.

0pJoh6IFEVENaA2LWtb3oA.text: Happy hour drink prices = AMAZING  Dinner was delicious. Had the baked goat cheese. This was SO good. How can you go wrong with goat cheese though....  Also ate the pork chile verde which was very good and truly the cornbread was some of the best I have had at a restaurant. Usually it is too dry or dense...this bread was light, fluffy, perfectly sweet/salty. My friend had the cauliflower soup and salad. Extremely tasty and satisfying and despite being so full from dinner, we had the cheesecake in a jar to top things off.   Atmosphere is definitely hipster and the building is just tucked away in the most random area in downtown Phoenix. Loved the decor and loved the openness of it all. I didn't necessarily like how loud it was inside. I don't think they can help that though.   Try it out!

m57eUOP3lXlJ3NZWPIGYvw.text: Great service, very kid friendly and the food was pretty good!  It was loud but that's good with kiddos :)

p_dtF6grWI7RAkoFwsWZNw.text: Came back here for what I heard was a good Sunday brunch.  Brought my girlfriend and another friend.  I was told the skillet pancake was good and it was.  Drenched with berries and whipped cream and the cake itself was soft, but dense.  That said, not enough food for me by itself.  My friend ordered the American breakfast and gave it average reviews (the bacon was a little flimsy).  I'm not a coffee drinker so I can't attest to this one way or the other, but my girlfriend and friend both HATED the coffee.  They had a live jazz band which was cool, though I had to shout across the table for my friend to hear me.  The ambience of the place is still pretty cool, but the food still doesn't match the hype in my opinion.

Itt1MlYNgizu7fw8WF3Jlg.text: Very nice place, good vibe.  Food was very good.  Salmon was excellent, chili verde was very good, Pig Dip sandwich was very good (and a big portion); fingerling potato (Small Bites) was not so small, but very good as was the baked goat cheese appetizer.  Salads were very good.  We'll definitely go back to try some of the other dishes.  Service was a bit slow and it was not that crowded, not sure what was going on, but noticeable wait time for drinks between courses and the longest wait was for our check.  All in all a really nice experience.

z71TIdzE4777PMltZrLk-A.text: Just wonderful!  The staff is so friendly and so accommodating!  The food is outstanding and consistently so. My friends and I came in tonight as we all love St. Francis and The Phoenix Market Cafe as well and eat at both places frequently. Make sure you take home a loaf of bread - you will not be disappointed!   Thank you.  Oh and Eleanor had a great birthday dinner!

MiZ1l9OJwzv-NJ0a4CwA-Q.text: Cool build put in former bank. Great food, location & patio. If not been should be on your list.

gj1VuTsuYiUMDELhrOCmRw.text: I only got an order to go but I liked the atmosphere and everyone was friendly. I got the Moroccan meatballs and they were horrible, but that could be just me. I've really liked other dishes I got there.

ml2YnTUa6KAnKNehdiXGQw.text: One of the best lunches I've had in Phoenix.  I'm still thinking about the fried egg sandwich and fries. A fried egg- yolk just barely runny. Barely. Two thick-ass slabs of good-ass, smoky-ass bacon. Arugula and aioli on a really tasty ass bun. Damn, son. Good as hell. The french fries were so damn good, too, and you have to dip those in the remoulade to really enjoy them all the way.   I would come back for this sammich every day if I lived next door. Don't be afraid of it being called a fried egg sammich, because it's a whole nother level.

66Lv0fRa1RQg68NIgP_7jA.text: Great breakfast burritos and various fishes.  Enjoy a Mimosa or a Bloody with your eggs...

N4rNCIR-xeORNOmHDITIyQ.text: I'm still a fan even though, my last meal really missed the mark. My friend took me here yesterday for an early birthday dinner and as usual the service was great. We had some delicious cocktails, the fingerling potatoes were amazing as always and dessert (sticky toffee pudding) is always a winner. We each ordered a different flat bread pizza and split them. She ordered the salmon which was amazing, I ordered the Mama's Meatzza which consists of prosciutto, sausage, bacon and, in my opinion the mistake, meatballs. I saw this on the menu and it sounded great, but what they fail to mention on the menu that its the same meatballs they use in their meatball entree - which uses Moroccan spices. Had I known that, I wouldn't have ordered it. I don't like thatflavoring on meats, especially when I don't expect it. It didn't go, it over powered everything else. I wouldn't order it again. I should have sent it back. If this was my first experience here, I would have given it 1 or 2 stars. Because I have been here many times, I would only take off one star, but I took off two for failing to mention the Moroccan spices on the menu description.

HTatKK-zigphVFk5X8YGZQ.text: Really fun place for happy hour with a good number of food and drink options at reasonable prices.  Cheap tap and bottled beer, mixed drinks (very good), and 1/2 off wine glasses. The happy hour portions are tasty and large enough to leave you full.  Service was so-so but not bad enough to prevent a return visit. Nice staff but took a while to get our orders and bring back drinks and checks.  We came on a Friday evening and there was quite a wait as we left, so plan accordingly. There's free valet with the obligatory tip.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lKOxpegjWtDI6hnvR1wTIA.text: Great food, awesome atmosphere.  Love this place.  The salmon superfood is to to die for as well as the squash with goat cheese, a must have.

ETp0tGKzABno5J8LOpcAuQ.text: Like the atmosphere of this place. Only had a drink after work so I can't comment on the quality of the food. The menu looked interesting enough that I'd come back and our bartender was cool to chat with.  Daniel H., you should check it out.

OjWQG8XGpQNbKcd9zynXYA.text: This is a must go to. Glad I saw diner dives and drives

lodaNl0RyV3Dbgz03hRzCw.text: Ok so update, although I had a bad experience, the mangers have reached out to apologize and offer to buy dinner for me and my guest which is nice to see.   They are obviously working at it so good for them.

x6wAKgOdnMrgGOblt5tPAQ.text: I loved this spot! I didn't realize that it had been there for about a year, found it in the New Times.  The wait time wasn't too bad (20-30 minutes, but the bar is a great spot to wait! Very good selection of beer (several that you do not normally see on drink / beer lists). Service was great! Our server had great suggestions, and we are so glad we listened to him. Dessert was very good, too! Atmosphere was wonderful (went in October, so it was perfect to sit outdoors). I definitely suggest this place to anyone, and look forward to hopefully going again, soon!

oz0pSbXPw9KMYyIvasHT_Q.text: The best Chile Verde I've ever had! Very kid friendly (kids under 10 eat for free). We got multiple plates to share and try different flavors. Iron Skillet Pancake, Roasted Fingerling Potatoes, Meat Flatbread, Fresh Baked Baguette with jam and butter, and of course the Pork Chile Verde.  Go, eat, enjoy.

wHL5Xhh5cn-sNyhBpbPXpQ.text: I had been wanting to try St. Francis for quite some time now. My boyfriend took me out for date night here. Let me start off by saying, if you're going on a Friday night-MAKE RESERVATIONS. We ended up waiting 45 minutes..thankfully we had cocktails and an old black & white movie to keep us occupied in the outdoor "waiting" area..is that what it's supposed to be? I couldn't tell if you were allowed to order food from there or not.   The ambiance is upscale and trendy, with low lighting & a modern, chic interior-which I find to be typical of restaurants that are considered "American New".  I quite liked the design of this place.  Finally, after what felt like FOR-EV-ER, we were seated (really I was just hungry & being impatient so any amount of time felt like an eternity). We ordered the housemade baguette with olive oil & waters to start with. I realize that this place was busy but it seemed like it took quite a while to get said items. In fact, we got our bread and water at the same time the table next to us did, and they were seated who knows how long before we were. I felt a small pang of empathy, which was silenced by devouring of bread. My boyfriend and I both ordered the same thing under the Specialties-The Forbidden Rice bowl. Considering how much we love Forbidden Rice, our expectations were quite high. We again waited quite a while for our food to arrive. The food itself is 5 stars-the vegetables were so delicious and the rice was cooked to perfection. The dressing is to die for-a great combination of sweet and spicy.  Overall, my experience was "good" but not great. The slowness of service is what gives it a 3 star rating. I didn't expect to be at St. Francis for over 2 hours. I would return again, perhaps for brunch..or for dinner-but make reservations beforehand!

chFuEjBxrfX2HrCnswAvsA.text: worth it just for the breakfast sandwich, one of the best i have had. other items are good, prices arent bad; but that breakfast sandwich is just perfect

voOaEy7MwjtnW90tZ7ig2Q.text: A nice trendy place to eat the sources everything local and fresh. If your looking for intimacy this is not the place as your conversation will be heard with the table next to you. It was very cramped with small portions for the money, but worth a try if you want something different.

frm2Tmv5YDj-bDxNyCP-XQ.text: We started at the bar while briefly waiting for our table and ordered the St. Francis Meyer lemonades on the bartender's recommendation; what a perfect combo: honey infused vodka with sparkling lemonade.   Based on the Yelp recommendations, we ordered the Baked Goat Cheese appetizer which was right on. Great dish.   My boyfriend ordered the Prime Hanger Steak. I tried a couple bites and it had very good flavor. He said he really enjoyed it. I ordered the Forbidden Rice... WOW! What a delectable dish of great veggies and the black rice... what great flavors. When I offered Matt a few bites, I almost had to pry the plate back out of his hands.   For dessert we shared the Chocolate Cake with caramel sauce and peanut butter gelato. Very good!   All of the portions were just right. We were able to sample a delicious variety of flavors and enjoyed everything we ordered. Nice atmosphere with an outdoor patio. The hostess, bartender, and waitress were awesome too.   We'll be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Forbidden Rice - Beautiful and delish dish!

AJjhKDD2DlTlMYJWJjcf7A.text: I finally went to St. Francis.  My mom and I got there right at 5 (old person's dinner time) and got seated on the lovely patio.  We shared the "Romaine" salad appetizer - and I wish I had gotten my own!  It was very good and fresh!  Then we shared the pot roast and the sweet corn polenta on the side.  I am glad we shared that because it was quite a generous portion :-)  Very tender pot roast, a ridiculously yummy glaze and perfect carrots and broccolini.  I didn't love the polenta, but I may have just been full of pot roast.    I will happily go back :-)

P-i_RY-OSuC4xuB8Ws7ZgA.text: I'm torn between three stars and four stars for St. Francis, but I'm giving four stars for the coolness factor. This was a service station that's been converted to a cool eatery with an AWESOME patio and an indoor/outdoor bar, which I LOVE. I like sitting in the upstairs dinning area because it's a little more quiet. It reminds me of one of my favorite restaurants in Paris.  My favorite dish is the Prime Hanger Steak but the food is where I waiver on giving four stars. Presentation seems to supersede preparation so that your meals looks better than it actually tastes. That is not too say that the food here is bad because fresh quality ingredients are used and there are some very creative entrees on the menu so the food is far from bad.  I guess I just feel that compared to what's been done to create an awesome atmosphere for dining and drinking, the taste of the food falls a little short.
