VYgGeCLzejZwts8NEOqraQ.text: I had the eggs Benedict with salmon and I loved it. The herb cream cheese topped it all off. Very cute and swanky. Excellent.

0KYZ5lxhlJR1AXwkIhixXw.text: Very disappointed in the food and service at St. Francis. We went to "happy hour" on a Tuesday afternoon during the week. The restaurant was not busy but the service was slow and food was not good quality. The baked goat cheese appetizer was accompanied by stale bread (all 3 varieties). The pork chili had great flavor but the meat was over cooked and the kale & apple salad they tried to serve us had old greens. The salad had no flavor and the greens were so old they weren't green, but rather turning yellow. I would have been embarrassed to serve the salad at my home to a guest. We sent the salad back. We may try it again for brunch but otherwise, not impressed.

hN4-vg4iGnJpkdO9KJMmiA.text: This was a lil slice of heaven and I use lil metaphorically.  There was nothing small about the pig dip.  I destroyed that amazing slice of heaven.    All the flavors hold their own but at the same time have their on individuality on your taste buds.  It's as close to eating at home without being at home.   AZ food game should be grateful to St. Francis for crushing it.  It's super chill and airy place, you almost forget your are in AZ. Whauut? I'm from So Cal so hate all you want but I digress.    St. Francis is a definite must try, and I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. San Tan - Shandy
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pig Dip

20TlyU5qQupAHh1j3jeNUQ.text: Good food. Wasn't busy the Saturday night we visited. A very reliable option.

kAtJtMpU_NxEXKyHXjWG8Q.text: Cool place-- but skip it until they figure out how to run a restaurant. Closed early (11:45) for lunch on Saturday because of " an issue" in the kitchen (aka someone didn't show up for work). I keep trying to like this place but it's runby amateurs. Too many great choices in Phoenix to waste another visit here.

qjw3_FxcMU7xgxvKvLgjdQ.text: St. Francis is one of the most consistent local spots in Phoenix that cranks out some fun seasonal food! Worth a visit if you're thinking about it. Here is why!  Why go there: We sat at the chef's bar where we got to watch the magic of a well run brigade. The guys (and girl) were in sync and communicating like a good kitchen should. They are led well back there, even when things got sticky, they pushed forward. We watched the food get sent out immaculately under the eye of the night's head chef at the pass. The food at St. Francis is accented by their wood fired oven, where you'll get all their flatbreads, roasted veggies, chicken, cornbread and freshly baked bread coming out of. Even the deserts. The menu is fresh, seasonal and generous in portions, from starters to mains.   Don't miss: Their fingerling potatoes were unbelievable, served with fresh rosemary and sage that went for a swim in the deep fryer before hitting the plate topped with paper thin Parmesan shavings and served with a lemon aioli. Anything with fresh garden veg is amazingly fresh, the chef's special pot roast was outstanding. Their flatbreads were great out of that wood fire oven. So hard to choose from their menu, though it is condensed!  Tip:  The place is the largest, if you can sneak in do so early and grab the chef table (oven bar) could seat 3-4 and watch the magic go down.   Overall:  One of the best in Phoenix, we got a freshly baked bread to take home to the sitter! A good thank you from where we just dined!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apricot Honey Cake
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pot Pot Roast
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetable Flatbread

zRr81N8c4k7ECrij9e6aVQ.text: Not a huge fan. I heard they changed ownership and I can definitely see a change on the final product. I still enjoy the Sunday brunch but I'm not going as often as before.

B8tbz7Nb-OGZjC9dm6iaew.text: Since the new menu this place is overpriced, with a downgrade in quality. The atmosphere has also become quite fake, where the importance of the food has gone by the wayside.   The swordfish was not tasty, particularly gamey and the flavors were all over the place.  What was once an inclusive atmosphere where the quality of food and beverage was the focus has become an exclusive atmosphere devoid of substance on a customer and experience level.

f17KoFJ2KxvSrtAWnDtOEw.text: The food was great. It took 20 minutes to get our cocktails and when I called in to ask about the wait they where pretty rude. I would say the food is a 4 Star and the service is a two but hey it's central what do you expect.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The sink is stupid but you can take a selfie while taking a wiz.......

H2xLwbdl7Bcc4Ife5dm0zQ.text: Looked forward to taking the family here. Drove from South Chandler and wanted to treat my wife to a good brunch for her birthday. Looked online and read good things about this place. Was disappointed. Bread and Jam appetizer was recommended and it's a joke they actually charge anything for 5 small slices of French bread with butter and some jam.  Daughter thought her Salmon Benedict was ok and wife liked her frittata. I had the French Onion burger and it was really bad. I love burgers and ate half of it because I was starving. The entire time I questioned the meat because it didn't taste like beef. Too mushy, not seasoned and served raw. Returned the rest and to their credit they didn't charge. But why wouldn't the manager on duty come out and investigate. Easy to write off the food, but more effective to come out and try to make it right. Overall just disappointing and somewhere I can't see myself ever going to again.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PoqjVi9L6h7AbGKb4hO5gQ.text: I do not understand all the hype and what the big deal is about this place. It is okay, good but not the best around and way over priced for quality. Ultra modern restaurant limited menu, pretty urban brick decor reminded me of Chicago or NY restaurant. Good service. Funniest ladies bathroom award. You will have to check it out for yourself I'm not telling why. teehee! Hamburger good, pork chili good. Chocolate peanut butter Gelato cake better! LOL! Nothing to go crazy over but worth a trip. I would go back and try something else. OOPS almost forgot I really loved the Flatbread bacon bread app and I don't even like bacon.

jTkx7V_g3hjPrOyx9OKnuw.text: St Francis is one of my very favorite resturaunts in Phoenix.  Their menu is super interesting and everything I have had is delicious, though I have only had one thing because it is so delicious I get it every time.  I usually get the chicken which has green olives.  Also it has a very kind of swank, trendy feel without the least bit of pretension which makes it very nice.  This is demonstrated by how super kid friendly the place is!  There is even a box of toys that your toddler can play with and one time when we went there the hosts practically babysitted our daughter, playing with her at the toy box.  It is so nice to go to a very grown up kind of resturaunt where they welcome children so throughoughly.

XXH08xi9a2gxVpK_L-fDUQ.text: Our dining experience was enjoyable. Salad had a generous portion of roasted beets and a nice balance of greens /dressing.  Picture the meatball entree as three small tennis ball sized meatballs in a red sauce- seasoning has a delicious Mediterranean/Asian spiced twist.  Although the menu stated this entree comes with pearl pasta we literally searched for it in the dish- our mistake for thinking this was an Italian style meal. My salmon superfood entree was perfectly cooked and yummy. The broccoli with aioli dish brought me back to Pulp Fiction "French fries with mayo in holland ...they drowned them."  Service could have been more attentive....busy place and great spot for outdoor patio dining on a warm June night!

ds7bJ7vVWd9DMwxpwhss1g.text: Sometimes you go to some fancy place that is all art and no substance.  Other times you hit the buffet line that is all food and no joy. In Phoenix no one has blended the two as tastefully as St. Francis.   The ambiance is hip without being exclusive.  The building itself is very open and worth the trip in and of itself.  The menu, while small, is loaded with dishes that will hook you and ensure return visits.   As a starter I'd recommend the Pumpkin soup.  I'm still trying to come up with an adequate superlative to describe the exhilaration I felt when that first spoonful made contact with my tastebuds.  The flavorful festival continues with the Green Chile Pork.  The dish itself is somewhat small but surprisingly hearty.  And cap off the evening with a desert, preferably in the form of the sticky toffee pudding. This place does the city proud and is one more shining light in a re- surging central corridor.

gIamXDgNHbudntTjIKgTrw.text: I've heard a lot of buzz about St. Francis and was eager to try it because I am always on the lookout for new restaurants in CenPho. I was not disappointed. This restaurant design and layout is as fantastic as the food and service.   The Spot:  Located on 1st and Camelback this gorgeous building boasts original brick walls and polished concrete floors downstairs. I had inquired about the upstairs and my server let me sneak a peak, the floor upstairs is made of cork, very unique and gorgeous. The contemporary design really stands out. There is a support system of cable and pin settings, which do away with support columns (so said my dining partner), and it creates a very open and airy flow.  The women's restroom has an original safe built in to the wall with the handle acting as a toilet paper roll. The bar opens to both the restaurant and the patio so giving diners a sense of comfort. There are also pop out windows, so you are able to see in to the kitchen from almost any spot. Currently only the downstairs is open, with plans to open the upstairs within a few months. (The upstairs would be a great place to have a big birthday dinner, seating about 40). The patio wraps around the restaurant and will provide additional seating once the weather cools off a bit.  The Chef: Aaron Chamberlin was part of the opening team for some of my favorite restaurants in the valley: Chelsea's Kitchen, LGO and Radio Milano. He has over 20 years of experience and his French/Mediterranean training helps him to create phenomenal dishes, with top quality ingredients. The kitchen has a brick chamber used for roasting meats, vegetables and breads. The oven and selected spices really brought out the flavor in each dish.   The Food: The menus will change seasonally to take advantage of the ripest produce Arizona has to offer. The current menu incorporates local ingredients such as Arizona pistachios, honey and goat cheese from Black Mesa Ranch. St. Francis is one of only a handful of restaurants that are able to use rare herbs from Sonoma.   Last night I started with the baked goat cheese with walnut herb pesto and toasted bread, it was absolutely delicious. The cheese and walnuts were so fresh I had to go easy not to ruin my appetite for dinner.  For my main I had the pepper-crusted flat iron steak with creamed spinach and fingerling potatoes covered in a red wine reduction.  The steak was phenomenal; it was so tender I could cut it with a fork. I was also pleasantly surprised on how much I enjoyed the creamed spinach.  Desert was also amazing; I went with the summer fruit trifle as it seemed a lighter dish. It had strawberries, peaches, raspberries and some other berry I couldn't nail down, all surrounded in a light cream topped with toasted almonds. It was heaven.  The Service:  The server was awesome. She explained the philosophy of the restaurant along with the vision of the chef. She was quick to point out her favorite meals and her parents were seated next to us. It was nice to see so many friends and family in a newly opened spot.   This place will become a part of my regular restaurant rotation in CenPho. Quality ingredients, wonderful layout and educated staff make this a 5 star review.

msMKLNsCu-caRjtkIgo9UQ.text: Based on a recommendation by a friend, we decided to suggest St. Francis for a dinner with the family on a Sunday night. First of all, I love, love, loved the setup of the place and the overall feel inside. There is also a patio that is outside, but opens up to the restaurant, which I thought was very cool and unique. The service we had was great, very attentive and helpful in answering our questions about the menu.   Since there were several of us there that night, I got to try a number of the entrees. I personally had the green chili pork, which I have still been thinking about a month later. It was so comforting and really really tasty. My Husband had the burger, which he also really liked and I tried... it was very good. Some others at the table had pizzas and the corn one especially was quite good.   All in all, I really liked St. Francis and cannot wait to go back some other time and try more of their unique, local products menu!

qFNLBFzVAqrTea55EJU2gA.text: Took my mom for brunch and was seated quickly but ignored thereafter for 20 min. Someone finally came back and took our order etc. They comped our drinks for the wait but it still is ridiculous when there were only three tables being occupied

uLXk9DTYPHmjqPHgIr4Crg.text: Revisited St. Francis with my mom and youngest daughter...  I had the same fantastic cocktail, but finished it this time. Thank goodness Mom was there to drive!  The waitstaff were all the same as the prior time, as were the bartenders... all EXCELLENT!  My daughter and I each had the pot roast with red carrots, corn polenta, and bok choy... FABULOUS! They make vegetables I crave.  Mom had the roasted chicken. She usually can find something to complain about, no matter how great a place is, but all she could complain about was the wait. I bought her a glass of wine...

SAM63Z4JmwZm-xRqOkEBkQ.text: Went to St. Francis for lunch about a week ago with my team and we sat out on the patio. What a great experience! It has an absolutely amazing atmosphere and the food couldn't be better. I ordered the pork chile verde and and it came out piping hot simmering in a skillet with a side of cornbread. This is probably one of my favorite dishes there even though everything is amazing. I ordered it with a fried egg on top which I also highly recommend. We will definitely be coming back here very soon.

0a6e-ag2WTyOq-L4-bsZvg.text: The pork belly sandwich lived close to expectations as on the food network it was tasty and not greasy at all.  Reasonably priced as well

-PWLwsqcaGwa-OT-m0ZWXg.text: Walking up the gently lit side corridor was an inviting prelude to the entry with a side peak of the open air indoor/oudoor bar that has a gorgeous illuminated onyx bar top.  The layout is quite nice, and  certainly is a place Phoenicians can be proud of.   Beautiful surface materials abound, which are a perfect example of how restraining architectural details allow the visitor to really appreciate the space and the dining experience.  I respect that Aaron Chamberlin candidly admits that the menu is still growing,  wine list being tweaked, and more dessert items shall be added.  I adore restaurants that have an evolving menu that incorporate seasonal ingredients and the chef's favorite food ensembles of the moment.  We shared a refreshing salad with chilled corn, radish, mini heirlooms with a  decadent homemade butter cream ranch dressing.  Plenty for 2, and very reasonably priced at $8.  Oh yeah, and there is a bread service!  The corn chowder was not to our tastes, but the Halibut with eggplant and green and yellow string beans was divine, and perfectly prepared.  I can't provide a technical description of the dessert, expect for it was like a toffee bread pudding with a scoop of vanilla gelato on top.  YUM!  They serve Cartel Coffee (Tempe), which is quite delicious, is and another locally owned spot, that I encourage everyone to try.  The service was absolutely stellar!  Our waiter was well-informed, attentive, and really let us take our time and enjoy ourselves.   St. Francis is a welcome, and much needed newcomer to the ever expanding Central Phoenix dining experience.

goNRSxmlZ93A4X5sqktRaA.text: This place gets more & more amazing each time we eat here.  The ambiance at night is really great for a date night, or just spending time with friends.  From breakfast to dinner, the food is spectacular.

GT9ZBvCbwDlz5tCDc2sJbA.text: Hey Yall...do it for yelp, I anit gon do it...actually I am. So I arrive @ 5.06 Kayla finally makes her way over excuse about huge table....you should have passed me on..ijs..so I ordered the meatballs and corn polenta...oh yea a cucumber lemonade type drink...so my food arrives @ 6 @ 6.06 I am GONE. Why everything was freaking COLD now the meatballs come in a skillet the was piping HOT and on the 1st bite...I'm like is this cold....not cool, but REFRIGERATOR COLD....you know how food has sat then you add more sauce straight from the icebox and don't re-warm it...YEP..YELP JUST LIKE THAT.....The polenta let's just say that I literally stuck my finger in it with another waiter cause that Kayla was busy working....I even had the other waiter touch the meatballs and he confirmed ICY and apologized immediately...here BEELINES the manager one of us was obviously exhausted cause I didn't here him introduce himself. He was kind enough to offer me a baguette to take home....oh its gets better because he then offered me a chicken salad sandwich...I asked the chicken salad sandwich Kayla mentioned you guys were out of....oh okay...it must have been the gtfooh expression on my face...cause he then offered a 25 gift card. I promptly accepted and headed to my next location.....Mexican Food....update coming to night. I will possibly try on the weekend if not I will give it away after all I am a TEXAN!!!!

leMVYsn0e6qra-IUDEFv5Q.text: Love this place. Had the amazing veggie flatbread/pizza. You don't even miss the cheese. I need to try the veggie spicy rice - they keep touting it as one of their best dishes, but I can't get myself to commit to a rice dish for a meal. The bread they serve is to die for - I bought and took home two loaves for my family. They wrap it cutely in paper and a straw string. You just need to make sure you put it in a ziploc type bag when you get home to soften it a bit, otherwise it's a brick. Just a tad sour without it being straight sourdough bread. YUM.

fLDOEdl5OmQIPVWaKzQH7A.text: Slowwwww service. From waiting 30 minutes to be seated (with open tables) to waiting 20 minutes before being able to order and 40 minutes for our food.

_h1zS_WJdhA0W6CkojUufg.text: Fantastic! Dinner and drinks for 2 were a bit pricy, but the service and food was phenominal.

EQIx2l88dVbDxmr3dxXsvg.text: Amazing brunch! Nice open air feel and quick service. The wood oven baked eggs are ridiculously good! Runny egg yoke with seasonal veggies all baked with red wine braised beef... Yes please. The chicken salad sandwich is also delicious. Live jazz has on Sunday morning is supposed to be great as well.

hB5OMd9TjpdWJcsW9kwo2g.text: Yum! I've been meaning to write this review for awhile.. and I'm not sure why I waited so long.  LOVE LOVE St. Francis!   LOVE the food! LOVE the decor!  LOVE the cocktail list!   Must haves breakdown-- if you haven't been: App: Baked Goat Cheese Entree: The chicken was the best entree at our table  other honorable mentions: pot roast and stew Dessert: sticky toffee pudding... delicious!   HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

mq-CtPjqoVlDkXxjlXQHgQ.text: Friday night din din, party of 5 gals after Smeeks' Caramelpalooza.  We were told an hour + wait but were seated immediately.  Loved that!  Beautiful space  Very friendly service from the valet to the server.  The baked goat cheese appetizer is a sure thing.   Very limited menu.     The rest of the food was ok; some things pricier than others.  It seems to be a bit of a "scene" these days which may account for the crowds.    Give it a try it you are in the area.

0JLJc6d1Rahy6B8rSRRDug.text: We read so many good reviews on Yelp that we had to try this place. We took the light rail and arrived around 830pm Saturday night.   The place looked very promising with its modern indoor/outdoor blended setup. It was a full house but not too packed. We waited around 20 minutes for a table which was passed with a round of drinks from the bar. This is where the downhill slide began. A Plum Blossom was ordered from the cocktail menu. It was so sugary, it really was totally undrinkable. The two Kiltlifters ordered came with about an inch and a half to spare to the top, as if someone took some sips on the way from the bar. The glass of house white was barely acceptable.   During our wait we had time to study the menu and decided the pumpkin soup and pepper crusted flat iron steaks would be ordered by at least two in our party. Little did we know until seated that they were out of the flat iron steak which left very limited options.   With pumpkin soup on the way along with a burger, the roasted chicken, and a flatbread, we still had high hopes.   The pumpkin soup was brought quickly. The plate was burning hot and the soup ice cold with a hardened film covering the top. We would have sent it back but our entrees arrived so soon after there  wasn't time. Apparently they pre-pour and use heat lamps.   The flat bread was just so so...very dry. The chicken was nothing to write home about. The burger was super well done (ordered medium well) and very dry. The menu states that it comes with a choice of sides but when we asked our waitress she stated that it only comes with fries.   A bottle of Patz&Hall Pinot Noir was ordered for the table. Normally we love Pinot's but this one was awful. It was much too harsh.   By the end of the meal we had had enough. Dessert was offered but we politely passed.   Maybe we are the sole recipients of a bad meal as the star ratings on here are very high. But in our opinion, Postino's and Maizes have nothing to worry about if this is the best St. Francis can offer.   On the plus side, there was a very entertaining crowd. The women's  bathroom was occupied by a frolicking couple so all in our party had the opportunity to digest the provocative corral art in the men's room.   Normally this place would deserve nothing better than a single star but it gets two as the prices were reasonable and the atmosphere was worth something.

edoXQMyxu7elMjV7uKQ3MA.text: This place is always great! Most recently went for Sunday brunch on my birthday, they had live jazz music and they sang a special song for me  food is always delicious, I've never had anything I didnt like here!

LfG3gANNx9m7qJ1-elJBsQ.text: Brunch with the ladies on a Sunday. Place gets crowded, so you'll need a reservation- you can have mine. Not impressed by the vegan breakfast bowl. The server told me they were out of chickpeas, so substituted avocado instead. She failed to tell me they were also out of spinach and tomatoes, which were the other two ingredients listed on the menu. It came with a flavorless saute of oily celery, carrots, and red pepper. This dish was really terrible. Like diet food gone wrong. Maybe a bit of seasoning or a sauce wold have helped? Can't blame the server on the mixed up breakfast dish, and she was very friendly so bumping up from a 1 star meal. Too many other good brunch places in town to waste a meal on this one.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan bfast bowl

DN26AJ3TmDJflhD6YKMu-A.text: Check this place out during happy hour, even on the weekend! Their hamburgers were huge and delicious. But their meatballs, OMG, amazing!! We ordered everything off of the happy hour menu and had plenty of leftovers to take home. Great food and service!! I highly recommend it!!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So excited to see our dear family members Bruno and Mary Ann. Going to have a fantastic dinner together!

LYOec_SaTPXgIkPdJp10xQ.text: It sucks now-   (((Don't eat here))))) The new owners have no idea why the restaurant had a loyal following-  Disappointment is the only thing on the menu they serve correctly.  You have been warned!!!

ZuJUSrq2WMC62xOHJ08CDA.text: Excellent spot to grab a meal. We came in on a Saturday around 1:30pm and we were seated within a couple minutes.  The staff was very friendly. The drinks were TOP notch. Food came out hot and tasty. I ordered the chorizo eggs with spinach and my husband ordered the onion burger and fries.  We both enjoyed our meals.  My husband had to jump on a work call for a while and our waiter held off with his burger until he returned to the table...thank you again:)  Clean bathrooms and large private parking lot.  Patio dining with misters and heaters, bar dining (inside bar/outside bar).  We will be back soon!!

iME7RzH2k-s9YBqxziH2_A.text: Amazing food amazing service. There was live music that added the perfect mood. It was my birthday and they were so nice and sweet and really made me and my birthday feel special!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs benidict with avacodo

FHDQ4ZT0x2RP6kvfxNqBOQ.text: I hadn't been here in yearsssss so this five star rating is based off only one recent visit. That being said, my service was stellar and my food was so damn delicious. Thanks to my server's recommendation, I ordered the tomato baked eggs during my Sunday brunch visit and it was a little piece of heaven. Why tomato sauce, cheese, eggs, and potatoes are so good together, I'll never know. But I'll be craving it until my next visit.

g_UbsDSQLFVUKnbkBqX1qQ.text: I had to update this review because I know my fellow yelpies depend on it and I hate to lead you astray. This use to be on my list of favorite restaurants in the valley. Unfortunately that was about 3 owners ago. I'm not sure what's going on with this place but I visited last night with a friend after not having been for about a year and was terribly disappointed. I ordered a favorite the margarita flatbread. This was a St Francis staple and always delicious with homemade bread and fresh cheeses. Last night it compared to little Caesar's. Greasy cheese and cardboard crust. I sent that back for the Forbidden rice. Also another favorite. It was bland with tons of pepper to keep your mouth so hot your taste buds died. My friend ordered the nochi. He said it was bland but the salmon he added was good. My Forbidden rice and his nochi cost us $52. They have raised their prices and skimped on their food   It's off my list. I will say our server was excellent. Don't remember his name, tall black guy. He was very good. He was about the only good thing...

2FB12hjnSTH4cd0veK6SUQ.text: Was in the area and was looking for a place to eat.  Found the place online and saw the past awards it had received.  Thought it was a good choice.  Disappointing.  The place looked unkept, rundown and dirty, doors, floors, furnishings etc.  Stayed any way for Sunday brunch. Food was so, so.  Omelette was dry and tasteless. Salmon on the Eggs Benedict was cold.  Expensive too.  Small glass of of out of the bottle or box oj for $4.  Had a better meal at IHOP or Denny's for a lot less.  Won't be back.  Don't recommend.

rWNVP48DmnptnEbAP2wWjg.text: I'm so sad to say that one of my favorite restaurants is no longer the amazing, delicious, trendy place it used to be. It's been a really long time since I've been so I was so excited to go back with a group and I was sorely disappointed. Nothing about the experience was the same as before. My favorite dish: the Moroccan meatballs, were the complete opposite of how I remember. I read a lot of reviews saying the owners had changed but I really hoped this classics had remained the same. Sad to report it was very different. We had a big party and I would say only one person of the large group was happy with their food. They were known for their wood fired dishes, amazing drinks, and incredible ambiance. However, when I walked in I could instantly tell it was different. Bright lights, no staff there to greet us, mismatched chairs and overall a lack luster experience.

PAWqwWo_1V_wMzMWseZxgQ.text: Pretty good.  The fries and kids pizza were my favorite part.   Everything else was pretty good too.  The sandwiches are HUGE.  You could split one with someone  and be full.    Service was good.  The restaurant was empty when we got there, which seemed like a bad sign, but it was great.  Guy Fieri said the Pig Dip was one of his top five dip sandwiches of all time.....I don't think I liked it quite as much as he did, but it was good.  Although, the one lame part was a sprite cost three dollars (a bit high, and it was a for a kid so I wish it was included in the price of a kids meal) and a lemonade out of the same fountain machine cost four dollars.  There was nothing else in the lemonade, so not sure why it cost four bucks.

HJLbDPUtSqIId288kIXfzA.text: Best brunch downtown! Had my birthday brunch and cousin have been happier. Ambience is great they kept the integrity of the old building and didn't over crowd it with decor.   The live music set the tone and made an enjoyable background. The portions were so big neither my wife nor myself finished our meals. The chili verde was spicy and full of flavor. The pork dip is a French dip twisted with bacon.   Will definitely be back for the great food a a outstanding atmosphere!

e7VWrrkxmLpTzpf29rPY1w.text: I love the patio and the busy happy hour. Lots of good looking people flock to their HH. St. Francis is one of those places that becomes your GO TO! I love the menu, but I do tend to get the same couple dishes.

vY4dku9a3qW5GZrSpqqEdQ.text: Last night my fiance and I came and gave St. Francis another try, and I definitely changed my mind about the food! It's not just okay, it's delicious :)   For dinner, I had the Pig Dip and a glass (two) of the L'acote rose which I really liked. He had beer and the Roasted Chicken. We both loved our meals! The Pig Dip is huge as well, which was great because I love having leftovers.   Or waiter was amazing as well - so professional and courteous! Definitely somewhere I want to come again.

Kx3Y6KeLO3MfHdDd_aKvSQ.text: The service was good. Place was empty, which was weird with all the positive hours.  Good food at fair prices, but not anything I'll be hurrying to go back to.

t-gJVpAMxCngkb-LYo6iyw.text: I love this place and have been here before, in fact I recall eating them too but for some reason my review no longer exists. I can here for my birthday with family back in end of April and I got the table I wanted (the window cube). Server was very nice and made recommendations. I ordered the French onion burger and it was delicious. Other people in my group ordered several other dishes, one of which was the forbidden rice bowl and they loved it too.   As for my drink I ordered the Moscow mule and definitely would not order again it as it does not come in a copper mug, so it's no fun!   Finally, the server brought a small cake for the table to share for my birthday and it was super delicious.  I'd definitely come back and also highly recommend it

J1bHGIVecW7FBwITlpRNxA.text: Atmosphere here is pleasant, staff is great and always smiling. Food is good but not great.  I ordered the Fillet medium rare, it was served medium.  Good cut but over cooked to a fillet.  Price was reasonable.  Defiantly check it out!

6UX7Bisnr9y2aEJGdqLubg.text: Great ambience! Beautiful service, good food!!! Thank you for the good service and accommodating staff! Highly recommend for something causal or classy! Great date spot and good for a family/friends get together!   Thank you.

Mk9IrViJj0x4MIHSKYpHzQ.text: Met a great friend for  brunch today. My Green Chili Verde pork with two over hard eggs was outstanding as was my bloody Mary.  My date loves her skillet pancakes topped with fresh fruit Maple syrup, and cream.  Thanks to chef, all the staff.
