nRpfK46cqzeyB8GaTxf4ww.text: OMG. Best burger of my life!!! I had the French Onion Burger (without a bun because I am gluten intolerant.) The sauce on the burger was phenomenal. I could have eaten a lot more than what they gave me! My husband got the pig dip sandwich and it was HUGE! He said it was absolutely amazing. The fingerling potato appetizer is also so good with crispy fried potatoes and aioli. Perfection. If you go during happy hour the burger and a couple other dishes are a few dollars cheaper. The bar is a really fun place to sit and enjoy the weather with an amazing list of drinks. Definitely make a reservation if you are going on the weekend.  Go try the burger and love it!!  I love St. Francis and I can't wait to go back!

fdF59LRNORdjBvMS_NSA3Q.text: Horrible service. Waited way too long for our entrees. Would have been nice to have received a "sorry for the wait", an explanation OR something taken off the bill, but NOTHING. No recognition of the ridiculous wait and watching tables (after us) being feed. Disappointed. But, The lady that sat us with the nose ring was very nice. May have had a better experience if she was our server.

H9RTmoKVGi-pyZ1QZnPtqQ.text: Great food and ambiance. Parking (Valet Only) is a nightmare. Not enough parking. Waited in Valet line with the rear of my car hanging off the busy Camelback corridor to find out there were no parking spots left. Uber it if you live within 10 miles.

bqt_STpr2z-r0bRCV9fudQ.text: Just visited for a great dinner. We got seated immediately with reservations (short wait for those without). Wait staff was very attentive and had lots of recommendations to offer. The restaurant is lovely, has a great "hip" vibe being inside of a renovated garage, and has lots of the indoor-outdoor space that Arizona is known for. We ordered drinks first, the Santa Rosa and Cucumber Cooler, and were impressed with both, aesthetically pleasing, great flavors, and very refreshing. Off of their Signature Items menu, we ordered the Pork Green Chile and the Moroccan Meatballs for dinner, both were very flavorful and different from other run of the mill restaurant fare.

D7oZvZDpjjJuB5H1B_0x2w.text: Awesome place!  Decent happy hour deals.  Best of all, and the most important thing about a restaurant in my opinion, the service was exceptional (thanks Maddie)!  Everything we ate (the baguette, almond margarita, seasonal flat bread, chili verde pork) was delicious as well.

Q56Wm91U171P838Z9TbiwQ.text: I've been coming here for years and still love it, it's getting better and better.  I had the roasted chicken dinner and it was awesome!  My wife had the salmon and again it was awesome. Mine was better.  Then I had the dessert, and it was to die for!...vanilla ice cream with breaded pastry and cinnamon sause. Oh my god....so good.  Love this place!

BmXuDTF3WZb-9EjGNbQ-pw.text: Business needs to check their hours with what is posted. I've never been here because they were closed when they were supposed to be open, so I cannot adequately review.

Gcu202IvawG0WBeThVQ6vg.text: Easily one of my all time favorite restaurants!  I make it a point to come here for happy hour and order a couple cocktails.  The drinks are refreshing and the food has so many elements.  I'm in love

eHu-KN_yeX2yJZ2iRsUszw.text: place is nice, but i strongly feel like you are paying for the ambiance. I did enjoy their roasted corn soup but overall their soup, salad and their orange mint soda costed me $20.00 pre tip. I felt like that price point was a little high even though it was locally sourced. I will probably come back again though just because the ambiance was amazing. Service was also on point

IEAA5odIGkWkcbb7iHGaRg.text: I had super high hopes for this place as it has been on my 'try' list for awhile and I know a lot of people that love it.  I feel like overall it was a pretty good experience minus a few minor details (gave it 4 stars but it's more like 3.5).  I like the ambiance.  The patio is super cool, cozy and large at the same time, with a very cool fireplace.  As far as food, everything we had was fairly tasty-the best items being the Crispy Fingerling Potatoes and the Pumpkin Soup (outstanding).  We happened to be there at happy hour and they've recently changed their menu a bit and it's a little limited at HH time.  We also tried the Moroccan Meatballs which were ok, lacking some flavor (I make them at home and mine are better) and could've used a little salt.  I had a glass of their house made sangria which wasn't that great.  It had no fruit.  It wasn't sweet at all.  I don't like sweet 'wines' but I was craving sangria which is usually sweeter.  Perhaps it would taste better on a hot day. It's very cool that kids eat free. However, the offerings aren't super kid friendly, in my opinion.  Personally, I am anti kid-meal and my kiddos typically split a pasta that is on the regular menu (or something similar).  Well, that's not an option here so we ordered the hamburger and the baked pasta off the kiddie menu for them.  The burger was huge but the bun was massive and hard to eat (fries were yummy though), and the pasta wasn't good at all.  It's a pearl pasta so it is a weird texture (my kids are foodies but they didn't like it) and the sauce didn't have much flavor.  So, while I appreciate the thought, perhaps the kids meals could be slightly more tailored to kid's tastes.  I know I shouldn't complain about something free, and as mentioned I am not wanting boxed mac n cheese but a couple other simple choices would be nice. Only other slight complaint is the service was super slow.  It was HH and not busy at all so I'm not sure if everyone was just in a super chill-ax'ing mood or what, but it took forever to place our order! All in all, I would return because there are a couple other menu items I would like to try but I'm not in any rush.

jepTTRmpNU3XeZBXurvr5A.text: From start to finish, everything about the meals were fantastic. Well prepared, thoughtful dishes. Atmosphere is busy, and parking is complimentary valet.

jJN3JrigaDXsQyZvpHVLxA.text: Ken, Megan, and the whole staff at SF are amazing.  I love this gem here in Central Phx.  MUST GO TO SPOT!

bS_M4TQ1569RaY2K3IrOug.text: Great patio. Excellent service.  Delicious food.  Can't ask for much more than that.  Thank you for making our dining experience great.

NyJbeqz209ACk3zsO3SDVQ.text: I'd heard so many good things about St. Francis and was excited to try it out, but unfortunately I was quite disappointed. Service was extremely slow, in fact our waitress disappeared for long periods of time and I had to flag down other servers to get refills, ask questions, and even try to find out where our food was. Not that it's the restaurants fault, but apparently it was prom season and we were seated in the midst of a large group of very loud high school kids. The food was good, but not great, and definitely worth the prices they are charging. Overall, it seems like the buzz around this place is overblown for the reality of the experience. I probably won't be back.

Hsv5ADvbh1lik0LOCKBpyw.text: When I come to Phoenix, this place is always a great dinning experience! We were lucky to be in Christy's section. Her personality and knowledge of the menu was outstanding. thank you for your recommendation of the Morrocan meatballs. The seasonal Pumpkin custard was amazing. I look forward to another visit.

7WbLjHbzzqzyosnlwKds-A.text: St Francis is one of those places that once you find it, you love it! We were told to eat there by a friend and we are so glad we did! We loved the decor, the wait staff and the food. We have visited Phoenix twice in the last few weeks and ate there both times. The baker's bread, which you can purchase by the loaf, is wonderful as well as the entree's. We loved the fact that the menu changes due to seasonal ingredients. We will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YotobkyHag9xrKT9TmbMLQ.text: Charlie Chaplin stumbling around, being clumsy making dough.   Walking up to this cute and quaint restaurant, I noticed they're playing silent old flicks on one of the patio walls via projector. The ambiance is really sweet, romantic. I'm not sure if it's valet only, but when you pull into the parking lot they do offer free valet if eating in the restaurant. It was pretty busy for a Wednesday night. My date and I were seated at a small table in the middle of the restaurant. We noticed a heavy, chilly draft coming from the two glass doors that were open to the patio.   Upon sitting down, we realize it's a bit too much so my date asks the hostess Kaitlyn (sp.) if we could be moved or if something could be done about it. No apologies were made at this time and all she said was it would be another 20-25 minutes of a wait in order to be moved. My date and I were pretty hungry, as it was around 7PM already by this time so we decided to stay put (not very happy about it tho). Ryan was our server. He noticed how cold I looked and said sorry, that he'll try and make the experience more enjoyable with his service. He recommended some food items, said their Moroccan Meatballs were featured on a Food Network show. They also have drinks on their list that are made in Arizona, as well as out, but I thought that was pretty cool.  We order the Goat Cheese appetizer, which was pretty good. We proceeded to order the Moroccan Meatballs and the Forbidden Rice Bowl. It took the usual time to come out, didn't have to wait long. In the meantime, my date and I are trying to stay distracted due to the chilly breeze coming through... noticing the table next to us is feeling the same thing. The entrees we ordered are pretty good. The meatballs weren't amazing, they were definitely different, but not as up to the hype as I expected. The Forbidden Rice Bowl is a dish to try - it tasted a bit too saucy though, but otherwise good. Water took a little bit to get refilled a few times, my date sat with an empty glass for about 15 minutes at one point.... Tsk tsk.  Halfway through the meal, a female server closes one of the glass doors to the patio that stops the chilly draft coming through. Of course we're already almost finished and the dining room is starting to clear out a bit, so damage was already done. My date and I both couldn't finish our meals, so we asked for boxes. Ryan boxes them up for us and I notice him and another employee smirking to each other while placing my little bit of rice into the to-go box..... Not sure what that was about, but okay. So I don't want to waste forbidden rice.... Why does that call for a smirk face?!  All in all, I give the food 4 Stars, the service started out good but towards the end not so great therefore I give 3 Stars total. I don't think I plan on going back to try this place again.

Cm03i_Duqm0d_jLbe7qq2A.text: Dinner last evening (1/20/18).  Very nice hostess and waitress. Apparently place is more of a warm weather establishment as it is open to the elements.  The only source of heat are heaters Outside on the patio. Even then, patrons outside had jackets on as temperatures were low 60's.  Busy place, I'm with 3 others for dinner.  Bar service is adequate. Moroccan meatballs were good. Mussels in coconut milk were good. Salmon and was just ok. I had an extremely dry pot roast server on slightly burnt Texas toast.

coF-W8kcz757l5CHUVhxMA.text: After months of saying I wanted to go...I finally went.    I am grateful for the complimentary valet...yet shameful of the condition of my car! ;-)    I enjoyed a lovely Saturday brunch with a good friend and had a damn tasty bloody mary...yummmm!  The tomato baked eggs...just do it.  You won't be sorry.    I would have given this place 5 stars, but the service on this particular day was quite lackluster.  It took a long time to even come take our drink/food orders even when the tables around us were getting taken care of rather quickly.

2hl0S-hlIsJ3jaHXdwwP1A.text: Pork Chilie Verde. Many seasonal veggie meals and flatbreads...all was delish. Neat change for a morning breakfast.

fXOcsI_0Qf9AnaLTjcdOwQ.text: Loved the atmosphere at St. Francis. Warm in cozy inside, airy yet cozy on the outside patio. Food was amazing! Had the shrimp risotto, the shrimp was fresh, the peppers were spicy and each bite melted in my mouth. Great cocktail selection. I will be back! Need to try brunch on the patio! And happy hour!

A5nT0E2vabn3iuNYJTodow.text: I ate here with my family and friends for my birthday dinner, and we all had a pretty decent experience. Although it was summertime in Arizona, their outside patio did not feel hot or warm at all. It was surprisingly comfortable. The steak I tried was impressively delicious, and everyone else said their food was really good. Myself, and another friend ordered the whitefish which was seasoned with way too much salt. I wish I had ordered the steak.   I really love the atmosphere of this place, and can't wait to try out their happy hour.

RKNZ7uwHY4KPW510S5rMUw.text: Love this restaurant! We have been there multiple times and we always leave happy. They have phenomenal service and the staff are knowledgable about the food, ingredients and drink pairings. I love their seasonal soups! And I highly recommend starting off with the Housemade Baguette. Prices are good and the atmosphere is great!

wydIfXizLWKvSmTaKpovfw.text: This is another Phoenix restaurant with great ambiance and decor.   I was able to arrive before the rest of my party and had a couple drinks from the outdoor bar. The dirty martinis here are delicious! I also had a couple flatbreads (cheese & chorizo) which were both around $10. They both were very tasty and filling.   For dinner I split the forbidden rice bowl (I added chicken) and the seafood cioppino ($25). I was surprised how much I liked the rice bowl, I am not exactly sure what type of rice they used, but it was on the sweet side in a good way. Other people at my table had the hanger steak , salmon and the french onion burger, but were not that impressed with it.   I would suggest giving this restaurant a try, I'm glad I did.

3htJEHXWrnNMSREqL3lmtg.text: I really like St. Francis. The space is one of my very favorites in Phoenix. They have a nice brunch and an excellent Happy Hour (last Sunday we ordered two entrees, two glasses of wine, and two beers and walked for $38.00), as well as one of the best desserts in town (sticky toffee pudding). And, we always receive impeccable service. Highly recommended!   Love the little patio, too. :-)

-rQMlvPvf3c3uR7Kr1SDUg.text: Went to the St. Francis for dinner with high hopes.  I was not disappointed.  Food was inventive and very memorable.  Beyond the great food was the incredible wait staff.  If you have the opportunity to meet and spend time with Libby (our drinks server), be sure to make it a point.  She, and Ryan (our waiter) made this one of the better dining experiences I have in quite some time.  Ryan gave us a great recommendation, which was to order a few items and share them all.  We had the opportunity to try a few different things.  The wood fired oven cooking method is wonderful and definitely adds a special quality to the food prepared.  One of my best overall experiences.

l8OLYbzFzMAerqj0h_tJ7Q.text: I came to St Francis to join friends for Happy Hour, as I am rarely in the area it was my first visit and I was instantly impressed with it's warm and intimate atmosphere. Seating is available indoors or on the heated patio with additional seating upstairs. Service was great and also accommodating in our request to stay warm but not too warm as we chose to dine outdoors braving a cool AZ evening. It's great place to join friends, is family friendly(as they paid special attention to my daughter's cherry filled drink)and is a cozy enough location for a date. I ordered the pork chili verde, topped with perfectly cooked sunny side up eggs, and a spicy roasted jalapeno, amazing! Being with a friends whom generously shared, I was able to try a bite of the large tasty meatballs, and the pumpkin soup that was like eating a sweet whipped into perfection bite of dessert. With such good food and service, St Francis is definitely worth  making a return visit!

rGG2dzG0UiPaXVfE4jzMSQ.text: I have never had anything I didn't like here. They have good fresh ingredients and a unique food and drink menu.

5Go3SEPEuYTVBOhcxw8ScQ.text: Wow has this place come into its own in the past 4-5 years.  I came here a few times for happy hour when it first opened and enjoyed the atmosphere and the drink specials but wasn't bowled over by the menu.  Funnily enough, it was an episode of Diners, Drive Ins and Dives (I know, I hate that guy too, but it's how I get my American food fix in London) that introduced me to what I would later become obsessed with: that cast iron, wood fired pancake. When it came time to plan my next visit home, I put that shit in my itinerary: Friday, visit grandma and lunch with dad; Saturday, cast iron pancake @St Francis. That's how serious I was about this pancake. Finally, the glorious day came and we arrived at opening time for Saturday brunch (sneaked past the valet who weren't quite set up yet and parked right out front, too!) Settled on the lovely covered patio with it's grape leaves that let just the right amount of sunshine flow through and got to business. Bloody mary ($9 ... ouch), biscuits and gravy ($12) and announced to my friends we'd be splitting the pancake for dessert (I needed my biscuit fix, too!) Fellow diners got the egg sandwich ($10 and one of the cheapest option on the breakfast menu) and the eggs benedict ($13). It took forever for our order to come out. I had to order another bloody mary (considering the price, it was not an easy decision to make), but the air was fine and we had no where to be. Finally, it arrived and was so, so happy. Dreams = fulfilled. The bill came to a whopping 72 (not including tip!) and they could have been a bit more apologetic about the wait and more upfront with updates from the kitchen, but I'll forgive them because PANCAKE.

mLdzJ0wnceNeLJJiZ-4TKA.text: We've been here a couple of times for breakfast and we've had great experiences both times.  The Eggs Benedict with salmon & chorizo scramble were our favorites.  Love the fingerling potatoes too!  Can't wait to come back and taste the dinner menu!

Fwj-Ym0afVOCOmmd4_upIg.text: This place is always packed and I think the tables are too close together. But the food is delish

ItQ8UEBULi9AmtRPOohqmw.text: Very cool spot.  Staff is always helpful.  Their signature cocktails are way above average.  I recommend the pork sandwich!

KiyyAw25EBKaxd2ilJqp8Q.text: St. Francis has some of the yummiest food! Their burgers are just about the best I've ever had. In fact, they've won awards for their French Onion burger (amazing beef topped with bacon, gruyere cheese and a house made French onion dip...drool!) The fingerling potatoes are out of this world too. It is served with fried sage and rosemary and let me tell you, I picked every piece of fried herb out of that dish and ate it. Who knew deep fried fresh herbs were so delectable? And their Pig Dip sandwich...oh yeah!  My absolute favourite dish is their Roasted Salmon Superfood. Perfectly seasoned and seared salmon served in a bowl of quinoa, radish, spinach and avocado and then dressed in a delicious chili dressing. It is the perfect combination of taste, texture and visual beauty. They also have daily specials, which are usually spot on. I try to strike a balance between trying their specials and ordering my usual favourites.    The service is always just fine; friendly attentive staff but not overbearing.  Even though the place is usually really busy when we arrive, it isn't overly loud inside, which is something I appreciate. I like having a conversation over my meal and sometimes in a popular spot, that isn't always possible.  Oh, and I love that they often serve locally grown/produced vegetables, meat and herbs.   The location is convenient; just east of Central on Camelback. St. Francis takes reservations (I use Open Table) but you can also walk in and usually get a seat without too big of a wait.  My ONLY complaint about St. Francis is that you can only park via valet. Generally I don't mind valet parking (in fact, I'm lazy enough to prefer it!) but I like to have the option, especially when the valet attendant only has to park my car three steps from the door. The valet stand is further from the door than my car usually is! Valet parking is free but of course you feel like a heel if you don't at least give them a tip so in a sense, it costs to park for your meal. I'd prefer to make the choice of either parking my own car and walking the three steps to the door or having valet park my car and then walking 10 steps to the door. Makes no sense. But then the food is totally worth it so....you decide!

sIMf8aFj0ZqZkTmwmMC7QA.text: I had a delicious and hearty meal here.  Started with the crispy okra - delicious, but possibly a bit too big a serving.  I ended up boxing what I left.  Next was a pork belly pozole - very tasty and satisfying.  The dessert was a toffee pudding, but it was more of a "cake with ice cream on top of a toffee base" than a pudding.  It was still great.  Next time I must try the trifle... Beautiful decor and a cozy atmosphere.

_6DUEQTR2ofBxv0jGQzPbg.text: I went here off a friend's recommendation and wasn't disappointed.  From beginning to end, everything was spot on.  I'm excited to come back.

QYJFSUyF5NVPbnjk14yBpQ.text: Went here for lunch.  Had the Summer Risotto. It was good and definitely had a refreshing flavor.

em6jxroIYPcFUM5nBgX-rQ.text: One of the top restaurants I've EVER been to. Scratch made, and presentation is flawless. This restaurant epitomized everything I look for when I go to eat. The only one gripe I have is that they seriously need to expand or add another location because it was a little tight.

KaaJulpq1cZKJw4DyLVx1Q.text: First time visit on a Friday evening. The happy hour is affordable and delicious. Drinks are imaginative and flavorful. The patio is comfortable and cozy with a fireplace and heaters. We sampled our way through appetizers of Mediterranean style meatballs, veggie flatbread, and goat cheese baked with fresh tomatoes. All were spectacular. Dinner salad was crisp and fresh, and the polenta was creamy good. Hubby had the risotto which was a bit salty to my palate, but appropriately creamy. Our friends had the salmon which was moist and flavorful, and the black rice shrimp bowl which was tangy and tasty. The only bummer was the chocolate cake. The gelato it came with was superb, but the cake was so dry. Sorry. We will definitely be back. Maybe the sticky toffee pudding next time....

6jDbuZvYS33PKCDQrXnDgQ.text: Went back for dinner the other night and I am glad to say that I still love this place.    The roasted chicken is really good.  That sauce is fabulous! It's crispy on the outside, juicy and tender chicken, yummy broccolini. The farro is a little out of place, but who cares! It is THAT GOOD!     Also had the romaine hearts salad with endive, bacon, apples. This will be another lunch visit for sure.  Has just the right amount of sweet, savory, creaminess and crunch. The apples are cut up very nicely as slices and julienned in the salad. The full portion fed 3 of us a small salad.  We also tried the pot roast which was very rich and decadent, almost like a short rib. It came on a creamy polenta which made it even more rich. It also has a few bok choy on the side as well. I love bok choy :) Overall good, but I'm glad we ordered a bunch of things and shared, because, it was a little heavy to eat all by yourself.  Everything doesn't compete with the chicken though.   And 3rd, we got our stand by the french onion burger, which was good as usual.   I also love the blackboard near  the back door that has the list of their seasonal fruits, vegetables, herbs that they use in their dishes.  If you eat here for dinner trust me, you have got to order the Chicken!

traGLP7hvYz9YCc77lV97g.text: There are some options for vegetarians which is getting to be the norm in cen pho.  Getting a table can be tricky so I recommend an early dinner or a late night nibble.    Fingerling potatoes are really yummy, though I always add some extra salt and pepper. Bread and oil is always a must. They really push the forbidden rice bowl to the vegetarians and that's ok, as it is pretty good!

JQOp8rfnoNzR5TUQH4Vcbg.text: I have been to St Francis several times and really love it but I had one dish that simply blew me away. The forbidden rice bowl-wow-flavors just explode in your mouth. I had chicken added for protein-the dish came to the table so fresh-with perfectly cooked veggies in season, the rice was beyond tasty and the shredded chicken the perfect compliment. The real star is the sauce-delicate,aromatic, light. I ate most of it for lunch then took home the leftover and and had a light dinner. I never eat the same thing twice in a day but this is the type f dish I could eat weekly. Thinking about going back soon...

jCMprt2-lMUpXYr003O2Mw.text: Wow....is all I seem to be able to say if someone were to ask me about this place.  My boyfriend had brought me here yesterday for my birthday and am so glad he did.  He had ordered a mushroom omelet for me but now knowing that omelets are probably the last thing I would order at a restaurant for breakfast.  I am not a huge fan of them normally but will eat them if I am hungry.  Before the food came out we had ordered a Bloody Mary which was so good.  I had seen a few different ways that people had ordered them with some muddled lemons and limes and was jealous mine didn't come that way to try.  Mine was still amazing don't get me wrong I just wish I would have seen that before ordering one for myself.    When we had received our food we both dug in and was I in shock! I instantly thought when I received my food that I would need a condiment of some sort for my eggs but boy was I wrong. It was so good the way they had prepared them you absolutely don't need anything besides your drinks.  I can't say I will order them again because I definitely would love to try the rest of the menu for sure. But the omelet was solid and a good choice if you Love omelets.  While I was half way through eating my omelet I tried the slices of toast that came with it and was blown away again at just how amazing that was. I also happened to try my boyfriends corn bread that came with his dish and was probably drooling from how delicious that was!  I am slightly nervous the next time I get to order my own meal and for more of their home made bread because I will probably look like an idiot with how in love I am with their homemade breads already.  We had put one last order in for the Johnny Appleseed drink in which was also to die for was definitely a dangerous drink to say the least.  Next time I will definitely have to try the mimosas and peach Bellini's.    Oh St.Francis why do you have to tempt me the way you do and be so far away from our place.

rfZPHEKGUfcZpsif6nRZqQ.text: MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT IN ALL OF PHOENIX.  And I love food!  I have yet to have any dish that wasn't 8 or 9 out of 10.   From simple food (the burger is the best burger I've had in my life, I swear), to brunch (the baked eggs is excellent, as is the mushroom and goat cheese omelet), to dinner or lunch (the chile verde is to die for!).  I read somewhere that the pudding desert ($7) is one of the top 100 dishes in the valley.  It's not huge, but perfect blend of flavors and gelato and just a 10 out of 10 desert.  Honestly, I'd eat here weekly if I wasn't afraid of growing tired of the food.  Ultra modern decor, clean, free valet, friendly owner/chef, and the most kid-friendly super fancy restaurant I've ever seen.  Anyway, I'm usually tough on restaurants, but this is my favorite place to eat, and I have a hard time imagining anyone could be disappointed for giving it a try.

1jL7A_zHZlXcQooa7fFFrw.text: I was on a business lunch and in charge of picking a place, so naturally I looked for a place on the pricier side. Just kidding (not).  St. Francis was a fabulous pick. The menu piqued my interest since it offered a variety of healthy options and curious flavor pairings. I ended up with a salad that had nuts, beets and avocado, and I added chicken. it was perfect!   My coworker ordered cauliflower soup which sounded unappetizing not only because I dislike that veggie, but because it was 113 degrees Fahrenheit outside. Even so, I was coerced into trying the soup and was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed it.  My one complaint is I was sitting next to a sign that said something about St. Francis having the best bread in Phoenix, but I never got a bread basket to see what the hype was about!  PS: It wasn't even expensive.

bGM4zML9-4a9LFo6rW9jNw.text: We went here specifically because of Diners, Drive-ins and Dives from Food TV.  We even got the Pig Dip that they featured on the show.  It was everything they claimed and more. Cooked perfectly. Amazing pork.  I'm not a fan of mustard, but it was perfect on this sandwich. We also had an appetizer of baked goat cheese. Wow. Delicious. Nice crowd, a little loud and would go back again in a minute. Highly recommend!

3gLgcc7rK0FA5dwafM_Mww.text: Really cool atmosphere! Great food and yummy drinks.  The brick oven is very cool. Quaint.

D8QQ2HCjVPJqJ-EfFGUdLQ.text: This place is the real deal.  I have been back twice now.  Once for dinner and once for lunch.  The food was amazing again!  The open-faced pork loin sandwich was just HEAVENLY!!!  Thick cut multi-grain bread, mashed sweet potatoes, braised greens, topped with 5 thin cut slices of pork loin covered in some sort of gravy brought down by angels.  A side of quinoa salad topped off this lunch.  Just check out the picture.  Nuff said.  HEAVENLY!!!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Open-faced Pork Loin sandwich

ThafzymUL42YkXsEw_Ho0w.text: Very nice chef menu. The atmosphere is trendy and warm. We had the goat cheese to start along with moroccan meatballs. Their specialty cocktails are terrific. The dessert was divine-apple crumble. We ate ourselves to the breaking point everything was so yummy!

NFZwDIBPtG5gxALVPDu33w.text: The food was great and the drinks were amazing! I had called to make reservation and I was happy with the table they gave me and my husband. We were seating against a glass second floor looking over the bar. I noticed some sauce on my husband's sleeve and I looked around were that might have come from and indeed the glass was stained with some red sauce as well as the handle there had some crusty old food on it. The atmosphere was nice I loved the little candles on each table, the thing was our candle was the only one not on.

Ch464kMu7MGRg-Xvb3j2aw.text: I'm not sure which came first, Postino's or St. Francis but I am a long-time fan of Postino's so the first thing I thought when my family and I went to St. Francis is "Oh, Postino's wanna-be". My opinion wasn't too far off as far as the air of hipster/yuppiness that exudes through the vestibule definitely screams Postino's while you wait for a table but as far as quality of service, you St. Francis, are definitely no Postino's.   Our server made a major push at the upsell of a combination appetizer and when we agreed to it, he forgot to bring it to us! I had ordered a soup/salad/1/2 sandwich entree for lunch, and he forgot the soup. When he did bring it after being reminded, it was lukewarm. He kept forgetting to bring refills as well. It was like he was in another world. We ended up being comped quite a bit off of our bill because of simple mistakes because what's the point in being served lukewarm soup or an appetizer at the end of your meal? And he was NOT new! I am very forgiving of new servers and this guy kept telling us how he's worked at St. Francis for 2 years and how much he loves it there....so whatever his problem was that day, it definitely affected our meal and our potential to return.  The saving grace was that the food was really delicious. I had the Del Real sandwich, my son had pig dip, my other "son" had French Onion burger, my "son's girlfriend had the forbidden rice bowl. All were really nicely done, fresh, served at the right temperatures (with the exception of the aforementioned soup), etc. I just wish the service had been better.   Maybe we'll go back..maybe I'll just go to Postino's. I guess we'll see the next time we are "in the neighborhood."

NFwg-ud-Mx5uDZahWGqP4w.text: 5 Stars for Design, this place is Impressive, VERY important to me.  4 Stars for Food, with a wood fired oven they should be making better "flatbread", just     focus on a good dough and make a killer pizza, please.  Baked goat cheese... BOOM! Pork Chile Verde...BOOM! Moroccan Meatballs...BOOM! Sticky toffee pudding...BOOOM!  (Did'nt care for the forbidden rice bowl.)  Happy Hour is great, drinks are spectacular, I may be an alcoholic though.  Go, try out everything and you will discover your faves, be merry!  S

bcaJSC-NQXaIBs7gHTlGyQ.text: I though the restaurant its self looked amazing, the staff quite helpful and friendly and the service was fast.  Sadly, I found the food quite lacking.  First off the menu is quite small, though it is a small place and small kitchen.  It seems the place focuses more on the bar and wine then the actual food.  The food for all our in our party was just over spiced.  Each of our dinners just tasted like spice and not so much the meat or other entree it ordered.  When ordering meatballs (no pasta, just had the meatballs), I kind of expect to be able to taste the meat.  Plus the garlic bread served with it was so hard, it was uneatable.  Even gnawing on it was ineffective.  It's a pretty place with a nice atmosphere.  But if you want a good mean, I just can't recommend it.

-vtO3CQ96Phyzq-LTGaq_Q.text: I had a rice bowl with 7 different kinds of vegetables.  It came a large plate with small portion food.  Felt like salad with a little half cooked black rice underneath.

t_4vzPTpYMYymJBVFTZggw.text: I ate at St. Francis this morning for brunch with three friends. I usually  love the restaurant although this morning I was disappointed. First, they were out of decaffeinated coffee! Granted, they had regular coffee, but not everyone drinks regular coffee. Someone did a poor job in their ordering department, but I wonder what would have kept them from running across the street to AJ's and just buying a few pounds of decaf? I realize that it would not be their usual Cartel Coffee, but wouldn't it have solved the problem, at least for the morning brunch crowd?  Also, I wonder if they changed the recipe for their otherwise excellent baked eggs in tomato sauce? Two of the four of us ordered it and it was runny.  Finally, while our table was trying to have a conversation, we were interrupted constantly asking if we wanted more water or more coffee. Repeatedly, we told the wait staff we were fine, but to no avail. Their staff need to somehow communicate to each other; I have not experienced this at other restaurants so I have to assume that other restaurants have some communication system in place to keep this from happening?  We will be back again since most of our visits to St. Francis are excellent but I do wish that they paid more attention to detail!

1AkqsUoy_CvqYJvm2tkkVA.text: I attended the St Francis happy hour last week.  The drinks are tasty but have very little alcohol.  If they weren't $5 apiece, I'd be upset; it's definitely not worth coming here and paying full price.    Great atmosphere but I probably won't be coming back due to the under-pours.

zA0bDkuCZoRBbxYRvDVVDw.text: Do you like crusty french bread? Hard crusty shell on the outside with soft, moist chewy crumb on the inside?  Whenever my wife makes soup, she asks me to bring home a loaf of crusty french bread. This is where I go to get it. Don't get me wrong, all their food is delicious, especially the veggie lasagna, and some kind of melted goat cheese in spaghetti sauce appy, but I don't have time for that, not tonight. My orders were very specific, "a loaf of crusty french bread."  When you arrive, there'll be a couple dozen loaves of bread for sale in the front area, across from the hostess station. Grab a loaf, take it home and when you walk through the door, hold it up to your crotch and pretend its your junk.  A hybrid, somewhere between a baguette and a traditional french loaf, you'll look like Ron Jeremy with this thing.  Go ahead. Wave it around. Maybe even do 'the helicopter' with it, signaling your after-dinner intentions transcending any level of naughty she's even vaguely familiar with.   Then prepare to eat your soup by yourself after getting a lecture on holding up any and every phallic shaped object to your crotch, as if it was some gigantic dong.  Keep on dreaming, my friend.  The world needs dreamers like you.  Note to St. Francis management Your bread is remarkable, and that little quinoa salad is scrumptious. Nice job!

KCs6p2tMASEIY3lVgFUAug.text: Just had the salmon and I have to say this is by far the best salmon I have ever had. It is flavored with a hint of coconut and the flavor is spot on. Do yourself a favor and order this dish if you enjoy salmon.   The fingerling potatoes and the broccoli are also amazing.   Great place for drinks food and overall atmosphere.

sLTGGHm-ZoWCi8jJrXnYWQ.text: My first time in Phoenix and this Restaurant came upon a suggestion. I thought the outside looked promising and that it was more upscale, but it was cute and down up earth. Although the entry was confusing the food, drinks, and atmosphere made up for the layout.   It's not overdone and affordable. I would not recommend children or kids here, because its do darn cool and sociable. Not too loud, but really a cool vibe for dinner, drinks and conversation.  The bar is kinda small so get a table!!!  Would definitely like another visit! Thanks Phoenix.

asycx_rTifZvcW9KMg4bjg.text: Went for a Saturday brunch.  Website is excellent for doing your research on the place.  Parking is a negative.  Why valet parking when your car sits in front of the entrance?   Architecture and ambiance is a plus.  Very fresh and innovative.  A little noisy, but OK.  Service was excellent.  The food:  Eggs benedict smoked salmon was one of the best according to our friend. Pumpkin soup and salad a clear winner.  The Farmer's frittata could have used some more veggies. The cinnamon roll was disappointing--very doughy and not flavorful. My iron skillet pancake was fantastic as was the bowl of that magical pumpkin soup. Would recommend this place for brunch, lunch, happy hour or dinner.  Always a winner for us but be careful what you order as not all offerings on the menu are winners.   A little fine tuning is needed.

uPfBCknfLxYGC6bdqtkvLg.text: Meh. Cool looking place, but the staff seems miserable, food sounds good but is mediocre at best, and has no clear identity.

DdLDC2G7zyscK-aopp3qpA.text: Came here for a business lunch on Sat. Great atmosphere and quiet enough to have a conversation. Enjoyed the chile verde pork stew.. Really liked the chunky cornbread that accompanied dish. I'm coming back for sure!

7OX290LQF_43RAC7j3kevQ.text: Started off with a Bloody Mary. Nice and thick with a big spicy kick. $9 seems a little steep for a Bloody Mary though.  The pumpkin soup was amazing!!! It was the perfect temperature. Thick, creamy, and each bite got better than the last.

DPhJnquYH8MogUN4X1jL7w.text: Love this place. Food is amazing with a menu for all types, whether you want comfort food or want to eat a bit healthier. Awesome customer service as well.

x2t71VXMRV10SwL7OfjiiQ.text: Delicious! I got the forbidden rice bowel with salmon and my friend got the shrimp risotto. I loved my dish. They cooked the salmon perfectly. Finally a place that doesn't overcook salmon. The flavors were unique and complimented each other well. I definitely recommend this place. They also have complimentary valet parking on site which I'm a huge fan of because I cringe at the idea of dealing with park garages in the city. Thanks St. Francis for a wonderful experience. It was a great time celebrating my best friend's birthday here.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon Forbidden rice dish. This can come with chicken or shrimp, I believe, if you prefer those.
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp risotto

53sLe-Tk_9olpd1a2m9cvg.text: With new ownership in play, that has some kinks in play, but does not make the food taste any less delicious!

R61gBCIcIPXUUtL2qTH-Fg.text: Lively place with a good variety of food. Service was friendly and prompt. Happy hour ends at 6:00.  Fun set up with a bar and indoor and outdoor seating. The acoustics in this place are a little much- it does get very loud. One especially loud table near us made it impossible to hear. Wish they had something to absorb all the noise. As for the food, I had the pumpkin soup which I could eat everyday! Just perfect! And the kale Brussels sprout salad, although it was good,  lacked Brussels sprouts.  A happy hour drink with soup and salad was $25.

iDBiARMuKXsfx1zVPSUFGA.text: This restaurant is absolutely delicious. Everything I've had has been amazing. The atmosphere is great too. The baked goat cheese with bread is....O.....M.....G, life changing! You have to try it. The only reason why I'm not giving it 5 stars is because it is a bit pricy for the portions and because the parking is a hassle. If you don't mind that though, this is a great place.

F0TeZL-sCeOYAfcIkQjttQ.text: Really great food and service. My water glass was never empty. I got the gnocchi tossed with mixed veggies. The texture of the gnocchi was perfect.  It could've used a little more sauce though. Also, it was a little too loud in the restaurant. Our waiter was soft spoken, and I had no idea what she said the first time she greeted our table. I also had a scratchy throat afterwards from raising my voice across the table during our visit.

KNN20tRN2ria_LoNVg9v0g.text: St. Francis holds a special place in my heart. It was where my husband & I had our 2nd date. Over the last few years I've gone here for holiday celebrations with loved ones, quick catch-up dinners with old friends & brunch dates with some of my favorite people. The ambience is warm & romantic while still feeling classy. It's considered a bit of a nicer downtown restaurant. The food is always amazing! You can tell they take pride in their menu! Everything tastes fresh & is just really well done. They also have one of my favorite moscatos! I highly recommend making it a point to try them out if you can!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wood-Oven Roasted Winter Squash
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tomato Baked Eggs
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh-Squeezed Grapefruit Juice

RcJANxLLXT53nOQ5yO6zxA.text: I am honestly sad to write this review. To start, have to give credit to our servers. Had 3 "touch" our table the other night and they were all excellent. We were happy and could care less about waiting for food (over an hour and 1/2, we did not order appetizers). They all kept apologizing for food taking so long. The place was not full by any means. If this review was service based alone, would be 5 stars. But, oh geez - the food was downright awful. As a central Phoenix neighbor have been going to St. Francis since day one. After I made a reservation a friend warned me that things had changed, wish had I listened to her. Our food was barely edible, all meals to our table were either undercooked/overcooked and made with wrong ingredients. Kids grilled cheese is now pepperjack on a bun? This used to be a great place with quality ingredients made well. See no reason to ever go back, too many other great restaurants in the area. Unless they get a new chef, do not see this place lasting much longer.

TcRMomU8AFk9j-u5wnnm3w.text: We have been coming here for years but last night was not good at all. Service was nice but slow. It took quite a bit of time to order drinks then a long wait to get beers. The we ordered the mushroom flatbread special which also took a long time to come out.....had about 5 slices of regular mushroom on it and was not baked well. We both ordered salmon but we waited so long that we asked for the check and left. All the wait staff were new and the menu was changed a bit. Must be a new owner, new chef, and new staff. We will not be back.

kiV4jfjzfjHzUc4pTMeNHw.text: Awesome--- this place was great dining experience. good food.  pork verde delicisou

GouovUn89SVJWTHHCVjzsQ.text: A business friend wanted to meet here for lunch. It's not in my normal neck of the woods so I had never heard of it before. I absolutely LOVED the atmosphere and our service was great. We sat outside next to people with a sweet small dog, the day was sunny and company was great.   We ordered delicious red sangria (only $5 until 5pm!) and enjoyed catching up. So far I was a 5/5 experience. For lunch we split the burrata and fig salad and the pork verde (the waitress said this was a favorite dish).   When the salad came out, it was a very small salad with a good sized slice of baguette with a healthy portion of both burrata and fig spread and a tiny bit of frisee salad next to it. Being a huge veggie person, I was disappointed in the lack of the absolutely delicious salad and the huge portion of baguette with too much sauce and not enough fig flavor, for my preference.   After that they brought us the chili verde. The meat was very chewy and the sauce was okay. We both politely ate what was in our plate but neither of us finished it or took home the leftovers. To be honest, I went home and got something else to eat because I was starving. For a $60 lunch for 2 (with 2 sangrias each) I didn't expect to go home hungry. I would be willing to come back again for the sangria and try something else on the menu, but the food was disappointing to me. If I could JUST get a nice sized bowl of the salad, I'd order that again in a heartbeat.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delish salad!
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pets are allowed in the patio. This was the cutie next to us.
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loved the company, atmosphere and salad, but wish the salad was bigger..

Unac_05mGvtR2Cbtcw3qXQ.text: St Francis is super cute for birthday dinners! At great way to get together! We made reservations and everything went as anticipated

b4pe3UEPrjIKQ3ZEHzR_nQ.text: First time here and honestly super yummy!   A friend and I came here hoping we could score some eggs Benedict, unfortunately I didn't do enough research and brunch is only served on Sunday's. We were so sad. However, our server was AMAZING! He offered to ask the chef to make us some breakfast and the chef agreed, after all that trouble we both settled for lunch lol. But I have to say CUSTOMER SERVICE was on point.   Next time I will come here to try their eggs Benedict. I ordered their bacon crispy onion burger with a side of fries. Everything was really good. The burger was a little dry for my preference but nothing a little ketchup cannot fix!   I love the space and atmosphere of this place i didn't realize they had an upstairs sitting area as well! Their menu is PERFECT pretty much to the point. And if you are familiar with my reviews short and sweet menus are like a BIG DEAL to me!   I am definitely planning to come back when my family from California is visiting for some Sunday brunch! To show them that yes I miss home but hey there's good food here too! :)

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

r0Yr8zyhJTUEGd8Xvz2mxQ.text: The food is good, although I wish there were more options. Service is standard, not bad- but not great either. I would return if someone else wanted to go, but probably not on my own.

gmAMDEF1MJykQMBpoR3q1w.text: Love this place. Used to go to brunch for a bartender who's moved, now we go for Shelly. And the food.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dinner at St. Francis, where we always go for Shelly at brunch, and finally saw her for dinner tonight.

PWB3fvzJFl2i3EwgU1bTPg.text: This place has good food and good service. I had the New York strip and my wife got the green chili. Wine was great and had a good time. I went to the elementary school st Francis so I always wanted to try it. They are just very proud of there little menu. Over priced and can't say I will return.

wwUNHiKgul3Wu48z9LQXgw.text: I really wanted to love this place, but I could only give it 3 stars.  Pros: servers, location, select menu Cons: small menu, parking lot was a little difficult to find, their margherita pizza gave me food poisoning Not sure if I'll return.

3R6Oq_Hp6-cAUUFUidK__A.text: This bar and restaurant is definitely for the higher class. It is very pricey, but you get soooo much quality with each order. My favorites are their happy hour cocktails.

fcmGuSck7hr5ajopTleYPg.text: The food here was absolutely unacceptable. I ordered the eggs benedict with pork loin--the pork, eggs, and biscuit on their own are of high quality. But I couldn't believe my eyes when this dish hit my table and--instead of seeing a layer of hollandaise atop my eggs--the biscuits were swimming in a pool of what appeared to be pure melted butter. Taken aback, I believed this was simply the way St. Francis has decided to prepare its eggs benedict--otherwise, surely no reasonably aware server would serve an eggs benedict with bare eggs and soaking wet biscuits.   Unfortunately, I went home after my meal to look at photos of the eggs benedict on Yelp, and it appears that the restaurant does usually utilize hollandaise sauce. So now I'm forced to wonder how anyone could ever imagine serving to me the inexcusable mess I received today. Phoenix Public Market Cafe is one of my favorite restaurants, but its sister establishment simply does not hold its own, at least not based on my experience today.

HjWlulTqP_FZ5-pXfThjiw.text: Been dying to come here and finally made it for dinner a couple of months back. We decided to start with a margherita flatbread, which was outstanding. Sometimes it's the simple things in life. I was a little more disappointed with dinner. I ordered the roasted chicken. It came in a cast iron dish which never allowed it to cool down and honestly made it a little challenging to eat. The chicken was a bit dry and tough and there weren't too many vegetables or potatoes.   I won't let this experience prohibit me from coming back and trying something else and giving it another shot though!

450MNLMpYD0V6qBSqw6Azw.text: If you're eating with someone, split the meal. I've eaten here twice. Both times I wish I would've split my meal.   Neither meal wow's me, in fact I went two weeks ago and cannot recall what I ate.   The service is pretty good. They do a good job of checking on you. I had the eggs Benedict and it was okay. Wasn't great, wasn't bad.   I will go back again if friends want to go simply because it's close to my location primarily.

YSJQ0kBC-B8btnh-1ijDlg.text: We ordered 3 dishes and were disappointed with 2.  Loaded Burrito and fingerling potatoes. Both great tasting.  Pig dip. We were excited to try it after so many raving reviews. The pork loin and jus were not good. We didn't like the pork loin taste. And the jus was not as expected and not worth a second dip. The bread was good, The cheese and onion marmalade had a good taste. The biggest disappointment was the caramel cinnamon roll . NOTHING like the pictures or description.  Mine looked like 3 smaller rolls and no caramel sauce. Mine had white frosting.  The roll was like biscuits not rolled like cinnamon rolls. And it was very DRY. $8  Skip it......

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caramel cinnamon Roll??? Was like 3 smaller buns, no rolled cinnamon. No caramel. Very Dry!!

NcDcaxfIP_Oatlm5zBKKZw.text: New owners, not the same St. Francis! ...  Having been to St. Francis many times I took my wife yesterday because she had never been there. Sad to say, as we walked up I noticed the place was dimly lit on the exterior and it looked like they hadn't had their landscaping done in a long time... I said nothing to my wife at the time because I didn't want to ruin it. As we entered I noticed the windows were dirty and the place just seemed unkempt. To my surprise, the normally packed bustling restaurant was dead! I really began to worry at this point but we persevered. We ordered some bruschetta to start and it came out with goat cheese, which wasn't on the description and neither of us like, sent it back...whatever, not a big deal. We then ordered and received our meals, I got the Moroccan meatballs which have always been great.... meatballs were ice cold in the middle!!! Yuck!!! I just hope they were cooked and then frozen because other wise I just had a bite of some lovely cold, uncooked pork! Server was good and apologetic... we asked to pay for our drinks and leave, he said don't worry about it, that it all was taken care of... we pressed to be charged for something so we could at least tip him, poor guy! Long story short, place sucks now, don't go! To the new owners, get it together or close down and stop wasting everybody's time!

PO53eYsZ7x6alO-7VyTwlg.text: It was my daughter's birthday. Since we all live in all parts of the valley, we often meet up in the center of town. This often means that our get-togethers are in Central Phoenix.  We opted to give St. Francis a try together as a group. I've eaten here for lunch on several occasions and was never disappointed. I figured that this would be a good birthday hangout for all of us to enjoy each other's company, in this pleasant atmosphere. All the while, enjoying this establishment's delectable offerings.  Unfortunately, I was disappointed. Let me start with the baker's board. It was a selection of treats only Otis Spunkmeyer can make. We had mealy sweet muffins, chokingly disgusting coconut macaroon and some very much not homemade danishes. I think Otis should come and demand royalties.   Next for the Eggs Benedict. My daughter and wife had this dish. The eggs were cold and tasteless. The salmon tasted raw.  Neither could finish them as they were that disgusting. My market side frittata was okay, but not very special. It was rather bland, all things considered.   It's a good thing we came loaded with gifts for our girl because the eats were no bueno.  Not sure what happened, but none of this was what I was expecting from one of my favorite lunch spots.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict with Salmon x2
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Marketside Fritata
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baker&#39;s board

ucJF1gGxLe0Ay0_uc40kPw.text: Awesome Brunch!  Wonderful live jazz music, delicious yummy Brunch drinks and menu.  We like to celebrate special occasions here and pop over for a business lunch.  Staff is super friendly and will bend over backwards to make sure you are taken care of.  Great sandwiches, salads and breakfast menu too!    Love the space, and patio area.  Worth a try, if you haven't, especially if you love to Brunch - it's a Phoenix classic!

EbghgOHwp-s9VXflPIu2lA.text: Really look forward to our next trip here. We came for brunch at noon on Sunday and had a good experience- they have live jazz music which is nice but super loud. I recommend requesting a table further from the stage. I ordered the pig sandwich which was hands down one of the best dip sandwiches!! Their fries are also very flavorful and crispy. Kyle got a burger, which he said was slightly overdone but looked delicious.  The mimosas are in champagne flutes and $8 each, so I skipped alcohol. The Bloody Mary looked ok, but Kyle didn't rave about it which means it was likely average.  Wayne had the French toast, and it looked like a large portion but very yummy.  Happy hour is in our future here for sure

NP3qR9XdyCrS9Hjo62QrjQ.text: Arrived to a modest exterior. Parking was great. Entered and was greeted and seated right away.  Ordered a champagne and checked out the menu.  Not going to get into what I ordered just that it wasn't great, and the obvious thing for food that isn't great means it is also overpriced.    The service was outstanding, the drinks were great out of the bottle...but the food...no.  Won't be back until they can make a dish that doesn't upset my stomach later. The aftermath wasn't fun.

WUBAus3WymmOpvkm3o8DFg.text: Great restaurant. Love the architecture. Food was wonderful. Great, attentive service as well. Recommend going before 6:00pm for reduced pricing. The Chile Pork Verde was awesome. Add over easy egg. Mix the cornbread with it ! Incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Chile Verde. Awesome !!

k9nmaAL7cFyUxhBQME1T-g.text: Have you been here recently? I was shocked  (in sadness ). St. Francis used to be one of my favorites spots (checked out my previous reviews). Unfortunately, the good and values are no longer support this business establishment to the STANDARDS as it used to represent.  I will not going back here!  This place has recently changed owner - it's simply suck! I was quite embarrassed...I brought my friends visiting international to this place on a Saturday (23rd of March to be exact). First Issue was reservation. I made a reservation via Yelp and requested for patio (main reason with this weather). We showed up & this request was not able to accommodate. The outside patio is half-empty. I asked the (acting like) a manager again, and he finally decided to seat us outside (Hence the One Star ...At least he's trying to make it right!) Second Issue was the Orange Juice. We asked the waiter, Nick, if they were fresh squeezed. "Yes" was the answer.  Come' on !!! Don't claim this if it is just freshly squeezed out of the box! Nick confirmed that he was mis-informed. Third Issue was the Egg Benedict was served without the hollandaise sauce...? What was really sad (and ironically...funny) there were three orders of Egg Benedict, two of them didn't have the hollandaise sauce. One  did! We asked for the sauce, and Nick brought them out. Sadly, none of the managers ever came out to said a word...of acknowledgment (so, sorry was a far-fetch!)

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All of these space, yet the outdoor seating was declined on first try...
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg Benedict (without Hollandaise Sauce - )
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg Benedict (with Hollandaise Sauce)

oDi2CcL1TiPbHbFQctWjHA.text: My boyfriend and I were so excited to try St. Francis  because we saw so many great reviews. I tried the pork chili verde (pictured), which was very delicious and flavorful, but the side of cornbread was dry and such a small portion that it wasn't enough to eat with my pork. I tried some of my boyfriend's salmon, which was well-cooked but also a smaller portion than anticipated.  The real disappointment was the vegan chocolate cake. It was dry and flavorless.  We might be back to try other dishes, but will not be trying any other desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I-W03N_n5R7G1Strwp3RYA.text: St.Francis ... what happened?  I havent been to St. in about 8 or 9 months because all the new restaurants in the area..maybe longer. It was such a fresh ingredient unique menu type place, on today's visit I was so strongly disappointed I will never go again.   First,  I went at 1:50 was told couldn't sit outside ( which was empty) because they had a party coming in..oook no biggie.. Keep in mind they close at 3. By the time we left... no party showed up.  Inside the whole restuarant was a mess. Just food on the floors, dirty tables seats looks like they need to be replaced on the benches, dirty tables... just horrible! Went to the bathroom and so dirty! not just busy dirty, dirty like it hasn't been deep cleaned in some time. Dirty like the walls are dirty, dirty.  Food came and my beet entree was horrible. Not just palate horrible, but esthetically made horrible. The beets were not fresh, the bacon was dry, it was just bad.  My Eggs Benedict was even worst. Eggs were thrown and hardly correctly made, Salmon was missing, and the potatoes weren't fully plated.   I dlsent it back and to credit the restuarant they did take it off the bill.. but I didnt eat it. Like non of it, at this point I was over St. Francis.   To the waiter I did tip 10 because he was nice.   St. Francis What happened!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. just bad

87QhMnKgyUHXIgUkUhuMzQ.text: The breads are amazing! Try the Baked Goat Cheese!  We arrived at St. Francis and they have free valet parking. We felt so bad for our valet because it was on a torrential monsoon evening.  In a beautifully designed dining room, hubby and I were seated at a table for two. It was still Happy Hour, so we ordered the Baked Goat Cheese. When it first came out, it looked good, but when we cut into it, it was cold and the tomato sauce was definitely under-developed. When they brought another serving back, it was perfectly done. All the flavors melded, and it was the star of the night.  The Caesar Salad was okay. The ingredients fresh, with shaved Parm. Yum!  I had to order a pizza after seeing the amazing pizza oven. The Margherita Pizza was fresh tasting with a crust that we used to sop up more of the Baked Goat Cheese.  We closed the evening with Crispy Fingerling Potatoes after we saw an order arrive at another table. The crispy rosemary was delicious. The portion was large.  Hubby and I also shared a delicious cocktail: Santa Rosa.   It was a delicious meal, but we agreed that the next time we came, we needed to reduce carbohydrate intake. We walked out high on carbs.

lpYlriuu9A69TXeegMaGww.text: Great little place, Anna is a great bar tender. Awesome food. Id come back for sure. Close to a lot of stuff too.

HuikMW_ZN6FPExD5i2bJTQ.text: I had a nice happy hour visit to the restaurant.  Their wine offerings for the $5 price were good with having 2 red choices.  I would have liked to see more vegan options on the menu.  The server Shaun was nice and attentive.  The decor was modern and hip.  The food was ok but nothing special.
