The dishes were all edible, I didn't have to "seagull choke" them down my gullet but every entree or salad I tried was very middle of the road. The ride was definitely not worth the price of admission. The service was mediocre, the beer and wine selection was limited. " I just don't get it?" maybe they were severing Kool-Aid at the exclusive entrance of the St Francis Skull and Bone secret society club? Good things to remark on; Auto Zone is a next door neighbor for your automotive needs and See's Candies is across the street for your sweet tooth?

QjPWyq7fHPCVGfKcb45Llw.text: The restaurant is really cute. Outdoor patio is perfect, small and cozy, but you don't feel crammed in. That is my absolute favorite part of the whole place, atmosphere is great and it can easily transport you and you don't feel like you're in the box in the middle of the parking lot. While all the food I've tried has been tasty, I always have hard time deciding on the menu. My only wish is that they expand a menu a little bit and include just a little more variety. But to summarize, I will be back, many times.

oABphw9e7lNqq4_Uwnsn-Q.text: We had such a nice lunch at St. Francis.  I was a bit surprised at the ceviche.  It was really 95% diced cucumber with only a few small pieces of shrimp and the heat level was pretty high.  It tells you there are chilis in it but it was much spicier than I expected.  Still - the flavor was good.  I just wouldn't call it ceviche personally.  And we had a burger - which also was very good with lots of fries.  They split the order for us so that was really nice as well.  Clean, bright, friendly staff.  Lots to choose from.

XV2-fZSL9LxYk75V0m28gg.text: Came here for Happy Hour and sat at the bar.  My friend recc a Basil/gratefruit/vodka cocktail that was so refreshing...before I knew it I had 3.  We had the heirloom tomato/pulled mozzarella salad and warm goat cheese with bruschetta.  All of the food was high quality, fresh and delicious!  Angel was a friendly and attentive bartender.  The only miss for me was that one of the bathroom's (1 out of 2) wasn't working..so a long line for the bathroom.. I'm also not a fan of the unisex bathroom.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hand pulled mozz and heirloom tomatoes salad... Perfecto
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Santa Rosa

9yX84OJXm5GuxfFsRA-7FQ.text: Love St Francis whether I go there with a group, a twosome or on my own...which is recommended as they treat you like royalty.  :)   My food choice is a little boring as I tend to go for the Salmon Super Food dish but at my most recent visit enjoyed the most delicious 'chicken sandwich' I have ever tasted while my date swooned over The Pig Dip.    Keep up the excellence, St Francis.

tFhiJJrkU16iRJJXOqH8-g.text: In the past have had great experience with food and service, but the new seating is terrible, having a foot distance between yourself and the next table really puts a damper on your dinner, your basically having dinner with your neighbor.  Overall vibe is fun good ok

BcyMv2erGGmY_vjwhM8wcw.text: Came here for brunch with a friend. I didn't have a negative experience at all, just thought the frittata and egg sandwich were ok. Nothing to get excited about. The bacon date scone was delicious. The coffee wasn't hot enough but other than that no complaints. Loved the live jazz and the service was good too. I would definitely go back.   I would love to see them do bottomless mimosas and Bloody's but they don't. That would be my one suggestion :)

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Summer vegetable frittata and orange vanilla soda.

RFWe9nQclmqauyALaiuFEA.text: Great drink deals and a wonderful atmosphere! A very cool building and very helpful employees :)

okC5PM28tYbdLj1-_YAyCA.text: First time coming to St Francis was this week. Was invited by a new business colleague and it did not disappoint.   I took my colleagues recommendation and ordered the Moroccan Meatballs. The sauce was unbelievable. The depth of flavors between the fresh tomatoes and the Moroccan spices was amazing. I was very impressed. I liked that the dish was served in a hot, cast iron skillet. The meatballs themselves had a great crust for added texture, though the inside was a bit on the dry side.   Dish was served with a slice of crostini that was perfect for dipping up the rest of that delicious tomato sauce.   Look forward to coming back and sampling more of the very diverse menu. The vibe was fun. Not too busy for lunch, though the restaurant was nearly full.

3l1HAnWHhoV2KHQ8GBvbQg.text: This place has a nice feel but the American breakfast was horrible. The service was just ok

67oWX_fko_EYMSejIfjc2Q.text: This restaurant tries too hard even though the waitress didn't.   The pig dip is the bee's knees but the flat bread was a soggy mess.

KcprU_zfU2g394A4fv13kw.text: I want to start by saying: I have been here a hand full of times and haven't experienced a visit like this one. I MADE A RESERVATION... I want to make that clear. We arrived with two guests who hadn't been there before and really wanted to impress them with one of our favorite joints in central Phoenix. We sat down at about 7:51pm and not one person had come to our table, not one, by 8:05. We asked someone walking by if we even had a server. A man came and promised the world. We decided to order a bottle of wine and by 8:40 we hadn't gotten it. We ordered an appetizer from another girl we made eye contact with and then our wine came and two seconds later came out app. I was embarrassed and my boyfriend asked for the manager. She offered to take our dinner order and or dessert then when she came over. We didn't want desert bc we hadn't even eaten dinner! I was really pissed but the manager comped our bottle of wine and fingerling potatoes. We went to another place close by and really enjoyed speedy service and attention from the wait staff. We will be back eventually but this was the worst service. P.s. this is a short summary of the way we were treated.... this is a long review but I don't want to barf it all out.

OmeYeYoEk_kIh0HsQS9DKA.text: Absolutely divine! Elevated, local food offerings - completely reasonable pricing for the quality received. Will return whenever we're back in town next!!

1l2gVEWCr1AR5zZCEAla5A.text: Food is always good. Upstairs seating area is pretty fantastic as well. Service can be a bit slow but it's worth the wait. Easy to get a table in the summer. Would recommend the filet. Presentation of the food is really impressive.

v-49TSOTGmK7XTiXub3tJg.text: Honestly was blown away by how fantastic this place was,the service was awesome,the food was incredible,way better than what I was expecting walking in,the cocktails were excellent,highly recommend the Santa Rosa! 5$ on happy hour before 6pm! Anyway,I will definitely be coming back,this me and my girlfriends new spot to come for date night,the only Reason I don't give five stars is because the menu was lacking in variety,very small would love to see more options!

HRNtshfRbM1YiXb2i0asdg.text: The ambience is nice, but the food was so so and far too pricey for what you get. Next time I'd try another place when in the area.

XfV_jBJMWWPakYyAv6PW0w.text: St Francis was the location of special date a few weekends back. We booked a table using OpenTable (on Yelp) for a Saturday and were promptly seated. I was stoked given the rave reviews and looked forward to a romantic dinner.  Until we were seated three feet away from a table of shrieking teens. Six of them.   (Eventually they left, and our dining experience remarkably improved. The volume returned to normal dining levels and it was possible to converse.)  Big shout out to Barry, our server, for doing everything possible to smooth things over. Even tho I had asked a manager (she was walking by) for an emergency Diet Coke (I forgot to eat all day) it was Barry who whisked it nano-seconds to our table. Barry also had a fresh Diet Coke at our table before a butterfly could possibly breathe. Our water glasses were never empty and our subsequent drinks were refreshed promptly.  Glass service is, in my opinion, a great indicator if a server is paying attention to your table. Barry was like frost on a window in winter. (A reference lost on Phoenix folks.) Except we never saw him unless it was necessary. He's that awesome.  St. Francis is a restaurant that will feed you and feed you well. (Big portions! Yummy stuff!)   I'm not kidding when I say "big portions". We shared the fingerling potatoes after scarfing a baguette down. There are enough potatoes on that plate to easily feed a family of four. (Seriously!)  We taste tested the Pork Chile Verde & the Pig Dip sandwich. I think if I had eaten the sandwich first I might have liked it more (as the cheese would have been warmer). I was wowed by the chile. I had to stop myself and remember to share. (It's not nice to eat all of the food when you're sharing :)   We sat on the main ground floor. I'd like to check out the outside bar / patio area next time. (Very cute!) I'd recommend booking a table alongside the walls if you're booking online. We were seated in the middle section. (We had traffic going both ways.)  The drink menu surprised me. St. Francis mixes a fabulous "Dark & Stormy"! We used to hunt around Manhattan trying to find the right ginger beer to make these. The Mixologist here has it down perfectly!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Pig Dip&#34; sammy. Nom!
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Perfect amount of spicy hot in Pork Chile Verde!
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fingerlings to feed a small country!

MMytCjMPNo60bVVF2P0ipQ.text: Another Diners Drive-Ins and Dives place...Gotta love when Guy visits the Valley! Overall fun experience. Good food, clean restaurant, friendly staff and just a good vibe. Fun place to go with a group of friends or just the two of you.

uCEf18B5dt6xHfLeZ0Vjxw.text: I give this place 5 stars for the food! My only teensy problem is the noise level and acoustics inside it also has super cute decor and a great patio area to enjoy our beautiful weather! We had the wild caught salmon with quinoa and it was cooked perfectly with a delicately browned crust and moist on the inside and truly the best tasting salmon and accompanying flavors that I've had in a very long time! "Cheers"

qSbfyeVl40rKHHrNBX0wLQ.text: We really enjoyed our first time! We were seated right away and they took our drink orders and we put in our son's order . We had the eggs benedict with pork loin,my husband had the french onion burger and my son had the kid's cheese pizza. Everything was very tasty,made with love, and quality ingredients. We love it when restaurants bring the kid's food first, which they did for us! The vibe was awesome, the decor was laid back and comfortable. We really enjoyed brunch, so much that we will come back for dinner ASAP!

Vczt6wlLE8wsSccU4g_CUg.text: Great friendly service and wonderful food! I've been here twice and will continue to come back.

5qTtiftqcLcYjBH9TfczYA.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants!  Everything on the menu is great.  My favorites include the baguette and baked goat cheese to start, the french onion burger, and pork chile verde.    The ambiance is second to none.  Modern landscaping invites you in.  There's an inside/outside bar with seats on the inside on one side and on the other side on the outside patio.  The patio wraps around and provides an intimate, relaxed dining experience.  The inside is more vibrant, with loud music playing (but not so loud that you can't have a conversation).  I also hear they have a great Sunday brunch with a jazz trio for entertainment.  It's a great spot if you're in Central Phoenix.

K4tG4Xw0mGX8mF-HCNSJ6A.text: Food was alright..nothing to talk about. The service was super slow and their booths suck. It has a joining cushion for two tables (picture sitting on pillows and your pillow is behind someone and your butt is touching theirs, no back support and drunk people who constantly hit you in your back because there's no divider) dumb idea to have a booth like that. Will not go back.

NtebSLWPO4GtgmuxzPBjbA.text: My second visit here, and this place never fails to satisfy.  Great food, friendly wait staff and pleasant atmosphere.  Great craft beers on tap and some real talent behind the bar.  If you want to avoid the crowds come on a Sunday night, but be careful, as the kitchen closes between 9 and 9:30PM.  No reservations needed on Sunday because the crowd doesn't show up on Sundays, but be sure to have a reservation on Friday or Saturday, because the place packs up pretty quickly.

hO1hMYySjk7X6JjtCe_DdQ.text: I love this swanky restaurant. Their staff is friendly and it is conveniently located. My only complaining is that I am not the only one who knows, so there is often a lengthy wait. I am also not a fan of valet parking, but hey- the food is worth it! The food is amazing! I won't lie I crave their perfectly cooked fingerling potatoes with their house made aioli.  If the noise level bothers you request seating outside or on the second floor. Both are perfect areas for small parties!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pr98sbahMvPCiqBwC1mklw.text: Great local restaurant with a very cool vibe. Super foods and vegan options. Repeat customers for brunch and thoroughly enjoyed the dinner options and cocktails.

WDBADUTgPZeO7nhAHE3_YQ.text: St. Francis is one of my favourite places for brunch in Phoenix. Its got an up class, trendy feel. American food with a pinch and pull from all over. Good brew selection, and mimosas and bloody Marys with brunch. Plus kids under 10 eat free.   The staff has always been friendly. I haven't had the slow service others have complained about. The food takes a while to come out but that is no fault of the server. The servers have always asked about my drink when they noticed it low.   My favourite menu item has been the eggs benedict with salmon, the hollandaise sauce is perfectly tangy and buttery! They used to be served with a side of fingerling potatoes, now they only throw a few on the plate. The pork chile verde is spicy and wonderfully seasoned. Its served with a large spoon and two slices of corn bread for the stew. I also love the cioppino; it's a spicy, red seafood stew. Definitely large enough to share IMO, and served with bread.   I've also come with friends for happy hour and just ordered appetizers and drinks. The feel was great and we all left happy and warmed by the fire on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunny side
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted chile verde con huevos
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Abstract but soothing wall art

PNgecUuEANLYzAIanUJaDw.text: Such a cute place! I will definitely be going back! My dad gave me a gift certificate after watching DD&D so the H and I checked it out. I got the biscuit and gravy, which was good, but a bit boring. My husband got a burger which he LOVED. I believe it was the one that they had on the show or something. It came highly recommended and did not let him down. The brunch bevvies were quite good as well.

--4LP64KSy6uwKshoio43Q.text: I'm really not sold on this place. I thought the appetizers that were raved about were average and unexciting.   I can only recommend the entrees. The pork chop was phenomenal.   Service gets an A+ as well..  BUT, it was also extremely loud and dark.  I could barely hear the person sitting across from me at our tiny table, and it was too dark to read the menu.  This was on a Tuesday. Very crowded, and I"m not sure what all the fuss is about.  If there's a wait, go somewhere else, it's not worth your trouble.  3 stars. Nothing great, but not really bad.  UPDATE: They also really chinced at Devoured. Only served a salad and a drink. Really did not showcase anything worth going there for.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chili verde
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0S0i-eP4zVTG-aCl8ixOjw.text: Stacy saw an iron skillet pancake on tv with apples and chocolate and other things - Obviously we had to come try it and it was everything she hoped it'd be. Dope place.

8embCgHiQ2NC01bgn9TIlg.text: I rarely am so happy about an experience that I think to write a review, but tonight was just great.   My boyfriend and I have conflicting schedules a lot of the time so I tend to dine alone (and am not upset about the solo time). On a Saturday night I assumed there would be a wait for an actual table so I opted to take a seat in the outdoor bar/lounge area. I faced the street, which might not be ideal for some people but was rather calming for myself.   My initial server was attentive and friendly, but the experience was later in the night when not only one, but three other servers stopped to see how I was doing.  I couldn't tell if this was a system set in place by the establishment or just the super genuine staff, but it didn't matter. Everyone who stopped seemed to care about my experience.    I appreciate you, St. Francis. Your team is on point.

Yf-tVBBWOh2jrnKrnaZ81Q.text: St Francis has one of the best happy hours in phx, and I love that it's everyday. My favorites are the fingerlings, the French onion burger and the flatbread. It's not on the HH menu, but I'd highly recommend ending your meal with their sticky toffee bread pudding. It's soooooo tasty and big enough to share with a group.

rhDXDGp3FxJ189uH4NkIHQ.text: Love St Francis! The drinks are a good start with the goat cheese, which is amazing. We love the pork chili verde, Moroccan meatballs, flat breads, and they have a couple of the best burgers in town. All the bread is made in house and it shows. I'm not a bread person but I eat it every time we visit. You can't go wrong at St. Francis.

_L9UCO0HdFGlJ1vUKe1yPg.text: Amazing food. Chicken salad sandwich was very good. They have a cheese pizza/flatbed that was amazing, the pepperoni one was a little more spicy,  but not too much.  Very good!! Mandatory valet. Enter in the front & exit out back.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken salad sandwich
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is the pizza (cheese only).

hXqWGss3wl5VF2HZ0tad2A.text: As entering the hostess didn't even help us out another hostess came by to acknowledge we were there This place is expensive for being so basic. Nothing special. Lighting was super dark so couldn't see your menu and The tables were so close it felt like a communion table. Food took forever for not being busy. But fries were tasty, drinks were good and, valet boys were super nice.

dzlWbbz_tIeCwdAcM2YfUA.text: My friend and I went on a Saturday night and had a very enjoyable dinner. The cucumber cooler was delicious and refreshing and my salad was perfectly dressed with an outstanding piece of mouth-watering salmon.  Truly the only disappointment was the valet service- if you want to call it that. When we left, we  handed the valet our ticket and he proceeded to give my friend her car keys and say, "Your car is just right over there." We were astounded to say the least. No tip for him, and a bad last impression.

0VfZjMiZi6X_Lo2wiUaZfw.text: I have not been to this place, but my daughter has and speaks on and on about them all the time, sounds like a great place but I am East Valley. Anyhow, she brought home pumpkin & apple pies from this place home for T Day and  had bragged on and on about them being the best pies ever. I didn't believe her and said we shall see, my sister makes some great homemade pies. Well.. I never want a pie from anywhere else ever !! The pies alone were literally the most flavorful, beautiful best tasting pies in the world to date thus far, but now I want to eat there . So excited to now have a meal there.What a GREAT introduction :)  Thank you!!

m8U3Qm_DODyjhZBYLCxGcQ.text: Came again for happy hour with two friends. This time, we salivated over the food with a glass (or two) of their happy hour drinks. I tried the Dark and Stormy- Fell in love. It was like a welcomed twist to the my go to whiskey ginger beer cocktail.   As for the food...We ordered the French Onion Burger (the best option in my opinion) and replaced the fries with fingerling potatoes ($2 extra). The fingerling potatoes were okay, should've just stuck with the fries. The burger, of course, did not disappoint. Also ordered the Meatballs, Pork Chili Verde and a cheese flatbread. Everything came straight out of the oven that so amazed us while waiting for our seats (we sat upstairs and it had a much quieter, less crowded feel with great views of the heads of palm tress haha). The Chili Verde was a favorite around the table but all four dishes were delicious and off the happy hour menu! Great finding random delights in the Arizona desert.

0ZqtbQk7D0uyNyWP76a1LQ.text: I've been to St. Francis a few times and everything has been very good. So far I've tried the following: Goat Cheese Appetizer - Generous portion size with fresh herbs and sauce Meatballs - Another huge portion size with lot's of flavor Veggie Flatbread - A vegan dish, you won't miss the cheese on this one Market Vegetable - This was broccoli with a lemon aioli and bread crumbs, I normally don't like broccoli but devoured this one. Cucumber cooler - great cucumber flavor, fresh and delicious!  Overall the food is quality and a great value. I look forward to trying more of their dishes. I would highly recommend St. Francis.

De2AmgVXv2c2pW_uWdn-iA.text: What a great scenery, delicious menu items and superb service from Kait, our server. We will be back for sure!

0FI76hiXFy6oaymxxy4Jcw.text: Nice decor and a short wait time but a $9 bloody Mary should be an f-ing perfect bloody Mary and too much citrus w/no black pepper is a major fail.  The chicken and egg salad thing was actually quite scrumptious and is the reason this isn't a 2-star rating as the service we received reminded me of my time spent in guantanamo bay: cold, lonely, and an altogether non-existent experience.  When I put plastic on the table I don't do it for the visual aesthetic it brings to the experience.

wy6VzAoJzbfiar06SORsxQ.text: First time here, and I wish it was better.  I have been hearing about this restaurant from everyone, saying how good it was and how trendy it became on the weekends.  But now that I think about it, these were all things I heard circa 2011-ish, so maybe St. Francis just isn't what it used to be?  That being said, I'll just jump right into what I didn't like.  We ordered the lunch special of the day, which was explained as a shrimp salad with mango salsa.  Sounds great, but what came to our table was 4 grilled jumbo shrimp on top of a couscous.  Now this was delicious, we scarfed it up, but if I was on some sort of gluten free or no carb diet, I would have been disappointed when the dish came out sans greens.  We also ordered the Morrocan meatballs, which were seasoned with WAY too much cumin.  It was overpowering.  I like the occasional cumin in Mexican and Moroccan fare, I even use it in my cooking quite often(even on steak and rib rubs) but this was way too much.  My mom and I each had a couple small bites and couldn't stomach it any longer.  I was SO sad, because the dish is on top of large balls of Israeli couscous and covered in melted mozzarella, and the cumin in the tomato sauce just overpowered it all.  Me reject melt-y, bubbling cheese?  Doesn't happen too often.  It is a cute little restaurant, and we may go back, I just wanted to share what I would have liked to know before going here(because I LOVE meatballs, and for my fellow meatball lover...heads up).

-dtGHaDcXcLg8KYgVl1NyA.text: Their egg sandwich is amazing. So is the bread. I just love this place.

CwUwB5BREuChrB3-L4Vfxw.text: i love love love this place! I feel like I'm in laguna when I'm there!! awesome Sunday brunch! best spicy bloodys ever! and the eggs Benedict? shut up!!! :)

_KKKqm7t33Y1Yznm-40K9A.text: There were three of us.  I had the forbidden rice bowl.  The others had pork chile verde and the French onion burger.  We all loved what we ordered.  The forbidden rice bowl uses a mystery black rice with vegetable and a special dressing.  The dressing is the magic.  You could put it on cardboard... Good service, atmosphere and food.  I will definitely return whenever I am in Phoenix.

iwHB7A03x7oR0OTBvhycSA.text: I went to St Francis for the first time. First,the service was exceptional! While waiting for my friends my server ( very nice guy from the Acoma reservation) brought me a complimentary tasting of the heirloom tomato salad, which was delish! The service, ambiance, and cuisine were great but unfortunately the entree was average at best (Fish). I will go again and try something else on the menu and definately will have the heirloom tomato salad again !!

oV-NkyyGqJQfZk_6w6KBjw.text: Came here on a work lunch and was very impressed.  Nice atmosphere, attentive service and very flavorful food.  Had the green chile burger and was one of the best burgers I have had.  I will likely skip the salad next time, but can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu.

bxfo7qjRP6ILoChlqGvfDQ.text: Hipster joint, for sure.  But you can't beat the cool half-indoors/half-outdoors bar area.  And the pork chile verde will bring me back soon!  It is a little noisy if you're trying to have real conversations over dinner.  But it's definitely worth it, considering the food & drink selection is tough to match!  Love this place ... my mouth is watering while I reminisce about the pork chile verde.  MMMMMMMM!

eJqogZCP5Ug-eHHIiVHtBg.text: Best salmon I have had!!!! Also the cucumber cooler is bomb!!!! Love it!

Dd07Yw_RHR5KuyVxwDQUFQ.text: I've had the pleasure of  trying St. Francis twice now... the latest  time, just last night, when I went with Yelp's one and only - the lovely Gabi - and her brand new hubby - Jared... plus my husband. It was a lovely double date, an occasion befitting the fun and hip vibe of this great little place.  They don't take reservations for parties under 6 people... so as a result we had to wait for a table especially having arrived on Friday night at 8:00pm. They told us 45 minute to 1 hour but the table was ready within about 1/2 and hour so that was a great way to start the evening.  The ambiance was great and our waiter was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu (he did screw up Gabi's order a bit which she wrote more about in her review...)   I started with an apple and hearts of palm salad which was the only salad option in the starters section - it was fresh and tasty... I had it without the creamy chowder dressing it comes with. For my entree, I had the flank steak that comes with a red wine reduction, fingerling potatoes and I substituted the creamed spinach it comes with, for the roasted vegetables (which are offered as a side on the menu.) It was a delicious dish! the meat was flavorful and the veggies light and fresh. We were too full for dessert but the options looked amazing!!!  The first time I dined there, I tried the veggie flat bread which was to  die for!!!  and I did try a couple of desserts that were ordered for the table... a chocolate mousse cake and the toffee pudding. They were, as they sound, delectable!!!  I could have done without the wait each time,  but overall I've had two great experiences at St. Francis!!!

ajusNcaaw_aQSykW6WthFA.text: Best burger ever! Every plate of food I have ordered there has been pretty amazing. Really cool atmosphere and my boyfriend is planning on having his next birthday party there.

2RaWzzbCzq-7a7DhQqbTuA.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere and how it looked like it belonged it a much more sophisticated city than Phoenix. That, however was the high point.  First, we were greeted by a man who was sitting at the counter eating his dinner. With a full mouth, he asked us how many in our party-gross! The service initially was decent, but at some point our server passed our table off to another server. We totally slipped through the cracks. No one came to ask us how everything was, if we needed anything, (we did), or even acknowledged us.  The food was decent but nothing to get excited about. Not a fan here.

hM57ApfVE9PnhhzWoU5UKg.text: As a chef, I was thoroughly pleased with this restaurant.  The decor, the service, and especially the food.  This was truly a winner!  I especially loved the movies that they had playing on the patio and the open kitchen.  I would strongly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a fun and casual night out with great eats!

SnWgVgdMpJVsUfkQX70-XQ.text: Heard about St. Francis from a friend and have been meaning to try it for a while now. We finally made it out and weren't disappointed. It's one of our new favorites. (Honestly every restaurant that has any sort of association to the LGO group turns out to be great in our experience, so we weren't surprised)  Decor is modern, atmosphere is great. We were there on a Tuesday night and the place was packed. They only take reservations for large parties so we had about a 30 min wait which we spent drinking on the outside patio. They have a bar along the front of the restaurant that opens up to both the restaurant inside and the patio outside, which is a really nice touch and adds to the atmosphere.  The food is upscale comfort food I guess? We started with the baked goat cheese app. It was flavorful and the pesto was such a good touch. The toasted bread was a little hard imo.  For dinner we had a bottle of the malbec which was outstanding. Both my wife and I thought it was one of the best $35 bottles (restaurant price obv) that we've ever had. We shared the burger and the pork chop. The burger was a perfect medium rare which made me happy. The pork chop was great and the polenta had a hint of horseradish. I couldn't have been happier. There wasn't any part of the meal we didn't think was perfect.  Oh, and for dessert have the sticky pudding. It's out of this world.  Overall it was a perfect night. Plus we felt like the prices were really reasonable. One caveat, as some others have said, it's a hopping place and is pretty loud inside. We love that, but we were commenting while there how our parents probably wouldn't like dining there because it's not a quiet relaxing place..We'll definitely be back though :)

MM5BgbVE1Vsw8xZ8mPIFiA.text: St. Francis, we live in a loud world and I thought the idea of having a delicious brunch, with an equally yummy Bloody Mary, was really appealing. The food is good and the service is getting sooooo much better but what is the deal with the Jazz trio IN the restaurant???  Seriously, we couldn't even hear ourselves talk!!!  You have to figure out what you're going to be during the weekends and I don't think Jazz Club is going to do you any favors.  I really need & want a relaxed environment so will just go down the street from now on.

0EN6y6AB0v2KTWHAkOnmPw.text: St. Francis is the patron saint of animals and he was a vegetarian so why does a restaurant named after him have I believe it was 1 veg entrees and 1 veg appetizer? The veg entree was a rice bowl. Rice is cheap. A rice bowl is big bowl of cheap simple carbs. Nothing special. I believe St. Francis would feel dishonored by this restaurant. Some of the fries I nibbled off my friend's plate were good but you can get good fries at nearly any place. Ketchup tasted store bought rather than made by the restaurant. Atmosphere was nice.

O3YP0fXY7SUSHcgWCP3pGQ.text: A friend recommended St Francis and I'm glad we listened.  What a great place.  Our server Amanda K. was so helpful, personable and knowledgeable I asked her how long she'd been working there expecting to hear a lengthy number.  I was shocked to find out 3 weeks!  This gal knew the menu and just what to recommend.  Within moments she had us hooked on trying more courses than we normally eat.  She was marvelous and made the evening just a little more fun.  The food was outstanding.  Taste, presentation and selection were unbelievable.  Lack of parking was the only down side.  This will be a place we frequent.

SDkW7P38v3Iu-iLsd8upXg.text: Came here the other day and had the worst service ever. The food was still amazing.

S0a9sSbnE2n9h9O8HxbYEg.text: Bacon and date scone was amazing. The rosemary fingerling potatoes are to die for! One of my fav places!

dF87tH-R_9ZwMjz2rww6Xw.text: After many failed attempts to drop in, we finally wised up and just made a reservation for Jeannie's birthday.  While everything looked fabulous, we couldn't really pull the trigger on what we wanted.  Took our time ordering and just settled in and  enjoyed some drinks.  Jeannie really liked her peartini...liked it so much she is on a peartini kick right now!    Feeling like big unadventurous lame-os, we ordered a mixed green salad and  a couple of French Onion Burgers.  Even a lame-o can score here!  The salad was very good, but the burgers were awesome.  I guess if you are paying $13 for a burger you are hoping for awesome.  Maybe everyone is just doing a better job at burgers these day.  The good news is that you can bring a burger person here and feel confident that they will walk away truly satisfied.  Still feel weird about ordering a burger here though....making a pledge to order a real St Francis entree next time.  Service was solid. Even though the place was packed and the waitress was very busy, she managed to take good care of us.   The architecture and the decor inside alone ( and the peartini!) was worth the trip.  Stopping in and hanging out the bar might be our next "no hamburgers allowed" visit.  Sitting on the street side of the bar might offer the best vantage point for soaking up the St. Francis ambiance..

JYlmmNI2N2kalE68Ko4lDw.text: I really hate to take away a star but I really wish that they would expand the menu. Everything on it is good, but there needs to be a bit more variety please. The Stew is great BTW!  We stopped in again the other night for Whitney E. birthday and had a great time. The service for our group of 12 was splendid and they even accommodated the cake we brought in. Thank you St. Francis!

Wb1vKZqUbGPPkEF5M3KLng.text: I don't know. I really wanted to like this place. Service was really slow. Akward stair case if you want to sit on top. Food was mediocre.  Odd corn chowder. Disappointed sadly.

0R6ZapuJX-v80EU4Mg4PnQ.text: Visiting with some girlfriends and came upon this gem, wow!! The truffle fries are to die for and the burger too- so good!!! The service was fantastic and I will definitely return when in the area

C5r5b8Zqc1xIX5XZQjNYww.text: Some of the best cuisine I've eaten in Phoenix! If you like bold fresh flavors, this your place

TbYfjyk4TfbkGSDzxiWgwQ.text: I've been going here for 8 years but ever since it changed owners the quality has gone down tremendously! We sent back a burger that was charred and burnt and were told that it would come out the same so we should order something else. Wow! I'm soarily disappointed in the low quality food that is being served. Tonight is the last night that I'll eat here. I post this in hopes that the ownership will hear this and maybe realize that quality matters too.

ytRsTmDBIjHiLblytFC_1g.text: Love this place!  If you eat meat you have to try the pork chili verde.  The pancakes and the cinnamon rolls are also to die for!  The Sunday brunch music is a bit loud for me, so we usually sit as far away from the stage as possible.  Service is usually good, drink and food are GREAT!

mp0hZU2F39LDc5rkhTBZqw.text: I absolutely loved my experience at St. Francis several years ago, however tonight was disappointing. Gnocchi was over salted and full of cream with marginal vegetables. Although, Meatballs were a hit for an appetizer. Fish was overdone. Service inattentive. Overall, sad experience from what it was years ago.

Ne2fopQlUQSourzK6nZx9g.text: We thoroughly enjoyed a brunch here while visiting Phoenix.  Service was just right - not intrusive but attentive. The kids menu is great with good sized portions.  I had the quinoa bowl with avocado and it was so good, with veggies and quinoa cooked just right.  My friend had the green Chile skillet, and enjoyed it very much as well.  We will definitely return here when we come back to Phoenix!

koO9UtKQgZq2Qlq1FuuGqA.text: Amazing place! It's frustrating how it seems impossible to get 5 stars on Yelp nowadays because St.Francis is certainly a 5 star restaurant. Their happy hour drink specials are great -$5 for specialty cocktails AND they have happy hour on Saturdays! The happy hour food is basically a few bucks knocked off of some normal menu items. The only time we come here is for happy hour as they are a bit pricey. They have menu items that change with the season so you get the freshest food. Last time I was here I ordered roasted cauliflower from the vegetable section of the menu, this time I got the zucchini chips. Both so so good, how are vegetables this tasty?? The squash and zucchini chips came with 3 different dipping sauces that were all 3 amazing. It made us regret ordering the flatbread (basically exactly like a skinny pizza) because we just wanted more squash. My husband got the mushroom burger and he said it was great. I also got corn bisque which was good, it was soup, nothing to impress. The two cocktails I got were high quality and refreshing, the cucumber cooler and Santa Rosa. Great service, great high quality food, and beautiful ambiance - shouldn't that get 5 stars?

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flatbread, zucchini crisps, corn bisque.

W0doWKrPbwIdlf8KR12oYg.text: I love St Francis for dinner but had never tried their brunch. First, mimosas were solid but overpriced $8, no refill. Some places offer bottomless or as part of your brunch. But the coffee toffee scone with whipped creme fraiche was unreal, scone wasn't too dry, you could taste the different notes of coffee & toffee and the topping was the kicker. I had a mushroom omelette, ok but was kinda dry & needed more cheese. My friend had the biscuit & gravy which was delicious but needed more sausage in the gravy. Overall tasty with great service...just needed a few tweaks

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mimosas &amp; scone

g1xSksa4Kyj-ERsT5yoHZg.text: Really nice ambiance and great food! Our server Chris was very friendly and went above and beyond to take great care of us! We had the beet salad with shrimp, the spaghetti squash with chicken, and the pork chile verde, all amazing!! I've also had the Moroccan meatballs before and they're delicious. I definitely recommend checking this place out if you're looking for a restaurant downtown (:

ih6l5bGiCR4Sr6hUbVL6Ng.text: After years of utilizing Yelp to find restaurants, this morning I had such an horrible experience at this establishment that I finally signed up just to leave this review... My wife, I and our 8 year old son decided we wanted to go to Sunday Jazz brunch. We have eaten here a bunch of times when our son was younger and always had a wonderful experience. This time however we were barely acknowledged when we walked in the door. The two young hostesses finally, in a discouraging tone, told us that there would be a 30 min wait. Before we could have a chance to respond they already started talking with each other again. We stood for minutes until she finally replied "Oh, did you want to put your name in?" again in a discouraging tone. We were already sitting in the small waiting area... obviously the answer was yes. We were waiting about 15 min when a woman with 3 boys came in. She was told they would seat her at a bigger table than she required and did so. We shrugged it off because they had 1 more person than us. The next party to enter was an obvious friend of the hostess. They also had a party of 3 and asked "Can you get us in?" They were greeted with " Got a table finishing up right now we'll seat you right away. My wife then asked if they had forgotten about us. They then stated "Oh no... they have a reservation." We were in earshot and heard the entire conversation.   The attitude and demeanor of these hostesses as if we were undeserving of their time. I've felt this a time or two over the years because my wife and I are a mixed race couple, but never in a establishment as well known and named after a Saint no less. Simply disgusting! Shame

4o5A2SxQwarLw1PXVdB3DQ.text: Warm atmosphere, friendly and prompt service, and great food. I made a reservation for Valentines Day and was seated immediately. They had a special Valentine menu that was extremely impressive. From our sexy cocktails to our plates, everything was delicious. Pleasent experience overall.

MkZw1iGN7K04a33yLhoFwQ.text: Crap crap totally empty wouldn't allow us to sit at a bigger table the outside was messy the inside was dirty the hostess was rude will not be back ever too many nice places that are clean to go to

wMA_8VmgJW7xK6rJerJYtg.text: Was recommended to visit this place by another restaurant (oddly enough).  The recommendation couldn't have been better.  We had the dry rubbed wings, rice bowl with salmon and the whiskey bourbon burger.  All were phenomenal- so full of awesome flavor.  Our waitress, Gabby, was super personable and friendly and really made our visit memorable.  Would definitely recommend this place to others and will definitely be back.

zOnoXyXf_f5zdKljfyrNLw.text: This used to be my favorite resturaunt. But after dinner on my birthday and brunch a couple days later, it's lost it's luster for me. The service, the food, the menu are all just meh. I'm so bummed.

hEDn5dbW_-jJVYhYfClKaQ.text: I've always loved this place. Started casually coming here about 6 years ago or so, but the food and ambience has always been top notch.

0Mj7wcKLT94EbqIzeuOxBA.text: Well the beet salad was good but the pig sandwich horrible better at Arby's also they realized they screwed up and instead of making another sandwich they gave me a bowl with some onions in it. They were cold I won't be back nor do I see what all the hype is about.

rEyMg7zEuoles0_vzXP9Ww.text: We had a 5:45 reservation on a Thursday night for 6 guests.  Since they open at 4, thought we could beat the crowd. There was plenty of open tables, but were seated in a booth, which would have been fine except one side of the table didn't have a back to the seat (meaning once they seated the table in back of us, we were literally back to back).    Our drink orders took a while and our meals did as well.  The waitress forgot an order for soup and made a couple errors in our order.   The food was ok but not impressive.     Having an early reservation I would not have expected a two hour dinner.

lG48AlqHIsS8Q9RjO3E2og.text: Great service, unique atmosphere, and the most boring salmon dish.  The other person in the party enjoyed the Pig entree greatly.

O1aBAY60vIY4w8r76IF5og.text: Heard great things about this place and was sorely disappointed. We arrived 20 minutes after opening so it was not busy. Took 3 staff members including the manager (within 5-10 feet of us) more than a minute to acknowledge our existence. Bartender was nice but they were out of many items on Happy Hour menu and from what we were told it seemed like this wasn't something that happened recently. It was printed on plain paper and could have easily been reprinted and updated. There was a ton of staff but I have had better customer service experiences from a computer. Had the pork chili verde, which was just okay. Quite a bit overpriced. I understand paying for quality or an awesome experience but this was neither of the two.

F11DOtVKrkSM8NTlGkOytw.text: When St. Francis was featured on Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives; I thought we would try it for the novelty.  After having brunch today, St. Francis is one of our must stop places when in Phoenix!  Atmosphere is great, service is exceptional, and the food really is "off the hook".  Don't pass up the chance to visit St. Francis.  Order the Iron Skillet Pancake and share with the whole table!

OB01SIWQUpdNy1za72yOAA.text: Saw this place on DDD so we had to try it. My wife and I decide to celebrate our anniversary with dinner here. The food was as good as we expected and the servings are plentiful. If you're looking for something different and good this place will fit the bill.

jH8sgaZmBeLbND9a79XLdg.text: Love this restaurant! The food was delicious (my favorite is the Wood-fired Roasted Chicken or maybe the Pork Chop, I can't decide which is better).  My husband loved the trout and orders it every time.  They also have a great beverage list and the Cactus Margarita, while a little pricey, is excellent.  We will be regulars!

H-jxGLK2XAkCSBJ0TRNUaA.text: Try this place. I've only been to the weekend brunch (twice) and it has been really good both times. It's that New American, Farm-to-table, Eat-Local kind of place which is great. It' also used to be an old bank so there are some of the old bank features still hiding in plain sight.

5VRKPUmp8nFFBpE8RPaIgA.text: The first time we came to St. Francis, the food was great, service was fast, and atmosphere was memorable.  Last night, everything seemed to start off great.  I booked a reservation on Open Table, we were seated immediately.  After ordering, it was apparent that they were understaffed and the kitchen was running behind.    I ordered the prime hanger steak with mashed potatoes and seasonal vegetables and my wife ordered the salmon superfood with quinoa salad.  We shared the wood fired broccoli with aioli.  After almost an hour, we finally got our food.  My steak was luke warm, potatoes cold, and vegetables undercooked.  My wife's salmon was piping hot, straight off the stove.  The food was delicious, however, sub-par execution in service from both in house waitress and back end kitchen.    At the end of our meal, my wife asked for a box for part of her salmon that she didn't finish.  At the same time, our waitress dropped the check off without asking if we wanted anything further.  Needless to say, I was unimpressed, offended, and will never return.    Maybe it was a fluke, maybe it was because we were sitting on the 2nd floor, maybe it was just our server.  Try it out for yourself.

OBGfX9bG91Rwn1oeuWMa_w.text: I read all the great reviews about St. Francis and so when I came out to Phoenix on vacation I made sure we went.  We weren't disappointed. First I ordered the wood roasted broccoli salad.  This ended up being an appetizer and it was gone in about 1 minute.  So delicious!  Then we had the baked goat cheese appetizer.  Another yummy experience. Our party of four each ordered something different; the pot roast, the Moroccan meatballs, the pig dip sandwich and the roasted chicken.  Everything was perfect.  The food is out of this world!  So nice that this restaurant is centrally located as my family lives on the west side and it was so easy to get to.  The food is so different than I usually experience in Phoenix.  A very nice change.   I will be going back every time I go to Phoenix from now on.  Dinner for the four of us, including 2 desserts, drinks and a 20% tip came to just under $200.  Very reasonable I think.  The staff (and the valets too!) were friendly and helpful.  The restaurant is a little noisy as some have mentioned but you can still have a conversation without having to struggle.   I still can't stop thinking about that roasted broccoli salad - OMG!

mzz9GPO57PeZRBIupdzZlQ.text: A business colleague and I were visiting Phoenix and when we asked for dinner recommendations, St. Francis was one of two. The local pointed out that St. Francis largely uses locally bought veggies, in particular, while also having great food.  Walking into St. Francis, it's clearly an eclectic, fun environment. The menu is just as attractively unusual -- and every appetizer, drink and dish we ordered was delicious and full of flavor.  The goat cheese appetizer wasa good -- the meatball appetizer was great. The almond margarita was unique, tasty and strong. We also had the roast chicken and pork chop - both were excellent. It seemed a little unusual to have just a piece of chicken on the plate, but the "sides" were under the chicken, and on top. The flavor was amazing - the fresh veg made all the difference.  The service was friendly and attentive, knowledgeable about the menu, and ready with recommendations. We happened to go at happy hour, which features an impressive range of options - bonus!  Can't wait to return to St. Francis next time I'm in Phoenix.

eV6hchV6DkxfW_iUDRNV2A.text: Great restaurant, with fine cocktails and good ambiance.  I give it three stars because of their terrible parking situation, which is "complimentary" valet.  First of all, it's totally inconvenient because it adds an extra 5-10 mins to your visit as you have to hand off your keys when you get there and then wait around for them to fetch your car when you're ready to leave.  And valets are never truly complimentary, as tipping the valet is standard.  Get it together St. Francis!  This is Phoenix, not DC, NYC or Chicago.

54SXP2mfz0g-Y72EATZwpw.text: Decided to try St.Francis with my daughter for a fun Mommy/Daughter day. I didn't know kids ate free until I received my bill so I was a bit surprised.   Upon entering the ambiance was great, it was lunch time and not filled with too many customers so seating was quick. Our server was a young man who was great. I would recommend this restaurant however because I realized the food was a bit bitter and over-salted, it was the beginning of a bad lunch experience. I noticed upon eating my meal (pork chili verde) The majority of the meat had a lot of fat chunks in it. I could tell the meal was pre-made possibly 4 days prior because of the pockets in the food. It all became valid when I became aware that my meal was not made fresh due to the clear wrap that was melted in the dish, almost as if it was reheated in a microwave and tossed into the oven to thoroughly heat. Left-over food is not what I was looking to spend money on, however I paid my bill & left a tip because our food issue was not with the server.   If your looking for quality, I would not recommend St. Francis. Yes, the name sounds great; but behind the name there is a owner not doing his/her job when it comes to quality control. We will not return.

4XlaAjFSNMcZ6q-G3b5t4w.text: Love.  Perfect place for an amazing date :-)  Delicious food, great ambiance, nice staff and a killer view.   Love (again).

7SDVleSnAjcJL7xSNK6MNA.text: Love it!  Amazing food. I always thought it was a fancy place so never stopped. Wrong!  Cool atmosphere, very family friendly.  Will go back!

oyK-i6QC1gEqSRyoE-P0hA.text: This place was amazing.  I'm so glad I found it while on a business trip in Phoenix.  The space is beautiful, and I really enjoyed sitting outside on the patio.  I came here with two other co-workers, and we each had a craving for something different.  At first, I was concerned that one of them wouldn't be that impressed with this place, but all three of us ended up loving it!  We each found something good on the menu, one had a good beer, another a good wine, while I enjoyed a mixed drink.  I will definitely come back if I'm back in Phoenix.

8HTwpcsFNHlAuspnE0rCuw.text: Remains one of my all time favorites near downtown. Food is always fresh and cooked to perfection. Drinks and staff are awesome.

IDlqtfI89DqmDirnvsQt2Q.text: Maybe it was just the dishes I got...but based on word of mouth and the reviews I had been excited to try this place and was disappointed  overall. We got a variety of flatbread pizzas to share and they were just ok. Then for my entree I split the Moroccan  meatballs and brussel sprout  salad with another girl. I liked the brussel sprout salad...but wasn't a fan of the meatballs at all. Alllllll I could taste was cumin. I actually love cumin so it surprises me that I didn't like it...but that was the only flavor. Needed salt badly too. The saving grace for the meal was the sticky toffee pudding for desert. That started an obsession and now I make it at home. Had it not been for the dessert tho I would have given it maybe 2 stars. Hoping I just picked some not so great dishes but then again I don't think I'll be back to find out

cTbNutUmQESCxfZdv_xE_g.text: A packed lunch hour shows off the kitchen rocking.  A few minor tweaks indicate management is aware of the kitchen's organization, as well as food protection.  Awesome romaine salad, prosciutto and, fig flatbread, and roasted vegetables. Nice wine pours.   Really comfortable, stimulating digs to unwind the week.   Thank you for the consistent reprieve!

F615V1LvgdJnt_9cWLr__A.text: My third visit here, not sure if I'll make a fourth.  After a lot of attempts we finally made it here for their brunch menu.   My mother had been wanting to try their skillet pancake after seeing it on Food Network.  I was looking forward to having their Eggs Benedict with salmon again.    Our service with Ryan was good.  We had a couple issues with our dishes though.   A side order of bacon that we'd requested as "crispy" was not, and the skillet pancakes apparently are not made fresh upon ordering? There was some ore made in the kitchen visable from entering the restaraunt and when served they failed to come with the cooked apples and whipped cream on top.  We had to ask for them and server then noticed they were bare .  After all the anticipation it was less than stellar.  My eggs Benedict : eggs were cold and although poached, they were very undercooked still.  The inside whites were visably raw and watery.

_DQV4yy07iRZpbVuqiAjyQ.text: One of my fav. place to go to in AZ. I like the design and the modern feeling I get from being in this place. 4/5 for food. I love their chicken salad sandwich and the pork chili verde. Staffs are ok. Feel like hit and miss. Sometime you get good service sometime it's ok. Parking may be a concern if you don't like valet parking. Also one time my friend stayed late after the valet guy shift ended. Instead of handing the keys to the other available staff the vallet guy stuck the keys in the ignition and left. I'm not sure if it's pure laziness or a few loose screws but someone could have stolen the car.   **This review was based on my prior visits before my plant based diet**

bZp19MdFZ8SoscRBjswpuA.text: Service was great and happy hour specials in Friday were amazing and delicious! Can't wait to go back!

JlvWIOJDTojUNSrtOl90Hg.text: I think St. Francis is great - if you don't pay full price. I've probably been 6-8 times now - once for brunch and the rest of the times at night - and I simply haven't left with as positive of a feeling if I've not been at HH or not ordered one of the more affordable entrees.   For example, I once went for a friend's birthday dinner and got a fish entree in the $30 range. While it was good, I simply couldn't stomach paying $70 for an appetizer, entree and two drinks. And that was just for me. By the time my husband was factored in, we had spent the kind of money we'd spend for a five-star meal at a nice steakhouse.   Same goes for brunch. While I can excuse paying $10-$13 for an entree if bloodys and mimosas are under $6, I can't if I have to pay $8-$9 just to whet my whistle. That said, I would probably pay $8 or $9 just for that delicious, succulent cinnamon roll. MMM - calories be damned.   Anyway, my friend recently introduced me to HH at St. Francis, where you can get their delicious cocktails (the Black Daisy is a tequila lover's dream) for $5 and food items for as low as $4. The Forbidden Rice Bowl (one of my typical choices to save money after that initial fish entree experience) is only $8 and is both exotic and filling.   There are many who rave about St. Francis and clearly, I like it enough to keep going back, but I just like to pay a little less for it. More money to spend at the tons of other great restaurants nearby!

vjdpIbfVTXDiY2pkMij9_w.text: What a wonderful restaurant!  The food is amazing: bold but balanced flavors in original, interesting and absolutely ecstatic combinations. The environment is comfortable and friendly, if a tiny bit hipster-ish, but ultimately a lovely place for dinner. 6 stars if I could give 'em!

ERbco59gEjxYuHvmxczJPA.text: Excellent service and was seated very quickly for an Sunday brunch. Love the giant cinnamon rolls and the brunch drinks where great. It's a cozy little spot for a weekend brunch with the girls and I will be returning.

z2FUxW7xtu2DYaEV18z-sw.text: DELICIOUS!!!  Had an early dinner here about two weeks ago.  To say that the food and the service here were outstanding is a gross understatement.  We started with the housemade baguette and the crispy fingerling potatoes.  The baguette was crusty on the outside and chewy on the inside.  We learned that the bread is baked in the restaurant's wood fired brick oven every night - and we took a loaf home (ask your server!).  The crispy fingerling potatoes were perhaps THE BEST POTATOES I have ever eaten.  Fried to a crispy outside, with a fluffy, tender inside, the potatoes were dusted with just a hint of herbs and sea salt.  The "appetizer" was perhaps as much as a pound of potatoes.  We ate so many we almost didn't have room for dinner!  For our entress, we had Wood Fired Stuffed Peppers, Moroccan Meatballs and a meat flatbread.  All entrees were hot, flavorful, and beautifully plated.  The Stuffed Peppers and Moroccan Meatballs were chock full of exotic flavors and the flatbread had an incredible crisp but puffy crust.  For desert, we had chocolate cake and sticky toffee pudding.  My wife and daughter thought the chocolate cake may have been the best they've ever had.  We all thought that the sticky toffee pudding was so sweet and caramelly that it should probably be illegal :-)  The wine and beer list is small, but had excellent choices.  The cost for dinner and drinks for three of us was less than $100.  We will most definitely be back!

hpRmY6QMsmA0ZNucM-LOVQ.text: My mom and I decided to give this place a try after we saw it on Triple D. I love the atmosphere and the staff was friendly. The waitress was attentive in the beginning but once it got a little busier, we didn't see her again for a while and a different person had to grab our check which took forever. I appreciate that the food is mostly local and you can tell it's fresh. The bread is baked in house which is nice but every piece of bread I tried was hard and chewy. We had the goat cheese as the appetizer which was pretty amazing. As for the entrees, we tried the pork chile verde and the pig dip. They were okay but nothing great for what they charge. I'm disappointed but hopefully I will get a chance to go back and try more flavorful entrees.

lH96HdCvl4LF_hQRUcnD7A.text: I dined at this place last week based on the great reviews here.  I was quite impressed with the place, waiting area and bar.  I was disappointed that there was a 45 min wait on a Wednesday night!  I had an apple martini by the bar while waiting, which was amazing as it tasted very natural with a thin apple slice.    After 30 mins or so, I was seated with my guest.  It was another wait to get the waiter and when we placed the order was another wait as well.  I ordered the pork chop and my guest ordered the roasted chicken. I was unimpressed by either orders when we got it.  For $24 pork chop I expected at least 2 of them and $21 roasted chicken (a drumstick and a thigh) was over priced.  Both orders were good but not worth it's price.    The place has a great ambience and would have drinks during happy hour but I wouldn't eat here again.

3om9JwSCO4fpP0jNQ4D1PA.text: We did Brunch here on Sunday for my brothers 40th birthday.  This place is busy and deservedly so.   We arrived early and did bloody Mary's outside while we waited on Matt & Ashley.   The drinks were spicy and delicious,  what a great start to our morning.  We were seated promptly at noon and Christy was our server.  Bright, Energetic and Happy to serve!  The food was terrific,  hot and as requested.  Coffee and water was constantly refilled and the dirty dishes removed immediately.   All in all, a great place to be! Great food great service great company!

tvUjYAqVcKSZw8bf4uw_0Q.text: A staple in Phoenix. Usually very good. This time was a little different. It was very busy which I always like.  Our reservation was for 830 and we arrived a little early for a a drink. They were very skimpy on their pours. Very weak drinks. We were sat exactly at 830 and our server was very courteous. Service was SLOW. We waited about 30 minutes before we received our appetizer. It was the hummus appetizer and was very tasty. Served with flat bread. For entree I had the roasted chicken. I thought the flavor was great but skin could have been crispier.  My partner had the pot roast and his comment was it was nothing special.  This is the issue with established restaurants, they sometimes become complacent. I'll be back because I have a gift axed I need to use up.

GQpvQneO3SatVlYxMgWtIg.text: A bit of a trendy downtown-type place, but food is amazing and the ambiance is very cool. When we went on Thursday night it was pretty busy, although the patio was closed (probably a good thing on a summer night). The only downside was that we had to wait a while fire our server to check in on us and others seemed to gaffe the same issue. Not sure if it was unusually buddy for a midweek night, our if they need an extra server or two to help distribute the attention to the customers.   Overall, though, a great experience, we look forward to returning to St. Francis!

jYz7u1YUVFizyuaxrBRVbA.text: I went with an open mind and really wanting to enjoy the restaurant, as I have heard and read nothing but good things. Our party was that of 9 people mostly couples who were ready to drink and eat the night away, which we did, but a few of us went home with upset stomachs, which could have been from any number of dishes we shared before our main course.   Here we go:  Started with multiple Flat breads (Fig, Smoked salmon and cheese) for the table and three bottles of wine, which were fantastic all around. After the breads we decided we had not yet had our fill of the appetizers and decided to order the baked goat cheese that also turned out to be tasty.   For dinner the table ordered multiple dishes that consisted of Seafood Cioppino, The Burger  & Fries, Meatball oven dish, roasted chicken and white fish, which is funny that between the whole group we basically all ordered the same thing in one way or another.   We all shred the dishes and they were all pretty good, but not outstanding, but perhaps this is due to the hype surrounding the restaurant and the overwhelming numbers that praise it as the next coming, but for me i wasn't wowed by anything i had that night and got the same feedback from the other guests. It wa snot that the food was bad, but it wasn't great , which i had expected.   The service was great and the atmosphere was worth the price of admission, but the real problem came later in the evening when another guest and I both got ill and both had shared similar dishes for dinner. I wouldn't normally be so quick to blame the food i had just had before i became ill in this manner, but the fact remains two of us who had the same dishes both left and then had unpleasant experiences later.   Overall the place was cool, and I am sure I will return for drinks only, as I enjoyed the bar area, but when choosing a spot for dinner I am doubting I would suggest it to friends given the end result.

XzgYxa6CFKQ6f0nizMUl2w.text: Best Salmon I have ever had. Great seasonal menu. Healthy. Fast service. Very pleased. Andrew was a great server! Never had a moment to wait for anything!

X-Z9NNJFFFBezZesPhZs6A.text: I loved St. Francis.  The service was awesome, all of the waiters were extremely nice.  They went out of their way to accommodate us when I called ahead and mentioned several members of our party were disabled.  The executive chef himself helped bring out some of our dishes, what a great atmosphere.  The food was FANTASTIC.  I'm from LA, and was told there "wasn't a food scene" in Phoenix.  I now know that isn't True.  Great prices for truly remarkable little dishes.  The goat cheese crostini is unreal.  You must, must, must have it. The pig dip sandwich is fantastic (and huge) The salads are nice, fresh, and beautiful The meatballs are tasty and unique  Check out St. Francis, they deserve your time!

nRHDul0fyDLkRUAlCoobjA.text: Two Words: HAPPY. HOUR.  Amazing cocktails are only $5 during Happy Hour - every day from 3-6pm. Arrive on the earlier end of Happy Hour to snag the best table before the crowds arrive.   I love the atmosphere - trendy and classy, without pomp and circumstance. I have eaten there in jeans and a t-shirt, and also in a dress with heels (okay, I lied...I can't walk in heels..but you get the idea.). The staff is friendly and accommodating to special orders, and the Happy Hour also offers great deals on food.   The menu is somewhat seasonal with some dishes staying consistent and some new additions every few months. Personally, I do wish they offered a few more vegetarian/vegan options, but it is still a great place for people of all dietary needs!   Must Try: Fingerling Potatoes.

Mr37Z4lL4SMcjwoGtj5IhQ.text: 4 stars for this restaurant. Can't give it 5 yet as there is so many more items on the menu I want to try. Great atmosphere and the flatbreads were fantastic.

rtIqiJ72LxqmR6rBA_ilPw.text: Visiting Pheonix for work (shocker) and had a hard time trying to pick a restaurant.  I looked on Yelp, I read reviews.....but in the end had a hard time finding a restaurant that fit all the criteria (good atomsphere for a "table for one", good food and within hotel shuttle distance).  AWESOME CHOICE.  Thanks to the bartender at the Hilton Suites recommendation.  The atomsphere was awesome with an open airy space, a view of the kitchen when you first walk in.  I was sat on the second (top) level and it was nice with great natural light. I got the farm salad and honestly one of the best salads I have ever had....very light and fresh.  As an entree I got the Pork Verde.....AWESOME.  It came in a cast iron skillet with a side of sweet corn bread (don't forget I am from Georgia).  :)  It also had pablano peppers and some cheese.  Nuff said. After dinner I went back downstairs to the bar to have one last cocktail.  I had the St. Francis Lemonade.....in both stawberry and lemon verbena flavors.  Thumbs up for both.  (Yep I had 2 last cocktails).  Overall all awesome restauant.  I think if I had someone with me and didnt feel so rushed during dinner, it would have gotten the 5 stars.  But they squeezed me in since I was a walk in.  Highly recommend for atomsphere, drinks and food.

flycYcU9s7MEpLP0cMwCUA.text: All I can say is the horrible service overrode everything that could possibly have been good about the food.  The ambience of this establishment was very cool and hip and had an abundance of open air seating which was most welcome coming into phoenix from Michigan winter that same day.  However, our server was not good at all!  We waited for waters for over 10 mins. and when I needed a refill, because that was all I was drinking, forget about it.  I had to flag another server down while I could see my waitress rolling silverware.  We were eating with another couple and she never asked if we wanted the bill split either which I thought was unacceptable.   Ok...for the food.  I had the pork chili verde which was very flavorful and the cornbread that came with it, I wished I had more of it.  My husband had the kale and Brussel sprouts and kale salad which he thought was very good but the meatballs were just that, nothing special.  Even with the hen egg.  The other couple we were with had been here several times and obviously have had much different experiences than we had because I don't think I would go back unless it was for a cocktail because they had a pretty good looking list and the bar area had tables and space to mingle.

j8VJF4v5s4x8DqYQ3Q4aGw.text: Conveniently located on Camelback Road just a block from the light rail, St. Francis seems to be one of the new hot spots in the general downtown area as they were packed on Sunday morning for their jazz brunch. It's still hot in Phoenix (even though it's mid-October), so we decided to wait for a table inside. In just under half an hour, we were seated up on their second floor dining deck. The space was very nice with exposed brick, steel, and lots of natural light. Service was friendly, the atmosphere was local and cozy, and the menu looked pretty good.  While I enjoyed our time here, I feel like perhaps I didn't order the right thing. I was talked into the special of the day, which was supposed to be a pork shoulder confit w/ poached eggs and potatoes. However, the pork was really just really carnitas (slightly dry from being seared); a little on the heavy side. The poached eggs were also cold when they came out and were a little overdone. The potatoes were the definite highlight. I feel like I should have either gone with the smoked salmon flatbread which my friend ordered (and was delicious from the bite of it I had) or perhaps their benedict or wood-oven baked pancake. They also serve lunch and dinner, so I'll be sure to try them again next time.  They take reservations for lunch and dinner via Opentable which is good, and it looks like they've got a good happy hour, too. 3.5 Stars

Nwc1BuMFNLLa9grarjKz9Q.text: I had the eggs Benedict w/avocado, daughter had the kids pizza, & my husband had the American breakfast. The food was okay - I would say that the breakfast items aren't spectacular. The potatoes are different, but good. I had to add more salt & some pepper because I felt that my dish was a bit bland. The hollandaise sauce didn't give it much flavor. The service from the servers was a bit slow but they were friendly! Our bill came out to be $30 so for us it wasn't worth coming back for brunch. However, we're willing to try it for dinner especially since our toddler can eat for free. That's what earned them the third star.

rFrS5mMqhuAEnmS5vlEo3Q.text: This food was great but Amanda made this evening special! She is so thoughtful and sweet.  We will be heading back there soon.

BTZVK5cnrpIB83IxNO_vrw.text: I have seen ST.Francis  on guy's triple DDD, several times and have always wanted to try it. Finally my wife and I made the trip from Gilbert to camelback and 5th street, well worth the drive. We shared the fingerling roasted potatoes( awesome), French onion burger and the Moroccan meatballs.OMG !!!!! Everything was amazing!!! Thank guy and DDD

C2_x2djjt8YZrV0mZY1bKA.text: Fantastic!! I loved the decor and outside patio. The food tasted very fresh and the orange juice and cartel coffee paired perfectly with the eggs benedict. The fingerling potatoes are AMAZING!

sfblsU9LGv6hHalttrvswQ.text: The "Pig Dip" is a work of art - and one of the best sandwiches I've ever had... with wood-roasted pork loin, prosciutto, bacon, fennel onion marmalade, dijon, and gruyere on a perfectly wood-fire toasted house baguette. The white fish was cooked perfectly over an olive and mint cous cous. Run don't walk to St. Francis - including for breakfast. Haven't tried the special salmon yet but everything else so far has been amazing.

c0Ov1Tk0ANr6MuxCEGy1mQ.text: Love the low lighting, the decor, the ambiance, the people, the staff, the location, and best of all, the food.  Was not hungry when I got here so just ordered a couple of starters, the fingerling potatoes and the mushrooms, and damn! A massive pile of wonderfully tasty spuds is piled up in front of me. I demolish them and the mushrooms. Couldn't help myself.  It was a Friday night and restaurant was busy so we decided to take a seat at the bar. Good move. Comfortable, access to extremely friendly staff, and plenty of people watching. Oh, and the prices were modest too.  Fantastic gem! Check it out!

nUlfTGpCRmNgqPT17z4WSA.text: Pork Chile Verde was amazing. My son had the French Onion burger and he said it might have been the best burger he has ever had.  That said we will be back for sure.

WiLbyhN8mhL9cmrpheRMsA.text: I had dinner here last week.  We went on Thursday night and there was a 45 min wait.  Good sign I thought!  I have no problem waiting for great food.  We took a seat on their patio and ordered a drink.  I ordered one of their signature cocktails with strawberry's and basil.  The waiter warned me that the drink was very strong and sweet,  since I like strong drinks I went for it.  This drink was terrible. TERRIBLE!!!! Not to mention I had to shell out about 12 buck with tax and tip for this undrinkable concoction.  Let me just say I am not dissatisfied because it was overly strong or sweet.   But rather because it was disgusting.  This is where St Fancis loses one full star from me.    Once we were seated our server was very attentive and nice.  We were seated at a table right inside the door next to a lager table set into this glass alcove.  It looked very cool but once the birthday party with eight ladies took their seats this alcove turned into a megaphone projecting everything this group of ladies said right into our faces.  It was so uncomfortably loud that it was actually painful to my ears.  I found myself holding a hand over the ear closest to them.   We could hardly hold  a conversation.  I ordered a salad to start and requested it without the bacon, the kitchen either did not get this request or overlooked it, because my salad arrived covered in pig.  The goat cheese appetizer was pretty good. The forbidden rice and the pork chop were excellent.  If I were only reviewing our entrees then this place would have gotten five stars.     All in all we dropped around $100 for two people.  I am in no hurry to eat here again.  Although the entrees were so tasty that I may be inclined to order just those again to go!

Fi8Q-U9C3Annadti_pbLCw.text: It may have taken a little while, but I'm finally in love with St. Francis.  What'd it take? A pear & blue cheese salad, and a delicious peartini.  I *love* their mixed drinks here.

pKmq6fXsPS_X5UtrYBgn-w.text: Went here for post dinner drinks last night. I've eaten here before and really enjoyed it (but it's been so long ago I won't base the review on that).   The drinks here are really nice and unique. Great ambiance and I love the Julia Child video. The cucumber drink is yummy. I had total order envy because it was so light and refreshing.

ixcRflYsGuCvBGocNvNIQQ.text: perhaps you might start with:  baked goat cheese pumpkin soup beet salad   then:   pork chile verde the pork chop  roasted chicken cioppino (this is no longer featured on their menu) forbidden rice bowl   end with:   sticky toffee pudding   -------- st. francis aint so bad; i mean, they're actually pretty great. go! actually, go here before public market cafe, because then that's a different story...

I06trYPoSenhmjpCHNERIw.text: I love their piggy dip. Their salads are great and the Baugette is to die for

Mw-ZUpUTKqW6VMcilSd8Yg.text: Wow, what a disappointment.  Made plans to have lunch with a friend. I picked St. Francis after seeing a review of them in The Echo. I was quite embarrassed.  Before making the date, I called the restaurant several times to ask some questions. No one would ever answer the phone, but the voice mail would pick up with a message about gift cards or something, so I knew they were atleast still in business.   My friend and I headed over for a late lunch, hoping to miss any crowds. The hostess handed us the menu. At first I thought there must be a mistake. There wasn't much there. The hostess heard us say we wanted a baguette, so she brought one out, with two glasses of water. The server, Patty (sp), came by. I ordered tea, she asked if I needed sweetener and I said yes. The sweetener never came. Neither did any refills. When our food came out, which was delivered by the manager, we had to ask for refills from him. Patty never checked on us once during the meal. She did finlly come by and clear a few dishes nd get us a box. We sat their for quite some time waiting for the check, still with no drinks. Patty was standing over by the kitchen snacking on something, so I asked another server for the check. The service was some of the worst I have received in the downtown area.  I called the restaurant today to give my feedback and see what kind of response I would get from management. That would determine if I would ever return to this place, as I really wanted to like it. Tried calling before the doors opened for lunch. Once again, no answer. Tried a couple more times, no answer. Finally, at 2pm today, Eva picked up the phone! I asked for the owner or manager. She asked who was calling and I identified myself as a customer. She came back on the phone and let me know the manager was too busy and asked for my nme and number. I told her not to bother, but let the manager know they had lost a customer.  While the food was pretty good (meatballs and salmon flat bread), the service from Patty was dismal. She is best suited for someplace Like Dennys, although I have never even received service this bad there.   Don't waste your time and money on this place. Too many other places in the area that are much better.

YBQQpaqbg4QAam5g3Fq0gw.text: I love this place!  Have taken friends here for brunch for the past several months and every single time, my friends have loved it.  This is a perfect BRUNCH spot!  I usually get the omelet or the scrambled egg dish and both come with crusty french bread that is just dee-lish.  The meals are plentiful, delicately balanced in flavors and just simply yummy.  Iced coffee is always strong and the mimosa's sing beautifully on a saturday morning!  The ambience is quite lovely in this restaurant.  Mixture of brick walls with modern undertones.  The restaurant is bright and airy and has a beautiful outside eating area as well.    My only complaint is the service.  It never is fast enough, although everybody is always very friendly.  I have learned to ask for the check when I get our meal to ensure that we are not left with empty plates for too long.  I wish they would beef up their service (although yesterday's brunch was a slight bit better in speed).  All in all, I highly recommend St Francis as a brunching spot!  Enjoy!  ps - they take reservations - highly recommended.

8HXBNW957OOjAY1PKOBs-A.text: This place is so cool! The ambiance is delightful, the staff oh so friendly and the food INCREDIBLE! I had one of the best meals of my life here. The whitefish was flavorful and presentation was gorgeous. Highly recommend this little place and I have. Will definitely be back!

hUBzgFdWBrgCJn7mGwCCBQ.text: St Francis is one of those places that once you find it, you love it! We were told to eat there by a friend and we are so glad we did! We loved the decor, the wait staff and the food. We have visited Phoenix twice in the last few weeks and ate there both times. The baker's bread, which you can purchase by the loaf, is wonderful as well as the entree's. We loved the fact that the menu changes due to seasonal ingredients. We will definitely go back!
