Couldn't have asked for better service was excellent and the food was just as good!  We will definitely be back!!

XuWm0jpuOfXry0Fx59VgTQ.text: Definetly love the St Francis Bloody Mary here! Love love. The staff is friendly, the view at the bar is good too.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Butter cake.
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Holy cow! Best Bloody Mary ever! Called St Francis Bloody Mary. Is home made. Best best best. Yum.

AOYTxFMnL7LTx1gEu7_zjA.text: Great beer and hostess's here. Issue was order to go of their awesome Moroccan Meatballs. Whoever packaged them did not secure the top, and the sauce leaked thru the brown bag. When I got home, the bottom fell out, covering my shorts and feet w/ rich tomato sauce. Was not down wid it.  They have Men's room's for Men and Women's rooms for women, so I have no idea what gender neutral bathrooms could be, per Yelp survey at the bottom.

0CqpEde1E8JjrC7SMla26Q.text: We had an amazing experience here today with Hannah as our server and Shelley (not sure on spelling for the names) coming around to check on us as well and keeping us laughing! We were out for a pre-bachelorette weekend lunch and Hannah and Shelley were so excited for the bride and asking about our bachelorette weekend plans. It felt like we were among friends with them. So sweet! Then, at the end of our meal, they brought out a beautiful three-layered cake dessert with real flowers on top, on the house! It was such a sweet surprise. I don't even need to mention that the food was also amazing, because you should eat here, or do your event here, based on how amazing the service itself is.

BhI7NEfV11hrjZfZUV9Ujg.text: My favorite brunch spot!  They have some of the best eggs Benedict in town!  Service is mixed.  I've been for brunch, lunch, and dinner and the service is really mixed.  Sometimes I have an awful experience, good food.  Or s great experience, great food.    The young ladies helping us are usually very nice.  The food is great and I really like the design of the building and restaurant.    A wonderful brunch spot to take friends and family from out of town.

xMryldMeNLlY4vgs3pL8cg.text: One diner ordered the pork sandwich and really enjoyed it.  The gnocchi tasted and looked days old and re-heated.  Deserts were good.  On the whole, wouldn't return.

aH1RehbDLGTzxaXaCLaVew.text: The Chile Verde was very good.  Just the right amount of spice and a perfect portion size.  The meatballs were ok but the sticky toffee pudding dessert was outrageously good.  I'd come back for that alone.  The menu itself isn't that deep but I tend to like that.  The complimentary valet is nice and the restaurants decor is pretty cool.  Overall I enjoyed it and look forward to trying them again.

bAbzEFVzgHuCpzkZdhnA2g.text: Megan - are you getting my emails?  I have sent several and a copy of our receipt.  Please respond.

XxwQI45_H1OBw_D4Afawzg.text: Drop in spare of the moment. Loved the complimentary valet parking. Very nice and cozy inside with no wait. I ordered the chicken Cesar salad (not impressed at all). My date ordered the pot roast and he refused to share with me. He said it was delicious. Everyone's good looked amazingly delicious. Mad at myself for not trying something new. My date tried the peach twin peeks draft beer and he said it smooth and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

f_KpOt7WycYblzv_DYCJzw.text: Good food and service! NY Strip Streak was delicious and well portioned for the price. Also had the sticky toffee pudding, which was good, but the gelato melted within a minute of it arriving.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BvySPGD5JxkdLF9bH_cgpQ.text: I came here for a networking event on a Thursday night. We were in the private upstairs area. There was about 25-30 of us there. I wasn't impressed with the service but it was fair. I didn't get a chance to try the food but the sangria I had was good. I'd like to go back again without being in a large Group to really experience the restaurant. It was pretty busy on the first level so it seems pretty popular.

ZB655eHEzr2MyDzlP9k6Gg.text: The only reason why I am giving them 3 stars is because when I made the reservation they specifically asked if I was celebrating something special so they could follow up and make my guest feel extra special because of her birthday. Well, that didn't happened. For a first time visit, I was a little bit disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bkrce_qEw_zHGFJwZo1weQ.text: This place has an atmosphere I can get addicted to!  I love the layout the lighting and I love the food.  I like the window seating that looks like a you when we go there as a group to celebrate birthdays etc.  I like sitting outside when the weather is nice it is very relaxing.  I never had a bad server here either.  Parking is really valet focused which is nice and not nice depending on my schedule.  Overall, lets eat!!

cNBTuHi7kqjilRiwCIECuw.text: Love this place! It's very cute and the food is amazing and staff are awesome. The roasted fingerling potatoes (appetizer) are excellent and I highly recommend them. Their Salmon and salads are great. My son almost always gets the chicken salad sandwich or French onion burger. If you can go on a weekend to take advantage of the brunch menu be sure to have the eggs Benedict. Very very good!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Main dining area
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Area near bar

Kwm2SnwWsJg-mmvfxeYxHw.text: Been here 2x for dinner & the food was great!  You can taste the quality!  The lights are dimmed and this is a great date spot.  I've had the chicken with forbidden rice and veggies and it was amazing!  I tried to replicate the rice and only got close 1x!  It's a special taste (kind of coconut flavor to it)!  Dessert is small (when you're sharing with your husband...) but still good!

MxpnW6B8Ap8J9p_QmiJAfQ.text: Great service, cool atmosphere, creative tasty food. Was first visit. In town for Spring Training. Spotted this on Yelp. Agree with fans. Will go back when in town. Try Moroccan Meat balls and the chocolate cake.

DRT_nWMRvkt7_QHld1MM8g.text: I visited with a group of 10 for my birthday celebration and I'll definitely be back! Our table started off with a few appetizers to include the baked goat cheese and seasoned papas. They were definitely smaller than anticipated, but worth every bite! A few of us ordered a bottle of Riesling to share while others sipped on the various beers choices. My fiance and I split the steak and potatoes with the brussel sprouts being the best part! The server was always on her game bringing carafes of water and keeping us updated when to expect our food. I noticed they have a cute upstairs area if you get a chance to stop in!

EeQI_vs4QL7MMFWOuI6nDA.text: Today was my birthday and I decided to give st. Frances a shot for brunch. Wow did I make the right choice!  It was a tad busy when we got there so we sat in front of the kitchen. We weren't sure what we wanted so we asked the chef what he recommended and he gave us some great suggestions.   We went with the iron skillet pancake, chicken salad sandwich and the frittata.   The pancake is to die for! It was so fluffy and moist and the apple topping was delicious.   I would recommend this place to anyone! Such amazing food. I will be back!!

iEfL1UGi0zEuFsaJRhC2sQ.text: Delicious. Fancy hip style tapas fare but better than most. Nice vibes. Great wine and very delicious and creative cocktails.

foUa_b-8y-t399D7IGB2EQ.text: Phoenix area restaurants have mastered the art of interior design. st francis is one of the most visually appealing restaurants around. Between the exposed brick, wood beams and the patio, this is beauty. On to the food: a diverse menu with many options to appease even the pickiest of eaters. The French onion burger is as creative as it is tasty. Definitely worth the trip!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French onion burger

m0CsU3CmQiy_hWRQEhMFUw.text: I saw this place on Food Network so I thought it would be amazing. It was just okay. I got a vegan option and my friend got the meatballs that were advertised on the show. What I had was decent and she said the meatballs tasted like blood...

ZV3TzHPoonNwnUt7BBm1CA.text: I think this will be the longest review I've ever left for any restaurant (yet)! So bear with me please :-) We went to St. Francis for the first time today instead of our weekend routine "Flower Child" treat. Mainly just to try something new. And here is what we ordered and my experience:  1) arrived at 5 so the Happy Hour was on, so I first started with a Pinot Noir. For $5, it was a great wine. I would call it a happy, young, fruity wine with a bit of a sour finish. Later on I ordered a glass of their Merlot and regretted big time (but I hope you don't make my mistake unless you're heavily invested in Merlot wines). Also their wines came out a bit warmer than what it should since they keep them outside (see one of the pics).  2) for the starter, we ordered a Romaine Heart Salad and potato leak soup. Both were excellent (A).  3) for Entrees, we ordered a French Onion Burger, a Forbidden Rice Bowl, and a Moroccan Meatballs and here is my opinion about each dish:  The Burger (B-): it was an Ok burger. I had it medium well and in my first bite I sensed a rush of a fatty after taste in my mouth. The one you would usually get at lower quality restaurants with high fat% beef. I was disappointed. My wife asked if I want to change it but I was already 40% through. She asked to try a bite and as soon as she had one bite she said the same thing but she said the fatty after taste might be from the cheese and not the beef and she was right! I enjoyed my burger much more after I shaved off the cheese. I shared this as a feedback with the waitress and hope they address it cuz it would have otherwise been a solid B+ burger...anyway let's move on. Shall we?  The Moroccan Meatballs (B): overall, it was good but in my opinion it was too cuminny (too much Cumin). The cumin flavor was too dominant that it faded out all the other goodness.  The Forbidden Rice Bowl, with Shrimp (A-): this dish, as my grading suggests, was the best dish over the three that we ordered tonight. The rice was a bit spicy and the vegetables were delicious. The only reason I did not give this dish an "A" was that the shrimp was over cooked.  4) for the desert, we ordered the chocolate cake with coffee ice cream (B-). The frosting was too sweet and dense, the cake itself was OK and the ice cream was also too sweet for me. This doesn't mean this would be too sweet for you as well because over the years I've realized  that most people like their deserts to be at least twice as sweet as the way I like mine. So if you're one of those most people, and you've made it through my long review, go for it and bon appetit.  Overall (B+): definitely happy we've decided to try St. Francis. The ambient was excellent, and food and service was good. Bill was under $100 (with tip) which is not bad for how much food and drinks we ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Happy Hour Menu
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Dinner Menu
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside

hFJffokWDHzgRSR2F-6Vjw.text: Really enjoyed dinner here! The Parmesan risotto with shrimp was really good! And...the French fries were amazing! My cousin ordered the black rice dish with shrimp and she loved it.  The Caesar salad was just ok. I'm not a fan of warm lettuce-I prefer it chilled. Wouldn't order it again.  For dessert we had the panacotta and it was delicious.

QdYttvCsq1xbCBhhIF5UIg.text: This place just isn't the same since ownership changed. Sad! Came here for brunch today and ordered a medium rare burger. Came out well done and I sent it back and ordered a burrito. I was told they were out of tortillas so they couldn't make that. There was nobody even there! We were literally the only customers there at 1pm yet they're out of tortillas. Sadly I won't be coming back. RIP St Francis.

FA9omcOc1vU84BtI8an5hA.text: I used to love this place. My last two times here have been poor, at best. This last visit was terrible - what used to be one of the best burgers in town last me wishing that I had instead gone to five guys... I had heard recent rumors of new ownership, but needless to say I will not be revisiting this venue...

z3BkwZTRAjjMXxoYQ5rlUQ.text: Truly delightful. The food was prepared with obvious care and attention to detail. I had the pork chili verde which was an interesting and nuanced departure from the traditional. I also tried the bread pudding for dessert, which was appropriately gooey but not overly sweet. Bonus points for the waiter candidly steering me away from a wine he didn't personally like (he gave me a sample, and I agreed) and towards something else instead. My only complaint is that they gave me cornbread to go, and I forgot it! Entirely my fault.

e3nsH26su-Y7TzJjpvNVDg.text: Horrible customer service. Your employees need to treat everyone the same, your a customer based business and pissing off customers isn't the way to make money... I drove 10 minutes away from your restaurant, treated great, and spent $200 for dinner, this could of been yours except your hostess blew it.. tip, read the removed reviews and you'll get the real info on this place

8GaxVijres8JSL4y5iWV5w.text: Three stars is generous for food and service.  Ambience, cleanliness, and the restaurant design is 4+ stars... Nerdy modern, clean, hip, and set the stage for what I was expecting from the kitchen.   Let's just say $50 for lunch and you expect something a bit special.  Multiple items on the lunch menu not available at 12:30pm on a Sunday.  I don't get it.    Waited 45 minutes for eggs benedict and a sandwich - - - four people in the kitchen and three tables in the dining room when we were sat. Mind blown why it took so long.   So eggs benedict is pretty simple and it was good, tasted good, good presentation, and I enjoyed it.  Pork sandwich was UNEDIBLE.  The bread was rock hard and GIGANTIC. The human mouth does not open six inches nor can our teeth go through rock hard bread.  It was literally 3/4+ the height of my glass of iced tea.  Just fork and knifed some of the meat and then aborted the mission. It would have been awesome if the bread was bias cut and toasted on the flattop. It came with a salad that had champagne vinaigrette.  I wish at this price point they could splurge for some herbs in the dressing to bring it to life.  Our server touched our table once and then cleared the plates.  He then starts taking another table and leaves us flagging someone down to get our check.  The part that I was surprised about was that he picked up a plate that was barely touched, and he didn't say a word other than asking if she wanted a box to go.   I would think that if a guest doesn't eat the entree you would want to make sure there wasn't a kitchen issue or something.    I waited months to come here and finally was in the area, and I am so disappointed.  I really really thought by the reviews and pictures that it would be a new go to or place to refer people to. I'm glad I came first before making referrals.

-PzYi3Ew-QtV5trF5ljsGw.text: So I had heard this place was awesome so my mom and I went there. The waitress was amazing but the food was terrible. First off we ordered Brie and fig sandwich and guess what they used blueberries not figs and didn't even tell us. We bit into the sandwich and thought that is not fig. When we told our waitress she asked and low and behold no they didn't have figs so they used blueberries. WHAT??? Are you serious. You don't even let your customers know. And the meatballs some were spicy and some not at all. And they were not suppose to be spicy. Not good.

ZQgIwcv-hTh5qs6QarhFxA.text: I'm a sucker for good design, especially when the building just looks great with glass windows, wood, high ceiling, and rustic red bricks. St. Francis has all of that and more. The entrance of the restaurant can be a bit tricky to find if you park on the side, I walked into the side door the first time I came here but the entrance is facing the street. I should have known better. Customer service here is what you expect from an establishment that was once owned and ran by Aaron Chamberlin & Co, it's prompt, friendly, and wonderful. I've had the pork chile verde and french onion burger on the two visits that I've been here and while I enjoyed the burger, the chile verde was definitely more memorable for me. 10/10 would recommend that. Decent amount of heat, flavorful pork. The flavors just blend well together. Also didn't hurt that you can add an egg on top because one should always add an egg if the opportunity presents itself. Eat here and be merry, there's a lot to like here from the ambiance to the food.

vaJW3GSTCSGmvfoC8IRmrQ.text: Amazing for breakfast/brunch and pretty good for dinner. Fantastic atmosphere, inside and out. Great staff, great beer, great music, amazing eggs Benedict.

tYSFRSsf2n-S-K35ZoTOEQ.text: Awesome pork sandwich, the bread is crisp and chewy on the inside.

zezNx0gz2RjcMZSz_Nw3hA.text: It has a lovely patio, but the overall dining experience was miserable. One burger was ordered medium and came out absolutely raw. The server's reaction was that it didn't look that raw to her. Then we ordered coffee after dinner to be told that only one person knew how to make coffee, and he had gone home after lunch. There are so many restaurants now in the area that diners don't have to settle for this! It's too bad because we like supporting independent places.

aMYbiihSZVSRdnzWk74FiQ.text: Use to be a favorite restaurant of mine but my last visit was off. My favorite dish Salmon Superfood is not being cooked the same - that's too bad.  The way that salmon was cooked was excellent! The seating seems to have gotten more uncomfortable and the wait staff was non responsive and seemed to be distracted.  Not sure if I will return now with all the other new restaurants in the same area.

AJ7JH8DPueQIsqsxFedWvg.text: I'm so sad I've lived in central Phoenix for years and just recently tried this place - it's great! The food is delicious and there's something for all tastes. Service is great. There was a pastry on the menu we were going to order and it was sold out, so they brought us another one on the house! I love the layout too, it's fun to sit on the 2nd level. I'll definitely be back!

Li58Je0Q-IA5Ovzl3tigiw.text: We went after the Parade cause heard a lot of good things about this restaurant. Drinks were good! Staff was friendly! My waitress described my item I had ordered as light and fluffy. Well it was hard and burnt. Everyone else's breakfast was good. They didn't take my meal off the check granted it was only $10.

O-Bn_X1nd2Mm37sj8fakmQ.text: St Francis is a two story inside/outside restaurant right off Camelback, super cute trendy place.    Food; roasted Cauliflower was amazing, with the yogurt dip is large enough to split.  Also, the Vegetarian flat bread had tons of fresh vegetables.  Service; Our server was friendly and the food runners were speedy, it did take a little time for beverages and wasn't able to order an additional beverage.  Must try

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sw2T9q5gqIs5pZozbn7GMg.text: Loved it! Great dining experience great food and decent wine selection. Family friendly and they have stuff to entertain the kids!  Best gourmet burgers in town and reasonable price.

JO3DjRuXBABv6TpW7jGRrA.text: Not good. Poor food quality and when food was sent back because it was wrong they sent it back and you could tell it wasn't remade correctly. Wouldn't recommend.

1tK6zxujgUp-zif5leANjQ.text: WARNING: New ownership, cheap ingredients and pretty terrible food. This used to be my favorite spot for brunch but it is terrible now. No longer farm to table unless you consider Kroger and Restaurant Depot to be farms. Also, overall management sucks. Not going back.

KneXa3-bfW5hQLXkQkjPQQ.text: A tremendous meal, academic service and traditional AZ style.  No corners were cut with this restaurant.  When you go, request Angie - she's the best server in the state.

rcca5W3ZRLhQ0mbEvmp6KQ.text: Have loved St. Francis since going to their opening night.  Until this week.  It was a disaster from start to finish.  Service was the WORST, and the food was awful.  First, Aaron needs to update the menu for summer.  Then, the food needs to be what it used to be.  Food that was supposed to be hot was cold.  Obviously our waiter let it sit for a long time before he managed to get to the kitchen to bring it to our table.  Sent my cold undercooked fish back, and it came back warm, but still undercooked.  Seared Ahi is great, but seared whitefish?  I don't think so.  The Pinot Grigio was barely chilled.  The waiter poured almost full glasses so he wouldn't have to fill them again, I guess, then plopped the warm bottle on the table so it would get even warmer.  Asked if Aaron was around to talk to him, but he was not there that night.  When the chef's away???  Won't be going back anytime soon.  What happened???

qlE_ffPAqKtZ5m7-uI7Eew.text: This place belongs in Scottsdale where they are more concerned with appearances than substance.  The place looks cool but the two times I have been, the main courses have been over cooked and last night, it was over cooked and cold!  Funny thing was it came out before we had taken two bites of our appetizers.  My guess is the waiter screwed up the timing when he put the order in.   There are better places if you want to enjoy the food but few places better in town if you want to be seen.

8U9bOv39kMV9FhqY54TUcg.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Being a snobby foodie from SF, I didn't have the highest expectations but actually found this place to be quite delightful. After making a reservation, we came her for a work event with about 12 people. While they don't have private rooms, they do have an upstairs seating area that was comfortable, secluded and perfect for our party. The atmosphere was welcoming yet a little swanky (just how I like it). The wait staff was attentive, friendly and quick to help us when needed. The menu didn't boast a ton of options, which made my decision on what to order much easier. For apps we had the baked brie and goat cheese, flatbread and potatos which were all very good. For my entree, I had the white fish which was good but a little dry, hence the 4 stars. My colleagues had the forbidden rice which was fantastic. We split a couple of desserts at the end of our meal and they were all very tasty. All-in-all, I would definitely recommend this place if you want good food that's somewhat reasonably priced, in an upbeat atmosphere.

HyO9hKq7YuEGvep7fnnauw.text: Love the food, cool building, great wait staff. Only complaints are that it can get and seem overly crowded at times and the live music on Sundays is great but holy cow LOUD. Complaints are minor to the pluses. Planning on becoming a regular. And those yukon gold roasted fingerling potatoes.....wow....my friend and I practically wrestled to the floor for the last one.

_WEAtPnR9UAFcn_nlV81eg.text: Went their tonight with my husband for our 7th anniversary. We were really excited to go after seeing the restaurant featured on Diners Dive-Ins and Dives. We got there around 4 and there was a wait so we went to the bar to order a drink. The bar is not big, probably about 12 chairs. All the chairs were taken so we stood by the bar and tried to get the bartenders attention so we could order a couple of drinks, and tried, and tried, and tried. You get the point, so after 10 minutes she finally took our drink order. After about 10 more minutes we received our drinks, a beer and a margarita, not too difficult to make. A couple of seats opened up at the bar so we sat down. We finished our drinks and after about 10 more minutes of waiting with empty glasses we were able to order another round and the meatball appetizer. We received the appetizer and the meatballs were slopped with tons of sauce, I think it was to cover up the dryness of them. They were way over seasoned and I can still taste them in my mouth 7 hours later. Finally after having an empty glass for 20 minutes we decided to remove our name from the waiting list and leave. While we were waiting for our tab, there were people standing behind us that were trying to find out where their server was. They had received their drinks but the server never came back to take the order. They were told all the servers were in a meeting! WHAT! A meeting in the middle of service on a Saturday. We finally received our tab after waiting about 20 more minutes. When we got up to leave the servers finally got our of their meeting. I have experienced bad service before, but this is by far the worst experienced of my life. I would never go back. They should take a lesson on service from The Keg Steakhouse. They have immaculate staff and food. Sorry Diners Drive Ins and Dives, but maybe you should not only rate the food, but the service as well.

WD6UDFKm8LAzfH4t_kGzew.text: Complete disappointment. St. Francis presents itself as an upscale, high-end establishment. It's complementary valet parking; the young hostess and the carefully placed lighting go way out the way to tell you this is a special place. Unfortunately, despite the careful appearance - I had the pork chilli verde and a used Band-Aid, still warm and juicy-- that I hope was from the sauce not the previous owner. Disgust does not describe my experience.  Our server was nowhere to be found.   I alerted Hostess back to my table.  I stopped her as she took my plate, I told her I wanted to talk to a manager.  She told me that she wanted to show it to the chef.  It took some time for anybody to respond. When the manager finally come over she was apologetic, she seemed unsure what to do. But really, how can you fix it--there was a band-aid in my food.  As the customer establishment that attempts project a sophisticated image, I was struck with the absolute absence of customer service and insight. The Band-Aid that ended up in my food was there for a reason: it was covering up something weepy? Bloody? Full of puss?  The band-aid was egregious enough but the genuine lack of concern from the Manager, waitress and chef all made this dining experience the worst ever. I wondered if any one in the kitchen ever wondered just where that band aid went? I began to wonder why there was a band-aid in my chili - did I miss something else? The St. Francis is a complete bust - poor service and unsanitary conditions. I will not ever go back to the St. Francis, I would caution current and future patrons to proceed carefully and examine your dishes closely.  The Valet, the first person you encounter displays no class, I don't care if he's young and tattooed.  When we asked what complimentary means, his response was "I park your car for free and, if you want, you give me a tip".  Really?  If the kid has no tact, can't the management intervene and require it?  As for the Manager, please read up on customer service - I 've had better service at Filabertos. The Waitress, please don't abandon your table and check back in from time to time. As for the kitchen staff - clean it up, wear gloves and pay attention. This time it was a band-aid next time it could be something much worse. The St. Francis was a total disappointment; you may want to cross this off your list if you are concerned about your health.  There was no excuse for their lack of responsiveness, they weren't even busy.

zgRXnWU3TWES976NgYxPpw.text: St. Francis is the kind of place that I believe will define the near future in restaurant trends, an evolution of the post-recession "new normal," if you will. This is about approachable, comforting dishes prepared excellently - food fit for foodies, but not "foodie food" - at a moderate price point (entrees $12-25). And it all happens in a cosy, informal atmosphere that feels like a neighborhood hangout, with exposed brick walls, metal tables, a garage door that makes the bar indoor/outdoor when open, and waiters dressed in jeans and t-shirts. The chef comes from LGO Hospitality, and while this is his own venture, you can certainly see their influence here...there are similarities to Postino, Chelsea's Kitchen, and LGO Pizzeria, in the cuisine and especially in the atmosphere.  The romaine hearts salad is the perfect way to start a meal, with a very light but flavorful dressing, a few slices of apple, the most amazingly thick and crispy bacon, and lots of creamy cheddar. You'll see the flatbread being served at a lot of tables, and for good reason. Firstly, because it's wonderful, with a perfect crust and tasty toppings, and secondly, because at $12 it's a steal...enough for an entree (probably with some left over) or as an appetizer for 2-4 people. The scallop special was amazing - perfectly cooked scallops paired with a lemon and caviar beurre blanc sauce and multi-colored cauliflower. The only mild disappointment was dessert, and less-so because of taste than because of misleading description. The warm sticky toffee pudding was delicious, but it was a little too dry to be a sticky toffee pudding...more like a toffee cake. It was also a little on the small side.  Service was excellent, the vibe was great, and the price was right for the quality of food...it's not your weekly hangout, but it's not special occasion dining either. My prediction is that 2010 will be all about restaurants like this.

ZFg-KjjZuhysnuzdO6giyA.text: We were so surprised not to have loved it!  After reading all of the wonderful reviews, we did not expect to be so underwhelmed.  The evening started out OK - we loved the building and overall atmosphere, so wine on the patio was a win.  Upon sitting down (which took 25 addt'l minutes, after the hostess called us in), we ordered the goat cheese and fingerling potatoes.  Both were fine, but nothing exciting.  The bread served w/the goat cheese was hard and five pieces for our group of four was weak.  I have done better fingerlings at home.  None of us were impressed with the entrees - extremely pork heavy, nothing popped.  The pot roast sandwich was heavy and diner-esque, the citrus salad was tiny, the cauliflower flat bread was colorful, but lacked flavor and the ahi tuna sandwich would have even been a little disappointing had I been eating lunch at a resort restaurant.  I am sorry to be so harsh, especially when I am definitely in the minority, but St. Francis did not live up to the sexy building it inhabits, nor the hype.  I gave it a three, because the patio was great and I would go back for a drink - BEFORE heading somewhere else to eat.

x6Rss4vn9G5pwg2wNw4SWg.text: i love the vibe of the place and the food is pretty good.  i am just not a hige fan of the menu... i felt that it was pretty small and fancy.  my palate is not that sophisticated.  but not a bad place for a drink

1UYWypREcOVE37dei9I54Q.text: Consistently good food in a trendy atmosphere atypical of Phoenix. Wait staff is friendly, but a bit inattentive- definitely a great deal for the quality of food you get.

KN3N9ianXQveeQG_-9KQGQ.text: Great place to eat.  We had the pot roast and it was amazing!  I cant wait to go back and eat again.

2Unk1EU6tIYhyW0mPdJOFg.text: I so wanted to like this place after driving by it many times, and reading all the hype...We went there on a Monday late afternoon it wasn't very busy, we had our choice of seats. We waited so long to be served even our first glass of water, then we waited to be waited on, then we waited for our drinks. I had to tell the girl cleaning the floor we were waiting for our drink order. Now, neither one of us ordered alcohol, so there's no excuse for us waiting so long for a glass of ice tea and a coke. Funny thing was with all the staff milling about, it seemed only one server was working. There were two women dressed in non-uniforms who appeared to be the managers...neither one seemed interested in making sure their customers were properly being waited on. One woman just kept shrieking she was so upset that one of the staff was leaving. Well, uh hello...why don't you worry so much about your customers??? The waiter finally came back to check on us, and told my husband he'll bring him another ice tea...NOTHING...my husband had to go up to the bar himself to get his refill...amazing, but True. Also, our finished plates sat on our table, never getting cleaned up. I'm sorry, but a sign of a good waitstaff is one that is prompt with service, which also means cleaning up a dirty table. Our appetizer plates didn't get taken until our meal came. Again, it's not like they were crazy busy, and they sure had enough staff, so it must be lack of good management. We did leave a tip, which I argued with my husband about, but he's a former waiter and out of a sense of brotherhood, he will always leave one. Me??? I would have left a penny! Well, if anyone from SF reads this..please work on managing your waitstaff...if you go there, don't expect any prompt service...the food??? it was ok.

1FSk3hePzWnXpZqsmyuyVQ.text: Like to support in-town eateries and this is a perfect place before heading downtown for a play.  Excellent food, service and atmosphere.

N42UXlQSkEkochQfCSuUFg.text: The food is very tasty and well presented.  Their soups are amazing.  The portions are too small for the price.  I also wish they would change their limited menu more often.

XcXmOitwWyt7M6KyoV_Hww.text: Arrived relatively early on Sat. night and waited about 15 minutes for a table. Not bad! The ambience and decor are very urban cool, brick and steel, visually interesting. Tables are a little too close together, but not a deal breaker. Wait staff was friendly and efficient. We had a kiltlifter and an Almond tequila margarita to start....both crazy good. We heard the server at the table next to us really raving up the whitefish of the day, Monkfish.  When our server presented the dish, he also said it was amazing.  I am a big fan of monkfish and he assured me it  was fresh, so I was in! We ordered it and the roasted pork chop.  The pork chop was everything we could have wanted, pink and juicy, super flavorful, the accompaniments were a perfect complement. Sadly, the monkfish was so flavorless, as to be inedible. And there was not much else on the plate that was interesting enough on its own to bother with .  Ok... it happens, BUT a True sign of the very best restaurants, is when the staff has been instructed to Care About when it happens and not just clear a full plate without an inquiry. The upside was I had plenty of room for the sticky pudding, which was as great as expected. I will probably return to the St. Francis but would not entertain guests there.

CUdKywpDESe0JfPNlV4dVQ.text: Great food, atmoshere and wine...LOVE St. Francis.

iGnV8ZZCzCXzuB4kYoHpLQ.text: really enjoyed happy hour here. went on a thursday and it was not so packed, food was really good and reasonably priced. great atmosphere/decor.

oiGI51E3-9NzmEc3EyIsYQ.text: Thia place was recommended by a really good friend, so we decided since we are out here let's try it out. Super friendly staff, seated right away and family friendly. The food is awesome and so is the drinks and dessert. Definitely will come back when we are in town.

PznPEv3rwsRER1WsHcQaWQ.text: This is a lovely place to eat and drink with indoor and outdoor seating and an upper level as I recall. I suggest ordering appetizers until you fill up

cxfUoOIwznYrh7O0fcWyeA.text: Recommend. This has a great menu. Had many great meals here. First date to dinner with family. Good feel to the place.

a-o3xXjxALXKp-SudVwbcw.text: This is a fun place to get together with friends- especially if you can snag the table at the front which backs up to the window. I had the shrimp risotto for dinner- probably the best I've ever tasted (and now crave!). While the menu is not huge, everything we ordered looked, smelled, and tasted delicious.

3spGSlGRJ3Ixg37PfFM5XA.text: I love this place, I came here for the third time for my friend's bday. We sat at the bar and there was a pretty extensive happy hour. My friend had sangria, she said it was the best she's ever had so there's that. I drank some Malbec and enjoyed the nice bar that has a huge opening to allow the nice outside breeze.  We ordered flatbread and the goat cheese, both were amazing and both were offered on the happy hour menu. The goat cheese is insane, it's one of the tastiest things I've ever had.   For dinner I had the steak, which I never thought I would order but was in the mood. The steak was fantastic, the mashed potatoes were delicious and the veggies were colorful and cooked perfectly.  Overall St. Francis never disappoints, definitely a gem.

SX80y6Jb6RdpDkcGPkbrRg.text: Me and my BF have been dying to try this place. We stopped in for happy hour and it was AMAZING! cocktails are $5 during happy hour... um okay WOW! i got the grapefruit basil one and it was delicious! We got the french onion burger and the caesar salad. Everything was great. service was 10/10! We definitely will be back and think we have found a new favorite spot!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. french onion burger + caesar salad

-PNJ_lFBJgw3EMIY92N_kw.text: Greatest juicy burger I have had here in phoniex. Fresh tomatoes, crunchy lettuce and crispy fries.

WnF93AbDWgN5B_NH7Ub94w.text: French onion burger was so good! The crispy onions and bacon added so much crunch to the burger, it was nothing like I've had before. We also loved the chili verde pork, watermelon cocktail, and Manhattan drink. Nothing bad to say about this place. Everything was delicious!

egcTiDxX-2fp2DwlBhS0Yg.text: Great brunch spot. Good coffee. The eggs Benedict are especially tempting. I have had them almost at every visit. Be prepared to wait for a table (and, sometimes, the food). But it is worth it!

XbrFm6nQPtDsJfUQf7VMRA.text: What a great experience! I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and our friends. I made a reservation for 8 and when I arrived they had everything ready. I brought a cake and they kept it refrigerated for me. Our waiter was AMAZING! He always made sure we were taken care of, was very kind and attentive. When it came time for the cake he brought it out on a beautiful platter and had candles burning. Then after pictures and singing happy birthday he took it back and cut the cake and served us and he cleaned the dish I brought it in. We had a great time of fellowship! This is definitely one of my Phoenix favorites.  Thank you St Francis for helping making the birthday party a great time!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VOgXdzOpD6E5E1vmmzgfiA.text: To be honest I would have to say 3.5 stars, above three but below four. St. Francis is in a great location visually appealing and the staff is very friendly and attentive. We came for brunch this visit and was welcomed by a friendly hostess, throughout the meal the staff does work moderately well together; sometimes there was a delay because it appears there was a shortage in servers and an abundance of other staff (roles unknown) standing about. Our server was very good! FOOD, we started out with the Baker's board which was a tray of breads and bread like pastries. Banana bread I was told was good I personally don't care for it so I didn't partake, a variety of other carb assortments including a delicious cinnamon cookie topped with caramel and my personal favorite the bread loaf as simple as it was it was delicious fresh bread with whipped butter there is nothing I hate more than warm bread with frozen butter you have to peel out of a wrapper so kudos for that! Fantastic! As a splurge my friend and I ordered eggs Benedict, avocado for me and salmon for him. Which came with fingerling potatoes. Let me speak to mine first, visually stunning a conservative amount of hollandaise (which I appreciate) there is nothing worse than drowning your meal in an unnecessary amount of heart clogging sauce. The egg cooked perfectly; However it wasn't hot...at all, I am not one to send anything back unless it was egregious and temperature wise this was definitely on the fence of "do I or don't I" I compared notes with my friend who not only was his not warm but his salmon was cold adding to the problem. If I ordered bagel lox and cream cheese I expect that the salmon wouldn't be hot but on eggs Benedict? Fingerling potatoes were very good crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, very salty but good.  Probably just this visit and our food probably just sat a little too long for whatever reason.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon Benedict
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Baker&#39;s board
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado Benedict

V4kL-zWji025TkTwtQEKmg.text: Wonderful place.  Had the pork sandwich which was awesome.  The service was great.  Atmosphere very good.  A bit hot on Phoenix in July so could not take advantage of the beautiful patio.  Highly recommend it!!

kGQm11GlVGNi5sBz5xACkQ.text: The spaghetti squash dish with added shrimp was exceptional. Great atmosphere, great food, great service. There was a super cute French bulldog puppy on the patio. I know that has nothing to do with the restaurant but it made for great entertainment.

xgAuETOEnjcdhCeCkm2NDg.text: Sunday brunch was delightful! Live music, great service and amazing food! Their eggs Benedict are amazing as is the pork chile verde. Next time we want to try their cinnamon rolls -they look and smell delicious !

GqB77UEdkgbg79oO3n93NA.text: Just left this restaurant moments ago.....My husband and I walked out do to the way I was treated. The Host at the front sat me down at a booth behind the waiter/waitress station, so I asked to move to the next booth over. He grabbed the menus and dropped them on the next booth and walked away. Here's what really pissed me off.....moments later the same Host sat down an older couple behind me and asked them if the location was ok and then proceeded to tell them about happy hour, the cocktails, mentioned to them he included dinner menus and dinner starts at 5pm. Host also told them their server would be right with them and to enjoy their dinner. That's how every customer walking through that restaurant door should be treated, one would think right! However this is NOT how I was treated! Menus were dropped on the table (which were only happy hour menus even after I told him we had a reservation for 2 for a booth for dinner at 5pm). That's all I got! He did not mention happy hour, no mention of cocktails, no dinner menus were given to us, not even a have a nice dinner... nothing!! I'm glad my husband went to use the restroom before I got sat down because everyone in the restaurant would of heard how we were treated. When my husband returned to the table I told him I'm not giving this restaurant any money after the way I was treated, we walked out! Thank you for treating me like crap on my 21st anniversary, we ended up at a classier restaurant down the road from you, and they are treating us very well, the way we should be treated at a restaurant.

qe9mj4HCFdEc9t7no0pS_g.text: Long time patron of St. Francis. We love the bread so much that I have driven across town for a few baguettes on more than one occasion throughout the years. This past Tuesday we stopped for a beer and ordered the Stracciatella appetizer which was OK- noting the bread was slightly different from the usual but still good so we ate it and ordered our 2 baguettes to go. What we received was two baguettes wrapped in PLASTIC that looked as though they were purchased from the Safeway bakery and felt like this purchase was made yesterday. When we questioned it, we were told "oh sometimes the ends get hard like that". Unfortunately, we know better and expect better from one of our favorite restaurants. Too bad.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

L85q9EkcNWzz1qHeFYabMA.text: I have mixed feelings about my first experience at St. Francis. I went on a dinner date with a friend because someone's been suggesting this place quite a bit. When I finally checked it out, I went on a Saturday night around 8:30 pm. Complimentary valet was easy (make sure you're still tipping your valet drivers!), and we were seated right away.   By this time, the restaurant wasn't crowded at all. We were seated in the back patio area. It's a cute little place with lots of lights.... except it took about 15 mins for someone to come to us to just take our drink orders. Actually, nobody ever came - I had to get one of the servers' attention. Once I told her we'd been sitting there for 15 mins, she was apologetic so I became less hangry at this point. Food came and it was alright. After sharing my experience with the waitress, she gave us a dessert on the house for the wait, which I appreciated.  I haven't gone back to St. Francis since this first encounter, but I'd be willing to try it again for brunch or sometime during the day.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Light aesthetics in the back patio.
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert on the house. Cute concept, but didn&#39;t taste as good as it looked.
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dE5wGHwMUgkwcVUpPZakkg.text: This was one of our favorite restaurants, but we discovered ownership about 6 months ago.  Sadly, quality has dropped.  Litter lined the walkway into the restaurant.  The halibut special was NOT halibut.  We were first told that the halibut has been sold out over the weekend.  Suddenly, it was available.  At best, this was cod.  My husband ordered swordfish and this also seemed to be a mystery fish.  Cutlery wasn't clean.   We had wondered why it was so sparsely seated.  Now, we know.   It will take a motivated owner/ staff to turn this place around and re-create the feeling of "St Francis", or this restaurant will not survive.

DFg6oba4051QNXL57ew56g.text: What on earth happened to this place? My wife and I quickly got our answer as soon as we sat down. The place is filthy, dried up food was encrusted on our table and salt and pepper shakers. Our food was clearly pre cooked hours ago and ALL except the stale toast arrived cold, not warm but actually cold. Seriously there were four tables in the restaurant and they served pre cooked cold food!  The mimosa was mostly OJ and cost $8.  Most brunch places (decent, busy ones anyway) offer discounts on brunch cocktails.  Any of these issues alone would not be reason to come back, but the entire experience was bad.  There's a reason why there was an empty parking lot and restaurant when most others have a wait.  Someone has clearly given up on this place.  It's a shame because it used to be so great.

7zcoc6a8xdTTodzat-GK7A.text: Really, really good restaurant. Most days probably 5 star. Nice vibe, yummy food. Unfortunately, first time out, one filet was overcooked, and the tomahawk steak for our friends was undercooked. It was eventually taken care of, but we all didn't eat at the same time.

P2Rt598Hpwmj3L6Vi9nmzQ.text: I've been to St. Francis numerous times over the past few years and then again this morning for breakfast.  I feel I need to post a review since I've just started using Yelp more.  I have to say that not only have I never been even close to being disappointed with any aspect of St. Francis, they continue to impress me with their reasonable pricing, great service and wonderful food.  The environment is unlike any eating establishment in the State.  You will not be disappointed!

25sJ71NLc6OhhWm4tiRUDQ.text: What happened to St Francis I took my family there for brunch today Sunday. The music was so loud we could not talk across the table upstairs.  Asked the waitress to tone it down and she came back and said the entire system was on one master control and it could not be done. Someone said the restaurant had been sold to new owners. The great food we have always had the was just ok

hOfKBXisC3xoaxuS34Xqmw.text: This was a great place to meet a friend for a weekend brunch.  I had the mushroom omelette and it was delicious.  This is not your run of the mill mushroom with Kraft american cheese slices omelette.  It had thyme, leeks, and goat cheese in it and was quite tasty.  Since the brunch was so good, I definitely plan to return to St. Francis in the future to try out their dinner.

l9VsulgVshCVcs66Od7_YQ.text: I don't know what took us so long to try this place? The service was on point and the ambiance was lively.  Get the roasted duck breast! We did based on the servers suggestion and we were very glad we did.  Don't miss the butter cake dessert, you'll be sad if you do.  I wish I would've taken a picture of it but I was too excited to eat it!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qtAHVh7ZCEhRTomLUif2Pw.text: It makes me so sad to post this updated review..St. Francis, what has happened to you?? We have been regulars at St Francis for a long time, so it is so sad to see this gem of a restaurant go so far downhill with service and quality. We ate dinner here twice in the last week, one of the dinners was on a Sunday night-the restaurant was empty! It was depressing! Even though the restaurant was empty it took a while for us to be greeted by a server. We ordered our food, but we were told they were out of chicken for our dish, which was super weird and annoying for a Sunday evening..especially in an empty restaurant. Also, my husband ordered a coffee at the end of our meal..the coffee was cold..he could stick his finger in it (despite the server saying that she just brewed it) Unfortunately, we were not the only patrons experiencing the current sad state of this once amazing restaurant. We  were next to a table that had a family who ordered steak and wanted to have mashed potatoes..they were out of those too. Then there was another table that had a group of five that were there to celebrate a birthday, but after they ordered drinks they actually got up to hand the server a credit card--they must have sensed that this restaurant just isn't what it used to be. Another thing that we noticed is that all of the servers that we knew and loved had left..apparently the changing of management has been really rough on St Francis. We sincerely hope that it turns around and that St Francis will once again be the amazing restaurant that we once knew.

GkM-iVgUOIaW2CQ0gi_6iQ.text: Possibly my favorite place in Phoenix. The food is fantastic and so was the atmosphere.  I was here for a business dinner, but it would be even better for date night.  The feeling is casual, even with its upscale appearance.   You can't go wrong with any of the food choices.  The dishes were all prepared and served perfectly. I like to try new places as much as possible, but I look forward to eating here again.

9Vi64goxKv6BcgjhlYds6g.text: Food was good.  My cocktail underwhelmed is my only reason to lower it one star. Unique set up inside, we had a bigger group and it worked out just fine.  All in all it's a place I would go back to

7rgVaFjB6vd_WJPbOMZQmQ.text: So first time at this joint. Wow! Loved it! I had the pig dip amazing! My wife had the salmon and my son had the meat flat bread. We all shared each other's and all had the dam opinion!  Great service and atmosphere! Definitely making this a regular stop.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fprR0hK8YoHZMU_BeSpAdg.text: Great food.  Great ambiance.  Great waiter.  Great friends and Great music.  I'll be back for sure but maybe on a date this time instead of with friends as it seems romantic and a nice quaint but elegant spot.  Parking wasn't bad either.

sbfkBCXoHMtAiSfkCb2eKA.text: One of my favorite Happy Hour spots.  We enjoy sitting on the patio in the nicer, cooler, weather. My favorite food is the pumpkin soup.  It is so creamy and sweet. The other items we usually order are the flatbreads. Have to get back there as soon as the weather cools down.

-7lFeWV24Q64TYYc4KrMkw.text: As a tourist from California, I was impressed with St. Francis.  I read many of the previous reviews before attending an event at the restaurant and was a little nervous. Turns out their food is delicious and their staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. I had the perfect desert cocktail, the Santa Rosa, with vodka, St. Germain, pink grapefruit, and basil. I loved the Moroccan meatballs and the fingerling potatoes. I sat at the bar after the event. Evan was bartending, and he was fabulous. Great conversation as I enjoyed a Deschutes Fresh Squeezed and finished my evening with their wood-fired winter squash. This is a place to go if you're looking for quality ingredients prepared in a wood-fired oven with fine-dining service. This is not the place to go if you're looking for fast and cheap food. The architecture is interesting and fun - a remodeled old bank. There is also outdoor seating, which is perfect this time of year.

qCSt4q4AH0E6XGLNb7w2_g.text: Wonderful food. Great service. Two of the top things I look for in a place to dine. They did not disappoint.   We started with the Bakers Board - delicious array of pasties and bread to start us off right. Fresh and full of flavor.  Their fresh squeezed lemonade is the perfect blend of tart and sweet. Gives the full flavor of lemon!   For our meals we had the tomato baked eggs with fingerling potatoes and toast served up in ahoy skillet - scrumptious. The quiche, a standard, but made with just an extra touch of love you can taste! And, the chile burger with a fresh-made bun that just melts into so much excitement in your mouth! Makes me almost wish I lived in this state!   I will be back and bring friends on my next trip. Simply delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chile burger and salad!
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tomato baked eggs
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor seating with mist system

TxfhwwLDXQ7W4g5X_hdRPA.text: Kind of a hipster cool place. Used to be an old fire house. Pretty good food and cocktails. I enjoyed it very much.

HO9PT2auF8m5IAUzQPVXOQ.text: I love St Francis, adore it in fact, but I went here the other day with my kids around 315 and was told they don't even serve food until 4, I had no idea the happy hour menu times changed, whatever, but then I realized they don't offer the kids free meals anymore, that's kinda annoying to get the bill and notice that, they need to make sure to tell people that with children. That was one of the nice perks of coming here with kids and I've been coming here for over 6 years. I'm giving it 5 stars because I do love the food and service was good.

WG6UDJAhsT-Qn1-QuHc3Aw.text: Fist time going for brunch. Received an email from the restaurant about customer appreciation and that we'd receive an order of their skillet pancakes for free. They were delicious! The real whip cream was unbelievable! Had the mushroom omelette which was average nothing to write home about. My husband had the tomato bake which we sent back because it was more like tomato soup with eggs. Not at all appealing. For now I think we will stick to dinner at St Francis.

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side of fries
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Skillet pancake delicious especially if you like chocolate chips
Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tomato bake

YO8-cvEDiOt1QWM-ksYkJg.text: After reading multiple reviews and promising that we would eat here the next time we were in the area....we did it! Oh my gastronomical goodness! The Pig Dip is amazing! Best tip? Share it! Save room for dessert! Sticky Toffee Pudding! The whole experience was delectable! Make reservations to come here the next time you are in the mood for some amazing food!

334uWpIo8bHcXfzHpsf14g.text: This used to be my favorite restaurant.  I've been coming here since they first opened.  The last couple of years I haven't had good experiences.  I came here last year for my 50th birthday, and they screwed up just about everything possible.  They ended up giving us free desserts and taking a couple appetizers off the bill to compensate.  I decided to give it another go for my birthday this year.  I ordered the burger.  I asked for it to be done medium.  It came well done and the bun was burnt, so I didn't eat most of the bun.  I upgraded my french fries to the fingerling potatoes.  They brought them with ketchup, but I remembered having them with lemon aioli.  I asked for the aioli, and they brought out mayonaisse.  I questioned them about this, and they assured me that it was the lemon aioli.  This is not the aioli I remember.  I used to be very lemony and creamy, and this might as well have been Hellman's mayonaisse.  Additionally, I remember the fingerling potatoes being "smashed" and covered with loads of fresh herbs and parmesan, and these were just "meh".  My daughter is a big fan of their goat cheese dip and she ordered it.  This time is was served with an excessive amount of tomato sauce, so the dip was way thinner than it normally is.  Aside from the mediocre food, they were clearly understaffed.  I didn't even bother complaining about the food, because I felt bad for the waitstaff.  I just wanted to go home.  This will be my last visit to St. Francis.  I am done thinking that the mediocre food was just a fluke and that it will be better next time.  Clearly, the chef/owners are not paying the same attention that they used to.

5R-bg3054fUqEbdoEGmErw.text: We came for brunch and it did not disappoint. We had the salmon eggs benedict, the pozole, mushroom omelet, and quiche. All of them were solid. We plan on coming back to try more items. There was a cinnamon bun situation that looked delicious!

I7NYlW242hB4Y7XPto17hA.text: Live Jazz. Delicious and Locally sourced. Kids eat free. Kids toy box for little ones to explore and let their parents talk...  Perfect recipe to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary. Thank you, St. Francis, for creating a unique space where we could brunch, enjoy live jazz, and make our 3 and 1 year old feel welcome so we didn't have to find a sitter!  On to the food: eggs Benedict with smoked salmon and cream cheese was heavenly--perfectly poached and well balanced! My husband really enjoyed the pig dip with bacon onion marmalade. The kid's skillet choc chip pancake was literally a pan-CAKE and was big enough for all four of us to have some and bring some home. My son had the kids burger and fries, also a cut above a typical kids meal.  Wonderful. Highly recommend.

wL2sSK0JBPJrqwisWf35bw.text: Lovely for brunch. Amazing bread products and craft drinks if you like your booze it's really good

5w9UaHdB1yeTD9jz-IEK5w.text: This place has always been a meh for me. Some of their dishes are very good like the chile verde and the meatballs. However, the lines are always very only and the seating inside is one of the worst setups. It is cramped and uncomfortable. You are so close to the people next to you that it is awkward. So, so much constant awkward eye contact has been made here haha. I go on about the service and ambiance of places all the time in reviews because I think it is a big part of the dinning out equation. So if I go somewhere and don't like sitting in the restaurant I feel like I need to mention it. Here some of the food is very tasty but the experience is brought down the interior.   I would say give it a try but come prepared.

DKEJO7-_MglNT8OOfBZTRg.text: Very disappointing. Wanted to order the goat cheese app, with a gf alternative dipper as well, was told that it was available, then returned and said it wasn't. Which is surprising seeing as they label their menu throughly. Wouldn't take much to keep some boxed crackers on hand. Decided to do the mussels, which overall were not appealing and borderline cold. We are all fans of coconut milk and that style of food, but it just didn't go well together. 3/6 of us ordered the rice bowls which although a very large portion were absolutely dry, totally unseasoned ( zero ), and no sauce? It was basically black rice al dente, plain steamed vegetables and slightly seasoned chicken. We were all taken aback and asked if there was supposed to he a sauce to which the waiter responded " i can get you som", and brought out about a tablespoon in a cup per person, when it really needed a half cup full for the whole big portion. The meatballs were just OK, menu didn't describe meat blend, but were gamey, and again a huge portion of 6 in a skillet drowning in a red sauce. Menu description included a pasta noodle which must have been microscopic amomgst the sauce. The pork was just OK as well. Again,huge portion served over mashed potatoes with a red sauce. Menu said paprika based this was way off.. more like smoked tomatoes? Just didn't go well and overall underseasoned and blah. Quaint and nice atmosphere. Wouldn't go again for dinner maybe just brunch.

3NIAggBkCPfRJntWRoi75g.text: A favorite of ours. I always end up getting the salmon, which is consistently delicious. Our waiter was attentive & fun to chat with as the dinner crowd started to thin. My husband had the scallops & said that was delicious as well.  We didn't mind the close tables - it was an opportunity to meet others. If you're looking for something more intimate, this may not be your number one choice. I'm sure we will continue to return & enjoy.

ET8RRn4xBfVvSUHJdderRg.text: I love St. Francis. They serve homemade dishes with unique flavor. I recommended the pork chop for dinner, eggs Benedict and skillet pancake for breakfast. Service is great, very cool modern atmosphere. I would strongly recommend it.

PNLYZOS9nTyUcE7A38Cnzg.text: I have only been here twice and i am in love! I'm not sure how the menus work or if they change? But when i have gone both times i loved each meal!! super good quality food taste and A+ for customer service and atmosphere! very "central"! (:

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TMXNRs3_seJf2bN-0-lzag.text: I was very excited to have a lunchy brunch at St. Francis this past Saturday. I was impressed by the environment and decor, but once I was served a rather average $9 Bloody Mary, the experience began to degrade.  I ordered the highly hyped Chile Burger. It's touted to be the best burger in the state. I beg to differ. It wasn't terrible, however it just wasn't all that exquisite.. The beef was kinda squishy and flavorless, and the spicy factor overpowered the flavors. This may just be a problem with my gut, but I began feeling kinda sick as I was eating it, and then spent the entire rest of the day experiencing horrific gut trauma. That's not why I'm giving St. Francis a 1 star review, though. The reason for the 1 star review is because my boyfriend and I experienced a bad case of waitress neglect. She probably spent a total of 2 minutes at our table. When the check arrived we were ready to pay immediately, and after waiting over 15 minutes, we took the check downstairs, and had to pay that way. She chirped out some sort of insincere apology, and I gave her a dirty look. The restaurant wasn't super busy, and we were the only party left upstairs at that point. This is inexcusable.

JZZpT8e-IHo0YiOAVVLA-Q.text: The corn soup was good but it needed more corn and I'd prefer it to be thicker than it was. The romaine salad was delicious with just the right amount of bacon, apple slices and cheddar ranch dressing.  The meat flatbread was big enough to share and a good authentic wood fired pizza. Red chile peppers added quite a kick.

sqEz-igsgTYPfPTWxrX_FA.text: I love that they are kid friendly! They have toys up in front that kids can grab and a kids menu! Super bummed they only serve the olive oil pancake at brunch! Wahhhh. My only real complaint is the super weird bench table that we were seated at. The I kept bumping the lady behind me and she in return. It was very awkward.

j5-4zSnqUliY9M3LEg1z1A.text: Sat at the bar, and started with a perfect Bombay Sapphire Martini. Always instruct them to swirl & dump vermouth.  Soup and salad was really very tasty. This time of year, with open air, and hip vibe...little slice of heaven. I think the nice female bartender forgot to put my order in, as waiting for food was way tooo long, greater than 45 minutes.. Quality over all was really good, and I would have been less irritated if I wasn't dining solo. Pumpkin Soup excellent, as was romaine/ bacon salad. Beran  Zin , was good, though it never ceases to amaze me that Arizona eateries do not chill their reds. When it's 80-90 degrees out side, and you have open air dining, wine placed on shelves is not served at desirable temp. Postino does the same thing. Having said all that , I would return gladly, as the good things were really good.

It49A7tWn2HGggbx-zRxFg.text: One of my top 5 feel-good and brunch spots in Phoenix area. Complimentary vallet parking, lovely patio and indoors bar, the food amazing as always. I love the fact that they have a bakery inside and make the most perfect pillowy bread that comes with jam and whipped butter for only $4. Bloody Mary's are always on point and their Benedict is just right! I have also tried the Egg Sandwich from the brunch menu and I can honestly say that I would not have a problem eating that every morning for the rest of my life. I am in love with this place, bottom line.

WX9sn-P0udUkFOE4Ps-TVg.text: Best spot for birthdays, to take out of town guests, etc. love the menu, drinks, building. This place is all in all terrific. Not great area for parking but they will valet. Salmon with capers is especially divine.

74yHGTdfA3B5GnzF8OCi4w.text: I love their food, however they get stricter with the baguette every time I go there. Why is so difficult to get a piece of baguette in this place??? Any idea??? And it is more frustrating the fact that I remarked please bring some extra baguette with my dish(since there was no bread at the time drinks were ordered) and my dish comes with JUST ONE slice of their famous baguette. When I asked the server for the extra bread, she replied "this dish doesn't originally come with bread". Thus, I was lucky that they delivered the dish with just ONE piece. Overall, interesting customer service approach!!!!!  I'm asking for 2-3 slices of bread, not for a free filet mignon or something like that.  I give them  two stars this time because of the above, hope the bread issue gets resolved soon. Going back on Thursday to see if they read reviews!!!!!

mOtCzLinzQ3eqLo_GXVusA.text: I go here for brunch a lot. The food is amazing. The decor is very chic and modern. W them renovating an old firehouse is such a cool idea!! I get the egg sandwich, they cook the egg anyway you like so I get it scrambled. Yummy. Also their caramel cinnamon roll is to die for!!! Yes, it's huge, and has tons of calories but so worth it!!! Share it w friends!!! Also I luv their mimosas!! A great place to eat, hang out w friends.

uAAMYbdkt5rSg5Jbd8s0MQ.text: 10/19/10 and 01/02/11  Took Mom w/ me for her first visit to St. Francis (and my second!) for a late lunch around 1p.  The place was packed, and as usual, very noisy.  Thought perhaps I'd finally get a chance to see how the seating was upstairs, but we were seated on the main floor.  Even though we were seated right away, it took more than 10 minutes before our server finally greeted us.  Even though I knew what I'd order for us both, I let Mom look over the limited menu-- for once, the lengthy downtime worked to our advantage!  She almost went for the lunch combo (soup, salad, and half of the Del Real sandwich), but in the end, we ordered the two items I already had my eye on before we'd left home (love to read menus online!).  We decided to share the French onion burger and the Red wine braised beef, and both came w/ a choice of fries or red quinoa salad, so we chose one of each.  The burger was a beauty!  On a substantial and gruyere-smothered patty lay greens, smoked bacon, and crispy shoestring onions, and these were all topped w/ a gorgeous bun!  We wouldn't hesitate to order this one again!  While the fries looked very promising, they were soggy, but Mom happily ate them.  I had the Red wine braised beef sandwich and the red quinoa salad to contend w/, so I didn't bother sending the fries back.  :)  We both loved the quinoa salad-- what a pleasant surprise!  Red quinoa is very good for you-- high in fiber AND protein.  A superfood, indeed!  The key to this salad was the citrus vinaigrette.  A must-try!  The braised beef was also very, very good!  That is, when we finally tried it w/ the horseradish sauce, which somehow was overlooked while Mom and I were divvying up the entrees.  Panini-style, between two slices of their Texas toast, buttered, and gruyere cheese.  DO NOT forget the horseradish sauce, as it just makes the flavors pop in your mouth.   --- When I'd learned that Dennis Rowland was in the house during Sunday brunch, I couldn't wait to go to SF on a rare Sunday off work!  Again, it was a packed house, and I finally was seated upstairs.  Oh my Lord, what a horrendous place to be!  While I could hear Rowland and his band play (it's actually less noisy up there- go figure), I couldn't see them, what w/ the rafters and the ceiling fans underneath, and the cork flooring made every footstep coming and going annoyances I couldn't wait to get rid off by finally leaving!  Thank goodness the two entrees I'd ordered made up for these... hiccups.  Liked the Iron skillet pancake (w/ dark chocolate chips and fresh raspberries), but thought the kitchen was a little light-handed on the chips-- please add more!  Also, I found the pancake was charred too much.  I thought it was bec. it was skillet-style, but I spied another table that received a perfectly un-charred one.  Really enjoyed the creme fraiche and fresh raspberries (please add more!), and the honey on the bottom of the pancake was delightful!  A great dish, really, even w/ the charred bits...  As for the house made biscuit-- well, one look at it and who could ever argue that it wouldn't taste grand??  Crazy-good fennel herb veggie gravy.  Yes, I said "crazy-good."  There's a first time for everything!  :)    Two very good meals which will keep St. Francis on my (long) rotation list!  (BTW, I think I heard Mom sigh when I told her where I was having brunch while she was getting ready work... I really wished I could've taken her w/ me!)  p.s.  Not only did I not get a chance to SEE Rowland and his band play, but for the majority of my stay, the band actually took a break!  No doubt they were all enjoying some of the great-looking cinnamon rolls...  Next time, I'm going to wait for a table to open on the main floor.  That cork flooring upstairs has to go!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French onion burger and soggy fries, $13.

nq7VTSfzVX4Ys2wdKSMHWg.text: I'm giving 1 star for ambiance because that's all this place had going for them!   Luckily we had a reservation because the place was packed, however, it still took our server 20 minutes just to introduce herself and get our drink orders. Our order was as follows...  Baked Goat Cheese  Pork Chili Verde Crispy Fingerling Potatoes Roasted Chicken and Pot Roast  Nothing was bad, but nothing was great.. my favorite was the Pork Chili Verde but I've had better. Even their drinks were weak! At least i tried!

KHTyg8YPYjWNhmTX9eZr1w.text: The food here is really, really good.   The restaurant overall has a lot of different places to sit.  My only complaint is that they were out of half of the liquors/liqueres used in their specialty drinks.

fk1fM5sxdXOVnRwblLQusA.text: The place is set up very nice. It was clean and the service was good. The food was a bit strange for me. You have to ask how things are prepared and what's in it.

IeAhLtJqcD4CfzikRiCjhA.text: I've driven by the place and finally had the chance to try it. If you go I highly recommend eating on the patio, very cute with a nice fire pit (wall). I ordered the house sangria (red) and the Pork Chili Verde, with an egg on top. This is a must! There is so much flavor, the meat is tender and the corn bread is perfect! The sangria could have been better but my meal definitely made up for it. I'll definitely be going back!!

photos.caption: Photo of St. Francis Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Chili Verde, added with an egg

R_lJP_dKpmZGDT_L30Xcsg.text: Awesome vibes, even better food. What's not to love about their giant cinnamon rolls, classic cocktails and yummy flat breads. The staff is friendly and chatty which I enjoy.

VSwBh_6ByoSEtbGyID8nxQ.text: Can't say it's the worst service in Phoenix because Phoenix is a big place and I have not been to every restaurant in the city, so all I can say is it's the worst service I've personally experienced. Management is unprofessional and needs lessons in time management. Can't comment on the food because we left before we could even try it. There are much better places in central Phoenix to give your time and money to.

NjecKFOuUaq8JGadS6GeNA.text: O Holy Pork Chili Verde,  your flavors are so grand. Your spicy kick  and sweet cornbread  make me a huge fan.  Long lay St. Francis, You're warm and friendly and hip. Your modern flair and down-home style is really hard to compare.  A thrill of hope for each new visit. St. Francis you inspire and your food I really admire.  I fall... on my knees! With taste buds exalting! For the French Onion Burger, the seasonal soup and a taste of things to come.  O, St. Francis!  O, Holy Pork Chili Verde! O, you're so divine!

ul9m9aQZeLF16CE0xjzldA.text: Generally, good restaurant.  However, went in the other day and ordered a vegetable sandwich.  i wanted a little protein to go with the sandwich, however, and my server flat our refused.  He would not even agree to bring out a separate, side of bacon for me to put on the sandwich myself.  This was just plain weird.

xCHKc6pl9anEvbUvmyfObg.text: The atmosphere is wonderful, the service was friendly and great and the food was to die for. I went for brunch yesterday and started off with their pancake. It was surreal. Whoever is in charge of the pancake did a wonderful job. I don't think I've ever tasted something that good! The cucumber cooler was light and refreshing and the eggs benedict was rich, fluffy and tasty. I really enjoyed myself and had no complaints! What a great dining experince! Greg knew his stuff and was able to guide my dining partner to the Woodfire Eggs, and once again we were not disappointed!  Side note! On Sunday's they have live jazz during brunch and kids eat free all the time!

53Tv0gY9TpHi5VNCp66pBg.text: Had the flat bread meat...was delicious.  So was the meatballs. A little on the pricier side..you may dress up and not feel overdressed.

WPUwy0FTl9brjRD11dGAAQ.text: I have wanted to try St. Francis for some time. I drive by it all the time and it always looks full of people having a good time. I went here with a group of friends on a Wednesday night and was surprised to find out there was a 45 minute wait. The hostess was very friendly and said we could go the bar area or the area by the fire. While it is nice that we could hang out and have a drink I thought 45 minutes on a Wednesday was kind of a long time to wait for a table. Maybe I am just getting impatient as I get older...  I had the St Francis lemonade which was delicious and refreshing. For an appetizer we split the baked goat cheese. It was so good we ordered a second order. It was probably my favorite thing of the entire meal. For dinner I split the chicken flat bread with my sister. It was a good size portion and came with caramelized onions, chicken, fennel, and arugula. While it was tasty it didn't "wow" me. Two other of my friends both got the citrus salad and it looked pretty good and was something you wouldn't normally make for yourself at home - so maybe I will try this next time.  The service was friendly but I did feel as if our server was repeating things directly from the menu like a robot and he couldn't really make a good suggestion on what to try for food or wine. Overall, I think St. Francis is good place for groups or for a romantic dinner it just wasn't as spectacular as I thought it would be.

wGIDn1QdrMvl-gEHa52QzA.text: Like many other folk when I travel I like to eat at places I've seen featured on tv shows.  This one was on D,D, and D.  We ordered a variety of things and most of it was very good. The fingerling potatoes, the flatbread, and the chili were all very tasty.  The signature pig dip sandwich however was disappointing, and most expensive at $16.  And I did not care for the Moroccan meatballs, but others at the table did.  All in all and good experience but, like most things, didn't quite live up to expectations.

bJBpB6E4bNfW4lX-k4rkRA.text: This has been my best eggs Benedict experience in Phoenix. After having a 20 minute conversation with my brother about how badly people destroy hollandaise sauce,  Surprise surprise!  Their sauce was the perfect consistency. Eggs were cooked perfectly.  Presentation with the fingerling potatoes was beautiful.    This is as good as it gets.

0FbZEc17lILUj9lW0lKYSw.text: So the last thing St. Francis needs is another glowing review, but I feel like any place that makes an item you get addicted to deserves a shout out. So here it goes...  The Za'atar chicken salad sandwich must have crack in it, or else there's no way to explain why I'm so hooked. The first time I had it, they were still making it as a chicken flatbread. Now they've incorporated it into a sandwich full of things that sound like they shouldn't go together but definitely do. It has a vinaigrette dressing instead of mayo, which makes it perfect for the sweltering Phoenix summer. And if you pair it with the quinoa salad, it's fantastic.   I'd like to order something else when I go, but no dice since I stumbled upon this combo. Maybe if I figure out the recipes, I'll finally be able to order and enjoy some of the other fantastic things they have to offer here. Until then, I'll just have to steal bites from other people's plates.

1Ez7kR1Q07L8B6iresUQIw.text: Well I've finally completed my full day of eating at St. Francis.  A while back I had the Pig Dip and the GF had the Moroccan Meatballs for dinner. Both were  great, with a ton of flavor. The freshly baked bread just added to the awesomeness of these dishes. (Hint- go buy some fresh loaves of bread to take home). Today we went for brunch which also was great. We both shared the Iron skillet pancake and biscuits and gravy. The pancake was very flavorful, with sweet and salty in every bite. The biscuits were flaky and buttery, but I was disappointed in the lack of sausage in the gravy. Not to mention that by the time I received the plate the gravy had gone cold.
